implementing_agencies: Kazakhstan Petrochemical Industries, Private Sector; Sinopec International Petroleum Service Corporation (SINOPEC),
title: China Exim Bank to finance the construction of an integrated petrochemical project near Atyrau (linked to project #53547)
description: The Construction of the first integrated petrochemical complex in Atyrau region was developed in the framework of the 'Program of development of petrochemical industry of the Republic of Kazakhstan for 2008-2013', approved by the Government of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated December 29, 2007, in order to use existing large volumes of gas from Tengiz and Kashagan feedstock for chemical complex producing expensive petrochemical products for subsequent sale in the domestic and export markets. The Atyrau petrochemical project is being developed by Kazakhstan Petrochemical Industries (KPI) who will own and operate the complex. Integrated petrochemical complex consists of two process units - the dehydrogenation of propane to propylene production and installation of the polymerization of propylene to produce an end product of polypropylene. In the framework of the project is expected to develop existing and construction of new infrastructure - gas turbine power plant, water treatment plants, fuel gas and water pipelines, road and rail interchanges, etc. According to various reports, in 2009 KPI signed an Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) contract with Sinopec for the first stage of construction. On 22 February 2011, the Development Bank of Kazakhstan (DBK) entered into an individual credit agreement with the Export-Import Bank of China for the amount of U.S.$1.4 billion to finance the construction of the integrated petrochemical project. However, as of 2017, no amounts had been drawn down under this individual credit agreement due the termination of the engineering, procurement and construction contract between KPI and Sinopec in 2014. It is highly likely that this project was funded through the 1.5 billion USD unrestricted portion of a China Eximbank Master Loan Facility to the Development Bank of Kazakhstan, captured in #53547.
sources: https://www.chemicals-technology.com/projects/kazakhstan_petrochem/, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.kpi.kz/en/news/view?id=19, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.gasandoil.com/news/2012/06/china-invests-in-construction-of-advanced-oil-processing-center-in-atyrau, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://en.tengrinews.kz/markets/China-allocates-over-1-billion-for-construction-of-advanced-10624/, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs; http://azh.kz/en/news/view/5049, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.plasticsnewseurope.com/article/20160201/PNE/160209985/lg-chem-scraps-plan-for-3-84bn-polyethylene-complex-in-kazakhstan, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://etheses.lse.ac.uk/3126/1/Bohnenberger-Rich_Kazakhstan_and_China.pdf, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://etheses.lse.ac.uk/3126/1/Bohnenberger-Rich_Kazakhstan_and_China.pdf, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=CDENGY0020100405e63p00034&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://uc920c267d56e444011c45cae5bc.previews.dropboxusercontent.com/nativeprint?file=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dropbox.com%2Fs%2Fb8pbob8b1n7pwr1%2FDevelopment%2520Bank%2520of%2520Kazakhstan%25202017%2520Bond%2520Prospectus.pdf%3Fdisable_range%3D1%26from_native_print%3D1%26preview%3D1, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://uc920c267d56e444011c45cae5bc.previews.dropboxusercontent.com/nativeprint?file=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dropbox.com%2Fs%2Fb8pbob8b1n7pwr1%2FDevelopment%2520Bank%2520of%2520Kazakhstan%25202017%2520Bond%2520Prospectus.pdf%3Fdisable_range%3D1%26from_native_print%3D1%26preview%3D1, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://kz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/ztdy/201210/20121008374197.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.kpi.kz/en/about/view?id=3, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

title: China commits 10 million USD grant of communications equipment
description: Summary: In 2001, China sent communication equipment worth 10m dollars to Kyrgyzstan. The head of the communication and information science directorate of the Ministry of Transport and Communication, K. Talypov, said equipment [telephone station] for 10,000 subscribers would be installed in Bishkek and then in other regions. China's ZTE company, and Kyrgyztelekom, a joint-stock company, concluded a cooperation agreement to deliver and assemble the equipment.

title: China Commits 20 Jeeps to Kyrgyz Interior Ministry
description: On September 20, 2002, the Ministry of Public Security of China agreed to hand over 1.4 million CNY worth of Jeeps and technical assistance to the Ministry of Interior Affairs of the Kyrgyz Republic. The agreement was signed by the Minister of Public Security Jia Chunvan and Ambassador of the Kyrgyz Republic to China Erlan Abdyldaev.

title: China grants Kyrgyz Republic 5 million RMB for food and other materials
description: On April 11, 2002, China agreed to grant 5 million RMB (~600,000 USD) to the Kyrgyz Defense Ministry for material and technical facilities and foodstuff during a meeting between Kyrgyz Defence Minister Col-Gen Esen Topoyev and Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of the People's Republic of China (PRC) to Kyrgyzstan Hong Jiuyin.

title: China commits technical assistance to Kyrgyz pension fund
description: In 2003, the Chairman of the Social Fund of Kyrgyzstan met with the Minister of Labor and Social Protection of China and signed a cooperation agreement. The Chinese side will render assistance to develop a system of social insurance and hold pension reform. Officials will also exchange information and jointly research issues.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=kabnew0020030306dz3300005&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=kabnew0020030301dz2s0005o&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China grants Kyrgyz Opera and Ballet Theater 50 million RMB
description: The government of the Chinese People's Republic allocated 50 million yuans to the Kyrgyz Opera and Ballet Theater named after Abdylas Maldybaev. First Deputy Prime Minister of Kyrgyzstan Kurmanbek Osmonov, Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of China to Kyrgyzstan Hong Jiuyin attended the ceremony dedicated to this event. In his speech, K. Osmonov noted that 'this event testifies our ancient and lasting friendly relations with China'. Two years ago, Kyrgyzstan and China signed bilateral agreement to allocate by the Chinese government gratuitous aid worth 50 million yuans, he said. According to him, the aid aimed to modernize equipment and reconstruct the building of the Opera and Ballet Theater, which is the leading and unique cultural building of Kyrgyzstan.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=KABNEW0020030514dz5e00007&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China agrees to provide solar batteries and wind turbines samples to Kazakhstan
description: In September 2009, during a state visit by Kazakh officials to China, China agreed to provide Kazakhstan with sample equipment for solar batteries and wind turbines. The equipment will be used for renewable energy projects in the country, with the projects being carried out in the Almaty Region. A 1MW solar power plant will be built in the free economic zone 'Park IT' near Almaty and a 5MW wind power plant will be built in the Yenbekshikazakhsky district of the Almaty Region, covering an area of 25 ha.
sources: http://www.inform.kz/eng/article/2217838, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=KAZWIR0020110927e79q0012x&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates 5000 USD to Kyrgyz Republic for Landslide Relief
description: On May 20 2003, the Chinese Embassy in Kyrgyz handed over 5K USD to the Red Crescent Society of Kyrgyzstan as a landslide relief. This money will be used to purchase food and other necessities to the 300 families of Sogot village, Uzgen region of Osh Oblast.

title: China Eximbank reschedules Kyrgyz Paper Mill debt
description: According to various media reports, in 2003, China Eximbank signed an agreement with the Kyrgyz Finance Ministry that allows for the restructuring of debt worth 100 million yuan. The 100 million RMB was reportedly the total value of interest-free and concessional loans given by the bank to the Kyrgyz government for the construction of a paper mill. According to the Kyrgyzstan AMP, there were two credits extended by China for the construction of the Kyrgyz-Chinese Paper Mill in Tokmok, which is located in the Chuy valley. The first credit was extended in 1996 (AMP ID 87188512380) and the second was extended in 1998 (AMP ID 87188512381). The debt has been restructured in pursuance of the resolution of the Paris Club of creditors on the consolidation of the Kyrgyz Republic's debt. In accordance with the agreement, the debt to be serviced (interest, plus the principal sum) is to be restructured. Media reported that the sum of payments deferred between 2001 and 2004 will total 1.98m yuan (about 250,000 dollars), which is to be paid within 10 years, starting from 2007. However, the value of 100 million yuan has been recorded as the restructured debt amount, because a MOFCOM source in 2015 reported that as of 2015, Kyrgyzstan still owes China 9,800,000 USD (around 40 million RMB in 2003) for the paper mill loans, and that in 2014 Kyrgyzstan had negotiated the return of 60,200,000 RMB to China by 2017. The sum of both values is close to the 100 million RMB that was reportedly loaned to Kyrgyzstan, suggesting that that was the total amount of debt that had been rescheduled in 2003. . It should also be noted that COMPLANT, the Chinese contractor for the paper mill project, reported a total project cost of 129,016,065 RMB, and People Daily report in 2002 put the total Chinese loan amount at 150,000,000 RMB.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcapp0020030714dz7e00a18&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dropbox.com/sh/csm96s09710qee6/AAAqblGqtEaa2-EC5YEjHT-ha?dl=0&preview=AMP+Kyrgyz+Republic+Project+ID+87188512381.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/sh/csm96s09710qee6/AAAqblGqtEaa2-EC5YEjHT-ha?dl=0&preview=AMP+Kyrgyz+Republic+Project+ID+87188512380.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://kg.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201503/20150300913195.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=KABNEW0020030715dz7f0000s&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.people.com.cn/GB/shizheng/19/20020830/811423.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.complant-ltd.com.cn/zcgf/rootfiles/2016/12/20/1483666625961168-1483666625999168.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

title: China Donates Equipment to Kyrgyz Police
description: On October 13th 2003, the Ministry of Public Security in China made a donation to Kyrgyzstan police, and it is the third donation from China since 2001. This donation includes 50 Beijing jeeps and an equipment used in detective experiments. It is to help maintain social security in Kyrgyzstan and better protect Kirghiz and Chinese citizens living in the central Asian country from crime.

description: In 2004, China agreed to send technical aid worth 300,000 USD to the Interior Ministry of the Republic of Kyrgyzstan. Furthermore, China also pledged to hand over 30,000 off-road vehicles.

implementing_agencies: China Railway Group Co., Ltd., State-owned Company
title: China Exim Bank loans Uzbekistan 350 million USD for Kamchiq Tunnel in the Angren-Pap Railway
description:
On November 30, 2013, China Eximbank and National Bank of Uzbekistan signed a loan agreement worth $350 million for the construction of the 19.2 km Kamchiq railway tunnel linking the Central Asian nation’s populous Ferghana Valley with the rest of the country. This tunnel is part of the Angren-Pap railway line.  

The terms of the China Eximbank loan were as follows: 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period, and an interest rate of 2.25%. Uzbekistan Railways State Joint-Stock Railway Company signed a contract with China Railway Tunnel Group Co Ltd. to construct the tunnel. The tunnel, with a total project cost of $455 million, seeks to connect the Qamchiq pass and Ferghana Valley as part of the electrified Angren-Pap railway. Construction began on July 29, 2013 and the excavation works were finished on February 27, 2016. The tunnel was opened for traffic on June 22, 2016. 

STAFF_NOTE: The tunnel is sometimes also spelled Kamchik.

implementing_agencies: China Coal Technology & Engineering Group, Private Sector
title: $89.5 million China Eximbank loan for modernization of Baisun and Shargun coal deposits in Surkhandarya region
description:
In 2014, China Eximbank and China Development Bank together provided $105,510,000 in debt financing for the Shargun Coal Mine Modernization Project. China Eximbank provided a $89.5 million preferential buyer’s credit loan and China Development Bank provided a $16,010,000 loan. This record captures the CDB loan.  Project ID#40326 captures the PBC loan from China Eximbank. The Shargun Coal Mine Modernization Project — also known as the “Modernization of JSC “Shargunkumir” project or 了沙尔贡煤矿现代化 — seeks to replace the existing technologies and production at Baisun and Shargun coal deposits and bring project capacity to 900 thousand tons of coal per year. It also involves the modernization of the system of coal transportation. China Coal Technology & Engineering Group (CCTEG) is the contractor responsible for project implementation and its work is being overseen by  Uzbekcoal JSC. Through its contract with Uzbekcoal JSC, CCTEG is responsible for delivering two mechanized complexes with production capacity of 450,000 tons per year each on a turnkey basis. China Railway Tunnel Group Co., Ltd. is also involved in project implementation.  As of September 12, 2017, China Coal Technology & Engineering Group Corp., and China Railway Tunnel Group Co., Ltd., began the preparatory work for this project. Project implementation officially began on May 23, 2018.  

The project was expected to reached completion in 2020.

implementing_agencies: CITIC Group, State-owned Company
title: China EXIM Bank commits USD300M for Turkmenistan Carbamide Production Plant
description: On Aug. 24, 2006, Turkmen President Saparmurat Niyazov has permitted its State Bank for Foreign Economic Activity to conclude a300-million USD loan deal with the Export-Import Bank of China. The loan is to be released for 20 years at a preferential rate of 3.0% annually. In the end of the talk between Turkmen President Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov and Chinese Prime Minister Wen Jiabao, the ceremony of signing bilateral documents was held. The Agreement on providing the lax credit for construction of new facilities and reconstruction of MaryAzot Production Association (US$ 239,358,000) and the Agreement on providing lax credit for construction of glass-manufacturing plant in Turkmenistan ($ 60,642,000). This is the first foreign long-term loan that Turkmenistan received in recent years. MaryAzot Production Association is a carbamide plant with the capacity of 400 thousand tons in the town of Mary. The 266-million-USD reconstruction project was contracted to CITIC Group, 90% of which was funded by the preferential loan provided by Chinese government aforementioned.

title: China donates 1.8 million USD worth of cars to Kyrgyzstan
description: The signing ceremony of an agreement was held today. According to the agreement, the Chinese government will provide as a grant cars worth 1.8 dollars to the Kyrgyz government for state protocol needs. The document was signed by Kyrgyz Foreign Minister Alikbek Dzhekshenkulov and Chinese Ambassador to Kyrgyzstan Hong Jiuyin. Staff_note: some other sources indicate that this is a loan. Need further research to figure out.

implementing_agencies: China CAMC Engineering Co., Ltd., State-owned Company; South Kyrgyz Cement CJSC, Private Sector
title: China Gave 70 Million USD Export Credit to Kyrgyzstan for the Construction of a Cement Factory
description: In 2006 China Exim Bank provided 70 million USD in preferential export buyer's credit for the construction of the South Kyrgyz Cement Factory in Kyzyl-Kiya city. This project is the first Chinese government preferential credit provided within the framework of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation. The loan is guaranteed by Kazakhstan Turan-Alem Bank. This project officially broke ground on 25 March 2006, with China CAMC Engineering Co Ltd implementing the project in partnership with South Kyrgyz Cement CJSC. The plant is expected to have an output of 2500 tons of cement per day and was slated for completion in 2008. The production line was successfully put into operation in September 2009. Although there was turmoil in the country including riots near the factory, a technical team successfully completed the performance evaluation of the production line and handed over the factory to the owner for management. STAFF_NOTE: Some sources indicate that the transaction amount is 77.8 million. We decided to use the data from BTA Bank, which is the guarantor of the loan.

title: China grants Kyrgyzstan 150,000 USD for earthquake relief
description: On Oct.13, 2008, Chinese government gave US$150 thousand in assistance to victims of the earthquake (happened in Oct.5) in the south of Kyrgyzstan, according to press service of the Chinese Embassy in Bishkek. 'We sincerely share pain and grief of family members of those who died in the quake and wish the soonest recovery to the injured,' said in the message of the Chinese Embassy.

title: China Eximbank provides $75.29 million preferential buyer's credit for the Osh-Sarytash-Irkeshtam Road Rehabilitation Project
description:
On December 10, 2008, China Eximbank and the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic signed a $75,290,000 preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) loan agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK PBC NO. 2008 (21) TOTAL NO. ( 61)] for the Osh-Sarytash-Irkeshtam Road Rehabilitation Project (Section from 123 km to 190 km). The loan carried the following terms: 20 year maturity, 2% interest, 5 year grace period, 0.25% management fee, and 0.25% commitment fee. China Road and Bridge Corporation was the contractor. The project was completed on December 20, 2013. The first loan disbursement (of $37,640,315) took place on December 31, 2009 and the last loan disbursement (or $3,764,100) took place on December 31, 2014. Total loan disubrsements amounted to $75,280,699.

This project is supporting the construction of a road segment that runs from Osh to Sarytash and Irkeshtam (the 123 km to 190 km segment). More locational details can be found within the source "Kyrgyzstan and the Belt and Road Initiative."

title: China reduces Kyrgyzstan's outstanding debt by 7 million USD
description: STAFF_NOTES: Unable to confirm this project in Stage 2 In May 2008, Kyrgyz Finance Minister Kalimbetova held bilateral meetings with Chinese and Indian Foreign Ministers concerning outstanding debts owed by Kyrgyzstan to these countries. During the meeting with the Chinese delegation Finance Minister Kalimbetova said all debt issues have been tackled between Kyrgyzstan and China. The Governments of China and Kyrgyzstan signed the agreement on transforming the Chinese governmental credit worth US$7 million into a grant.

title: China loan syndicate funds Phase II of the Beineu-Bozoi-Shymkent Gas Pipeline (Additional Financing) (link to #39562)
description:
On January 18, 2011, a joint venture (special purpose vehicle) called Beineu-Shymkent Gas Pipeline LLP was established in the Republic of Kazakhstan to oversee the financing, design, and implementation of the Beineu-Bozoi-Shymkent Gas Pipeline Project. JSC KazTransGas and China National Petroleum Corporation each have 50% ownership stake in Beineu-Shymkent Gas Pipeline LLP.  The Beineu-Bozoi-Shymkent Gas Pipeline is a 1454 km long gas pipeline that will run through the Mangistau, Aktyubinsk, Kyzylorda and South Kazakhstan regions. The purpose of the project was to ensure stable gas demand in the southern regions of the Republic of Kazakhstan, reduce dependence on imported gas and ensure the energy security of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Construction of the pipeline was split into two phases. 

The first phase of the Beineu-Bozoi-Shymkent Gas Pipeline Project was initiated on July 17, 2012 and completed on September 7, 2013, resulting in a throughput capacity of up to 6 bcm per year.  It involved 1143.2 km of pipeline construction from the Bozoy gas metering station in the Shalkar region of Aktobe oblast to Akbulak gas metering station in Sairam region of South-Kazakhstan oblast. It also involved the installation of pipeline facilities, such as: compressor station CS-1 and Bozoy shift camp in Shalkar region of Aktobe oblast, emergency-response centers in Saksaulsk, Aksuat and Karaozek in Kyzylorda oblasts and an emergency-response center in Shornak within South-Kazakhstan oblast, as well as construction of the automated process control system (SCADA) and telecommunication (fiber-optic communication line) for the gas ppeline in Mangystau, Aktobe, Kyzylorda and South-Kazakhstan oblasts. 

The second phase of the Beineu-Bozoi-Shymkent Gas Pipeline Project was completed on December 30, 2016. It involved 306.3 km of gas pipeline construction from Beineu settlement in the Mangystau oblast to Bozoy settlement in the Aktobe oblast. It also involved the installation of pipeline facilities, such as: compressor station CS-4 Karaozek in Kyzylorda oblast, Beineu gas metering station in Mangystau oblast, the SCADA central dispatch control in Kyzylorda, and gas pipeline construction in Mangystau, Aktobe, Kyzylorda and South-Kazakhstan oblasts. Between 2014 and 2017, over 9.0 bcm of gas was transported via the Beineu-Bozoi-Shymkent gas pipeline, providing southern regions with Kazakhstani gas. Then, in November 2017, a head compressor station at Bozoi and a line compressor station at Karaozek were put into operation, which increased the capacity of the Beineu-Bozoi-Shymkent Gas Pipeline to 10 bcm per year. In October 2017, Kazakhstan began exporting gas deliveries to China pursuant to a contract concluded between JSC KazTransGas and PetroChina for the supply of 5 billion cubic meter of natural gas (bcm) during the period from 15 October 2017 until 14 October 2018. 

The price of gas exported to China pursuant to this agreement is linked to the price of Brent crude oil and determined quarterly. Negotiations are ongoing with respect to a long-term gas supply agreement between JSC KazTransGas and PetroChina. BSGP and KazMunayGas expects the transportation of gas to China to increase in the coming years and, in order to facilitate such transportation, plans to construct three new compressor stations on the Beineu-Bozoi-Shymkent Gas Pipeline between 2018 and 2019. 

In order to fund Phase I of the Beineu-Bozoi-Shymkent Gas Pipeline Project, Beineu-Shymkent Gas Pipeline LLP signed a $1.8 million syndicated loan with China Development Bank and Bank of China on December 11, 2012 (Project ID#39562). This loan bears interest at a rate of three-month LIBOR plus 2.7% per annum for the duration of the guarantee period and, thereafter, at a rate of three-month LIBOR plus 3.2% per annum. The loan matures on 11 March 2028. The loan is secured by corporate guarantees from KazMunayGas and CNPC. Beineu-Shymkent Gas Pipeline LLP then signed a $700 million syndicated loan with China Development Bank and Bank of China for Phase II of the project on September 17, 2015 (Project ID#40362).  CDB and Bank of China each reportedly contributed $350 million. This loan reportedly carries a 15 year maturity; however, the interest rate of the loan is unknown

This 1454 km pipeline runs through runs through the territory of Mangystau, Aktobe, Kyzylorda and South-Kazakhstan oblasts. The first phase of the project (Project ID#39562) involved 1143.2 km of pipeline construction from the Bozoy gas metering station in the Shalkar region of Aktobe oblast to Akbulak gas metering station in Sairam region of South-Kazakhstan oblast. It also involved the installation of pipeline facilities, such as: compressor station CS-1 and Bozoy shift camp in Shalkar region of Aktobe oblast, emergency-response centers in Saksaulsk, Aksuat and Karaozek in Kyzylorda oblasts and an emergency-response center in Shornak within South-Kazakhstan oblast, as well as construction of the automated process control system (SCADA) and telecommunication (fiber-optic communication line) for the gas ppeline in Mangystau, Aktobe, Kyzylorda and South-Kazakhstan oblasts. The second phase of the project (Project ID#40362) includes 306.3 km of gas pipeline construction from Beineu settlement in the Mangystau oblast to Bozoy settlement in the Aktobe oblast. It also involved the installation of pipeline facilities, such as: compressor station CS-4 Karaozek in Kyzylorda oblast, Beineu gas metering station in Mangystau oblast, the SCADA central dispatch control  in Kyzylorda, and gas pipeline construction in Mangystau, Aktobe, Kyzylorda and South-Kazakhstan oblasts. More detailed locational information can be found at https://www.dropbox.com/s/8j082veud49pzvb/_i%20class%3D_fa%20fa-map%20fa-lg____i_%20Pipeline%20map%20%E2%80%93%20Beineu%20Shymkent.pdf?dl=0 and https://bsgp.kz/en_US/%d0%ba%d0%b0%d1%80%d1%82%d0%b0-%d0%b3%d0%b0%d0%b7%d0%be%d0%bf%d1%80%d0%be%d0%b2%d0%be%d0%b4%d0%b0/ and https://www.kaztransoil.kz/en/about_the_company/main_pipelines_scheme/

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Shenyang International Economic and Technical Cooperation Co. Ltd, State-owned Company
title: China Exim Bank loans $74 million to Papua New Guinea for construction of marine industrial zone
description: In November 2009, China's Exim Bank provided a $74 million concessional loan to Papua New Guinea for the construction of the Pacific Marine Industrial Zone in Vidar, Madan Province. The total cost of the project was $95 million; Papua New Guinea paid for the remaining $21 million. In September 2009, Shenyang International Economic and Technical Cooperation Company was chosen to be the contractor; the project included the construction of a wharf and pier, a water and waste treatment plant, roads, and other key infrastructure. Construction began in 2011 and was completed by 2013, but the zone was not put into operation until November 2015.
sources: http://www.pina.com.fj/?p=pacnews&m=read&o=9766753304fb1b0a1b8db818471661, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.sypaffc.com/upload/%E5%8F%8B%E5%8D%8F%E4%B9%8B%E5%A3%B0-13.pdf, Academic Journal Article; http://pg.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/zzjg/201010/20101007171873.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pina.com.fj/?p=pacnews&m=read&o=910302904ca416a50c7500edcd9a32, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Liu Yongsheng, SASAC Director (Shenyang International Economic and Technical Cooperation Co. Ltd)

title: China Grants $2.7m Worth of Equipment to Tajik Drug Control Agency
description: In 2007, China granted the Drug Control Agency of Tajikistan funding for mobile drug testing equipment to detect illicit substances in vehicles and containers. The Flat Export of AIMS Tajikistan as of May 2018 reports a 'Mobile inspection-examination complex' project funded by Chinese government for2,739,726 USD, which is the amount captured in this project. Other media sources list the total amount as4 million USD.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/rl546mymjz3f15f/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20from%20Tajikistan%20AIMS%20China%20Specific%20Projects.xlsx?dl=0, Other; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCCA00020071123e3bn0012x&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: SinoHydro, State-owned Company
title: Exim Bank loans Tajikistan $200 million to construct hydroelectric power plant on Zarafshon River
description: In 2007, China Exim Bank and Tajikistan's Ministry of Finance signed an agreement for a 200 million USD loan for the construction of a 150 MW hydroelectric power plant on the Zarafshon River. The loan has a maturity of 25 years and 1% annual interest rate. SinoHydro will be constructing the plant, and the project is expected to take three years. The power plant will have a capacity of 150 MW with an annual output of 0.6 billion kilowatt-hours. The project also includes the construction of a 60- kilometer, 220-kilovolt power transmission line to carry electric power from the HPS to sub-station Rudaki in the city of Panjakent. STAFF_NOTE: River also spelled Zeravshan.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TASS000020070118e31i0020d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://old.silkroadstudies.org/new/docs/CEF/Quarterly/May_2007/Peyrouse.pdf, Academic Journal Article; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=WPSCAN0020070119e31j00005&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NOVA000020070119e31j0003d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.news.tj/en/news/tajik-mof-chinese-bank-sign-loan-agreement-financing-zarafshon-hydroelectricity-project, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://books.google.com/books?id=wkyiAgAAQBAJ&pg=PT197&lpg=PT197&dq=tajikistan+Zarafshon+hydroelectric+power&source=bl&ots=t_e-XjTDnb&sig=Xty65OP9FwMqYAJTrrrkmDCK8tY&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjL5O30pZTOAhWNZiYKHTVWBWM4ChDoAQgbMAA#v=onepage&q=tajikistan%20Zarafshon%20hydroelectric%20power&f=false, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020070120e31k00236&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China grants 105 vehicles to Tajikistan
description: In August 2008, China granted Tajikistan a total of 105 vehicles, consisting of 80 buses, 5 garbage trucks, and 20 executive cars for use during the Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit. The value of the cars is unknown. This project seems to correspond to record TJK/082181 of the Tajikistan AIMS, which captures the 'supply of buses and technical equipment for community facilities' with a total value of 2,739,726 USD.

implementing_agencies: China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC), State-owned Company
title: China Development Bank provides $3 billion loan for Galkynysh (South Yolotan–Osman) Gas Field Phase I Project (Linked to Project ID#41905)
description:
In June 2009,  visiting Chinese vice-premier Li Keqiang and Turkmen President Gurbanguly Berdymukhammedov signed an agreement stating that China Development Bank would provide Turkmenistan with a long-term preferential loan of 3 billion USD.  This loan was given to help develop the Galkynysh Gas Field (also known as South Yolotan–Osman Field) while Turkmenistan will supply China with up to 40 billion cubic meters/year of gas for 30 years under deals signed June 24 in Ashgabat. They include a supplementary agreement covering CNPC's exploration and production activities at Bagitiyarlik, where the company has a license to produce up to 30 Bcm/year, and a separate contract under which state-owned Turkmengaz will deliver 10 Bcm/year to CNPC. 

In April 2011, China signed an additional 4.1 billion USD loan agreement with Turkmenistan for Phase II of the project. The loan will be dispensed in the course of 3 years, and in return Turkmenistan will supply natural gas to China for 10 years. (See project ID #41905)

The project officially started in August 2010, and was completed on September 4, 2013. 

This project is part of the umbrella project captured in project #43168.

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: Chinese government grants $4.2million to construct office building for Mongolian National Chamber of Commerce and Trade (MNCCT)
description: Summary: On January 5, 2009 a new office building for the Monogolian National Chamber of Commerce and Trade was completed and handed over to Mongolia. The project was funded through $4.2million in grant money from the Chinese government. Construction had begun in May 2007.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=XNEWS00020090105e515004mq&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China grants Tajikistan 41,664,633 USD for construction of Shar Shar (Liberty) Tunnel (linked to #53615)
description: On August 30, 2009, Tajikistan opened the Liberty Tunnel on the Dushanbe-Kulab road. The tunnel project was partly financed by a 41,664,633 USD grant from China. The Liberty Tunnel is part of the major overhaul of Dushanbe roads financed by the Chinese government and Chinese banks. Construction of the project started in October, 2006. The tunnel was originally named Shar-Shar (alternatively: Sharshar) Tunnel, then renamed Ozodi (freedom, liberty) Tunnel in 2014. The construction was carried out by the Chinese Railway Company and was completed in 2009. The project is part of the Dushanbe road construction and rehabilitation megaproject. STAFF_NOTE: A document from the Asian Development Bank reports the Chinese grant amount as 32.9 million USD, while media sources report the amount as36 million,38 million or40 million. The transaction amount of 41,664,633 USD from the Tajikistan AIMS has been used, since it is the only official source that provides a figure. This project has ID TJK/102014 in the Tajikistan AIMS, and its title is 'Project 'Construction of auto-tunnel Shar-shar''.
sources: https://www.ifri.org/sites/default/files/atoms/files/ifrichinacentralasiakassenovaengjanuary2008.pdf, Academic Journal Article; https://www.ifri.org/sites/default/files/atoms/files/ifrichinacentralasiakassenovaengjanuary2008.pdf, Academic Journal Article; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TRENDE0020090831e58v00565&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://uceec09b265043133ca8d4b53bdb.previews.dropboxusercontent.com/nativeprint?file=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dropbox.com%2Fs%2Fj174ru3dvw3sl4k%2F2016%2520Development%2520Partners%2520Profiles%2520From%2520State%2520Committee%2520on%2520Investments%2520and%2520State%2520Property%2520Management.pdf%3Fdisable_range%3D1%26from_native_print%3D1%26preview%3D1, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.tj/en/news/shar-shar-tunnel-officially-opened-sunday, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://nationallizenzen.zbw.eu/zbwhtml/10836/11535/Country%20Report%20Tajikistan%20September%202006.html?page=cr_crtj_main_20060913t000000_0036_xml.xml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.asiaplus.tj/en/news/tajikistan/20060825/construction-shar-shar-tunnel-officially-commence-next-month, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.ifri.org/sites/default/files/atoms/files/ifrichinacentralasiakassenovaengjanuary2008.pdf, Academic Journal Article; https://wikileaks.org/plusd/cables/09DUSHANBE954_a.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/linked-documents/49042-005-dc.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/rl546mymjz3f15f/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20from%20Tajikistan%20AIMS%20China%20Specific%20Projects.xlsx?dl=0 , Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China Provided Humanitarian Aid Worth of 8 Million Yuan to Kyrgyzstan for Restoration of Peace after Riots
description: On June 17, 2010, in order to help the restoration of stability in Kyrgyzstan and the normalization of living and working order in the southern region, Chinese government provided emergency humanitarian aid materials worth of 5 million RMB yuan to Kyrgyzstan. On June 30, 2010, China decided to offer another batch of humanitarian aid materials worth of 3 million RMB yuan to Kyrgyzstan. The aid materials were delivered to the southern city of Osh in Kyrgyzstan by China's relevant departments on the early morning of July 28, Beijing time. The representatives from both sides signed the transfer list at the Osh Airport. The aid materials include rice, edible oil, biscuits, black tea, milk powder, blankets, clothes, stationary and daily sanitary necessities. China hopes the aid will help Kyrgyzstan to resettle the refugees.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=DANWS00020100622e66l00105&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=PEODEN0020101124e64f001i5&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=IXCENT0020100630e66t000p3&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.china-embassy.org/eng//fyrth/t712738.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/xwfw_665399/s2510_665401/2535_665405/t712738.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://newyork.china-consulate.org/eng/fyrth/t709413.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://fts.unocha.org/flows/76396?destination=donors/2976/flows/2010%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522504%253ACHINA%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520April%25202010%2522%26f%255B2%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522516%253ACHINA%2520-%2520Floods%2520-%2520June%25202010%2522%26f%255B3%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522508%253AKYRGYZSTAN%2520-%2520Civil%2520unrest-%2520June%25202010%2522%26f%255B4%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522520%253APAKISTAN%2520-%2520Floods%2520-%2520July%25202010%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China provides H1N1 aid to Mongolia
description: In January 2010 the Chinese government announced to deliver 100,000 H1N1 doses of vaccine to Mongolia. Vice-Minister of Health J. Tsolmon met on 19 January with a H1N1 fighting team consisting of 14 medical doctors from the Health Ministry of China. They arrived in Mongolia to help combating the H1N1. A group of Chinese doctors worked in the National Centre for Infectious Diseases from 18 to 23 January diagnosing and treating patients free of charge.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=BBCAPP0020100119e61j001jl&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.cidrap.umn.edu/news-perspective/2010/01/h1n1-flu-breaking-news-first-donated-vaccine-h1n1-and-minorities-surplus, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: J. Tsolmon, Chinese Vice-Minister of Health

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China provides 10 million RMB snow relief aid
description: Summary: On January 31, 2010 China sent relief supplies to Mongolia to help it tide over the difficulties caused by the unprecedented snowfalls. This batch of supplies, included rice, food, portable power generators and quilts arrived in Mongolia's capital Ulan Bator. The total cost of the aid was 10million yuan.
sources: http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/china/2010-02/01/c_13158627_4.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=TARGNS0020100204e622002b6&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=XNEWS00020100127e61r007pu&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China donates 300 tonnes of rice and flour to Mongolia
description: Summary: On March 16, 2010 China has donated 300 tonnes ($100,000 worth) of rice and flour to Mongolia to help fend off the effects of a bitter winter in the remote southwest of the country. The severe winter, or zud, has decimated flocks and isolated herders, especially in western Mongolia. The United Nations estimates 2.7 million livestock have died. The grain, consisting of flour and rice, was loaded onto nine trucks which were driven by 18 experienced drivers.
sources: http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2010-03/16/content_9596057.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=XNEWS00020100315e63f009hp&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=LBA0000020100315e63f001ph&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.baabar.mn/content/1598.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Guangdong Construction Engineering Group Co., State-owned Company
title: China loaned Papua New Guinea for a dormitory construction project aid in the University of Goroka
description: On January 25, 2011, the Chinese government signed an agreement to provide a concessional loan to the Goroka University student dormitory construction project of the Papua New Guinea government. The project was constructed by Guangdong Foreign Construction Company. Construction began in July 2011. Four 7-story dorms were built and delivered on December 5, 2014. The project cost 170 million kina.

title: China grants Kyrgyz Republic 5 million USD for reconstruction of south
description: On Apr.7 2011, an agreement has been signed on China allocating 5m dollars in no-strings financial aid to Kyrgyzstan to restore the south of the country. On Dec.13, 2012, the Parliament of Kyrgyzstan ratified the exchange letters between the Governments of Kyrgyzstan and China on5 million aid for Kyrgyzstan for reconstruction of southern parts of Kyrgyzstan affected during June 2010 events. The multi-storied residential building of 66 apartments was to be built from China’s funds in Osh city under the agreement.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=AKIPEN0020110407e7470002t&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=BBCCA00020110407e7470015p&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=AKIPEN0020121225e8cp0002t&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=AKIPEN0020121213e8cd0018h&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: Tebian Electric Apparatus, Private Sector
title: China Exim Bank loans $208 million for Modernization of Power Transmission Lines in South of Kyrgyzstan (Linked to Project #39619)
description: On June 14, 2011, Kyrgyz Finance Minister Melis Mambetzhanov and President of Export-Import Bank of China Li Ruogu signed a concessional loan agreement for the modernization of power transmission lines in southern Kyrgyzstan for208 million, according to the Finance Ministry's press service. The power lines are located in Batken, Jalal-Abad, and Osh. The Export-Import Bank of China extended the grace period from 5 to 7 years. The maturity period is 20 years and interest rate is 2%. The project will support construction of 500 kV Datka station in Jalal-Abad and construction of 220 kV power transmission line stretching for 256.5 km. On July 29, 2011, this project was contracted to TBEA on a ceremony held in Kyrgyzstan. According to AMP Kyrgyzstan,197.5m of the committed amount has been disbursed as of 2018. This project is linked with #39619, an Eximbank loan for the construction of a power line from Datka to Kemin.

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: China agrees to lend Mongolia 500 million USD for Tuul River Highway, Yarmag Bridge, and other projects
description: On June 16, 2011 China agreed to lend $500 million to its northern neighbor Mongolia after the two countries signed a 'strategic partnership agreement' in Beijing. The loan is agreed between Mongolian Ministry of Finance and the Export-Import Bank of China. The two sides also agreed to boost economic, technological and educational ties during a meeting between Chinese premier Wen Jiabao and the Mongolian prime minister, Sukhbaatar Batbold. A condition of the agreement was a request to guarantee that Mongolia will not accept Southern Mongolians and grant any legal residency. The loan is repayable in 20 years with 2% annual interest. Repayment will begin only after the seventh year. During the Mongolian Cabinet of Ministers meeting on November 2, 2015, the government agreed to sign contracts on construction using the loan. Approximately US$200 million will be used for financing construction of the highway of the Tuul River and Yarmag Bridge.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=CEASEN0020151104ebb4000p4&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.bondsupermart.com/main/file-depository/download-file?paramCategory=bondDocument&paramDocumentNo=1189, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.business-mongolia.com/mongolia/2011/06/02/500-million-usd-loan-from-china-is-supported/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://townhall.com/photos/2011/06/17/mongolian_pm_batbold_speaks_during_his_meeting_with_chinese_vice_president_xi_during_their_meeting_in_beijing, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.smhric.org/news_393.htm, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=LBA0000020110616e76g000rp&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China EXIM Bank loans Tajikistan $64 million for Chormagzak tunnel of Dushanbe-Dangara Road (linked to ID #53750, #40063)
description: In 2010, the Export-Import Bank of China loaned Tajikistan64 million for the construction of the Chormagzak tunnel. This is part of the Phase II of the reconstruction project of the Dushanbe-Dangara section of the Dushanbe-Kulma road, which was also financed by Exim bank loans. The Chormagzak tunnel is 4.4 km long and was implemented between 2010 and 2013. This project is linked to projects ID #53750 and #40063, which capture Exim bank loans for phases I and II of the reconstruction of Dushanbe-Dangara road.

title: China grants food, tents and sheets to Tajikistan for Harsh Winter Relief (linked to #57839)
description: In April 2012, the government of China sent Tajikistan a humanitarian aid package consisting of 220 tons of rice, 120 tons of vegetable oil, tents, and sheets. It is unclear which part of the Chinese government provided the funding, and the financial value of the project is unclear. This project should not be confused with project #57839, the 2011 natural disaster response from China to Tajikistan. The 2012 aid package primarily seeks to address the impact of an unusually cold winter, while the 2011 aid package primarily seeks to address a flood.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=CEASEN0020120417e84h000b7&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCCA00020120416e84g000m9&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dropbox.com/s/rl546mymjz3f15f/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20from%20Tajikistan%20AIMS%20China%20Specific%20Projects.xlsx?dl=0, Other

title: China grants Tajikistan 10 buses and 25 tractors
description: Stipulated under earlier agreements, China granted Tajikistan 10 buses and 25 tractors. No further information regarding the value of the equipment was located.

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: China EXIM Bank Provides 200 Million USD Loan to Mongolian Development Bank for construction of apartments for civil servants
description: On March 16, 2012 the Development Bank of Mongolia (DBM) has been allowed to establish a loan contract of up to USD 200 million with the Export-Import Bank of China, with an aim to create a financial resource for constructing apartments for state servants. Related Minister and a leader of the DBM have been obliged to organize the construction of apartments and to give to the cabinet reports on implementation of the contract and construction process. Money equivalent to 15 per cent of the loan will be placed in the annual state budget for the construction. The loan's term is 15 years, its interest is one percent a year. The payment of loan and its interest will not be made in the first three years after the establishment of contract. Groundbreaking occurred in December of 2012, however as of 2015 full construction had not begun. At its approval in 2015, the amount of the loan was approved and finalized to be used for the New Yarmag Housing project.
sources: http://www.news.mn/r/208313, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=OANA000020120316e83g0005n&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.gdelaf.com/en/News/134.aspx, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

title: China grants Kyrgyzstan 5 million RMB for training civil servants
description: On July 5, 2012 a signing ceremony took place for a Chinese grant of 5 million RMB to Kyrgyzstan for training civil servants. The grant supports a program established by presidential decree in 2011 that would expand opportunities for Kyrgyz civil servants to study and train abroad. The current state of this project is unclear.

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Shanghai Construction Group General Co., State-owned Company
title: China gives 160mil yuan worth of aid to Mongolia for Buyant-Ukhaa sports complex
description: The Chinese government gave a 160 million RMB grant to Mongolia in order to build a sports complex in Buyant-Ukhaa. The construction was carried out by the Shanghai Construction Group. The Mongolian National Stadium, built by the Chinese government, covers an area of ​​4 hectares and a construction area of ​​15,304 square meters with 5045 seats for basketball, volleyball, badminton, wrestling and judo. Gymnasium started in May 2008, completed in September 2010, by the China and China Construction Engineering Design Consultants Limited design, Shanghai Construction Engineering (Group) Corporation construction. It is unclear when the project was committed.

implementing_agencies: Zijin Mining Group Ltd., Private Sector
title: China Development Bank loans Tajikistan gold mine venture 140 million USD for expansion
description: In 2013, China Development Bank and Zijin Mining Group signed a loan agreement with Tajikistan-based gold mining joint venture worth 140 million. The loan is to be used for expanding the production capacity of the mine. Other agreements signed at the meeting include two 20 million USD loans from China Development Bank and 33 million RMB to finance expansion of Tajikistan's agricultural sector.

title: China EXIM Bank loans $35 million to Tajikistan for rehabilitation of Regar substation (linked to ID #40481)
description: In 2013, China EXIM Bank loaned35,043,320 to the Tajik Ministry of Finance for the rehabilitation of the 500 kV Regar substation for the reconstruction, as reported in the May 2018 flat export of Tajkistan's AIMS. The total cost of the project is36.9 million. Loan details are unknown, but media reports state that it is a concessional loan. The project is currently under implementation.

title: Chinese Central Bank loans Tajikistan 20 million USD
description: In 2014, the State Savings Bank of Tajikistan, Amonatbok, and the Chinese Central Bank have negotiated a 20 million US concessional loan. The loan will be used for construction of the bank's new building and expansion of the bank's agricultural credit. The project's overall aim is to expand entrepreneurship and alleviate poverty in Tajikistan.

implementing_agencies: China Railway Construction Corporation (CRCC), State-owned Company
title: China Exim Bank loans Tajikistan 68.9 million USD for Vahdat-Javan railway section upgrade
description: China EXIM Bank has agreed to loan Tajikistan 68.9 million USD at concessional rates to construct the Vahdat-Javan (also spelled Yavan) railway section. This railway section is part of a larger regional railway construction that aims to link Tajikistan, Afghanistan, and Turkmenistan. According to the State Committee on Investment and State Property Management of the Republic of Tajikistan, the official title of the project is 'Construction of railway tunnel on Dushanbe-Kurgan-Tyube railway, Vahdat plot - Yovon' and the total project cost is 71,992 million. 68,992 of this amount is being provided through a loan from China EXIM Bank, and the source for the remaining3 million is listed as 'Other.' The project was previously reported as costing56.9 million before the amount increased. The construction includes 5 bridges with 712 m length and 3 tunnels of 3755 m length. The contractor is China railway 19 bureau group. This project started in May 2015 and is expected to be finished by August 2016. According to news report, the project went into full operation in 2016.

implementing_agencies: China Road & Bridge Corporation (CRBC), State-owned Company
title: Alternative North-South Road Project Section Kazarman-Jalal Abad and Section Balykchy-Aral (Linked to Project ID #46350, #53585)
description: In September, 2013 officials from China's Exim Bank and the Kyrgyz Republic's Ministry of Finance signed a399,989,041 USD preferential buyer credit loan agreement to finance the construction of the Alternative North-South Road Project Section Kazarman-Jalal Abad (km291-km433) and Section Balykchy-Aral (km183+500-195+486). The Ministry of Transport and Communications of Kyrgyzstan and China Road and Bridge Corporation entered into a Commercial Contract on July 8 2013 for the purpose of implementing the project. Construction began in 2014. The aim of this international North-South transport corridor is to reduce trade costs and connect Russia, Central Asia, Iran, and India. As of 2015, phase 1 was still in implementation, and an agreement had been signed for the financing of phase 2. According to AMP report on the project last updated in 2015, the project status is still ongoing. Kyrgyzstan's 'North-South' highway will have a total length of 433 km and require850 million in capital. The project is being implemented in three parts: Phase I (2014): Alternative North-South Road Project Section Kazarman-Jalal Abad (km291-km433) and Section Balykchy-Aral (km183+500-195+486); US399,989,041 financed by the Export-Import Bank of China [Project 40491] Phase II (2015): Alternative North-South Road Project Section Aral-Kazarman (KM 195-KM 291); US185,254,119 export buyer's credit from EXIM Bank [Project 53585] & US112 million concessional loan from EXIM Bank [Project 46350] Phase III (planned): 'Balekchi-Kezeldez' (0-183km) [Total: 183km] STAFF_NOTE: Since this project is an export credit and has concessional terms, it was coded as mixed intent.

title: China provides 9.3mil som worth of emergency construction materials to Kyrgyzstan for emergency relief
description: Summary: On October 7, 2014 the Ministry of Emergency Situations received building materials in the amount of 9.3mil som($171.1thousand). The building materials were received through the Chinese grant in the framework of the agreement on economic and technical cooperation between the Government of Kyrgyzstan and the Government of China signed on 13 September, 2005. The Ministry of Emergency Situations was instructed to use the materials while carrying out emergency repair works and other emergency operations in the areas and settlements.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=CEASEN0020141016eaag0008h&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China aids the construction of the baba lilly road in PNG
description: On March 16, 2005, the groundbreaking ceremony was held in the village of Baba for a highway projects in Papua New Guinea Baba Lilly. China aids to build the highway. The road construction side of Beijing Municipal Corporation project team manager also participated and made a statement.
sources: http://pg.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/hzjj/200503/20050300027169.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Guangdong Construction Engineering Group Co., State-owned Company
title: China provides a 70 million CNY grant for construction projects (linked to #39284)
description: In 2005, China committed a $10.3 million USD grant package to Papua New Guinea. This funding would go toward the extension of the computer building at the University of Technology in Lae, Morobe Province, and the extension of students' dormitories and staff houses at the Vudal University in the East New Britain Provinc. Chinese government granted free techical assistance to the renovation of the mansion of the Governor-General of Papua New Guinea. Guangdong Construction Engineering Group Corporation was in charge of the construction of the Governor Mansion project, including the residential houses for officials and the the reception lobby. The construction was started in January 2007. The lobby was completed on 2007 May 31, and the whole project ended in Dec 2007. The hand over ceremony was held on Feb 20 2008. On Feburary 1, 2008, China handed over K23mi worth of buildings. Guangdong Foreign Construction Company implemented this project. #39284 On April 1, 2005, Chinese Ambassador Li Zhengjun, who was guest speaker at Unitech's 37th graduation in Lae, made a commitment for the Chinese Government to fund the construction of a new building to house the mathematics and computer department to replace the one that was burnt down several years ago. Primary and detailed design for the new building had been completed and work on the site was expected to start before September. The project was implemented by Guangdong Foreign Construction Company. It was actually started March 25, 2006 and was completed on January 10, 2008.

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Hunan Construction Engineering Group Corporation of China, State-owned Company
title: China helps renovate the Siumu Primary School (Linked #37736)
description: On Oct. 23, 2015, the two story-state of the art school building for Siumu Primary School was officially opened. The total cost of the work was 5 million Samoan Tala which was constructed by Hunan Construction from China for 18 months. The new school building include 16 classrooms, a multi-function hall, 5 office rooms, a boardroom, a fitness room, a computer lab and a library. The ceremony was attended by Members of Cabinet; Speaker of the House, Afioga Laaulialemalietoa Leuatea Polataivao; Leader of the Opposition Party, Afioga Palusalue Faapo II; Members of Parliament; China’s Ambassador to Samoa, Mr Xue Feng Wang; Representatives of the Hunan Construction Company; members of Siumu district, teachers and students. Funding reportedly came from a 13.3M grant given by China in 2012 (see linked project ID #37736).
sources: http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjb_663304/zwjg_665342/zwbd_665378/t1312985.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://ws.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/hzjj/201510/20151001145958.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjb_663304/zwjg_665342/zwbd_665378/t1308982.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.facebook.com/GovtPressSec/posts/903660436394306, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs; http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjb_663304/zwjg_665342/zwbd_665378/t1309385.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.radionz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/228345/national-university-of-samoa-to-build-maritime-training-centre, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Xuefeng Wang, Ambassador (Chinese Embassy)

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: China loans the Cook Islands $950,000 USD for Ministry of Education Administrative Building (Linked to Project #37877)
description: A loan from the Chinese EXIM bank funded the building of a Ministry of Education Building on Nikao (Rarotonga), Cook Islands (territory of New Zealand). The loan was signed in 2007 and construction took place from 2011-2012. The conditions of the loan include a 2% interest, 5 year grace period, and a 20 year maturity rate. The cost of the project was $950,000. Construction was done by Mike Rennie Builders, a local company. The new two-story building includes offices, conference rooms, and training facilities. This project was funded together with project #37877 for the Telecom Sports Arena. The project has been completed. STAFF_NOTE: There is some discrepancy in transaction amount with sources ranging between $950k and $1.1mil.
sources: http://www.lowyinstitute.org/files/pubfiles/Hanson,_China_stumbling_Second_edition_web.pdf, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://www.lowyinstitute.org/chinese-aid-map/, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation)

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China offers 10 million yuan worth of relief goods to North Korea
description: On Apr. 24, 2004, Chinese government announced its emergency relief supplies worth 10 million CNY to North Korea in response to the explosion accident at Ryongchon Station in North Pyongan Province on Apr 22. The first batch of 500,000 yuan worth of relief goods arrived at the site on Apr. 25, 2004, including food, 2000 blankets, and 300 tents. The second batch arrived at Apr. 27, mainly including medical equipment and medicines. The third batch arrived on Apr. 30, including gasoline, diesel, and materials for windows and doors.
sources: http://news.163.com/2004w04/12532/2004w04_1082783119933.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2004-05-01/13503180758.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCMNF0020040425e04p001p5&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China donates $18m worth of aid for flood victims in North Korea
description: In August 2012, the World Food Program (WFP) said the Chinese government has contributed the cash to a total amount of emergency food aid worth $18 million USD sent to flood-hit areas in the southern part of North Korea.The aid came after the North filed a request for emergency aid this week, and the U.N. Resident Coordinator's Office in Pyongyang called for immediate assistance after an on-site investigation. Cash donations North Korea has received will be used to buy corn, sugar, vegetables and other materials from inexpensive, yet quality resources, the aid group said.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=THAINS0020120813e88e0007f&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2016/04/113_117095.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China grants $5.86m for reconstruction of Samoan Schools
description: In 2009 China gave $US 5.86 million grant for post-tsunami reconstruction and furnishing of three schools in Samoa.

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China commits $1.46m grant to Samoa for a Women and Youth Hall
description: In 2009 China committed a 1.46 million USD grant to Samoa for the construction of a Women and Youth Hall. STAFF_NOTE: Sources disagree whether the grant was for 1.46 or 1.6 million USD.

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Shanghai Construction Group General Co., State-owned Company
title: China commits grant for the construction of eight school buildings in Samoa
description: In November 2013 the last two schools of a total of eight that were funded with Chinese grant money were completed. One school was built in Falevao and another was built in Sapapali’i. The Shanghai Construction Group was in charge of implementation.

contacts: Li Yanduan, Chinese Ambassador to Samoa

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China gives $9m loan to Samoa for construction of parliamentary complex
description: On September 18, 2007 construction on the parliament offices in Samoa began. The project was funded by a Chinese loan worth $9m. The terms loan included an interest rate at 2%, a five year grace period, and a 20 year maturity rate. Construction was completed on September 17, 2008. It is a two storey building to provide offices and meeting rooms for members of Parliament of Samoa. The project involves construction work, supply and drain work, electricity, mechanical ventilation, fire alarm system, telecommunication system, exterior road, parking area within the building line and furniture.

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China loans $15m to Samoa for the construction of a Ministry of Justice and Courts Administration
description: On September 18, 2007 the Chinese government began construction on the Ministry of Justice and Courts Administration court house in Samoa. The venture was funded by a $15m soft loan by the Chinese, with a 2% interest rate and a grace period of 5 years. Construction ended on January 25, 2010. The building provides offices, judiciary chambers and court rooms for the Supreme Court, Land and Titles Court and other necessary functions of the court. It involves construction work, supply and drain work, electricity, mechanical ventilation, fire alarm system, telecommunication system, exterior road, parking area within the building line and furniture.

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: Chinese EXIM Bank gives $41m loan to Samoa for the construction of a National Medical Centre and Ministry of Health Headquarters
description: In 2008 construction began on the Samoan National Medical Centre and Ministry of Health Headquarters. The venture is being funded by the Chinese EXIM bank with a concessional loan of $41m with an interest rate of 2%, a 5 year grace period and a 20 year maturity rate. The Chinese handed over the buildings to the Samoan government on July 23, 2011

implementing_agencies: China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC), State-owned Company
title: China Development Bank loans $4.1 billion for Galkynysh Gas Field Phase II (Linked to #40393)
description: In April 2011, China Development Bank signed an loan-for-gas framework agreement with Turkmengaz (the national natural gas company of Turkmenistan) for Phase 2 of the Galkynysh Gas Field Project (also known as South Yolotan–Osman Field Project or the Ioujno-Elotenshoie Gas Field Project). Then, in September 2013, China Development Bank and Turkmengaz signed a4.1 billion loan agreement for this project. The CDB loan is reportedly secured by natural gas exports to China. Turkmengaz will use the revenue it earns from a supply contract for natural gas as collateral for the loan. The loan will be disbursed over 3 years, and in return Turkmengaz will reportedly supply natural gas to China for 10 years. CNPC is the contractor responsible for project implementation. The purpose of phase II of this project was to build facilities at the Galkynysh Gas Field that will process 30 billion cubic meters (bcm) per year. The project entered implementation on May 8, 2014. Staff Note: This project is part of the umbrella project captured in project #43168 and it is considered to be part of the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI).

implementing_agencies: China National Nuclear Corporation, State-owned Company
title: Part I: China gives financial package including concessional loan of 2.647 billion RMB to Pakistan for GCL Karachi Nuclear Power K2/K3 project (Project ID linked to #41917 #41918)
description: On January 14, 2014 China Exim Bank agreed to a mixed credit of6.5 billion USD to finance Pakistan's Karachi Nuclear Power Plant's K-2/K-3 projects. The inter-government framework agreement went through various stages of approval until February 18, 2014. The groundbreaking ceremony of the 2000 MW energy plants, took place in November 2013. The project is being jointly financed by China Export-Import Bank in the form of a 'mixed credit' at a ratio 81.97 [$6.5 bn] with Pakistan financing 18.03 percent (the Pakistani government will have to mark up against this loan at a rate of 3.20 %). The terms of the financial package are as follows:(i) Government concessional loan of RMB 2.647bn (with interest @ 1pc per annum)[approved FEb 18, 2014]; (ii) preferential buyer credit of4.001bn (with interest @ 2pc per annum); and (iii) buyer credit of2.250bn (with interest @ 6pc per annum) China developed the ACP-1000 reactor, which cost about5 billion each to build, bringing the total cost of the project up to US$10 billion.The construction is being managed by China National Nuclear Corporation, using Hualon One technology (the CNNC's third-generation nuclear reactor design). STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to the Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16, the project is listed as a Preferential Buyer's Credit Loan at the amount of USD3,618.15 million.
sources: http://www.finance.gov.pk/releases_mar_15.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.brecorder.com/fuel-a-energy/193:pakistan/1157769:two-nuclear-power-plants-exim-bank-agrees-to-extend-65-billion-credit/?date=2015-03-05, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.thehindu.com/news/international/10-billion-pak-nuclear-power-plant-to-be-built-by-china/article7561473.ece, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2015/03/26/business/exim-bank-to-facilitate-construction-of-nuclear-power-plant/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.financialexpress.com/article/world-news/pakistan-to-begin-work-on-third-unit-of-karachi-nuclear-plant-soon/270852/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.world-nuclear.org/information-library/country-profiles/countries-o-s/pakistan.aspx, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.dawn.com/news/1143822, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.dawn.com/news/1167800, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/kyodo-news-international/130613/pakistan-start-work-chinese-aided-nuclear-power-plant, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.sbp.org.pk/reports/quarterly/fy15/Second/Chap-4.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Website%20Year%20Book%202015-2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.theanalystworld.com/chinese-investment-in-pakistan-rhetoric-or-reality/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.finance.gov.pk/press_releases.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

The terms of the financial package are as follows:(i) Government concessional loan of RMB 2.647bn (with interest @ 1pc per annum)[approved FEb 18, 2014]; (ii) preferential buyer credit of4.001bn (with interest @ 2pc per annum); and (iii) buyer credit of2.250bn (with interest @ 6pc per annum) China developed the ACP-1000 reactor, which cost about5 billion each to build, bringing the total cost of the project up to US$10 billion.The construction is being managed by China National Nuclear Corporation, using Hualon One technology (the CNNC's third-generation nuclear reactor design). STAFF_NOTE: NOV 18 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape A Pakistani ministry of finance monthly project status report in May 2015-16 records the project as a loan of the same amount.

implementing_agencies: China Nonferrous Metal Industry's Foreign Engineering And Construction Co.,ltd. (NFC), ; Kazakhmys, Private Sector
title: China Development Bank Aktogay copper deposit USD Facility (Linked to Project ID #39557)
description: In December 2011, CDB signed two bilateral agreements with Kazakh Copper Company (Originally called Kazykhmys PLC, now called KazMinerals) to set up loan facilities worth 1.5 billion to for copper mine development projects in Aktobe. Aktobe maintains a volume of 5 million tons of copper. The money was used to construct Aktogay mine. First copper cathode production from oxide ore occurred in December 2015, whilst first copper in concentrate output from sulphide ore began in February 2017. The main sulphide concentrator was constructed by Nonferrous China (NFC). The project capital cost is expected to be in the region of2.1 billion. The mine is expected to produce up to 100,000 tons of copper concentrate annually in 2015. On February 16, 2012 the loan was finalized and signed as two transactions one for RMB 1 billion (158 million), the other for 1.34 billion USD. It is being developed as an open-pit mine including an on-site concentrator and construction work started in the first half of 2013. The Facility has a final maturity of 15 years from the date of first drawing. The total Aktogay Facility of approximately1.5 billion is comprised of two separate agreements, a USD agreement for up to1.34 billion and an RMB agreement for up to RMB 1.0 billion (approx158 million). Both agreements are reportedly on essentially similar terms and conditions, except that proceeds drawn under the RMB agreement can only be applied towards payments to Chinese suppliers for equipment, materials and services sourced from China. The interest rate on the USD agreement is set with reference to USD LIBOR, while the RMB agreement is at the applicable benchmark rate published by the People's Bank of China (PBoC). The maturity period for the loan is 15 years, and the grace period is 3 years.
sources: http://finance.sina.com.cn/stock/hkstock/ggIPO/20110613/17019982894.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.kazminerals.com/en/operations/aktogay, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.kazminerals.com/resources/1235/CDB%20Dec%202011%20Final%20v2%20161211.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.caifcgroup.com/press/1/59.jsp, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=KAZWIR0020111221e7ck000dy&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/industry/mining/8573834/Kazakhmys-gets-1.5bn-loan-from-China.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.kazminerals.com/media/1725/ka149_book-small-cmyk-1.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.mining-technology.com/projects/aktogay-copper-mine/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.sina.com.cn/w/2011-06-14/073122636248.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://kz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/tzwl/201106/20110607607532.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.kazminerals.com/our-business/aktogay/, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

title: China sent seismologists to India to help monitor aftershocks(linked to project #41963,#41964)

title: China sent relief materials to India for earthquake
description: China is sending relief material to show the sympathy of the Chinese government and people to the Indian government and victims of the quake-stricken areas. Specifically, China has already sent 10,700 dozens of zinc oxide adhesive plaster, 26,000 dozen bandages, 3,300 rolls of absorbent cotton wool, 20,000 pieces of acrylic blankets and 2,000 tents. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service created the project entry on 23/04/2001 and last updated it on 17/05/2001, so the project is likely to have been finished by then.

implementing_agencies: China Road & Bridge Corporation (CRBC), State-owned Company
title: China grants additional 50 million RMB for 6th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge (Linked to #33941, #39022)
description:
In 2002, the Chinese Government provided an RMB 50 million grant (Project ID#41981), an RMB 60 million grant (Project ID#33941), and an RMB 50 million interest-free loan (Project ID#39022) for the 6th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge Project. These grant and interest-free loan commitments were codified in Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreements (ECTA) that were signed on January 11, 2002 and December 24, 2002. The bridge is located over the Dhaleshwari (Dhaleshwari) River, a tributary of the Meghna River, and on Dhaka-Munshigonj road. It is 37 kilometers southeast of Dhaka. The construction of the bridge sought to establish a fixed transport link between Dhaka city and Munshigonj, which is one of the major supply area of agricultural products to the capital city. The district of Munshigonj, sepereated by Dhleshwari river is situated 30 km south of Dhaka. It consists of 6 upazilas, 67 union parishads, 662 mousaz, 906 villages, 18 wards, 73 mahallas and 2 municipalities.  

The Muktarpur bridge is located over the Dhaleshwari (Dhaleshwari) River, a tributary of the Meghna River, and on Dhaka-Munshigonj road. It is 37 kilometers southeast of Dhaka. The construction of the bridge sought to establish a fixed transport link between Dhaka city and Munshigonj, which is one of the major supply area of agricultural products to the capital city. The precise locational coordinates of the Muktarpur bridge can be found at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Muktarpur+Bridge,+Bangladesh/@23.5696501,90.5103998,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x3755ae1dcd95674d:0x96d85ebcaadf43f0!8m2!3d23.5696452!4d90.5125885 and https://www.google.com/maps/place/Muktarpur+Bridge/@23.5716112,90.5135207,15z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x0:0xfd1bce5e1ee0e66a!8m2!3d23.5716112!4d90.5135207

The Jamuna Multi-Purpose Bridge Authority (JMBA) signed a project implementation contract  with China Road & Bridge Corporation (CRBC) on December 27, 2004.  A groundbreaking ceremony took place on January 27, 2005. Construction began on April 28, 2005. The 1521 meters long and 10 meters wide bridge was officially opened to traffic on February 18, 2008. Several sources indicate that RMB 141 million of grant funding was ultimately disbursed for the construction of this bridge 

Staff Note: The Chinese project title was 援孟六桥——达雷斯瓦里河公路桥. The 6th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge Project is also known as the Muktarpur Bridge (Bangla translation: মুক্তারপুর সেতু).
sources: http://www.bba.gov.bd/6th-bangladesh-china-friendship-bridge-2/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcsap0020021229dyct000rt&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
