title: China offers $77m in debt relief to Nauru (Linked to Project ID #37645)
description: On July 22, 2002, it was announced that China has offered $60 million USD in aid and $77 million USD toward debt relief to Nauru. The China-Nauru deal was sealed on the basis of China's promise to offer Nauru $60 million USD in financial aid as well as the promise to repay debt worth $77 million USD owed to the General Electric Co, Chang said. According to the CIA World Factbook, Nauru is burdened with external debts of about US$33.3 million. This project is linked to Project ID #37645.

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China gives grant for expansion of Vanuatu Prime Minister's Office
description: On January 13, 2013, China signed a grant to Vanuatu to renovate the office of the Prime Minister in Port Vila as part of bilateral economic and technical agreements. A design survey was undertaken from October –November 2013. In October 28th 2014, the preliminary design documents were forwarded to Government for consideration. In January 2015, the Government acknowledged receipt of the preliminary design for the extension of the Office of the Prime Minister. The Chinese side agreed to demolish the existing one two – floor building and one floor building and car parking shed behind the U shape building, to allow for the new Prime Ministers Office building to be built on the same site comprising a three floor office building which consists of the Prime Ministers Office and auxiliary building. STAFF_NOTE: The commitment year is uncertain, as one source mentions the grant as having occurred in 2010. The transaction amount is unknown. The original project entry listed it as $2960000, but this number is not mentioned in any of the sources, so it is left as blank.
sources: http://www.pireport.org/articles/2016/05/17/china-renovate-vanuatu-pm%E2%80%99s-office, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.lowyinstitute.org/sites/default/files/pubfiles/Hanson_and_Fifita%2C_China_in_the_Pacific_web_1.pdf, Academic Journal Article; http://www.radionz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/304024/china-to-fund-renovation-of-vanuatu-pm's-offices, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://indigenouswatch.wordpress.com/2016/05/19/china-to-build-new-prime-ministers-office/, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs

title: China grants $3.6m for road construction in Tonga

A hand-over ceremony was held in Vientiane last weekend between Chinese Ambassador to Laos Pan Quang Xue and Minister to the Presidential Palace and Chairman of the National Committee for Drug Control and Supervision Suban Salithilath.

title: Chinese doctors to provide free services in India
description: In January 2008, it was announced that a joint team of Chinese and Indian doctors will provide free medical services in some of the poorest regions of India in memory of an Indian doctor who died serving in China over 70 years ago. A China India Joint Medical Mission (CIJMM) has been set up during Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's visit to Beijing to serve the rural populations of the two countries. The 20 doctors will first serve in Hebei province in north China. The joint mission is also expected to visit India by the end of the year. All the medical services offered by the doctors would be free. These would include medical consultations and drugs.

implementing_agencies: Reliance Communications Ltd., Private Sector
title: CDB loans $750m to India's Reliance Communications (Facility I) (Linked to #54348, #54349, #54350)
description: On June 4, 2008, Reliance Communications (RCOM) obtained a750 million USD (Rs 3,000 crore) loan from China Development Bank to fund its nationwide GSM foray. RCOM sources said the company has already received all necessary approvals including that of RBI for the said amount, whose tenure is for 10 years and has an interest rate of the applicable LIBOR and a margin of 1.8%, making the interest rate 4.032%. The loan would finance RCOM's GSM equipment order placed with Chinese network major Huawei. In January this year, RCOM had awarded a nationwide GSM rollout contract for electronics valued at about500-600 million USD to Huawei. As of December 31st, 2014,518 million USD of the loan was outstanding.

implementing_agencies: China Telecom Corporation Ltd., State-owned Company; Nepal Telecom, State-owned Company
title: China agrees 250 million Nepalese rupees for Nepal Fibre-Optic Cable Construction (Linked to project #34388)
description: The network extends from Banepa [southeast of Kathmandu] to Khasa [border town in Tibet, 'Zhangmu' in Chinese (also from Tibetan as Dram or Zham, from Nepali as Khasa)] to create digital optical fibre network along the whole Araniko Highway. The network is expected to serve as a vital communication traffic transit point for Indian and Chinese telecommunication services. The single mode optical cable that will run through 120 km between Kathmandu and Khasa will have a total of 36 fibres. China has extended a grant of 250m rupees [approx. 4m US dollars] for creating this network. The exact terms of financing is unknown. According to press release by the Chinese embassy in Nepal on Sep 23, 2007, the implementation contract was signed between China Telecom and Nepal Telecom that day. The contract amount is RMB24.5 million, roughly the equivalent of 250m rupees/4m dollars. According to a BBC news report on January 23, 2008, the government began work on laying optical fibres on January 22, 2008. Minister for Information and Communications Krishna Bahadur Mahara and Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Zheng Xianglin jointly inaugurated the project. The survey and designing works have already been completed. The work was estimated to be complete in the next five months. According to the Chinese Ministry of Finance Investment Guide 2018 (p.27), the project finished construction in 2008 but the communication carrier services on both side did not establish connection, and Nepal used the fibre network for domestic communcation use. In 2016, China extended its optical fibre network from Lhasa, Tibet to Nepal via Geelong(Keyrong)-Rasuwgadhi border point and handed it over in August that year. In 2018, China Telecom and Nepal Telecom completed compatibility works and Nepal is officially connected to Internet via Chinese fibre networks. STAFF_NOTE: On December 20, 2007 China and Nepal signed an agreement for China to provide a grant assistance equivalent to 50 million RMB (428.5 million Rs) for various development projects in Nepal. Projects include the Rasuwagadi-Syafru Besi road, an optical fibre cable connecting Kathmandu and Lhasa, broadening the Khasa-Tatopani Road, and repairing the Miteri Bridge. For the umbrella project, see #34388.
sources: http://www.c114.com.cn/ftth/315/a223640.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020080123e41n001p5&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://books.google.com/books?id=HtSGAwAAQBAJ&pg=PA131&lpg=PA131&dq=The+single+mode+optical+cable+that+will+run+through+120+km+between+Kathmandu+and+Khasa&source=bl&ots=TRgCguBmFd&sig=ArCTZKM3HuAdwTr9w_0RzDtDdeM&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiK7K28lP3NAhVFzz4KHXAGBMoQ6AEIKjAA#v=onepage&q=The%20single%20mode%20optical%20cable%20that%20will%20run%20through%20120%20km%20between%20Kathmandu%20and%20Khasa&f=false, Other; http://www.infopig.com/keywords/Nepal/02-28-2008-090212.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international/business/china-links-nepal-with-optical-fibre-to-end-india-dependence/articleshow/52706038.cms, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2016-06/11/c_135428118.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/dl/gbdqzn/upload/niboer.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.chinca.org/cica/info/35367, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/jm/t365849.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Nepal Telecom, State-owned Company
contacts: Krishna Bahadur Mahara, Minister for Information and Communications (NEPAL); Zheng Xianglin, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal

title: China Pledges to Train 100 Indian Officials on Heavy Haul Transportation (linked to ID #42673)
description: 20 September 2014 China has agreed to train 100 officials of Indian Railway on heavy haul transportation apart from helping redevelop two railway stations and set up a railway university in India. 25 September 2014 Under the agreement, China has agreed to provide training in heavy haul for 100 Indian Railways officials, redevelopment of existing railway stations and establishment of a Railway University in India. 26 December 2014 The first batch of the 100 Indian Railway officials, who are to receive training in heavy-haul technology in China, has begun their 12-day coaching at the Jiaotong University. The inauguration ceremony for training in the heavy-haul technology for the 22 officers from the Indian Railway was held at Beijing Jiaotong University yesterday, an Indian Embassy press release issued here today said. The 12-day training programme, which is being conducted by Beijing Jiaotong University under the supervision of National Railway Administration of China, is the first step in the cooperation envisaged by India and China in the MoU and Implementation Plan on Cooperation in Railways. The training involving 100 Indian officers will lay emphasis on onsite training covering operational and maintenance facilities, monitoring systems and traffic controls. Four more batches from Indian railway officials will be trained at the Beijing Jiatong University in heavy-haul technology in the next two years, the press release said. The training was part of the MoU signed during the visit of Chinese President Xi Jinping to India in September this year. Under the MoU, China will do a free feasibility study for a high-speed train corridor. India has chosen the Delhi-Chennai route for this study.
sources: http://www.rediff.com/business/report/first-batch-of-indian-railway-officials-begin-training-in-china/20141216.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.firstpost.com/india/1st-batch-indian-railway-officials-begin-training-china-1852021.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=DECHER0020140919ea9k000gy&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=DECHER0020140919ea9k000gy&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.telegraphindia.com/1141125/jsp/frontpage/story_19085087.jsp#.V4etOJMrKu4, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China extends loan of $98m to ICICI Bank of India
description: On March 19, 2009, the Export Import Bank of China (China Exim bank) and ICICI Bank signed a loan agreement for98 million USD under a two-step buyer credit (export credit) arrangement. The ICICI Bank signed the loan agreement through its Hong Kong branch and is the first Indian bank to have entered into this arrangement with China Exim. The cooperation between ICICI Bank and China Exim bank is likely to lead to creation of business opportunities for Chinese firms in India and is also expected to help Indian companies in tying-up long-term debt for their projects.
sources: http://www.icicibank.com/managed-assets/docs/about-us/2009/HK_ChinaEximFinal(2).pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PRTRIN0020090331e53u00059&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China pledges 147 USD in export-buyers credits to Vietnam Coal and Mineral Industries Group
description: An agreement was signed (May 12th) by the Export-Import Bank of China (EximBank) and Vietnam Coal and Mineral Industries Group (VCMIG). The agreement was worth US$147m. The EximBank signed an export-buyers credit agreement with VCMIG to support the two-110 mw coal-combustion power-station project contracted by China SFECO Group.
sources: http://www.ide.go.jp/English/Publish/Download/Brc/pdf/01_chinaseconomic.pdf, Academic Journal Article; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=EIUCP00020060520e25j0002p&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Vietnam National Coal - Mineral Industries Group (Vinacomin), State-owned Company

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: China National Machinery Industry Corporation, State-owned Company
title: China EXIM Bank Agrees $1.67 billion Cambodia Oil Refinery
description: In October 2013, Cambodia signed a $1.67 billion loan with the Export-Import Bank of China, allowing construction on Cambodia’s landmark oil refinery to break ground in December 2013. The prime minister has called for refined oil – which would hypothetically first enter the country in crude oil imports or through off-shore extraction – to be flowing by 2018. The venture is among CPC, Chinese Sinomach China Perfect Machinery Industry Corp and Sinopec. First announced in December, the $2.3 billion refinery is slated to be constructed on 80 hectares of land between the provinces of Preah Sihanouk and Kampot. After Exim Bank provides the $1.67 billion, the remaining funds will come from shareholders, according to Khieng.
sources: http://www.shanghaidaily.com/Business/finance/Chinas-Exim-Bank-to-fund-US/shdaily.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.cambo-china.com/CHINANeswID.asp?ID=12719, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.gov.cn/ztzl/2013-01/07/content_2306500.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.phnompenhpost.com/business/ground-broken-oil-refinery, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://thebricspost.com/china-to-fund-1-67bn-cambodian-oil-refinery/#.Wpj2gxMbPow, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=THENAT0020141027eaar0000q&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.phnompenhpost.com/business/oil-refinery-receive-167b-loan, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: State Customs Service (Turkmenistan), Government Agency
title: China Donated Inspection System to Turkmenistan
description: On June 22, China agreed to provide a mobile inspection system to the Turkmenistan government. The chairman of the State Customs Service of Turkmenistan, [Myratberdi] Annalyyew, from the Turkmen side, and Vice President of the Nuktek Company, Ms Wen Hwan, from the Chinese side, signed the contract. The mobile inspection system was handed over on April 3, 2006. STAFF_ NOTE: Neither resource indicates any terms associated with the mobile inspection system, so it is coded as a grant.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=BBCAPP0020060822e28m004ed&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://presidentniyazov.tripod.com/id63.html, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs
recipient_agencies: State Customs Service (Turkmenistan), Government Agency

title: China provides 1.2 million USD grant for Pakistan's law enforcements
description: On September 27th, 2011, a meeting in Islamabad between the Pakistani Interior Minister Rehman Malik, Chinese Vice Premier Meng Jianzhu, and Pakistani Army Chief Gen. Ashfaq Kayani resulted in the announcement that the Chinese government would provide a grant to Pakistani law enforcement agencies. The grant, worth 1.2 million USD, was committed to strengthen ties and with an underlying goal of fighting terrorism.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=DJ00000020110929e79t000fy&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://tribune.com.pk/story/261546/china-announces-aid-for-pakistan-law-enforcement-agencies/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provides USD16,310,011 loan for 18 MW Naltar Hydropower Plant-IV (linked to #43228, #43229)
description:
According to the 2006-2007 Foreign Economic Assistance Status Report on Commitments and Disbursements, the loan agreement for the 18 MW Naltar Hydropower project was signed in December 2001, with a commitment of $16,310,011. Disbursement has been completed as of 30 June 2007. The feasibility study had been completed in 2000. The project was finished in October 2007. The executing agency is KANA.  China has taken up at least four other hydropower projects in these areas—Bhunji including the Naltar project and then smaller projects in places like Phendar, Harpo and Yurlbo. 

STAFF_NOTE: Found on "P" tab of Status Report.
sources: https://www.dawn.com/news/597545, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AIWINE0020100905e69500002&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ecil.com/projects/details/Feasibility-Study-of-18-MW-Hydroelectric-Project-at-Naltar, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.ead.gov.pk/ead/userfiles1/file/Trainings/Status%20Report%20from%20July-June%2007.xls, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.suchtv.pk/pakistan/gilgit-baltistan/item/32924-naltar-hydropower-project-to-be-completed-by-july-2016.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://asianetpakistan.com/official-news/press-information-department/157968/prime-minister-performs-ground-breaking-of-14-4-mw-naltar-v-power-project/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China to invest USD44.6M in Harpo hydropower project, Pakistan (linked to #43228, #43229, #43230, #43231)
description:
5 September 2010
Besides these, China has taken up at least four other hydropower projects in these areas—Bhunji project in Gilgit-Baltistan, Kohala project (1100 MW), Naltar project and then smaller projects in places like Phendar, Harpo and Yuribo.

17 February 2014
The French Development Agency (AFD) and Germany’s Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ) will give 50 million euros and 20 million euros respectively towards the 35 MW Harpo hydropower project in Skardu district in Gilgit-Baltistan province, said Ali Raza Bhutta, joint secretary of the Federal Economic Affairs Division. The total cost of the project is 90 million euros.

24 May 2016
In addition to these undertakings, the Chinese firms are also working on six other power projects in Gilgit-Baltistan that include : US$7.8 billion Dasu Hydropower Project, US$ 70 million Phandar Project, US$ 40.01 million Bashu Hydropower Project, US$ 44.608 million Harpo Hydropower Project and US$ 6 billion Yulbo Hydropower Project. China is also investing an amount of US$ 300 million in housing, communication sectors.

9 June 2016
Other power generation projects are at various stages of construction, including 4,500MW Diamer Bhasha, 128MW Keyal Khwar, 106MW Golan Gol, 2,160 MW Dasu Hydropower Project, 34.5MW Harpo, 243MW 2nd Rehabilitation of Warsak Hydropower Station.

WAPDA.gov
The project area is located about 75 km north-west of Skardu town and 670 km north-east of Islamabad.
- ECNEC approved PC-I amounting to Rs.9522.801 million approved by ECNEC on March 28, 2014.
- Donor agencies KfW/AFD have conveyed their “No Objection Certificate” on Development and Operation Agreement”.
- NOC from KfW/AFD for combined evaluation (Technical & Financial Proposal) has been requested and reply awaited.
- Chairman WAPDA and Chief Secretary GB along with Secretary KA&GB have signed the Development and Operation Agreement (D&OA) and submitted to EAD for counter signatures of Secretary EAD.

STAFF_NOTE: The project was deactivated as there is no evidence of Chinese official financing
sources: https://www.ooskanews.com/story/2015/04/pakistan-approves-94-million-harpo-hydropower-project_164728, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.trust.org//item/20140217142812-dhgm0/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AIWINE0020100905e69500002&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pakobserver.net/2016/05/24/chinese-role-in-pak-development/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.wapda.gov.pk/index.php/projects/hydro-power/future/harpo, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.cpecinfo.com/cpec-news-detail.php?id=MTg0, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: Hunan Water Conservancy and Hydropower Construction Co. Ltd., State-owned Company
title: China provided grant to Nepal for 10MW Sunkoshi hydropower project
description: In September 2010, the 11th meeting of the Nepal-China Non-Government Cooperation Forum took place. A high-level 40-member team came to Nepal to attend the forum. The power shortage in Nepal was discussed as an important opportunity for Chinese companies to be involved in hydropower development in Nepal. According to the Ministry of Energy, Sunkoshi (10MW) hydro project has been completed with Chinese grant assistance. Pictures of the completed project could be found on the websites of the implementing agencies, all of which are Chinese state-owned companies. However, no information on Chinese financing could be found. The implementing companies include Hunan Water Conservancy and Hydropower Construction Co. Ltd. and Hunan Hydropower Design Institute.
sources: http://hnslsdsg.com/gongchengyeji/20190110/223.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://hnslsdsg.com/qiyegaikuang/, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/printedition/news/2011-02-24/cabinet-approves-chinese-loan-for-upper-trishuli-3-a.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.hhpdi.com/Item/5843.aspx, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=KATMPO0020100917e69g0005x&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China Commits 60M RMB to Construction of Bridge (linked to ID #43295)
description: Bangladesh received a grant of about 60 million yuan and an interest-free loan of 100 million yuan (Project ID #43295) from China, for one of the bridges which connects the northern and southern parts of Bangladesh. No year was stated in the article, and several bridges have been constructed in Bangladesh with Chinese grants, so specific details are uncertain.

description: In 2008, Bangladesh received an interest-free loan of 100 million yuan from China, for one of the bridges which connects the northern and southern parts of Bangladesh. Several bridges have been constructed in Bangladesh with Chinese grants, so specific details are uncertain. This is in addition to 60 million yuan grant from China for the same purpose (project ID #43294).

implementing_agencies: China Great Wall Industry Corporation, State-owned Company
title: China EXIM Bank provides concessional loan of 1.385 billion yuan PAKSAT-1R Satellite for Pakistan (linked to #36953)
description:
In October 2008, a contract for the construction and launch of Paksat-1R, a DFH-4-type satellite, was signed between Pakistan's Space and Upper Atmosphere Research Commission (SUPARCO) and China Great Wall Industry Corporation (CGWIC). The communication satellite was to be constructed with 30 year transponders, 12 in C-Band and 18 in Ku-Band, each of 36 MHz Bandwidth. Then, in September 2009, China Eximbank and the Government of Pakistan signed a framework agreement. Under the terms of the framework agreement, China Eximbank agreed to provide up to RMB 1.385 billion for the Paksat-1R Project. Any subsidiary loans under this framework agreement would bear the following terms: a 2% interest rate, 20 year maturity, and a 5 year grace period. 

Shortly thereafter, on October 15, 2009, Deputy Director of the China Eximbank and the Pakistani Ambassador to China signed a RMB 800 million loan agreement for the Paksat-1R Project (Project ID#43298). China Eximbank and the Government of Pakistan also signed an RMB 86.5 million loan agreement for the construction of a ground control facility on October 29, 2010 (see Project ID #36953). Paksat-1R, a DFH-4-type satellite, was constructed by the Pakistan Space and Upper Atmosphere Research Commission (SUPARCO) and the China Great Wall Industry Corporation (CGWIC). 

On August 12, 2011, at the Chinese Xichang Satellite Launch Center, Pakistan’s first Communications Satellite PAKSAT-1R, as part of Pakistan’s Space Programme 2040, was launched. The launch was witnessed by Pakistani Secretary Defence Lt Gen Syed Athar Ali (R), Secretary Foreign Affairs, Salman Bashir, Director General, Strategic Plans Division Lt Gen Khalid Ahmed Kidwai (R) and Ambassador of Pakistan to China, Muhammad Masood Khan. Launched on the Long March 3B rocket, the Paksat-1R satellite has a design life of 15 years with initial goals to provide broadband internet access, digital television broadcasting, remote and rural telephony, emergency communications, tele-education and tele-medicine services across South and Central Asia, Eastern Europe, East Africa and the Far East. The satellite successfully took over the operations of its predecessor, the PakSat-1E satellite leased by Pakistan, in geostationary orbit at 38° East.  The commercial services of the satellite were inaugurated by the Prime Minister of Pakistan on November 5, 2011 from the satellite ground station located near Lahore. On November 11, 2011, the ground control center was transferred to the Pakistani side for its use.
sources: https://web.archive.org/web/20170916210549/http://www.eximbank.gov.cn/tm/Newlist/index_343_30111.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.dawn.com/news/651018/pakistans-first-communications-satellite-paksat-1r-launched, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://tribune.com.pk/story/229797/paksat-1r-china-launches-pakistans-first-communications-satellite/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.eastasiaforum.org/2011/09/09/china-pakistan-space-technology-cooperation/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AIWNAT0020110429e74t0000u&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.orfonline.org/research/chinas-design-to-capture-regional-satcom-markets/#_edn68, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=SCMCOM0020101115e6bf0000l&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.pakistaneconomist.com/pagesearch/Search-Engine2009/S.E652.php, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.gov.cn/jrzg/2009-09/18/content_1420933.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://cn.cgwic.com/paksat-1r/focus.html#, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.ofdi.net/hydt/1642.jhtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://spacenews.com/pakistan-china-space-deal-paksat-1r-ground-control-stations/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.atimes.com/atimes/China/KJ07Ad01.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China EXIM Bank loans Tajikistan 26.5 million USD for construction of unified power system
description:
On July 20, 2011, the Export-Import Bank of China signed a $26,463,789 USD preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) loan agreement with the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan for the Unified Power System in Northern Tajikistan Project (see 'Tajikistan: Policy Notes on Public Expenditures' and 'Ѕарор Іукумати Їуміурии Тоїикистон аз 16 июни соли 2011 № 299...'). This loan carried a 20-year maturity, a grace period of 5 to 7 years, and a 2% interest rate (see 'List of Chinese Government-Financed Projects in Tajikistan from the Ministry of Finance via the IMF May 2018'). The entire project had a cost of $27,857,000 million USD (see pg.32 of 'Foreign Aid Report 2011'). According to Asia-Plus, the Government of Tajikistan contributed $1.4 million USD to the project.

The Government of Tajikistan used the proceeds from this PBC loan to on-lend — through subsidiary loan agreement No. 2011(19) TOTAL (170) – 030 BT, dated July 20, 2011 — to Open Joint Stock Holding Company (OHSHC) “Barqi Tojik” at a 3% interest rate between July 20, 2011 and March 21, 2031 (see pg. 38 of 'Consolidated financial statements...'). OHSHC “Barqi Tojik” was a state-owned enterprise in Tajikistan responsible for the generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity and thermal energy (pg. 15 of 'Consolidated financial statements...').

According to Asia-Plus, the loan was to be used to finance the construction of a new substation, Sughd-500, because the operating substation, Khujand-500, was not able to ensure regular electricity supplies to northern Tajikistan through the 550 kV South-North power transmission line (also Chinese-financed, project ID #39644 and #70910). Construction of the Sughd-500 substation was also intended to promote the implementation of the Central Asia South Asia Electricity Trade and Transmission Project (CASA 1000), which aimed to establish the necessary transmission and trading infrastructure and systems to enable a trade of surplus electricity from Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan to Afghanistan and Pakistan.

Chinese company TBEA was responsible for implementation (see 'Ѕарор Іукумати Їуміурии Тоїикистон аз 16 июни соли 2011 № 299...'). According to Asia-Plus, the project was to begin in October 2011 and be finished by the end of the year. However, the completed project was not accepted by Tajikistan until March 15, 2013 (approved by the government on October 4, 2013) (see 'Постановление Правительства Республики Таджикистан от 4 октября 2013 года, № 444...').

This project involved the construction of a unified power system/single power grid through the construction of a new substation, Sughd-500, in the north of Tajikistan, near Jamoat Lolazor in Devashtich District. More locational details can be found at https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/project-documents/52122/52122-001-rp-en.pdf.

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian project title is Проект создания единой электрической системы севера Республики Таджикистан. In English, it is also sometimes referred to as the Sughd 500/220 kV Substation. The AIMS project ID is TJK/112373. Additionally, in October 2011, Minister of Finance Safarali Najmiddinov said that the loan had an annual interest rate of 2.0 percent for 33 years with a seven-year grace period, as relayed by Asia-Plus. However, according to the IMF in 2018, this loan had a maturity of 20 years, a grace period from 5 to 7 years, and an annual interest rate of 2% interest rate. With all this in mind, the interest rate was coded as 2%, the maturity period was coded 20 years, and the grace period was coded as 5 years (5 was the minimum, so this seemed to be the safer option).
sources: http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:cf9drzyFSUAJ:idbgbf.org/assets/2014/11/4/pptx/1958f46f-3318-48ed-b740-3b1a3fa2e709.pptx+&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=us&client=firefox-b-ab, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/rl546mymjz3f15f/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20from%20Tajikistan%20AIMS%20China%20Specific%20Projects.xlsx?dl=0, Other; https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/linked-documents/52122-001-dc.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.tj.undp.org/content/dam/tajikistan/docs/library/UNDP_TJK_Foreign_Aid_Report_2011_Eng.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://documents.worldbank.org/curated/en/877071468303575509/pdf/891840NWP0P14700TJK0NOTE60final0web.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=ASIPLU0020111003e7a30005l&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: China National Technical Import & Export Corporation, Government Agency
title: Southern Transport Development Project
description: On 17 February 2011, China Exim Bank signed a 138 million USD loan agreement with Sri Lanka for the Southern Transport Development Project. The loan has an interest rate of LIBOR 06 Month for US$ + 2.40% margin and a maturity of 15 years, including a 3 year grace period (see 'Global Partnership' document from Sri Lanka Department of External Resources). The average 6 Month LIBOR rate in February 2011 was 0.464%. Total interest rate is therefore coded as 0.464% + 2.40%, or 2.864%. The objective of the project was to assist development of the economic activities of the Southern Province by encouraging growth in industries, tourism, fisheries & agriculture sectors. The project includes 15 km of highway section from Pinnaduwa to Kodagoda and the 15 km of highway section from Kodagoda to Godagama as well as the balance work in Galle Port Access Road. The contractor for this project was China National Technical Import & Export Corporation. According to the Sri Lanka Department of External Resources, this project was completed on 17 February 2014 (see 'Resource Mobilization'). STAFF_NOTE: In the 2017 Government of Sri Lanka Bond Prospectus this project is referred to as Southern Expressway Construction Project (Phase II).
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/udvlumdle28we4n/Government%20of%20Sri%20Lanka%202017%20Bond%20Prospectus.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/pdf/global_partnership_towards_development_2013.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/files/Parliament%20Question%20-%20Export%20Credit%2022.052014.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.cabinetoffice.gov.lk/cab/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=16&Itemid=49&lang=en&dID=3797, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.mohsl.gov.lk/web/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=129%3Anorthern-road-rehabilitation-project-nrrp&catid=42%3Anational-highways-ongoing&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/files/Performance%20Report%202011%20-%20English%20Version.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/files/Disbursements%20in%202014%20January%20to%20December.PDF, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/linked-documents/42254-014-sri-dc.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.mohsl.gov.lk/web/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=76%3Asouthern-transport-development-project&catid=40%3Aexpressways&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=HTSLGN0020101210e6ca000b8&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_rmobilization&view=resource_project&category_id=1&sub_category_id=1&searchby=donor_type&donor_id=4&today=2018-10-23&Itemid=321&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.rda.gov.lk/supported/project_progress_pmu/stdp/stdp.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Tebian Electric Apparatus, Private Sector; Xinjiang Beixin Construction Engineering (Group) Co., Ltd. (XBJG), State-owned Company
title: China Eximbank loans 331,058,220 USD to Tajikistan for Dushanbe CHP-2 (Phase II) (linked to #54106)
description:
Dushanbe 2 is a combined heat and power plant (CHP) — also known as the Dushanbe-2 Thermal Power Plant (TPS-2) — that provides heat and electricity for the residents of Dushanbe. It only operates in the winter. The 400MW Dushanbe CHP-2 Construction Project required two phases. Phase 1 (mainly constructed between 2012-2014) installed a capacity of 100 MW, while Phase 2 (constructed between 2014-2016) installed an additional capacity of 300 MW. TBEA was the contractor responsible for implementation of both phases, according to the Diplomat. CHP-2 was to be fueled by coal, with the potential to switch to gas (see 'KEEPING WARM: Urban Heating Options in Tajikistan Summary Report'). According to State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission of the State Council, Inner Mongolia Electric Power Survey and Design Institute Co., Ltd. was the project designer for Phase 2. According to PowerChina, Hydro Electric Power System Engineering Company was also involved in the undertaking of Phase 2 of the project.

According to President of Tajikistan Emomali Rahmon as relayed by TBEA, the plant generates 9.6 million kWh power per day and 235 trillion Kcal heat, and provided nearly 700 stable jobs to Tajiks. 150 Tajikistan technicians went to China for training, and about 100 Tajikistan operators mastered professional know-how under the guidance of Chinese experts. According to Xinhua, the completed station met 60 percent of the power demand and enabled the restart of central heating for more than 700,000 Dushanbe residents after 15 years of suspension. The completion of the Dushanbe-2 thermal power station was also declared to be the solution to Tajikistan's long-existing issue of power shortages in winter. 

On July 4, 2009, the Export-Import Bank of China and China Development Bank (CDB) provided a $30 million USD loan for Phase 1 of the 400MW Dushanbe CHP-2 Construction Project (see pg. 30 of 'Проект «Повышение синергетического эффекта национальных программ стран-членов СНГ по ЭЭ и энергосбережению для повышения их энергетической безопасности» Страновое иследование (Таджикистан)'). According to Trend News Agency, the project's financing was on a 50-50 basis by the two banks. For purposes of recording, the two flows are separate; the China Eximbank contribution is captured by linked project ID#54106; the China Development Bank contribution is captured by linked project ID#71101. Other terms of this loan are unknown. 

Then, in 2014, the Export-Import Bank of China provided two loans — an RMB 929,977,078 government concessional loan (GCL) (captured in project ID#46211) and a $178,969,220 USD preferential buyer’s credit loan (PBC) (captured in project ID#71137) for Phase 2 of the 400MW Dushanbe CHP-2 Construction Project (for the GCL loan amount, see pg. 87 of 'Program Appraisal Document on a Proposed Grant...'; for the PBC loan amount, see 'Information on existing state investment projects'). Both of these loans were ratified by the Tajik Parliament on January 14, 2015, according to a 1/14/2015 Sputnik article.  

The RMB loan, captured by this project, was contracted with the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan and it carried the following terms: 25 year maturity, 11 year grace period, and 1.5% interest rate (see 'РАМОЧНОЕ СОГЛАШЕНИЕ между Правительством Китайской Народной Республики и Правительством Республики Таджикистан о предоставлении Китайской Народной Республикой Республике Таджикистан льготного кредита'). The PBC loan (see linked project ID#71137) has a 20 year maturity, 9 year grace period, and 2% interest rate (see 'List of Chinese Government-Financed Projects in Tajikistan from the Ministry of Finance via the IMF May 2018). The Government of Tajikistan contributed $17,443,400 USD ('Information on existing state investment projects'). In total, the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan contracted $331,058,220 USD of China Eximbank debt for Phase 2 of the 400MW Dushanbe CHP-2 Construction Project (see 'The May 2018 Flat Export from Tajikistan AIMS'). 

The Government of Tajikistan used the proceeds from the GCL and the PBC loan to on-lend to Open Joint Stock Holding Company (OHSHC) “Barqi Tojik” (see pg. 39 of 'Consolidated financial statements...'). OHSHC “Barqi Tojik” was a state-owned enterprise in Tajikistan responsible for the generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity and thermal energy (pg. 15 of 'Consolidated financial statements...'). 

The subsidiary GCL loan agreement (#TАJ 2014-028-2) was signed between Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan and OHSHC “Barqi Tojik” on December 18, 2014. It carried an interest rate of 5% and a maturity of 25 years. Its final maturity date was set to August 21, 2039. The subsidiary PBC loan agreement (#TАJ 2014-028-1) was also signed between Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan and OHSHC “Barqi Tojik” on December 18, 2014 and it carried an interest rate of 5% and a maturity of 20 years. Its final maturity date was set to June 21, 2034 (pg. 39 of 'Consolidated financial statements...'). 

According to the Economic and Commercial Counselor Office in Tajikistan, the first phase was scheduled to be completed and put into production before the celebration of the 20th anniversary of Tajik independence in 2011 (September 9th), and the second phase was scheduled to be completed in 2013. Phase 1 of the project began on September 8, 2009. According to the 11/11/2015 Sputnik article, Phase 1 was put into operation on November 10, 2014. Phase 2 of the project began on May 14, 2015, according to the 05/14/2015 Sputnik article. Phase 2 was completed on December 8, 2016, according to TBEA. 

This power plant is located in Dushanbe. Its exact locational coordinates are available at http://globalenergyobservatory.org/geoid/41775. 

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian project title is Душанбинская ТЭЦ-2. The $30 million loan from China Eximbank and China Development Bank may not have covered the full cost of Phase 1 of the project. In the Government of Tajikistan’s Aid Information Management System (AIMS), the project is referred to as 'Project of construction of second in succession construction of 'TPS-2' in Dushanbe.' The AIMS project ID is TJK/152048.

Some sources suggest that major delays took place after Tajikistan contracted this loan on July 4, 2009. The ceremony for the beginning of the project was clearly on September 8, 2009, but it seems project construction did not begin in earnest until 2012, when TBEA agreed to “front” $178 million for the construction of Phase 1 by borrowing directly from China Eximbank, and, in turn, the Tajik government agreed to grant TBEA exclusive rights to explore and develop gold deposits at the Eastern Duoba mine and the Upper Kumarg mine (until TBEA could recoup its investment). The Tajik government also reportedly agreed to give TBEA the rights to further mining deposits (at an unidentified location) if the profit made from the gold deposits did not cover the cost of building the power plant. It is also important to note that the Economic and Commercial Office of the Chinese Embassy reported in 2009 that TBEA was to receive mining rights in return for the project, before this exchange took place. Please see the 'The Full Story Behind China's Gold Mine-Power Plant Swap in Tajikistan' article from the Diplomat for more information on this 'resource-for-infrastructure' deal.

title: China finances city security upgrade for Tajikistan
description: On May 20, 2013, the Ministry of Finance of Tajikistan and the Export-Import Bank of China (China Exim Bank) signed a20.9 million loan agreement for implementation of the Safe City Project, which would install cameras to monitor movement and traffic across the city at busy locations. The loan is repayable over 20 years. The first stage of the three-stage project was launched on November 1, 2013. The second stage was expected to be completed by May 2014. The installation of the cameras was completed by Chinese company Huawei.

title: China Eximbank provides $200 million preferential buyer’s credit for Section 1 of Bishkek–Naryn–Torugart Road Rehabilitation Project (9km-272km)
description:
On October 15, 2009, China Eximbank and the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic signed a preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) loan agreement [China Eximbank PBC NO. (2009) 25 TOTAL NO. (87)] worth $199,999,703 for the Section 1 of Bishkek–Naryn–Torugart Road Rehabilitation Project (from kilometer 9 to kilometer 272). The PBC loan carried the following terms: 20 year maturity, 2% interest rate, and a 5 year grace period. According to the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic’s Aid Management Platform (AMP), the first loan disbursement ($189,999,717.85) took place on July 1, 2013, and the loan was fully disbursed by December 31, 2014. 

This project sought to upgrade rehabilitate a 223 km stretch along the Bishkek–Naryn–Torugart Road between kilometer 9 to kilometer 272 (9km-272km). The Bishkek-Naryn-Torugart road is one of the main transport routes within Kyrgyzstan and comprises part of 'Europe-East Asia' CAREC Transport Corridor. More detailed locational information can be found within the sources 'Due Diligence Report' and 'Km 9 to 272 of the CAREC Transport Corridor 1 Rehabilitation Project.' China Road and Bridge Corporation was the contractor responsible for project implementation. A “notice to commence” was issued to the contractor on May 1, 2010. Section 1 (from kilometer 9 to km 103) was completed on December 31, 2012.  

Staff Note: The Russian project title is проекту реабилитации  дороги Бишкек-Нарын-Торугарт  (участок  с  9 по 272 км,  протяженностью 223 км).

implementing_agencies: Kyrgyzstan Ministry of Transport and Roads, Government Agency
title: Alternative North-South Road Project Section Aral-Kazarman RMB Loan (Linked to Project ID #40491, #53585)
description: On June 15 2015, the Kyrgyz government signed an agreement with China on the allocation of a government interest-subsidized concessional loan for the Alternative North-South Road Project Section Aral-Kazarman. The Ministry of Transport and Communications of the Kyrgyz Republic and China Road and Bridge Corporation entered into a Commercial Contract on May 4 2014 for the purpose of implementing the project. The aim of this international transport corridor North-South is to provide cooperation of the North European countries and Russia with the countries of the Persian Gulf, the Indian Ocean and South-East Asia through Iran. The international transport corridor North-South, which is an alternative to the sea route through the Suez Canal, primarily deals with container cargo traffic. The loan details for this project are as follow: 25 Year Maturity, 11 Year Grace Period, 1.5% Interest Rate Kyrgyzstan's 'North-South' highway will have a total length of 433 km and require850 million in capital. The project is being implemented in three parts: Phase I (2014): Alternative North-South Road Project Section Kazarman-Jalal Abad (km291-km433) and Section Balykchy-Aral (km183+500-195+486); US399,989,041 Preferential Buyers Credits financed by the Export-Import Bank of China [Project 40491] Phase II (2015): Alternative North-South Road Project Section Aral-Kazarman (KM 195-KM 291); US185,254,119 export buyer's credit from EXIM Bank [Project 53585] & RMB 697,562,608 concessional loan from EXIM Bank [Project 46350] Phase III (planned): 'Balekchi-Kezeldez' (0-183km) [Total: 183km]

description: In 2014, China's Export-Import Bank agreed to a 1.1 trillion IDR loan to Indonesia for the construction of the Manado-Bitung Toll Road. In March 2015, it was reported that the toll road would be one of several projects offered to the private sector at the end of 2015.

title: China Provides Loan for Airport Terminal Upgrade in Samoa
description: In February 2016, phase I of Samoa's Faleolo International Airport Upgrade was completed. This project cost $31.7 million USD and was funded by a loan from the EXIM Bank of China. This project was completed In conjunction with a World Bank initiative to improve safety and security of airports' runways and taxiways. Phase two for the new arrival lounge and phase three for the public areas and businesses will begin in January 2017 and is set for completion by August/September 2017. This project was committed in 2014.

title: China Grants USD 82M for NR13 Road Upgrade to Laos
description: The Chinese government granted USD 82 M to Laos for the purpose of upgrading the No. 13 road between Oudomxay and Pakmong. The 82 km highway was supposed to take 36 months to complete, but China's Sunny Road & Bridge company and Third Railway Survey and Design Institute Group Corporation (TSDI) completed the project in 26 months, by the end of 2016. China’s Export-Import Bank (EximBank) issued Laos the loan three years ago for U.S. $82 million at two percent interest for 20 years to build Pakmong Road from Nambark district in the Pakmong area of Luang Prabang to Oudomsay province.

title: Rehabilitation and Improvement of Priority Road Project 1 (PRP1)
description: China Development Bank provided Sri Lanka a loan of152.8 million for the Priority Road Project-1, which began on December 16, 2010, and ended December 16, 2016. The total project cost was US$169.8 million, it is unclear which organization provided the remaining funding. This project was for the purpose of providing an efficient national road network that would improve the integration of the country. The following excerpt from Sri Lanka's Department of External Resources describes the extent of the project: C1A (I) - Beliatta Tangalle Road - 7.47 km C1A (II) - Bopale - Kiribbanara - Uadamauara Road - 8.5 km C1A (III) - Flyover at Siribopura Junction C2A - Pelawatta Kankotiyawatta Thiniyawala Morawaka Road - 47 km C3 - Thiruwanaketiya Agalawatta Road (0 - 033.45km ) C6A - Kandy - Mahiyangana- Padiyathalawa Road - 20.5 km C8 - Kalkudah Road - 5.63 km C8 - Kalkudah Valachchenai Road - 4.42 km C11 - Paranthan Mullaitivu Road - 52 km: This segment of the road will benefit up to 800,000 people who live along the road, and will cut transport costs in half for the region. The priority road project had three sections. See projects #39001 (PRP2), #33402 (PRP3-Phase 1), and #39002 (PRP3-Phase 2) for more details. STAFF_NOTE: Other project sources (some official) indicate that the loan was for US$153 million, but another official source reports a loan of152.8 million. Since these are similar, the lowest (and potentially most current) amount was recorded.

implementing_agencies: China National Complete Plant Import & Export Corporation Group (COMPLANT), State-owned Company
title: Lighting Sri Lanka Uva Province Project (Uva Udanaya)
description: On 19 July 2011, China Exim Bank signed a 24.9 million USD loan agreement with Sri Lanka for the Lighting Sri Lanka Uva Province Project (Uva Udanaya). The loan has an interest rate of LIBOR 06 Months for US$ +2.8% margin and a maturity of 12 years, including a 3 year grace period (see 'Public Investment' and 'Global Partnership' documents from ERD). The average 6 Month LIBOR rate in July 2011 was 0.414%. Total interest rate is therefore coded as 0.414% + 2.80%, or 3.214%. The objective of this project was to procure materials required for construction of 250 new substations, 625km new MV lines & 2250km new low voltage lines. According to the Sri Lanka Department of External Resources, this project was completed on 19 July 2013. The contractor for this project was China National Complete Plant Import & Export Corporation.

title: China funds Taean Friendship Glass Factory in North Korea for CNY 260 million

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: China Exim Bank gives $30 million loan for Laos telecommunications sector
description: In February 2001, Exim Bank of China contracted a government-guaranteed loan for US$30 million for investment in Laos' telecommunications sector. The loan has a grant element of 24 percent and will have a minor impact on debt sustainability.

implementing_agencies: China National Aero-Technology (CATIC), State-owned Company
title: Supply of 02 Nos MA - 60 Aircraft Project
description:
On September 9, 2010, China Eximbank and the Government of Sri Lanka signed an RMB 280,000,000 government concessional loan (GCL) agreement for the Supply of 2 MA-60 Aircraft Project. This GCL carries the following terms: 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period, 2% interest rate, 0.5% management fee, and a. 0.5% commitment fee. 

The proceeds of the GCL were to be used to purchase two commercial (MA-60) aircrafts that will be used for passenger transportation between domestic and regional destinations. The MA-60 is a twin engine turboprop aircraft with seating capacity for 56 passengers. China National Aero-Technology Import & Export Co. (CATIC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. 

The two MA-60 aircraft were successfully delivered to the Sri Lanka Air Force on September 30, 2011. These aircraft will be operated by ‘Helitours’, the Sri Lanka Air Force's commercial arm for domestic flights.
sources: http://capsindia.org/files/documents/ISSUE-BRIEF_54_CHINA-CROWDING-INDIAN-INFLUENCE-OUT-OF-SRILANKA_13-July-2012.pdf, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://island.lk/index.php?page_cat=article-details&page=article-details&code_title=123055, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.economynext.com/Sri_Lanka___Exim_Bank_of_China,_CATIC_aircraft_deal_murky;_mired_in_false_feasibility__probe_report-3-1521-.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.erd.gov.lk/files/Parliament%20Question%20-%20Export%20Credit%2022.052014.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_rmobilization&view=resource_project&category_id=1&sub_category_id=1&searchby=donor_type&donor_id=4&today=2018-10-23&Itemid=321&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/pdf/performance_report_2010.pdf , Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.airforce.lk/news.php?news=849, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCAPP0020050830e18u002p9&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://defence.pk/pdf/threads/china-gains-edge-in-sri-lanka.192793/, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs; http://www.sundaytimes.lk/091206/News/nws_02.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: China National Aero-Technology (CATIC), State-owned Company
title: Relocation and Development of Institute of Technology, University of Moratuwa
description:
In November 2011, Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Higher Education entered into a contract with the China National Aero Technology Import and Export Corporation (CATIC) to carry out a project for the relocation and development of the Institute of Technology of the University of Moratuwa. China Eximbank agreed to provide a loan of $76.1175 million buyer’s credit loan (BCL) for the project. 

The total cost of the new complex for the Institute of Technology of the University of Moratuwa (ITUM) at Diyagama, Homagama was $89.55 million (Rs 11.7 billion), and China Eximbank agreed to provide 85% of the funding required. Thus, China Eximbank’s estimated contribution = $89.55 million * 0.85 (or $76.1175 million). The BCL carried the following terms: 15-year maturity and 3-year grace period. 

The goal of the project was to increase student intake from 1050 to 3000 students annually and help middle level skilled technicians. The new ITUM complex was be relocated to Diyagama, Homagama. Lecture rooms, laboratories, workshops, libraries, administrative complexes, medical rooms, hostel facilities, and playgrounds were among the sections which will be developed. Under the project, the institute was to be provided with the required equipment, computers and machinery, along with training of the staff. 

However, the Government of Sri Lanka eventually abandoned its plan to implement the project with CATIC and China Eximbank financing. It ultimately completed the project with support from the International Construction Consortium (ICC).

STAFF_NOTE: The Institute of Technology of the University of Moratuwa (ITUM) is located in Diyagama. Detailed locational coordinates for the Institute of Technology of the University of Moratuwa (ITUM) can be found at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Institute+of+Technology,+University+of+Moratuwa/@6.8081429,79.9931164,15z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x0:0x8b5a42ec8bb36159!8m2!3d6.8081429!4d79.9931164.
sources: http://www.cabinetoffice.gov.lk/cab/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=16&Itemid=49&lang=en&dID=4269, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.accessengsl.com/project/piling/piling-works-for-relocation-development-of-the-institute-of-technology-university-of-moratuwa-itum-diyagama-homagama/, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.parliament.lk/uploads/documents/paperspresented/annual_report_institute_of_technology_university_of_moratuwa_2011.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.news.lk/news/item/3162-institute-of-technology-at-moratuwa-university-to-be-re-located, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.icc-construct.com/web/projects/ongoing-projects/Relocation-and-Development-of-the-Institute-of-Technology-University-of-Moratuwa.-ITUM.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.skyscrapercity.com/showthread.php?t=1972894, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs; http://www.sundaytimes.lk/130721/education/more-chinese-funds-to-boost-local-technical-education-53469.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://online.fliphtml5.com/rvlcv/lrxu/#p=1, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.erd.gov.lk/files/Parliament%20Question%20-%20Export%20Credit%2022.052014.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates medical equipment to National Ayurveda Research and Training Center in Nepal
description: In May 2016, China donated 2.26 million USD worth of medical equipment to Ayurveda Training and Research Center in Kathmandu, Nepal. The equipment included advanced machines for CT scan and X-ray, research tools and kits for basic health and emergency treatments along with training and research materials.

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: China Exim Bank Loans Mongolia $270 Million for Housing Projects
description: In August 2014, Mongolia and China signed a loan agreement for the construction of a residential area in 7th Khoroolol, Sukhbaatar District, Ulaanbaatar. The agreement was signed by the State Housing Corporation of Mongolia and the Export-Import Bank of China. China will loan $270 million USD for the construction of apartments and for the financing of a mortgage program. The loan is split into a $150 million USD loan at 2% interest for 15 years and a $120 million loan for Buyant-Ukhaa II (or 4,323 apartments in Ulaanbaatar). This is part of the Mongolian government's plan to construct 1000 housing projects in every province from Dornod, Sukhbaatar, Omnogovi, Hovsgol, Gobi-Altai, Zavkhan to Ulaanbaatar.
sources: https://www.bondsupermart.com/main/file-depository/download-file?paramCategory=bondDocument&paramDocumentNo=1189, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://mad-intelligence.com/exim-bank-of-china-finances-buyant-ukhaa-ii-in-ulaanbaatar/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: Electricite du Laos, State-owned Company; Sinohydro Corporation, State-owned Company
title: China Exim Bank loans $127 million for construction of Nam Khan 3 hydropower plant in Laos (linked to project #33809)
description: October 13, 2006, Laos and China signed the Memorandum of Understanding for the Nam Khan 2 & 3 hydropower plants. On Feb. 9, 2012 Electricite du Laos (EDL) and Sinohydro Corporation Ltd of China signed an engineering procurement and construction contract for the Nam Khan 3 hydropower project in Luang Prabang province, and a tariff MOU for the Nam Ou 2, 5 and 6 hydropower projects in Phongsaly and Luang Prabang provinces. The Nam Khan 3 dam, located in Xiengngeun district, will have an installed capacity of 60MW and will be able to generate 241 million kWH of electricity per year. The dam will take about 3.5 years to build, with developers expecting it to be fully operational in 2016. The Lao government will invest about US$127 million in the project through a low interest loan from the Exim Bank of China. On June 23, 2014, 35 percent of the Nam Khan 3 project was completed. Construction began some time in 2013 A video from March 2016 shows the Nam Khan 3 dam near Luang Prabang near completion. In 2017, the 120MW Nam Ou-2 dam and the 60MW Nam Khan-3 dam, both in LuangPrabang province, will be complete and become operational. This is linked to project #33809, the Nam Khan 2 plant. staff_note: sources on completion/commercial operation of dam could not be found
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BDU0000020090814e58e0000p&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://laospdrnews.wordpress.com/2012/02/10/hydropower-projects-to-light-up-northern-provinces/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.unescap.org/sites/default/files/7.%20PPP%20in%20Energy%20in%20Lao%20PDR%20-%20DFDL.pdf, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://www.laoenergy.la/pageNews.php?id_News=63, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1kJP07w6aKA, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs; http://asian-power.com/project/in-focus/laos-have-4-hydropower-projects-in-2-northern-provinces, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.odi.org/sites/odi.org.uk/files/resource-documents/10458.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.iseas.edu.sg/images/pdf/ISEAS_Perspective_2014_31.pdf, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://jclao.com/laos-to-produce-12500-mw-electricity-by-2020/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Government of China supplies emergency materials in response to locust plague in the north of Laos
description: China has handed over two batches of emergency materials to Laos, one in May 2016 and the second in May 2017. The project provides Laos with various material supplies, including self-propelled sprayer, knapsack power sprayer, protective suit, deltamethrin emulsifiable concentrates, etc. Besides, experts were dispatched to Laos for field investigation and skill training immediately after the outbreak. The value of this donation is unknown.

implementing_agencies: Electricite du Laos, State-owned Company; China National Heavy Machinery Co., State-owned Company
title: China Exim Bank commits Loan for Construction of 500kV Saravan–Sekong transmission line project in Laos
description: China Eximbank signed the Loan Agreement for the 500KV Saravan–Sekong Transmission Line Project on May 3 2016. On January 22, 2014, China National Heavy Machinery Corporation signed an Engineering, Procurement, Construction (EPC) contract for the project. The contract was signed with Electricte du Laos. China Exim Bank provided a loan to fund the project. The project transmits electricity from a number of power plants in northern Laos to Khammouane Province and Savannakhet Province in central Laos. The main project involves constructions of two 500kV transformer substations and a 72km, 500kV transmission line. The project was expected to last 43 months. The memorandum of understanding for the project was signed on Nov 1, 2013, and the project was formally committed in 2014. STAFF_NOTE one source lists expected construction costs at $162 million but it was a very preliminary estimate

description: In 2012 an irrigation project began implementation in Laos by Gezhouba Group International Engineering Company Ltd. The funding for this project was provided by a 350 million RMB preferential loan from China. The project consists of Xesalalong and Saige irrigation projects. Once completed, it is capable of meeting 2000 hectares of farmlands’ water supply as well as drinking water for people and livestock in 18 local villages. The project was completed in Feb, 2015 STAFF_NOTE: could not find a source with loan amount

description: Construction of the Lao Front for National Construction (LFNC) training center began in 2014 and was completed in 2016. The government of China, China Railway Engineering Consulting Group Co., Ltd (Design), and Hebei Jianshe Construction Group Co., Ltd. (contractor) were involved in financing/implementing the project. The project includes construction of classrooms, meeting rooms, dormitories, etc., with a total construction area of about 3600 square meters, and construction lasted 17 months.

description: In Sept 2009, tropical storm Ketsana hit Lao southern provinces. 19 people were killed and property losses in the storm-hit provinces were estimated at about 100 million USD. The Chinese government granted USD $200,000 as emergency assistance for disaster relief in support of recovery and reconstruction in the stricken area.

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China Gives 1 Billion Yuan to Cambodia for Morodo Techo Stadium
description: In October 2015, China provided a 1 billion Yuan grant to Cambodia for construction of the Morodok Techo Stadium. 300 million Yuan has already been given, and the rest of the donation will come continuously until the project is completed on January 1, 2021 in preparation for the SEA Games 2023. Construction of the stadium began in March 2017 about 10km north of Phnom Penh, and it will have a capacity of 60,000, making it the second largest stadium in the country.
sources: http://swiftnewsdaily.com/en/morodok-techo-national-sports-complex-financially-funded-by-chinese-government/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://odacambodia.com/reports/Individual_project_summary_report2008.asp?Record_Id=China-2007-WE75&DonorName=China, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://sportsvenuebusiness.com/index.php/2017/04/13/construction-begins-chinese-funded-stadium-cambodia/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: China Gives Loan to Cambodia Worth 159 Million Yuan for Electricity Project (linked to #48917)
description: In March 2015, China Exim Bank provided a loan to Cambodia worth 159,155,400 Yuan. The money will go towards the ministry of economy and finance for the first phase of a 230 KV loop transmission line project in the southwestern part of the Cambodian National Grid. The loan is concessional as the interest rate is 2%. 103 million Yuan has been given as of 2017, with the rest coming every year until 2020. The project is planned to be completed by January 1, 2021. The second phase of the project is #48917.

implementing_agencies: Electricite du Cambodge, Government Agency; China Heavy Machinery Corporation,
title: China to Give 85m USD to Cambodia for Rural Grid Extension Project Phases 5 and 6 (linked to Projects #33071 & #35571)
description: On March 30, 2016, CHMC signed the Cambodia Rural Grid Extension Phase 5 & Phase 6 EPC Project Contract, with Electricite DU Cambodge(EDC). The contract includes a loan of 84,982,500 USD from the Chinese government. The loan has an interest rate of 2%, a grace period of 7 years, and a maturity period of 20 years. CHMC Board Chairman and President, Mr. Lu Wenjun, and Keo Rattanak His Excellency, Director-general of the EDC, mutually affixed their signatures on the Contract. This project covers the area of 13 provinces in Cambodia, including the construction of one 2525km medium voltage transmission line and the installation of the column equipment, the construction of two new 115kV substations, as well as one 22km-115kV high voltage transmission line which connects the two substations. This is the 7th electrical engineering project which is successfully developed by CHMC by its â€œRegional Roll â€Strategy, in Cambodia.
sources: http://www.chmc2003.com/en/contents/145/27409.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://odacambodia.com/reports/Individual_project_summary_report2008.asp?Record_Id=China-2007-WE86&DonorName=China, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Electricite du Cambodge, Government Agency

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China builds school in Rarotonga, Cook Islands
description: On June 22, 2016, Representatives of the governments of Cook Islands and the People’s Republic of China (PRC) officially signed the implementation agreement for the Apii Nikao primary school rebuild project in Rarotonga in the Cook Islands. The cost of the overall project is estimated at around NZ$14.9 million over a period of three years and will be paid for through grant funds from China. The rebuild comes nearly two years after an arson which destroyed nearby Avatea School, forcing students to combine with Nikao. Under the 2016 agreement the long-awaited project will officially begin in the first quarter of 2017, with construction scheduled to take 20 months. Preparatory work, including the construction of additional classrooms to accommodate senior students, will be carried out in the final two terms of 2016. The new school will accommodate 500 students and 40 staff, consist of three new buildings, with a total building area of 5,200 square meters.
sources: http://www.education.gov.ck/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/Apii-Nikao-Rebuild-Project.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://cookislandsnews.com/national/education/item/50818-apii-nikao-rebuild-hits-a-brick-wall, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.cookislandsnews.com/national/local/item/59136-it-s-all-go-for-apii-nikao-rebuild/59136-it-s-all-go-for-apii-nikao-rebuild, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=RNZINT0020150807eb870005l&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Wang Lutong, China's Ambassador to the Cook Islands; Zhang Fan, Chinese Embassy in New Zealand; Garth Henderson, Cook Islands Financial Secretary

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: China Railway 14th .Construction Bureau Co., Ltd (China Railway Shisiju Group Corporation), State-owned Company
title: China grants $14 million USD to Fiji for bridge construction
description: In December 2015, China provided a $14 million grant to Fiji for the construction of the Stinson and Vatuwaqa bridges in the Fijian capital, Suva. Work was contracted to China Railway 14, a Chinese construction company. Work began in early 2016, and is expected to be completed sometime in 2018.
sources: http://www.fijitimes.com/story.aspx?ref=archive&id=398640, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.fijiroads.org/china-railway-14-group-to-construct-stinson-and-vatuwaqa-bridge/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAFAGEN020151209ebc80008d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2017-09/30/c_136649425.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: Chinda donates FJ$15 million in cyclone relief aid to Fiji (Linked to Project ID #49141)
description: In March 2016, China donated FJ$15 million in relief aid to Fiji following the devastation of Tropical Cyclone Winston. China announced a total of eight flights with relief supplies to the island, with the first plane arriving on March 17. A total of 500 tonnes of relief material were donated, compromising of 6,000 tents with blankets and pillows, 135,000 first aid kits, 120 portable generators, 10,000 flashlights and 45,000 bottles of water purification tablets.
sources: http://www.fijitimes.com/story.aspx?id=346100, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://reliefweb.int/report/fiji/china-pledges-15-million-relief-supplies, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjb_663304/zwjg_665342/zwbd_665378/t1349168.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PARALL0020160322ec3m0002w&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Fiji Red Cross Society, National NGO
title: China gives $100,000 to Fiji Red Cross Society for cyclone relief
description: On Feb. 22, 2016, China provided emergency humanitarian aid of $100,000 to the Fiji Red Cross Society in the aftermath of cyclone Winston. The Fiji Red Cross Society will make effective use of the aid in disaster relief and reconstruction. The Chinese ambassador to Fiji, Gu Yu, handed over the check to Cathy Wong, President of Fiji Red Cross Society.
sources: http://fj.china-embassy.org/eng/topic/fjzwsdxj/t1342219.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2016-02/22/c_135120532.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://fj.china-embassy.org/eng/topic/fjzwsdxj/t1346298.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PARALL0020160322ec3m0002w&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

contacts: Cathy Wong, President (Fiji Red Cross Society); Gu Yu, charge d'affaires of the Chinese embassy in Fiji

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China donates $1 million USD to Fiji for cyclone relief (linked to Project ID #49137)
description: On March 5, 2016, the China donated $1 million to Fiji for relief aid from Tropical Cyclone Winston. Prime Voreqe Bainimarama said the donation would be placed in Fiji's fund appeal account, which was established to assist Fijians in the relief efforts following the devastation. This donation is on top of the FJ$15 million in aid China provided to Fiji the week prior (#49137).
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=SEDAYS0020160306ec350002u&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://reliefweb.int/report/fiji/china-adds-usd1million-assistance-relief-package, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.radionz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/298925/planeloads-of-relief-from-china-due-in-fiji-this-week, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: China Exim Bank and Mongolia sign $1 billion loan agreement
description: In November 2015, President of Mongolia Tsakhia Elbegdorj and President of China Xi Jinping signed several documents on Mongolia-China economic cooperation in Beijing. A $1-billion loan agreement between the Mongolian government and the Export-Import Bank of China was signed. The loan has a payback period of 20 years with an annual interest rate of 2 percent, and with a moratorium period of 7 years. Last year, seven projects to be financed by the loan were sent to the Chinese Export-Import Bank. The loan will be used to finance four more projects: a project to expand and repair the 20.9 km road between Gatsuurt intersection and Nalaikh-Choir intersection, a project to construct Ulaanbaatar-Mandalgovi electrical transmission lines and sub-stations, a project to construct 12 meat processing plants, and another project to renew Erdenet Thermal Power Plant.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=CEASEN0020151111ebbb001gv&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://golomtcapital.com/usd-1-billion-loan-from-china-approved/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://mongolia.gogo.mn/r/149615, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AUBPOS0020160201ec2100001&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://vom.mn/index.php/en/p/36373, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://montsame.mn/en/s/agreement-for-chinas-usd-1-billion-soft-loan-to-be-amended-96581, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China and Mongolia sign loan agreement for bridge construction and rehabilitation
description: In November 2015, President of Mongolia Tsakhia Elbegdorj and President of China Xi Jinping signed several documents on Mongolia-China economic cooperation in Beijing. Loan agreements on projects including construction of a footbridge near the Traffic Police Department in Ulaanbaatar and rehabilitation of a bridge in Yaarmag were signed; however, loan details were unspecified.

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
title: China provides US$300,000 of humanitarian aid to Myanmar after flood (link to ID #49176)
description: On 3 August 2015, the Chinese Embassy to Myanmar provided the first batch of humanitarian aid to Myanmar's flood-hit regions, which covered 1,545 families in Kalay township in Sagaing Region. The second batch of aid was delivered on 4 August 2015 to 20,000 families in Sittway. Chinese Ambassador to Myanmar Hong Liang also dispatched another group of Chinese diplomats to carry out a rescue mission in central Magway Region within the same week. The total fund of the program for Rakhine State as well as Sagaing and Magway regions amounted to about US$300,000. A special family rescue package had been designed to provide the flood-stricken people with daily necessities. This aid includes 100 motorboats to be sent to flood-hit areas.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020150803eb83008px&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020150804eb8400692&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://reliefweb.int/report/myanmar/more-chinese-relief-aid-sent-myanmar-flood-victims, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ATDOMB0020150810eb8a00001&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://english.cntv.cn/2015/08/16/VIDE1439706721555419.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://books.google.com/books?id=8XIzDwAAQBAJ&pg=PA217&lpg=PA217&dq=china+300,000+aid+flood+myanmar+2015&source=bl&ots=jWzadSXaXN&sig=h2tEY2n_cyv1TXh3jc_iBuhEGmM&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjzoOK37a3XAhVK5CYKHXpMDIYQ6AEIUTAH#v=onepage&q=china%20300%2C000%20aid%20flood%20myanmar%202015&f=false, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2015-08/05/content_21502953.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://reliefweb.int/report/myanmar/chinese-team-rescue-13-flood-victims-myanmar, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020150803eb83006eq&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Hong Liang, Chinese Ambassador to Myanmar (Chinese Embassy)

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China's Yunnan Province provides 2.41 million yuan of humanitarian aid to Myanmar after flood (link to ID #49175)
description: On 7 August 2015, the provincial government of China's Yunnan province handed over relief aid worth 2.41 million yuan to the Myanmar side in Mandalay in response to severe flooding. The relief aid included 1,000 bags of rice, 1,000 units of tents, 500 boxes of milk powder, and 10,000 boxes of instant noodle. These supplies were shipped by 14 trucks via the border gate of Muse to Mandalay. This relief aid is in addition to the US$300,000 captured in project ID #49175.

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
title: China sends US$1.6 million worth of motorized dinghies to Myanmar to help with flood rescue operations
description: On 17 August 2015, China flew US$1.6 million worth of motorized dinghies to Myanmar to help with rescue operations after severe flooding.

funding_agencies: Unspecified Chinese Government Institution, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: People's Liberation Army (PLA), Government Agency
title: Chinese PLA delivers 10 million yuan worth of humanitarian aid to Myanmar after flooding
description: On 28 August 2015, two military aircraft from the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) arrived at Myanmar's Nay Pyi Taw International Airport with relief supplies for flood victims. The supplies include blankets, electric generators and tents to be used by Myanmar flood victims. Another batch of PLA aid supplies would be delivered by two other military aircraft later. The total worth of teh PLA supplies amounts to 10 million yuan.
