implementing_agencies: China Communications Construction Co., Ltd. (CCCC), State-owned Company
title: China Ministry of Commerce provides interest-free Loan for construction of Gwadar Eastbay Expressway
description:
Gwadar deep-sea port is currently connected by a narrow 16 feet wide thoroughfare of Gwadar town at the West-Bay. The Gwadar Eastbay Expressway will consist of a new 6-lane expressway and a 30 meters-wide railway corridor that will connect Gwadar Port to Makran Coastal Highway (or National Highway N–10 or Makran沿海公路（N-10). The project is being developed as part of the 'Early Harvest' scheme of China Pakistan Economic Corridor, and it is part of a wider 170.667 billion Pakistani rupee ($1.6 billion) development package for the city and Port of Gwadar. 

In May 2017, China’s Ministry of Commerce signed an interest-free loan agreement worth $140 million (or 14.7 billion Pakistani rupees($140 million) for the construction of Gwadar East Bay Expressway. China Communications Construction Engineering Company is the contractor responsible for project implementation. Its work is being overseen by the Gwadar Port Authority. 

On November 22, 2017, the construction of the expressway began. As of November 2018, project completion was expected to occur by October 2020. Staff Note: Different sources record different financial amounts for this project: Pakistani Ministry of Finance Economic Affairs Division yearbook reports the project has a total interest-free loan of $168 million. The Shahid Javed Burki Institute of Public Policy at NetSol records a committment amount amount of US$141 million. The 2016 Government of Pakistan Bond Prospectus lists the estimated project cost as $140 million. We use the most conservative of these estimates for the time being.

implementing_agencies: China, Government Agency
title: China provides cataract operations and MVR 5.7M worth of equipment for 200 Maldivians (Linked to Project #53776)
description:
On December 21, 2015, the Chinese government signed an agreement with the Maldivian government to send the Bright Journey Medical team, along with the appropriate equipment, to the Maldives to conduct cataract surgery on 100 patients at the Hulhumalé Hospital, according to Sun Online. On January 27, 2016, the Chinese government donated the equipment used for the eye surgeries, worth MVR 5.7 million, to the Maldives for its hospitals, according to Sun Online.

According to the Chinese Embassy to the Maldives, the Bright Journey Medical Team were in the Maldives from January 17 to January 28, 2016. According to an article from New Stories of the Silk Road, the medical team was sent by Guangdong Province’s Health and Family Planning Commission and performed 107 cataract surgeries on the island, improving the eyesight of many patients. According to the Chinese Embassy to the Maldives, the plans for the eye camp go back to Xi Jinping's 2014 state visit to the Maldives.

For the Bright Journey eye camp in 2017, see project ID #69440. For the eye camp performed by doctors from Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center in 2020, see project ID#69381. For the China-Maldives Ophthalmology Centre, see project ID #53776.

title: China Grants 19 computers to Autism Association in Maldives (linked to #53962)
description: On October 24th, 2016, the Chinese Embassy granted 19 computers to a school run by the Autism Association in Hulhumale, Maldives. This project is linked to #53962, in which China provides monetary assistance to the school.
sources: https://psmnews.mv/en/18513, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=MIADMD0020161025ecao00007&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China Grants MVR 7 million for Male' Redevelopment Project in the Maldives
description: On November 13th, 2016, the Chinese Embassy granted MVR 7 million (approximately454,000 USD) for Male' Redevelopment Project at a handover ceremony. The funds will be used to develop 7 pedestrian-only alleyways in Male' and a children's park in Villimale. The project is being implemented by Maldives Ministry of Housing and Infrastructure's Public Works Services department, materials have been acquired, and project will be completed by May 2017.
sources: https://maldivesindependent.com/society/china-donates-mvr7-million-for-male-redevelopment-127715, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=MIADMD0020161114ecbd00005&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://edition.mv/news/1492, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: [CPEC] China funds the Khuzdar-Basima Road in Pakistan
description: In 2016, the Pakistan-China Joint Cooperation Committee approved the Khuzdar-Basima Road project costing USD$200 million. The 110 kilometers long road project includes objectives such as the road contributing to the economic and social development of Balochistan, serving mineral rich Sandak and Rekodek areas, and linking the National Highways N-85, N-25 and Motorway M-8. However, the other two sources report the cost to be USD$80 million. It is possible that the80m is contributed by China but this likelihood cannot be confirmed. During January 2017, it was reported that Pakistan's Under Communication Division contributed 310 million Pakistani rupee towards the 110 km section. In December 2017, the funding from China was temporarily paused. After that, no further information can be found about the relaunch of the project. CPEC website confirms the estimated cost of US$80 million. It also suggests that reports on Feasibility and PC-I have been completed and LOI forwarded to Chinese side. According to CPEC website as of Nov 2018, procedural formalities to be completed shortly. The Pakistan Ministry of Finance economic survey for 2018 reports the project is planned to be completed by 2020. A Pakistani government Finance Ministry annual project status report in May from 2017-18 does not specify the total loan commitment, but records that in May from 2017-18 China fulfilled part of the loan at the amount of 11.374 million USD, meaning the project is likely to have started or at least committed.

title: [CPEC] China funds Dera Ismail Khan-Zhob Project in Pakistan
description: In 2016, the Pakistan-China Joint Cooperation Committee approved the Dera Ismail Khan-Zhob project. According to the express tribune report, the western route of the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC), including the Khan-Zhob project, is going to be completed by the end of 2018 along with other 11 mega projects which were initiated in 2015-16. In January 2017, Pakistan's Under Communications Division provided 120 million Pakistani rupees for the Zhob Mughal Kot road. The division also contributed 40 million Pakistani rupees for the rehabilitation of DI Khan Mughal Kot road. As of Nov 2018, CPEC website only indicates that Feasibility and PC-I have been completed and the LOI has been forwarded to Chinese side. No other progress is indicated. A second CPEC website puts the project cost at US$195 million. It also suggests that the project is an 'upgradation of D.I.Khan - Zhob Phase I.' It is unclear whether the transaction amount is provided solely by China and in what form the fund is provided. The Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates of Foreign Assistance for FY 2017/18 lists this project as a 'Dualization of Yarik - Mughal Kot-Zhob Section of N-50'. It includes the Zhob Bypass. Cross-checking with the CPEC website confirms they are the same project. According to the source, Pakistan received no loan assistance in FY 2016/17 for the project, and are estimating loans of 4,000 million Pakistan rupees in FY 2017/18.

implementing_agencies: Gwadar Port Authority, State-owned Company
title: China to fund the Pakistan-China Technical and Vocational Institute
description: The project is intended to impart specialized skills to Pakistanis so that they may be employed at the Gwadar Port, which is currently under major expansion as part of the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor. The project will be executed bu Gwadar Port Authority Or any Financial Framework Agreement under CPEC and will be supervised by the Ministry of Maritime Affairs, Government of Pakistan and Planning, Development. According to the Chinese Embassy in Pakistan, the project is still under negotiation as of the end of 2018. The Pak-China Technical and Vocational Institute at Gwadar, Pakistan is a vocational school which will be set up by the Pakistani government at a cost of 943 million Pakistani rupees. The project was set to be completed by March 2016; however, it is still under construction as of 2018. The Pakistani government has allocated approximately 200 million rupees towards the project while the remaining 743 million rupees will be financed by the government of China. The specific funding agencies and form of funding are still unknown. The official China-Pakistani Economic Corridor states that that total cost of the project is 1,235,500,000 Pakistani rupees. The 2016 Government of Pakistan Bond Prospectus corroborates the transaction amount of 10 million USD. As of 2016, Pakistan was awaiting a response to the grant request from the Chinese MOC. According to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates of Foreign Assistance for 2017/18, the estimated cost for 2016-17 is 200 million Pak Rupees and that for 2017/18 is 400 million Pak Rupees. It is unclear if the cost is carried by the Chinese side or in what amount. In January 2017, the Pakistani governments Ports and Shipping Division contributed 20 million Pakistani rupees for The Pak-China Technical and Vocational Institute at Gwadar.

implementing_agencies: Gwadar Development Authority, State-owned Company
title: China Funds 300-bed China-Pakistan Friendship Hospital
description: In 2015, China funded a 300-bed China-Pakistan friendship hospital with a cost of Rs.9.96billion in Gwadar district, Balochista. This project will aim at creating a state-of-the-art medical facility in the port city of Gwadar. The project is proposed for implementation of Phase-II of 50-bedded hospital constructed under GDA Business Plan (Federal PSDP). The hospital is planned on 68 acres of land. As of August 2nd, 2018, the hospital consists of one medical block and some residential blocks. In order to upgrade the hospital to 300 beds five more medical blocks (with 50 beds each) will be constructed as well as nursing and paramedical institutes, medical college, central laboratory, and other allied facilities with a supply of medical equipment and machinery. Gwadar Development Authority will implement the project. Supervising agency is P&D Dept., Government of Balochistan and Planning, Development, and Reforms Commission. The specific funding organization is unknown. The CPEC website records the project with an estimated total cost of USD100 million, which is higher than the Rs 9.96 billion (roughly USD90 million) reported in the media article. Coder defers to the lower amount here.

title: China Gives Pakistan USD $10m for Internal Displaced Person Rehabilitation Program
description: According to the Pakistani National Assembly records, in July 2015, China signed an agreement with Pakistan to provide a special grant in cash to support the rehabilitation program for thousands of internally displaced people who were affected by the military operation in Pakistan's northwestern restive tribal region. The agreement, involving a grant of 10 million U.S. dollars, was signed by Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan Sun Weidong and Secretary of Pakistan's Economic Affairs Division Muhammad Saleem Sethi in Islamabad. The funds were used to support efforts to rehabilitate people of Federally Administered Tribal Areas and promote social development. Specific funding Chinese agency is unknown The agreement commits a total of USD129million(RMBYuan800million) to be utilized for the Temporarily Displaced Persons (TDPs) and social sector projects in terrorism affected areas of FATA region. The USD 129 million grant amount included cash grant of USD 10 million for supporting the Pakistani government in rehabilitation of residents in FATA area, while the remaining USD 119 million remained unfulfilled, as projects with FATA Secretariat were being identified for the purpose of reconstruction and rehabilitation in FATA region. These projects include reconstruction, rehabilitation, improvement of schools, irrigation system, highways, electricity, livelihood/ agriculture etc. The special assistance earmarked for rehabilitation of TDPs were recorded as fulfilled. US$ 5 million was received in September, 2015 and remaining US$ 5 million in April, 2016. China disbursed an estimated 1,541.63 million Pakistani rupees, or 11.01 million USD, to Pakistan in 2015-2016, according to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates for Foreign Assistance for 2016-2017. The funds were separated into one special grant of 509.150 million Pakistan rupees and a grant to support GoP in TDP FATA of 1,032.480 million Pakistani rupees.

implementing_agencies: Bangladesh Computer Council, Government Agency; ZTE Corporation, Private Sector
title: China EXIM Bank provides 945,551,000 CNY export credit for construction of IV Tier National Data Center in Kaliakoir
description:
On April 15, 2016, China Eximbank and the Government of Bangladesh signed a RMB 945,551,000 government concessional loan (GCL) agreement for the Tier IV National Data Center Project in Kaliakoir. The GCL carried the following terms: 2% interest rate, 20 year maturity, and 5 year grace period. The Government of Bangladesh loan identification number for this China Eximbank GCL is L1120160415A. 

The purpose of this project was to build a flagship Tier IV Data Center in the Kaliakair Upazila within Gazipur District and the Division of Dhaka to store and process large amount of official data.  ZTE was the contractor responsible for project implementation and its work was overseen the Bangladesh Computer Council (BCC). As of 2017, the data center had been constructed, but the operational status of the data center was delayed by U.S. government sanctions on ZTE. In October 2018, the data center underwent operational tests. The project was officially completed on November 29, 2019.

The Bangladesh National Data Center (NDC) is the first national data center that received both the UPTIME Tier IV design certification and facility certification in the country and is also the first data center in South Asia that got UPTIME Tier IV facility certification. In addition, the data center passed all the test items of the Uptime Tier IV construction certification, thereby being highly appraised by the Uptime Institute. During the construction of the data center, ZTE construction team overcame a series of challenges, such as inconvenient transportation, unstable power supply, and bad weather.

implementing_agencies: Shandong Ruyi Group, Private Sector
title: Chinese loan syndicate funds Sahiwal 2x660MW Coal-Fired Power Plant project in Pakistan (Linked to Project #54134) (CPEC, IPP)
description: In March 2014, the government of Punjab, Pakistan issued invitation for bids for six 2x660MW coal-fired power development projects. By May 2014, the consortium of Huaneng Shandong Power Generation Co., Ltd., its subsidiary in Hong Kong, and Shandong Ruyi Technology Group Co., Ltd., officially obtained the right of development of Sahiwal 2x660MW coal-fired power project, located in Qadirabad, Sahiwal, Punjab. The groundbreaking ceremony was held on May 30 2014, with Nawaz Sharif, Prime Minister of Pakistan and Shahbaz Sharif, Chief Minister of Punjab Province attending the event. Coal was procured from Indonesia and South Africa for the project. The project spans 690 hectares, which was given by the Pakistani government free of charge. According to CPEC website, the project achieved Commercial Operation Date (COD) on Oct 28, 2017, and has been connected to the national grid. According to a March 2015 document from the National Electric Power Regulatory Authority (NEPRA) as well as an announcement from ICBC, the total investment is estimated to be 1.808 billion USD. The project's debt-equity ratio is 80:20. The debt component is covered by a Chinese loan syndicate led by ICBC. In February 2015, ICBC had submitted a letter of interest to act as financial advisor and arranger for the borrower. On April 20, 2015, ICBC Chairman Jiang Jianqing signed power project financing agreements for four energy power projects in the presence of Chinese President Xi Jinping and Pakistani Prime Minister Sharif. The four energy power projects include Sukhi Kinari hydropower project, Dawood wind power project, Sahiwal coal-fired power plant, and Thar coal-power integrated project. Sinosure reported in 2018 that that the loan syndicate had in fact covered up to 85% of the total cost, providing 1.8 billion USD worth of export buyer credits. According to the ICBC website, ICBC alone provided 1.44 billion USD worth of export buyer credit. Other Chinese banks in the syndicate include Bank of China, China Construction Bank, Agricultural Bank of China. Huaneng Shandong Power Generation Co., Ltd and Shandong Ruyi Technology Group Co., Ltd provided the equity funding. Sinosure has earlier committed to reduce the premium rate from 9% to 7%, increasing the business insurance coverage for overseas projects from 50% to 65%. For the purpose of this project, only the funding from ICBC has been recorded. For details on the equity portion, please see the linked project #54134. According to a March 2015 NEPRA document, the interest rate of the loan is 4.95%. For determination of the upfront tariff, the repayment period was assumed to be 10 years, and the grace period was assumed to be the same as the construction period, which is 4 years. This project has thus recorded the loan details as such. Project's first 660-MW capacity plant unit was reported a success with completion in a short 22 months and inaugurated May 2017 by the Prime Minister of Pakistan and has been linked to the national grid. Project also received a No Objection Certificate (NoC) from Pakistan's Environment Protection Department. Project's second 660-MW capacity plant is projected to begin electric generation in June 2017 at the reported available rate of 8.11 rupees per unit.

implementing_agencies: Goldwind, Private Sector; Hydrochina Corporation, State-owned Company
title: ICBC loans 100 million USD to Sachal 100 MW Wind Power project in Jhimpir, Pakistan (CPEC, IPP)
description: Sachal Energy Development (Ptd) Limited's 49.5 MW wind power generation project is located at Jhimpir, District Thatta, Province of Sindh, Pakistan. Sachal Energy Development (Ptd) Limited is 100% owned by Arif Habib Corporation Limited. According to the National Electric Power Regulatory Authority (NEPRA), the total project cost is 130.481 Million USD. The project achieved commercial operation on April 10, 2017. The debt-equity ratio of the project is 80:20. Hydrochina Corporation is the Offshore EPC Contractor and Hydrochina International Engineering Company Ltd Pakistan is the Onshore EPC Contractor for this project. Goldwind provided 33 Wind Turbine Generators with a capacity of 1.5 MW each. Sachal Energy Development Pvt Ltd entered into a foreign facility agreement with ICBC China on February 15, 2015 for an amount of 100 Million USD. This was later revised to 104.385 Million USD to reflect the 80% debt component of the total project cost. The interest rate is 6 Months LIBOR (1.4154%) + 3.75%. The repayment period of 10 years was determined according to the Debt Service Schedule on a 2018 document released by NEPRA. The project's inauguration ceremony was held on April 20 2015 during Chinese President Xi Jinping's visit to Pakistan. According to ICBC, the project is the first private new energy loan project in Pakistan undertaken by China Export and Credit Insurance Corporation (SINOSURE), and is also the first project to complete loan signing under CPEC. A 2013 Tariff Petition Determination document released by National Electric Power Regulatory Authority stated that the debt was to be shared between China CITIC Bank (80% of debt) and Askari Bank Limited (20% of debt). However, the Tariff Petition was ultimately rejected, which suggests that ICBC may have become the sole foreign financier to the project.

implementing_agencies: Southeast University (Bangladesh), Academic, Training and Research
title: Wuhan Textile University and Bangladesh's Southeast University create Joint Textile Engineering Undergraduate Program
description: In 2015, a Memorandum of Understanding was signed to develop a joint undergraduate program on textile engineering. This program would be between Southeast University in Bangladesh and Wuhan Textile University in China. Under the agreement, the two universities will exchange students and faculty members from various disciplines. This project is similar to #52668, where a similar joint programs was developed between the WTU and Bangladeshi universities.
sources: http://www.observerbd.com/2014/11/17/55151.php, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ATAPAR0020150602eb620005m&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.thedailystar.net/backpage/bangladesh-china-sign-six-deals-87067, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Southeast University (Bangladesh), Academic, Training and Research
contacts: Wei Yiliang, President of Wuhan Textile University; Prof Anwar Hossain, SEU Vice Chancellor

implementing_agencies: Bangladesh Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government Agency
title: China grants Tk 354 million for medical equipment and appliances
description:
In 2015, AMA Muhith, Bangladesh's Finance Minister, and Gao Hucheng, China’s commerce minister, signed two Letters of Exchange (LEs). In one letter China pledged to collect medical equipments and appliances for the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The funding came from a Chinese grant of Tk 35.4 crore (TK 354 million).

The coder did follow-up research in both English and Chinese, but could not find any  information relating to the progress of the project. Unsure if transaction ever occured.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=UNIBAG0020150825eb8p0000k&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dhakatribune.com/uncategorized/2015/08/25/china-interested-to-invest-300m-in-bangladesh-textile-sector, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Bangladesh Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government Agency

title: China agrees to first phase of upgrades for Karachi-Peshawar main railway line
description: In 2016, the Chinese government agreed to help finance the first phase of upgrades to the Karachi-Peshawar railway, otherwise known as Rail Line 1 (RL-1). Pakistan's Ministry of Railways is overseeing the construction of the project. The Chinese firm that will carry out the upgrade has yet to been named. The project has recently suffered delays and cutbacks to the overall budget as Pakistan reviews all CPEC-projects. So far the feasibility study has been completed and framework agreement signed between the two governments. The document indicates that the project will be funded by concessional loans. Continuing negotiations between the two governments will see the overall cost of project fluctuate, as well as the total amount of financing China is willing to give. However, so far the estimated cost had been adjusted from the initial 3.4 billion USD to 8.2 billion now. It is unclear which institution is funding in the project, in what form, and for how much of the total cost.
sources: https://tribune.com.pk/story/1672759/2-railways-upgrade-pakistan-delays-approval-mainline-amid-differences-cost/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.thenews.com.pk/print/369263-china-to-help-upgrade-karachi-peshawar-railway-track, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=IARPAK0020160604ec5v00002&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=KHALEJ0020150309eb380000w&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.sjbipp.org/publications/AR/reports/AR-10-17.pdf , Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://cpec.gov.pk/project-details/30, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/Estimates_of_Foreign_Assistance_2018_19.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://propakistani.pk/2018/07/16/3-4-billion-railway-project-between-karachi-and-peshawar-to-be-completed-on-priority/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: Bangladesh Power Development Board (BPDB), Government Agency; China Datang Corporation (CDT), State-owned Company; China National Machinery and Equipment Import & Export Corporation, State-owned Company; North-West Power Generation Company Limited (NWPGCL), State-owned Company
title: China EXIM Bank loans $1.98 billion for Payra Coal-Fired Thermal Power Plant debt portion (linked to projects #56005 #38245 #56547 and #56357)
description:
On June 9, 2014, the Northwest Power Generation Company Ltd. (NWPGCL) signed a joint venture agreement with China National Machinery Import & Export Corporation (CMC) to construct the first phase of the 1320MW Payra Coal-Fired Thermal Power Plant Project (Chinese translation:  孟加拉帕亚拉PAYRA2*660MW燃煤电站项目). CMC and NWPGCL formed the Bangladesh-China Power Company Ltd. (BCPCL) — a special purpose vehicle — to carry out this project. The Prime Ministers from both countries attended the June 2014 signing ceremony for the BCPCL. NWPGCL and CMC registered BCPCL on October 1, 2014. 

NWPGCL is a subsidiary of the Bangladesh Power Development Board (BPDB). BPDP and CMC are both state-owned companies. The total cost of the 1320MW Payra Coal-Fired Thermal Power Plant is $2.48 billion and it is reportedly being financed according to a 80:20 debt-to-equity ratio. NWPGCL and CMC each reportedly will provide 50% of the equity financing for this project. This project only tracks the debt funding. Project ID #56005 captures the equity funding for this project. China Eximbank covered the remaining 80% of the project through debt financing. On December 29, 2016, the China Eximbank and BCPCL signed a $1.984 billion loan agreement to support the construction of the 1320MW Payra Coal-Fired Thermal Power Plant Project. This loan reportedly carries the following terms: 19 year maturity, 4 year grace period, interest rate of LIBOR plus a 2% margin (which we estimate as 3.306% at the time of commitment since 1.306% was the average 6-month LIBOR rate in December 2016). The Government of Bangladesh provided a $1 billion sovereign guarantee for this loan on December 31, 2017. 

The Payra power plant is located in Dhankhali, Patuakhali, Bangladesh. This places the power plant along the north side of the Payra port, which will be renovated by the China Harbour Company and the China State Construction Engineering Corporation (see Project ID #55522). Phase one of the project involves construction of units one and two. Each unit will have a capacity of 660 MW, so phase one has a combined capacity of 1320 MW.  In December 2017, BPDB contracted China Energy Engineering Group Northeast No. 1 Electric Power Construction Co., Ltd. (NPEC) and China National Energy Engineering & Construction Co., Ltd. (CECC) to construct the power plants. The project was officially launched on October 27, 2018. The power plant became operational on January 13, 2020.  A consortium led by the China Datang Overseas Electric Technology and O&M Co. Ltd. will carry out operations and maintenance of the power plant.  Once operational, this power plant will sell energy to the BPDB at a cost of 6.56 BDT per unit of energy.  

The project site is located at Latitude: 22⁰ 59' 58' N and Longitude: 90⁰ 17' 58' E adjacent to the Kazol River or upstream of Rabnabad Channel at Dhankhali Union, Kalapara Upazila, Patuakhali District of Bangladesh. The site is spread across the Mouza: Modhupara, Char Nisanbaria and Nisanbaria. The site can be approached by a direct road from the nearby Dhaka – Kuakata Road (highway no. R880). The site is nearby the widely used Londa Kheya Ghat at Kalapara Upazila. Transport of heavy equipment can be made by adjacent river route. The site is approximately 13 km away from the nearest Upazila

STAFF_NOTE: Despite news articles that identify the lending terms for the 1320MW Payra Coal-Fired Thermal Power Plant Project as non-concessional, the grant element is 43.52%, so we code it as a concessional loan. We also code the project as having mixed (development and commercial) intent because the power plant is being partially financed via equity contributions (described in Project ID #56005). Other English names for the Payra Coal-fired Power Plant Project include 'Payra Power Hub' and the alternative spellings of “Pyra” and “Paira”. This project should not be confused with any of the joint-development agreements for the Payra 3600 MW LNG-to-Power Project signed by NWPGCL and Siemens (Germany). 

Also, note that there are three different power plants being constructed in the Patuakhali region of Bangladesh. Each one of these projects is funded partially via joint ventures between Chinese and Bangladeshi state-owned enterprises and partially via China Eximbank loans. Two of the coal-fired plants will contain two 660MW generators, with the third project involves two phases, both of which have two 660MW generators. The joint venture partners have clarified that these plants are near each other, but they are distinct plants supporting a region-wide electrification campaign. 

These projects include: (1) Bangladesh’s Northwest Power Generation Company Ltd. and China National Machinery Import & Export Corporation, which established the Bangladesh-China Power Company Ltd. (BCPCL) joint venture in October 2014 to oversee the financing, design, and construction of Patuakhali 1320MW (2 x 660MW) Ultra Supercritical Coal Based Thermal Power Plant Project (Phase 2). The joint venture is captured in Project ID #56005. China Eximbank is funding phase one (units 1 and 2) of this project (see Project ID #52748). China Eximbank financing for phase two (units 3 and 4) is currently unspecified, with the most recent details record in Project ID #38245. 

(2) Bangladesh’s Ashuganj Power Station Company Ltd. (APSCL) and China’s China Energy Engineering Corporation Ltd. (CEEC) established a joint venture in July 2017 to oversee the financing, design, and construction of  Patuakhali 1320MW (2 x 660MW) Coal-Fired Power Plant (Ashuganj/ APSCL). The joint venture is captured in Project ID #56547. CEEC will solicit a loan from the China Eximbank for the debt portion of the project. China Eximbank financing for this project is currently not captured in a stand-alone Project ID#. 

(3) Bangladesh’s Rural Power Company Ltd. (RPCL) and China’s NORINCO, which established a joint venture in November 2017 to oversee the financing, design, and construction of 1320MW (2 x 660MW) MW Patuakhali Coal Fired Thermal Power Plant. The joint venture is captured in Project ID #56357. China Eximbank debt financing for the project is captured in Project ID#56402.

STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese name of the project is '帕亚拉超临界燃煤电站'.

recipient_agencies: Bangladesh Power Development Board (BPDB), Government Agency; Ministry of Finance, Government Agency; North-West Power Generation Company Limited (NWPGCL), State-owned Company

title: $1.02 billion China Eximbank-financed Expansion and Strengthening of Power System Network Project under the Dhaka Power Distribution Company
description: On June 1 2014, Chinese company TBEA Co., Ltd. signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Dhaka Power Distribution Company (DPDC) for the expansion and strengthening of power system network in DPDC area under a Chinese Concessional Loan (G to G ). The Executive Committee of the National Economic Council approved the project on December 6 2016. According to media reports, on August 11, 2017, China agreed to assist in the project of expanding and strengthening of the power system network Dhaka Power Distribution Company (DPDC) area project in South Dhaka. China EXIM Bank will provide a Preferential Buyer Credit loan worth1021.77 million. The project begun in January 2019 and is expected to be completed by 2021; no additional information on project status could be found. According to media reports, 15 per cent of project financing will come from the Bangladesh government and 85 per cent of project financing comes from the Exim Bank of China.
sources: https://mofa.gov.bd/site/press_release/5dea4427-68f9-4b55-acee-d302cf1a7455/Press-release-on-meeting-between-H-E--Mr--Md--Shahriar-Alam,-MP-Hon%E2%80%99ble-State-Minister-for-Foreign-Affairs-and-H-E--Mr--Zhang-Zuo,-newly-appointed-Ambassador-of-China-to-Bangladesh, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.newagebd.net/print/article/2329DPDC finally takes project to strengthen capacity, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.theindependentbd.com/arcprint/details/110427/2017-08-21, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dpdc.org.bd/list/annualreport/anl_rpt14_15.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020160816ec8g002p9&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=AIWTHS0020161107ecar001m0&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dropbox.com/s/absm9i5y8b3fawb/IJGlobal%20-%20DPDC%20Power%20System%20Network%20Strengthening%20and%20Expansion%20-%20Bangladesh.pdf?dl=0, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://dpdc.org.bd/list/annualreport/anl_report17_18.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

implementing_agencies: Aerospace Long-March International Trade Co., Ltd, ; Bangladesh Television (BTV), Government Agency; Radio, Film & TV Design and Research Institute (DRFT), Private Sector
title: Chinese EXIM Bank agrees to loan 988.46 Bangladeshi Taka Crore to Bangladesh to construct six TV stations
description: In November 2015, the Chinese EXIM Bank loaned Bangladesh 988.46 BDT crore to establish 5 regional TV stations through Bangladesh Television (BTV). Negotiations began in 2015 to establish 5 TV stations, but BTV announced plans for a 6th station after already signing the initial deal with the Chinese EXIM Bank. The 6th station in the Mymensing region will join the first 5 stations in the Rajshahi, Khulna, Sylhet, Rangpur, and Barisal regions. The loan details are unclear, but a Bangladeshi news agency, the Independent, reports that the loan is concessional. In October 2017, the Chinese state-owned organisations Aerospace Long March International Trade Company Limited (ALIT) and Radio, Film and TV Design and Research Institute (DRFT) secured contracts to help implement the project.
sources: http://www.theindependentbd.com/arcprint/details/119570/2017-10-19, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.shantasecurities.com/backend/web/page_files/Morning%20Newsflash%20-%20%2031%20May%202018-1527758055-5.pdf, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020160816ec8g002p9&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Bangladesh Television (BTV), Government Agency; Radio, Film & TV Design and Research Institute (DRFT), Private Sector

implementing_agencies: Alternative Energy Promotion Centre, Government Agency
title: China Granted Solar Panels Worth 37 Million RMB to Nepal
description: On March 21, 2016, China signed an agreement with Nepal's Prime Minister to grant Nepal 32,000 sets of solar panels at a cost of 37 million RMB. The grant aimed at helping Nepal provide electricity for communities that had been without power after the earthquake on April 25th, 2015. On January 21, 2018, China handed over the donation, including 32,000 sets of household solar power generation system of 10Wp, 325 sets of solar power generation system of 1200Wp, battery, controller, and LED bulbs. According to government of Nepal, the donation will be distributed by the Alternative Energy Promotion Center to earthquake effected communities.
sources: https://indianexpress.com/article/world/china-donates-over-32000-solar-power-generators-to-nepal-5034679/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2018-01/21/c_136913167.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinanews.com/gn/2018/01-21/8429569.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://mofa.gov.np/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/MOFA_REPORT_Nepal-Foreign-Affairs_2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://mofa.gov.np/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/MOFA_REPORT_Nepal-Foreign-Affairs_2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://thehimalayantimes.com/business/china-hands-over-1mw-solar-system-in-singha-durbar/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AIWTHS0020160325ec3l0028r&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Alternative Energy Promotion Centre, Government Agency

implementing_agencies: China Geological Survey, National NGO; China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC), State-owned Company
title: China Agreed to Grant RMB 470,000 for Nepal's Oil Exploration
description: On March 21, 2016, China signed Exchange of Letters to provide the grant assistance of RMB 470,000 for the oil and gas exploration project of Nepal. The agreement was under the commercial deal on the supply of petroleum products between the two countries. China also agreed to build oil storage facilities and send exports to carry out the research on oil exploration for Nepal. On February 22, 2018, Nepal's Department of Mines and Geology informed that a Chinese expert team from China National Petroleum Corporation will visit Nepal to conduct the feasibility study, but the actual date was not determined. It is not clear whether the grants assistance has been disbursed. STAFF_NOTE: Limited information on the status of the grant assistance.
sources: https://mofa.gov.np/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/MOFA_REPORT_Nepal-Foreign-Affairs_2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2019-01-18/china-roped-in-for-oil-and-gas-drilling.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://thehimalayantimes.com/business/chinese-experts-study-fuel-exploration-extraction-prospects/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://mofa.gov.np/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/MOFA_REPORT_Nepal-Foreign-Affairs_2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020160323ec3n007kf&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China Exim Bank funds Port Qasim 2x660 MW Coal-Fired Power Project [CPEC, IPP]
description: In April 2015, China's President Xi Jinping and Pakistan's Prime Minister, Mian Muhammad Nawaz Sharif witnessed the signing of an investment agreement on a coal-based power project in Port Qasim, Karachi. The Project is located in the Port Qasim Industrial Park, and consists of two modern supercritical coal-fired units, a self-dedicated coal unloading jetty and a 4 km-length channel dredged and transferred to Port Qasim Authority. The coal will be imported. This project is one of the largest Priority Implementation Projects under China Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC). According to a CPEC website last updated in 2017, the total investment for the project amounts to 2.085 billion USD, with a debt-equity ratio of 75:25. China Eximbank will be providing a loan of 1554.9 million USD dollar, which is the 75% debt component of the total 2.085 billion project cost. A Special Report on CPEC Projects from the Chinese embassy stated that as of October 2018, China Eximbank has disbursed 975 million USD (62.7% of total loan). Shareholders Powerchina Resources Ltd., who holds 51% shares and AMC, Qatar, who holds 49% shares, injected USD 346 million (i.e. 65.3% of total equity). The exact breakdown is unknown. For the purpose of this project, only the loan by China Eximbank is recorded. According to a February 2015 report from the National Electric Power Regulatory Authority (NEPRA), the interest rate of the loan is 4.95%. For determination of the upfront tariff, the repayment period was assumed to be 10 years, and the grace period was assumed to be the same as the construction period, which is 4 years. This project has thus recorded the loan details as such. On November 29th, 2017, Yao Jing, the Chinese ambassador to Pakistan, accompanied the Prime Minister of Pakistan at the power generation ceremony of the first unit of the coal power plant at Port Qasim.
sources: http://www.cpecinfo.com/news/port-qasim-coal-fired-power-project/MTYxOA==, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://pk.chineseembassy.org/eng/zbgx/CPEC/t1627103.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/8csdpteq2a5b3lj/2016%20Government%20of%20Pakistan%20Bond%20Prospectus.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.nepra.org.pk/Tariff/IPPs/003%20Coal/Port%20Qasim/TRF-299%20Port%20Qasim%20Upfront%20Coal%20Determination%2013-02-2015%201839-41.PDF, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/survey/chapters_17/Annex_III_CPEC.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://dukespace.lib.duke.edu/dspace/bitstream/handle/10161/16605/MP%20CR%20TS%20XW.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.cpecinfo.com/news/cpec-project-updates-april-2018/NTE5Mw==, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://cpec.gov.pk/project-details/1, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t1516990.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/vults7c3kv89j45/BU_PITCH_ENGLISH_2018.xlsx?dl=0, Academic Journal Article; https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=PAPRIN0020151217ebcf0006l&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: China Road and Bridge Corporation, State-owned Company
title: Chinese grant for Rehabilitation and Reconstruction of Bishkek Road Network Project Phase II
description: In September 2016, Chinese state-owned company China Road and Bridge Corporation signed a commercial contract to handle the newly-named Bishkek Municipal Road Network Improvement Project in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan. Under CRBC management, the project was shortened to 95.33km in length, and 49 sections of individual road repair. The project is currently underway, with an expected completion date in 2019. It was reported that the Chinese government granted 481 million yuan to this project. The first phase of the Rehabilitation of the Bishkek Road Network Project involved a road that was 7.47km in length, committed and finished in 2015. STAFF_NOTE: This project should not be confused with project #54376, as CRBC reported this project in 2 phases, but reported #54376 as a stand-alone project

implementing_agencies: China Railway 14th .Construction Bureau Co., Ltd (China Railway Shisiju Group Corporation), State-owned Company
title: China Granted RMB 900 million Economic Package to Nepal to Repair Araniko Highway (Linked to project #43970)
description: On March 25 2015, China pledged RMB 900 million economic package to Nepal for expansion and upgrade of the 114km Araniko Highway, which provides transportation between China and Nepal. Chinese President Xi Jinping announced the aid during a visit of Nepalese President Ram Baran Yadac at the Boao Forum for Asia Annual Conference. In December, 2015, A Memorandum of Understanding was signed during the Nepalese Deputy Prime Minister's visit in China. Chinese state-owned company China Railway 14th Construction Bureau started the construction on August 8, 2016, and handed over the highway after repairing it on March 3, 2017. This is one of the 25 projects promised by China after the 2015 Nepal earthquake to help with reconstruction. For details of the umbrella project, see project #43970.
sources: http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/printedition/news/2015-03-28/xi-announces-rs-14b-in-new-aid.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2017-03-03/china-hands-over-araniko-highway-to-nepal-after-repair.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinanews.com/gj/2017/03-03/8164764.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=KATMPO0020150325eb3p00038&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: Architectural Reconnaissance and Design Institute of the Tibet Autonomous Region, State-owned Company
title: China to Construct Inland Container Depot in Timure, Nepal
description: In October 2014, China conducted a feasibility study for the Timure (Rasuwagadi) Frontier Inspection Station Project and signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) for the development of an Inland Container Depot (ICD) in Nepal. Then, on April 11, 2015, the Chinese Government and the Government of Nepal signed letters of exchange to construct the Inland Container Depot (ICD) in the town of Timure within Rasuwagadi District. China agreed to cover all the expenses except the costs of land acquisition. The 6,900 m² ICD will include two warehouses for storage and investigation before clearing, three quarantine check points for animals, plants and food testing, a parking lot for 315 freight vehicles, separate terminals for import and export, and food protection levee. China will also provide equipment for inspection and other infrastructure such as water tanks. On November 15, 2015, China sent a technical team to conduct the inspection of the site for construction. Nepal Intermodal Transport Development Board also acquired 8.5 hectares land for the project: 5 hectares from Langtang National Park and 3.5 hectares from the general public. The Chinese state-owned company, Architectural Reconnaissance and Design Institute of the Tibet Autonomous Region, oversaw the design of the ICD. Construction was expected to begin in October 2018; however, as of October 27, 2018, the construction had still not begun. Tibet Fuli Construction Group Company Limited was selected as the contractor responsible for project implementation on May 13, 2019.  Project implementation then began on May 29, 2019.
sources: https://thehimalayantimes.com/business/construction-of-icd-timure-to-begin-from-october-end/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://thehimalayantimes.com/business/construction-work-of-timure-inland-container-depot-icd-to-begin/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/printedition/news/2015-03-09/china-moves-to-construct-inland-container-depot-at-rasuwagadhi.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://myrepublica.nagariknetwork.com/news/construction-of-dry-port-in-rasuwagadhi-yet-to-begin/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ATHIMT0020150411eb4b0000p&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: People's Liberation Army of China, Government Agency
title: China's Military Provides Earthquake Assistance in Kathmandu, Nepal
description:
Following the earthquake on April 25, 2015, the Chinese military also dispatched a 215-member rescue and medical team which arrived in two batches, on Monday evening and Tuesday, according to the Chinese Foreign Ministry. The rescue team carried 40 tons of relief goods, 95 electricity generators,  more than 300 tents, 4 sniffer dogs, 5 recovery vehicles, and life detectors. The team included 12 seismic experts and 58 medical workers from Chengdu People's Hospital along with the rescuers. The medical team supported the victims with surgery and trauma alleviation in downtown Kathmandu. On May 1, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Wu Chuntai and Nepal's Minister of Industry Mahesh Basnet visited a base of the military medical team, and conveyed gratitude to efforts of the Chinese military. 

A 62-member International Rescue Team arrived only around 24 hours after the quake struck, reaching Kathmandu at noon on Sunday. The team comprised 40 rescuers and 10 medical experts as well as six sniffer dogs. A second 58-member team followed on Monday morning, setting up a makeshift hospital and carrying 13 tons of aid. The team  [中国政府医疗队] was organized by the Health and Family Planning Commission of Sichuan Province. On April 27, the team arrived in Kathmandu with the 13 tonnes of medical supplies. The team returned to Sichuan on May 9 after 13 days of operation.

STAFF_NOTE: There are some discrepancies regarding exact number of aid workers, because some teams providing auxiliary support to the military medical unit were included to varying degrees in total reports.
sources: https://fts.unocha.org/flows/127941?destination=donors/2976/flows/2015%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522629%253ANEPAL%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520April%25202015%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.indiatoday.in/nepal-earthquake-2015/story/nepal-earthquake-china-to-triple-aid-rescue-efforts-250781-2015-04-29, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.china.com.cn/zhibo/zhuanti/ch-xinwen/2015-05/07/content_35513605.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.scwst.gov.cn/index.php/tpxw/11716-2015-05-11-08-09-40, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.scwst.gov.cn/index.php/tpxw/11716-2015-05-11-08-09-40, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.scwst.gov.cn/index.php/tpxw/11716-2015-05-11-08-09-40, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020150501eb51008sq&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: People's Armed Police of China, Government Agency
title: Chinese People's Armed Police Repairs Road in Nepal after the Earthquake
description: On May 3, 2015, China sent a 500 member group of Chinese People's Armed Police to help restore the transportation in Nepal after an 8.1 magnitude earthquake. The group entered Nepal from southwestern Tibet with 180 engineering machines, in order to repair the 114km road from Zham Port to Kathmandu. As of May 6, 2015, the group was working on the restoration. STAFF_NOTE: The current status is marked as completion because implementation began immediately after the earthquake as an emergency response.
sources: http://www.chinatoday.com.cn/english/columns/2015-06/02/content_690609.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020150505eb5500462&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: Nepal Oil Corporation Limited, State-owned Company; PetroChina, State-owned Company
title: PetroChina Granted 1.2 Million Liters Petroleum to Nepal (linked to #53157)
description: On October 28, 2015, China National United Oil Corporation signed a memorandum of understanding with Nepal Oil Corporation (NOC) to grant 1.2 million liters of petroleum to Nepal. On October 31, 2015, China handed over the oil. The grant aimed at helping relieve the acute energy shortage in Nepal. 'We have received 73.5 metric tons of petrol from China in these two days,' NOC spokesperson Deepak Baral told Xinhua. In December of the same year, China provided an additional 1.4 million liters (captured in project (#53157)
sources: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international/world-news/nepal-receives-first-consignment-of-petrol-from-china/articleshow/49629852.cms, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ATHIMT0020151028ebas0003o&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//world/2015-11/04/c_128392390.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Nepal Oil Corporation Limited, State-owned Company

implementing_agencies: Nepal Oil Corporation Limited, State-owned Company
title: China Grant 1.4 Million Liters of Fuel to Nepal (linked to #53155)
description: On December 29, 2015, the Chinese government signed an agreement to grant an additional 1.4 million liters of petroleum worth 10 million Yuan to Nepal. The grant aimed at helping the country cope with the fuel shortages after the devastating earthquake on April 25, 2015. Deputy Prime Minister of Nepal Kamal Thapa secured the grant during his visit in Beijing. Nepal Oil Corporation transported the fuel provided by China from Kerung in Tibet to Kathmandu. This is an additional grant, following a previous donation of 1.2 million liters in October (project 53155). STAFF_NOTE: Nepal Oil Corporation was recorded as the participating organization because its officials reported the figure of this project.
sources: https://www.freepressjournal.in/world/china-to-give-additional-1-4-mn-litre-fuel-to-nepal/745721, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://thehimalayantimes.com/nepal/thapa-returns-with-chinas-pledge-of-another-fuel-grant/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AIWTHS0020151230ebct0004c&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: China Harbour Engineering Co., Ltd., State-owned Company
title: Extension of Southern Expressway Section 4 from Mattala to Hambantota via Andarawewa (link to projects ID #38337, #53526, #33488 and #53529)
description: On 16 September 2014, China Eximbank signed a 2,528,170,000 CNY concessional loan agreement with Sri Lanka for the Extension of Southern Expressway Project (ESEP) Section 4 from Mattala to Hambantota via Andarawewa. The loan has an interest rate of 2% and a maturity of 20 years, including a 5 year grace period (see Sri Lanka Department of External Resources 2014 Annual Performance Report). According to the 2017 Government of Sri Lanka Bond Prospectus, this loan covers the total estimated cost of the project. The objective of ESEP is to enhance the efficiency of the transport system by linking the country's major economic centers with Colombo City and other parts of the country. Under this objective, ESEP Section 4 consists of the construction of a 25 km length road section from Mattala to Hambantota via Andarewa. The scope of this project includes the construction of 2 viaducts, 1 interchange, 6 bridges, 2 bridge underpasses, 2 overpasses, 10 culvert underpasses, 61 box culverts, and 1 aqueduct. The contractor for this project is China Harbour Engineering Company Ltd. (CHEC). ESEP Section 4 commenced on 19 January 2016, and this section has a target completion date of 28 May 2019 (see 'Extension of Southern Expressway' from Road Development Authority). As of 31 December 2018, this section was 86.06% complete. For information on other sections of ESEP, see projects ID #38337 (Section 1), #53526 (Section 2), and #33488 (Section 3). Additionally, China Eximbank provided a loan to fund consultancy services for the expressway (see project ID #53529).

title: Chinese Embassy in Pakistan donates office supplies to the Pakistani capital police department
description:
On June 2, 2010, the Embassy in Pakistan donated a batch of office supplies to the Pakistani Capital Police. 
Chinee Ambassador Luo Zhaohui and other diplomats of the Embassy, ​​and Kalim, as well as the director of the Pakistani Police Department, attended the donation ceremony.

implementing_agencies: China State Construction Engineering Corporation (CSCEC), State-owned Company
title: Extension of Southern Expressway Section 2 from Beliatta to Wetiya (link to projects ID #38337, #33488, #53522 and #53529)
description: On 7 April 2016, the Export-Import Bank of China signed a 360.3 million USD concessional loan agreement with Sri Lanka for the Extension of Southern Expressway Project (ESEP) Section 2 from Beliatta to Wetiya (see Sri Lanka Department of External Resources 2016 Annual Performance Report). Based on information from IJGlobal Project Finance & Infrastructure Journal, the total project cost is 498.58 million USD, and the project's debt-equity ratio is 85:15. The USD 423.58 million debt portion is funded by two loans. The first loan is a USD 360 million loan from China Exim Bank with a 20-year maturity, 5 year grace period and 2% interest rate. The China Exim Bank loan includes an upfront fee of 25bp and a commitment fee of 25bp paid each year. The second loan is a USD 63.58 million loan from Hatton National Bank. The Road Development Authority of Sri Lanka provided the equity funding amounting to USD 75 million. For the purpose of this project, only the USD 360 million loan (USD 360.3 million according to the 2016 Annual Performance Report) from China Exim Bank has been recorded. The objective of ESEP is to enhance the efficiency of the transport system by linking the country's major economic centers with Colombo City and other parts of the country. Under this objective, ESEP Section 2 consists of the construction of a 26 km length road section from Beliatta to Wetiya. The scope of this project includes the construction of 2 interchanges, 26 underpasses, 7 overpasses, 8 bridges, and 70 box culverts. The contractor for this project is China State Construction Engineering Corporation (CSCEC). ESEP Section 2 commenced on 28 October 2016, and this section has a target completion date of 27 October 2019 (see 'Extension of Southern Expressway' from Road Development Authority). As of 31 December 2018, this section was 61.23% complete. For information on other sections of ESEP, see projects ID #38337 (Section 1), #33488 (Section 3), and #53522 (Section 4). Additionally, China Eximbank provided a loan to fund consultancy services for the expressway (see project ID #53529).

implementing_agencies: Sinohydro Corporation, State-owned Company
title: Thalpitigala Reservoir Project
description: On 22 December 2017, the Export-Import Bank of China signed a 147.9 million USD loan agreement with Sri Lanka for the Thalpitigala Reservoir Project in the Badulla District of Uva Province. This loan covers 85% of the total project cost, and it has an interest rate of 2% and a maturity of 15 years, including a 6 year grace period (see Sri Lanka Department of External Resources 2017 Annual Performance Report). The estimated total cost of the project is 174 million USD, and the remaining 15% of funding (26.1 million USD) not covered by the China Eximbank loan will be provided by the Peoples Bank, a state-owned commercial Sri Lankan bank (see 2017 Annual Performance Report). The contractor for this project is China Sinohydro Corporation Ltd. (see Sri Lanka Ministry of Irrigation and Water 'Thalpitigala Reservoir Project'). The project is targeted for completion within 5 years after the signing of the loan agreement. As of 31 March 2018, loan funds had yet to be disbursed, but the pre-feasibility study had been completed and the loan agreement had been approved (see 'Progress...as of 31 March 2018' from Ministry of Program Management). The objective of the Thalpitigala Reservoir Project is to improve the agricultural productivity in the Badulla district by providing irrigation water while enhancing provision of safe drinking water and generation of hydropower. The scope of this project includes the provision of irrigation water to new and existing lands around 1400 hectares in the area through constructing upstream of the Battmedilla anicut in the Badulla district, the provision of safe drinking water facilities to Wasanagama, Madulla, Thetilla and Beramada villages in the Kandaketiya Divisonal Secretary's Division, and the construction of a hydropower station with a capacity of 15 MW that will generate 51 GWh of hydro power annually to fed the National Grid.

recipient_agencies: Peoples Bank, State-owned Company

title: Kandy North Pathadumbara Integrated Water Supply Project
description: On 22 December 2017, China Eximbank signed a 1,636,600,000 CNY concessional loan agreement for the Kandy North Pathadumbara Integrated Water Supply Project. This loan will cover the total cost of the project, and it has an interest rate of 2% and a maturity of 20 years, including a 6 year grace period (see Sri Lanka Department of External Resources 2017 Annual Performance Report). The objective of this project is to provide safe pipe-borne water supply facility to six divisions, namely Pathadumbara, Harispattuwa, Akurana, Pujapitiya, Kandy Four Gravets and Thumpane. The scope of this project includes the construction of a clear water reservoir (2100m3 within existing water treatment plant), a filtration unit, a flocculation unit, a new pump station and improvements to existing stations, Slude lagoon, service reservoirs, and pump houses. The project also includes the improvement of existing pump stations and the supply and laying of distribution lines and transmission lines. As of 31 March 2018 there was no physical progress on this project, and loan funds had yet to be disbursed. The loan agreement had been finalized, but cabinet approval was needed for deviations. Land acquiring and procurement activities were in progress (see 'Progress...as of 31 March 2018' from Department of Project Management). The project is expected to be completed in 2021.

title: Consultancy Services for Extension of Southern Expressway Project (link to projects ID #38337, #53526, #33488 and #53522)
description: On 22 December 2017, the Export-Import Bank of China signed a 577 million CNY concessional loan agreement with Sri Lanka for consultancy services for design review and construction supervision of civil works on the Extension of Southern Expressway Project (ESEP). According to the Sri Lanka Department of External Resources 2017 Annual Performance Report, the China Eximbank loan would cover the full cost of this project. The loan has an interest rate of 2% and a maturity of 20 years, including a 6 year grace period (see 2017 Annual Performance Report). The objective of ESEP is to enhance the efficiency of the transport system by linking the country's major economic centers with Colombo City and other parts of the country. Under this objective, the 577 million CNY loan from Eximbank will fund the provision of consultancy services for design review and construction supervision of civil work of the Southern Expressway from Matara to Hambantota. According to the Sri Lanka Department of External Resources, this project commenced on 22 January 2017 and is targeted for completion in the year 2022 (see 'Resource Mobilization'). As of 31 March 2018, the consultancy work for all four sections of ESEP was on schedule (see 'Progress...as of 31 March 2018' from Sri Lanka Department of Project Management). For information on the four sections of ESEP, for which the consultancy services captured in this project will be provided, see projects ID #38337 (Section 1), ID #53526 (Section 2), #33488 (Section 3), and #53522 (Section 4).

implementing_agencies: China Railway Group Co., Ltd., State-owned Company
title: China grants 300 million RMB for the construction of the 8th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge over the Kocha River
description: On March 7th, 2016, China pledged 300 million RMB towards the construction of the 8th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge over the Kocha River. The bridge is located in Bekutia and will be part of the Rajapur-Pirojpur expressway. It is about 1km long and costs a total of 8.3 billion BDT, 6.55 taka of which is granted by the Chinese government. The implementing company is China Railway Major Bridge Reconnaissance & Design Institute Co., Ltd. (BRDI), a subsidiary of the Chinese state-owned construction company, China Railway Group Limited. In April 2016, the deal was signed. Construction begun on November 1, 2018, and the expected completion date is June 2020. According to press release by the implementing agency, the project is under construction as of January 2019. This is an annual contribution: 2009: #53972 (100m RMB) 2010: #43215 (60m RMB) & #34251 (40m RMB) 2011: unknown 2012: 53975 (23.770m USD) 2013: 53578 (50m USD) 2014: none reported 2015: none reported 2016: 53530 (300m RMB) [8th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge] 2017: 53577 (500m RMB) [9th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge]
sources: http://www.daily-sun.com/arcprint/details/126821/2016/04/08/Deal-signed-for-8th-friendship-bridge/2016-04-08, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://bd.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201706/20170602591597.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b09c0301_8d15_49e1_8af9_3231f08b8ad8/Tbl-6.00.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.brdi.com.cn/Article.aspx?ID=3587, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://bd.mofcom.gov.cn/article/todayheader/201811/20181102802410.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://erd.portal.gov.bd/site/page/dbc55067-77ac-4d2d-a2a2-a7b348ff20de/Commitment-FY-2015-16, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://bd.china-embassy.org/eng/dshd/t1354461.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides 500 miillion RMB grant for 1,000 fire department motorcycles
description:
On October 14, 2016, China committed to grant 500 million RMB (approximately $73.29 million) for the modernization of Bangladesh's Fire Service and Civil Defence. The financial and technical cooperation agreement was signed during President Xi Jinping’s visit to Bangladesh, and is said to be part of the project of Disaster Emergency Operation Centre and Information Platform. The grant will provide for 1000 ‘water mist fire motorcycles’ fitted with modern technologies. The motorcycles will be able to maneuver through Dhaka's crowded streets. 
The PDF Named 'অনুদাৈ ও ঋণচুতির িাতিকা' or 'List of Grants and Loans' is a part of Bangladesh's Economic Relations Division's 2017 Annual report.  This PDF confirms the signing date.
Chinese Commerce Ministry website reports in August, 2018 that a quality examination of the motorcycles was conducted on August 13-14, 2018, and the shipment is scheduled to be shipped from Tianjin Port on August 29 and is expected to arrive in Bangladesh at the end of September. The reports also identifies the implementing agency as the Jiujiang Fire Fighting Equipment Limited Company(九江消防装备有限公司).
sources: http://www.theindependentbd.com/arcprint/details/68236/2016-11-14, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/article/shangwubangzhu/201809/20180902786272.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b4e54c5e_8c4b_4df5_b6cc_84ade7365591/6.12.8_Asia%20%281%29.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b4e54c5e_8c4b_4df5_b6cc_84ade7365591/6.12.8_As, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b4e54c5e_8c4b_4df5_b6cc_84ade7365591/6.1%20%281%29.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b09c0301_8d15_49e1_8af9_3231f08b8ad8/Tbl-3.12.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://en.ntvbd.com/bangladesh/39715/1000-fire-motorcycles-to-be-procured-with-Chinese-assistance, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b09c0301_8d15_49e1_8af9_3231f08b8ad8/Tbl-6.00.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

implementing_agencies: People's Liberation Army of China, Government Agency
title: China Sends International Rescue Medical Team of 50 people to Pakistan for flood relief (Linked to project #53534)
description: To assist the Pakistani people and the army in fighting the floods, an international rescue medical team of 50 sent by the Chinese People's Liberation Army arrived in Karachi, the capital of Sindh province, on the afternoon of October 20, 2011. They will go to the southern city of Kunri to carry out rescue work the next day. The 50 tons of emergency relief materials carried by the medical team were also delivered to the disaster area on the same day. Linked to project #53534

title: China sends 50 tons of in-kind flood relief assistance to Pakistan (Linked to Project #53533)
description: To assist the Pakistani people and the army in fighting the floods, the Chinese People's Liberation Army sent in an international rescue medical team of 50 people, who also carried along with them 50 tons of emergency relief materials. Linked to project #53533

title: China donates US$5 million in cash to assist Pakistan in flood relief (linked to project #37183)
description: According to the report by Chinese embassy in Pakistan, by October, 2011, Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan Liu Jian said that the Chinese government will provide 5 million US dollars in cash assistance to the flood-hit country, in addition to the previously provided humanitarian assistance captured in Project #37183

title: China provide 30 million Chinese Yuan Emergency Assistance to Afghanistan (Linked to #37850, #34501, #34498)
description: In January 2002, Chinese President Jiang Zemin, Prime Minister Zhu Rongji signed an agreement to provide Afghanistan emergency aid package worth 30 million Chinese Yuan during the visit of Afghan interim leader Hamid Karzai. The aid package includes medicine, medical equipment, stationery, and sports products is for support of the temporary government. In March 2002, Northern Afghanistan was hit by Hindu Kush earthquakes, so part of the aid was also used for rehabilitation. The handover ceremony was held on March 26, 2002. The agreement was signed together with #37850, another assistance of 1 million USD in cash. For other 2002 earthquake response fund that China provided for Afghanistan, see #34501 for details. This project is part of a package of 2002-2005 China assistance to Afghanistan of 150 million USD reconstruction plan (#34498).
sources: https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/web/gjhdq_676201/gj_676203/yz_676205/1206_676207/fyrygth_676215/t5488.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2002-05-22/0616582394.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206/1206x1/t356107.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China signs ETC agreement worths US$30 million with Afghanistan
description: On May 15, 2002, Chinese Minister of Foreign Affair Tang Jiaxuan signed an Agreement on Economic and Technical Cooperation of US$30 million Chinese aid to Afghanistan. The purpose of this grant is to immediately and actively implement the commitments made by China to the reconstruction of Afghanistan. While the signing date is similar to the handover date of #53537 and they are both intended for reconstruction, they are distinct projects because they were signed at different times and have differing transaction amounts.
sources: https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjb_663304/zzjg_663340/yzs_663350/gjlb_663354/2676_663356/2678_663360/t15832.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2002-05-15/2131576543.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China grants 1 million USD material aid to Afghanistan
description: In November 2002, China signed an agreement to donate 1 million USD material aid to Afghanistan during Afghanistan Minister of Foreign Minister Abdullah's visit in China. The exact use of the materials is unclear. STAFF_NOTE: This is not a duplicate project for #37850 since the commitment years are different. It is neither a duplicate for #53812 because this projects reports 1 million worth of material aids and #53812 reports 1 million cash. CRS code is emergency response as it is grouped with efforts towards reconstruction in the sources.

title: China assists Pakistan in post-flood road rehabilitation project
description: On December 5, 2012, Chinese Ambassador Liu Jian was invited to attend the signing ceremony for the post-flood rehabilitation project of the Pakistan National Road Highway. The project was signed by the Pakistan National Highway Bureau, China Railway 17th Bureau Co., Ltd. and China Yunnan Sunshine Road Bridge Co., Ltd. to repair 460 kilometers of the north and south sections of the flood damage. STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to a Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2016/17, LoE signed on 26-09-2011. The committed amount is CNY1273 million. STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to a Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16, the project was under implementation at that time and had a transaction amount of CNY1340 million.

title: China provides $1.5m USD for earthquake relief (linked to #54186)
description: Sep 25, 2013, the Chinese government decided to provide emergency relief assistance to the Pakistani government for earthquake aftermath. The assistance includes1.5 million USD and supplies worth 30 million yuan (captured in project #54186). According to Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Status Report July-June 2013-14, the project started on 07-OCT-13 and ended on 31-OCT-13, meaning the aid is likely delivered by that date.

title: China Development Bank finances Ekibastuz GRES-2 Power Plant
description:
In 2013, China Development Bank issued a $1.2 billion loan to Russia's Vnesheconombank (VEB).  The loan had 2 tranches: a $400 million tranche with a maturity of 10 years and an $800 million tranche with a maturity of 6 years. The $400 million CDB loan tranche was used to support the construction of the third unit of Ekibastuz GRES-2 coal power plant in Kazakhstan (project ID#53544). The $800 million CDB loan tranche was used to support the construction of a multifunctional complex on the territory of the Slava plant (see project ID#TBD). VEB then used the proceeds of the CDB loan to on-lend to to 'Ekibastuz GRES-2' Joint Stock Company (JSC) for the construction of the third unit of Ekibastuz GRES-2 coal power plant in Ekibastuz. 'Ekibastuz GRES-2' Joint Stock Company (JSC) is an energy company located in the Republic of Kazakhstan. Its shareholders are: Samruk-Energy (JSC) (50%) and Samruk-Kazyna JSC (50%). Two of the existing power units at GRES-2 currently produce about 12 percent of all electricity produced in Kazakhstan. The CDB-financed project involved the construction, development and operation of a third unit, which, once completed, would seek to increase the power station’s installed capacity by 50 percent. Construction began on October 21, 2014. Staff Note: The Russian project title is 3-го блока Экибастузской ГРЭС.

The GRES-2 Power Station (or Power Station Ekibastuz) is a coal-fueled power generating station in the town of Ekibastuz within Pavlodar Region. More detailed locational information can be found at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ekibastuz_GRES-2_Power_Station#/map/0 and https://latitude.to/satellite-map/kz/kazakhstan/15146/ekibastuz-gres-2-power-station and http://globalenergyobservatory.org/geoid/40122 and https://www.google.com/maps/place/Ekibastuz+GRES-2+Power+Station,+Gres-2+140000,+Kazakhstan/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x4257917c05aaeefb:0x1106a87977b9d7ae?sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwj0uOak1pvpAhVUkHIEHTxjBNUQ8gEwC3oECBQQBg.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/vults7c3kv89j45/BU_PITCH_ENGLISH_2018.xlsx?dl=0, Academic Journal Article; https://chinaperspectives.revues.org/4053, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); https://eabr.org/en/projects/in-process/ekibastuzskaya-gres/, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://en.tengrinews.kz/finance/China-and-Russia-to-spend-400-million-on-Kazakhstan-power-23474/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://community.apan.org/wg/tradoc-g2/fmso/m/fmso-monographs/194970/download, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.gtreview.com/news/asia/veb-inks-series-of-china-loans/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.samruk-energy.kz/en/se/jsc-ekibastuz-sdps-2, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://carnegie.ru/2015/03/19/taming-dragon-how-can-russia-benefit-from-china-s-financial-ambitions-in-sco-pub-59445, Academic Journal Article

implementing_agencies: China National Chemical Engineering Corporation (CNCEC), State-owned Company; Kazakhstan Petrochemical Industries, Private Sector
title: China Development Bank loans $2 billion to construction of Atyrau Petrochemical Complex in Kazakhstan
description: In December 2015, China National Chemical Engineering Corporation agreed to construct an integrated gas-chemical complex in Atyrau region, Kazakhstan. On September 3 2016, China Development Bank signed a financing agreement with Kazakhstan Petrochemical Industries (KPI) to provide a2 billion loan for the construction of the complex. Kazakhstan Petrochemical Industries (KPI) will operate the complex. The complex will produce 500,000 ton/year of polypropylene and is the first integrated gas-chemical complex in Kazakhstan. Loan details are not available at the moment of project creation.
sources: https://www.polyestertime.com/kazakhstan-pp-production-atyrau/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=KAZNAE0020160904ec940005p&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dropbox.com/s/dil9222kl0ts6il/IJGlobal%20-%20Atyrau%20Petrochemical%20Complex%20-%20Kazakhstan.pdf?dl=0, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/article/i/jyjl/e/201609/20160901391312.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://nationalbank.kz/cont/BoP_2017_eng.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.globuc.com/2018/06/28/overview-of-the-largest-downstream-projects-in-central-asia/#kazah, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://www.whitecase.com/news/white-case-advises-kazakhstan-petrochemical-industries-development-2-billion-petrochemical, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.netherlandsworldwide.nl/.../energy-issue-december-2017-kazakhstan/Ene..., Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
