implementing_agencies: KazAvtoZhol, Government Agency
title: China Eximbank finances construction of Karaganda-Balkhash road
description: In May 2017, the Export-Import Bank of China provided a loan for the construction of the Karaganda-Balkhash road in Kazakhstan, which is part of the Central South Corridor. According to an article from CITIC, the company signed a EPC contract with KazAvtoZhol on May 17 2018. The Asian Development Bank states the cost of the project is 200 million USD. However, a Ministry of Commerce article reported that the Kazakhstan provided a sovereign guarantee to China Eximbank's loan in June 2018, and that the loan valued 727 million USD. According to the BoP, the loan was likely disbursed in the 4th quarter of 2017. The implementing agency is KazAvtoZhol. The road will be 363 kilometers long and is part of the Central South Corridor. Construction is to begin in August 2018 and will be completed by fall 2020. According to a project report by KazAvtoZhol in May 2019, the project is implemented in 8 sections with a total length of 362 km by a consortium of CITIC Construction Co.Ltd and JV KazGerStroy LLP. No loan details can be found.
sources: http://www.chinainvestmentresearch.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/China-Outbound-Investments-Vol-34_Summary_060717.pdf, Academic Journal Article; http://nationalbank.kz/cont/BoP_2017_eng.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.unescap.org/sites/default/files/CSN%20Report%202017_1.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/institutional-document/357426/cobp-kaz-2018-2020.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://bnews.kz/en/news/karaganda__balkhash_roads_construction_to_be_launched_this_august, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-05/15/c_136286376.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/article/i/jyjl/e/201806/20180602754249.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://construction.citic/content/details_39_2084.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

title: China donates 5 million Pakistani Rupee for resettlement of internal displaced persons in Pakistan
description: On July 9, 2014, the Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan, Sun Weidong, presented a donation of 5 million Pakistani Rupees to a Pakistani official on behalf of the Chinese embassy for the resettlement of internal displaced persons in Pakistan. The check was accepted by Abdul Qadir Baloch, minister of Pakistan's Ministry of States and Frontier Regions (SAFRON) for the resettlement of the internally displaced persons (IDPs) from North Waziristan The surge in internally displaced population was caused by Operation Zarb-e-Azb, a military campaign launched by the Pakistani armed forces on June 15 against domestic local militant groups hiding in North Waziristan tribal regions. SAFRON officials reported that more than 833,000 people have been registered as IDPs as a result of the operation.
sources: http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t1172925.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://dailyfrontierstar.com/%EF%BB%BFchinese-embassy-in-pakistan-donates-50000-to-nwa-idps/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.alamy.com/stock-photo-islamabad-pakistan-9th-july-2014-chinese-ambassador-to-pakistan-sun-71609402.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nation.com.pk/10-Jul-2014/china-reassures-pakistan-on-economic-package, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China assists the Pakistani Parliament solar photovoltaic power supply project
description: Oct 29, 2014, officials from the two countries signed an agreement about the cooperation on the Pakistani parliament solar power project. On February 23, 2016, the lighting ceremony of the Pakistani Parliament Building solar photovoltaic project was held in Islamabad. Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif switched on the solar-powered building. STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to the Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16, the project entails the installation of solar panels on the parliament house. It includes a grant assistance of RMB45 million. The project was completed and handed over to National Assembly Secretariat by the contractor on 16-03-2016. A media source, the Economic Times, reports the amount donated by China as55 million USD, but the amount reported in an official Pakistani report is what has been recorded here.

title: China donates 2 million Pakistani rupees to Pakistan for flood relief
description: On September 9, 2014, the Chinese ambassador to Pakistan, Sun Weidong, met with Pakistani foreign secretary. On behalf of the Chinese Embassy in Pakistan, he donated 2 million rupees to the Pakistani government to support the Pakistani government in carrying out flood relief work. The Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates of Foreign Assistance for 2015-2016 state in the revised estimate for 2014-2015 that 102.730 million Pakistani rupees are expected to be lent by China in 2014. STAFF_NOTE: same source mentions that a donation made by the Chinese Red Cross Society was transferred by the ambassador to the Pakistani Red Crescent Society at the same event. This is captured in Project 53543
sources: https://pk.chineseembassy.org/eng/zbgx/t1190533.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t1189861.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/foreign_assistance_2015_16.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Chinese Embassy establishes US$29k 'Chinese Ambassador Scholarship' at Quaid-i-Azam University
description: On December 8, the establishment ceremony of the 'Chinese Ambassador Scholarship' was held for undergraduate and MPhil Students at the School of Politics and International Relations (SPIR), Quaid-i-Azam University (QUA), Islamabad. The scholarship has a reported worth of US$29,500. In an academic year, each of the ten selected students will receive Rs 150,000 on need and merit basis. The scholarship was established to help QUA students with financial difficulties and foster Pakistan-China relations.
sources: http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t1422883.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://pakobserver.net/chinese-ambassador-scholarship-established-at-qau/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provides $33.1m RMB for F-9 Park Solar Lighting Project
description: On December 15, Sun Weidong, the Chinese ambassador to Pakistan, attended the handover ceremony of the33.1m RMB ($4.8m USD) solar lighting project in Islamabad F-9 Park (also called Fatima Jinnah Park). Ambassador Sun Weidong congratulated the F-9 Park solar lighting project on its successful completion and said that the project will have more than 3,400 polycrystalline silicon photovoltaic modules, which will provide lighting and electricity for more than 240 acres of parks. The project has an installed capacity of 0.85 MW. The Chinese company has built the project efficiently and completed the project two months in advance. On behalf of the Pakistani government, Finance Minister Dahl thanked the Chinese government for assisting in the construction of the Pakistani photovoltaic lighting project. STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to a Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2016/17, the project is listed in the category of completed projects with a grant of RMB 33.1 million. Changed the project status to completion. STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to the Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16, the project has a transaction amount of 45millions RMB and was under implementation. This is likely to be outdated.

title: Procurement of material for the Northern Province power sector development program project (Uthuru Wasanthaya)
description: On 9 September 2010 the Export-Import Bank of China signed a US$31.7 million loan agreement with Sri Lanka for the procurement of material for the Northern Province power sector development program project (Uthuru Wasanthaya). The loan has an interest rate of LIBOR 06 Month for US$ + 2.40% margin and a maturity of 15 years, including a 3 year grace period (see 'Global Partnership' document). The average 6 Month LIBOR rate in September 2010 was 0.478%. Total interest rate is therefore coded as 0.478% + 2.40%, or 2.878%. The goal of the project is to construct a low and medium voltage network in the Northern Province, to achieve 100% electricity coverage. According to the Department of External Resources, the project was completed on September 9, 2012 (see 'Resource Mobilization'). STAFF_NOTE: The Sri Lanka Department of External Resources document 'Public Investment' lists the maturity as 12 years, with a 2 year grace period, but the 'Global Partnership' document lists the maturity as 15 years with a 3 year grace period. Because the 'Global Partnership' document also lists the interest rate, the maturity and grace period from that document have been coded in the project.

implementing_agencies: Ceylon Electricity Board, State-owned Company
title: Lighting Sri Lanka Eastern Province Project (Negenahira Nawodaya): Supply and Delivery of Materials
description: On 16 November 2011, China EXIM Bank signed a 32,496,000 USD loan agreement with Sri Lanka for the supply & delivery of imported materials required for the Lighting Sri Lanka Eastern Province project (Negenahira Nawodaya). The project was commenced on January 16th, 2012, with the goal of electrifying 268 villages in the Trincomalee & Batticaloa Districts. The implementing agency for this project was the Ceylon Electricity Board. The China Eximbank loan has a variable interest rate of LIBOR 06 Months for US$ + 3.00% margin, a 4 year grace period, and a 15 year maturity (see Sri Lanka Department of External Resources 2012 Annual Performance Report). The interest rate is coded based on the 6 Month LIBOR at time of signing of the agreement. The average 6 Month LIBOR rate in November 2011 was 0.681%. Total interest rate is therefore coded as 0.681% + 3.00%, or 3.681%. This project involved the procurement of materials for the construction of new electrification schemes (268 new rural electrification schemes), 106 new low voltage distribution substations, 802 Km of low voltage lines, and 273Km of medium voltage reinforcement tower lines and rehabilitation of 200 of low voltage distribution substations.
sources: http://powermin.gov.lk/english/?page_id=1410, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/pdf/performance_report_2012_english.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.cabinetoffice.gov.lk/cab/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=16&Itemid=49&lang=en&dID=4294, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_rmobilization&view=resource_project&category_id=1&sub_category_id=1&searchby=donor_type&donor_id=4&today=2018-10-23&Itemid=321&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Ceylon Electricity Board, State-owned Company

implementing_agencies: China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC), State-owned Company
title: China Development Bank provides loan of US$195 million for Gampaha Attanagalla and Miniwangoda integrated water supply project
description: The China Development Bank (CDB) signed a loan agreement for US$195 million for the Gampaha Attanagalla and Miniwangoda Intergrated Water Supply Project (Gampaha, Attanagalla and Minuwangoda Integrated Water Supply Scheme) in 2016; the ground breaking ceremony for the construction of the project was held on 5 December 2014 and the project is expected to last until May 2020. The total project cost was listed as US$229.49 million; the China Development Bank (CDB) will provide a USD 195 million (20 year) loan, while the remaining 15 percent of the total cost of the project will be borrowed locally. The Bank of Ceylon will provide the Government with credit for 15 percent of the estimated cost or USD 34 million (Rs 5.3 billion). The goal of the project is to provide safe and reliable drinking water to the areas of the Gampaha, Minuwangoda and Attanagalla Divisional Secretariat (DS) divisions and part of Meerigama Divisional Secretariat (DS) division. The project is expected to take three years, and will include the construction of Basnagoda 3.5 MCM capacity impounding reservoir at Karasnagala, the construction of 85,000 m3/day capacity water intake at Karasnagala, the construction of 54,000 m3/day capacity Water Treatment Plant (WTP) at Karasnagala, the construction of a waste water and sludge treatment facility including all accessories and pumping equipment at the treatment plant premises, the construction of 10,000 m3 capacity High Level Reservoir (HLR) at Nikahetikanda, construction of five (05) 1,500 m3 capacity elevated water towers at Ranpokunugama, Belummahara, Naiwala, Minuwangoda and Pasyala, the supply and laying of 1,000 mm diameter Ductile Iron (DI) pipes for raw water pumping main of 1.75 km length approximately from the water intake to the WTP, the supply and laying of 1,000 mm dia. DI pipes for treated water pumping main of 1.65 km length approximately from the WTP to the high level reservoir (HLR), the supply and laying of 1,100 mm dia. to 150mm dia. range DI pipes for the gravity transmission main approximate length of 89.2 km from the HLR to existing and new water towers, supply and laying of 225 mm dia. to 90 mm dia. range uPVC pipes for the distribution network, approximate length of 600 km, supply and laying of 400 mm dia. to 300 mm dia. range DI pipes for balance part of the distribution network, approximate length of 30 km, and finally catchment protection. The project is contracted by CMEC, which will be responsible for all the design, sourcing, civil engineering, installation, and commissioning works. The Sri Lankan Department of Project Management and Monitoring reports that as of 31 January 2018, the cumulative physical progress of the project is 20.27%.
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/pdf/performance_report_2016_english_version.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.sundayobserver.lk/2018/08/12/news/cmec-attanagalla-water-project-ag-points-%E2%80%98colossal%E2%80%99-squander-public-funds, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ft.lk/article/151679/Chinese-firm-signs----229-5-m-contract-for-water--project-in-Sri-Lanka, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Progress%20of%20Prority%20Project%20as%20at%2031%20January%202018.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.colombopage.com/archive_14B/Dec07_1417973694CH.php, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=MENREP0020130517e95h001lh&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Performance%20of%20Priority%20Projects.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/Publications/ERDReport2017/ERDReport2017-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_rmobilization&view=resource_project&category_id=1&sub_category_id=1&searchby=donor_type&donor_id=4&today=2018-10-23&Itemid=321&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: National Water Supply & Drainage Board of Sri Lanka, Government Agency
title: Katana Water Supply Project
description: The China Development Bank provided a loan of US$54.8 million to Sri Lanka for the Katana water supply project, which was signed on August 21, 2017. The goal of the project is to provide safe drinking water via pipes to all 45 Grama Niladdhari divisions in Katana Divisional Secretariat, which covers 50% of the population in that area. This involves the construction of three towers at Bambukuliya, Ewariwatta and Thibirigaskatuwa, and the laying of transmission and distribution mains and supplying and supplying and installation of pumps. The project is expected to take three years and cost a total of US$64.5 million. The remaining US$9.7 million is provided by the Bank of Ceylon (state-owned, commercial, Sri Lankan Bank). The Sri Lanka National Water Supply & Drainage Board is implementing this project, and as of the end of 2017, the project is still under implementation. This project is one of the four water supply projects under implementation in Sri Lanka funded by the China Development Bank. The other three projects are: 54435 (Gampaha, Attanagalla and Minuwangoda Integrated Water Supply Scheme), 53567 (Thambuttegama water supply), and 53568 (Valachchenai Water Supply Project and Banadarawela, Diyathalawa and Haputhale Water Supply Project).
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=97:recently-signed-water-projects-china-division&catid=30&lang=en&Itemid=225, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/Publications/ERDReport2017/ERDReport2017-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_rmobilization&view=resource_project&category_id=1&sub_category_id=1&searchby=donor_type&donor_id=4&today=2018-10-23&Itemid=321&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Bank of Ceylon, State-owned Company; National Water Supply & Drainage Board of Sri Lanka, Government Agency

implementing_agencies: National Water Supply & Drainage Board of Sri Lanka, Government Agency
title: Thambuttegama Water Supply Project
description: The China Development Bank provided a loan of US$102.5 million for the Thambuttegama Water Supply Project, as signed on August 21, 2017. The goal of this project is to provide safe drinking water via pipes to all 45 Grama Niladdhari divisions in Katana Divisional Seretariat covering 50% of the population in the area (similar to project #53566). To do this, the project will, over 3 years, construct a water intake structure with a capacity of 42,000 m3/day, a water treatment plant of 18,000m3/day, a ground reservoir of 1,500 m3 capacity, a raw water and treated water transmission mains totaling up to an approximate length of 50 Km, elevated towers of 1,500 m3 capacity, a distribution network of 135 KM, and facilities to operate and maintain the water supply scheme. The project is expected to commence operations in 2021 and is in the tender evaluation stage as of March 2018. The project is being implemented by the Sri Lanka National Water Supply & Drainage Board. According to a March 2018 Sri Lanka news source, the Sri Lanka National Water Supply & Drainage Board Assistant General Manager for the North Central Province Sudath Ratnayake indicated that the Chinese loan for this project carries an interest rate of 1-1.5 per cent plus London Inter Bank Offered Rate (LIBOR) and is payable over 15 years. The interest rate is coded based on the 6 Month LIBOR at time of signing of the agreement. The average 6 month LIBOR (USD) for August 2017 was 1.454%. The least concessional base interest rate from the 1-1.5 per cent range will be used for calculating the total interest rate. The total interest rate is therefore coded as 1.5% + 1.454%, or 2.954%. The total project is expected to cost US$120.5 million; the remaining18 million will be provided by the Bank of Ceylon (state-owned, commercial, Sri Lankan bank). This project is one of the four water supply projects under implementation in Sri Lanka funded by the China Development Bank. The other three projects are: 54435 (Gampaha, Attanagalla and Minuwangoda Integrated Water Supply Scheme), 53566 (Katana water supply), 53568 (Valachchenai Water Supply Project and Banadarawela, Diyathalawa and Haputhale Water Supply Project).
sources: https://www.lankanewspapers.com/2018/03/05/suspended-tambuttegama-drinking-water-project-battle-water/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_rmobilization&view=resource_project&category_id=1&sub_category_id=1&searchby=donor_type&donor_id=4&today=2018-10-23&Itemid=321&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/Publications/ERDReport2017/ERDReport2017-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://mirrorcitizen.dailymirror.lk/2018/03/06/thambuttegama-farmers-losing-their-calm-before-the-storm/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=97:recently-signed-water-projects-china-division&catid=30&lang=en&Itemid=225, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Bank of Ceylon, State-owned Company; National Water Supply & Drainage Board of Sri Lanka, Government Agency

implementing_agencies: National Water Supply & Drainage Board of Sri Lanka, Government Agency
title: Valachchenai Water Supply Project and Banadarawela, Diyathalawa and Haputhale Water Supply Project
description: The China Development Bank provided a loan of US$242.66 million, as signed on 30 August 2017, for the Valachchenai Water Supply Project and the Bandarawela, Diyathalawa, and Haputhale Water Supply Project. According to the Sri Lanka Department of External Resources Performance Report 2017, this loan covers 100% of the estimated project cost (see page 70 of document). This project is expected to be completed in 3 years according to the attached 'Resource Mobilization' source. The goal of this project is to provide safe drinking water to Bandarawela, Diyathalawa, Haputhale and Valachchenai through the Valachchenai Water Supply Project and the Bandarawela, Diyathalawa, Haputhale Water Supply Project. This project is being implemented by the Sri Lanka National Water Supply and Drainage Board. As of the end of 2017, the project is still under implementation. This project is one of the four water supply projects under implementation in Sri Lanka funded by the China Development Bank. The other three projects are: 54435 (Gampaha, Attanagalla and Minuwangoda Integrated Water Supply Scheme), 53566 (Katana water supply), and 53567 (Thambuttegama water supply). It is worth noting that the Katana Water Supply Project (USD 54.8 million), the Thambuttegama Water Supply project (USD 102.5 million), and the Valachchenai Water Supply Project and Bandarawela, Diyathalawa and Haputhale Water Supply Project (USD 242.66 million) loan agreements with CDB were all signed in August 2017 with a total balance of about USD 400 million combined. In Sri Lanka government documents, the Valachchenai Water Supply Project and Bandarawela, Diyathalawa and Haputhale Water Supply Project are together referred to as 'Balance of 400 million facility for priority Water Supply Projects', because they account for the final allocation of the August 2017 USD 400 million from CDB for water supply projects.

title: China provides $170 million loan to Kazakhstan Development Bank
description: In 2016, the China Development Bank provided a170 million loan with a floating interest rate to the Kazakhstan Development Bank. staff_note: doc references flow on pg 65

implementing_agencies: China Petroleum Engineering & Construction Corporation (CPECC), State-owned Company; Kazakhstan Petrochemical Industries, Private Sector
title: CDB loans $607 million for reconstruction and modernization of Shymkent oil refinery in Kazakhstan
description: In June 2017, the China Development Bank provided a607 million loan to the Kazakhstan Development Bank, for Stage 2 of the reconstruction and modernization of the Shymkent Oil Refinery owned by Petro Kazakhstan Oil Products LLP. The project increased production from 5.25 million tons a year (Mt) to 6Mt and included to construction of a complex of catalytic cracking units with a capacity of 2Mt. The project is being implemented as part of State program of industrial-innovate development for 2015-2019. The China Petroleum Engineering and Construction Corporation is the main contract developer of the project. The facility matures on 25 April 2030 and bears interest at a rate of 2.7% per annum plus LIBOR. As the LIBOR rate is not specified, the 6 Month LIBOR rate of 1.432% is used. As at 30 June 2017, no amounts were outstanding under the facility. In September 2017, DBK drew down U.S.$100 million under the facility agreement. Stage 2 of the modernization of Shymkent Oil Refinery was completed in July of 2018.

implementing_agencies: CCCC Highway Consultants Co., Ltd. (中交公路规划设计院有限公司), State-owned Company
title: China grants 500 million Yuan for the construction of the 9th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge over the Bogha River
description: On May 11, 2017, Ambassador Ma Mingqiang and Mr. Kazi Shofiqul Azam, Secretary of Economic Relations Division (ERD), Ministry of Finance of Bangladesh, signed the Agreement on Economic and Technical Cooperation between China and Bangladesh in Dhaka. The agreement was for the construction of the 9th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge and other Infrastructure Projects. China granted 500 million Yuan for the construction of the 9th friendship bridge. The Chinese state media outlet, the People's Daily, reports that the Ministry of Commerce of China has commissioned the China Communications Highway Planning and Design Institute to conduct a comprehensive investigation of the construction of the 9th bridge in October, 2015. This bridge will go over the Bogha (sometimes spelled Boga) river. This is an annual contribution: 2009: #53972 (100m RMB) 2010: #43215 (60m RMB) & #34251 (40m RMB) 2011: unknown 2012: 53975 (23.770m USD) 2013: 53578 (50m USD) 2014: none reported 2015: none reported 2016: 53530 (300m RMB) [8th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge] 2017: 53577 (500m RMB) [9th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge]

implementing_agencies: Kazakhstan Development Bank, Government Agency
title: CDB provides $300 million loan for Aktogay mine in Kazakhstan (linked to #39557 and #41941)
description: In 2016, the China Development Bank provided a300 million loan to the Kazakhstan Development Bank, for the third phase of the construction of a sulphide ore processing plant at the Aktogay deposit in East-Kazakhstan region. The DBK is expected to sign an agreement with the KAZ Minerals to finance a line of credit for300 million on December 14, 2016. The debt extends for 8.5 years until final maturity in June 2025. The KAZ Minerals facility with the DBK bears an interest rate of US dollar LIBOR +4.50%. KAZ Minerals loan facilities with the China Development Bank are based on a ratio of total liabilities to total assets, with adjustments to mitigate the translation impact of movements in the US dollar/tenge exchange rate. In 2014, Nonferrous China (NFC) was granted the contract to construct the sulphide concentrator. The main sulphide concentrator was commissioned on 6 December 2016. Production began in February 2017. This loan is liked to two previous loans for the Aktogay mine. In 2011, the China Development Bank committed two loans of a total of1.5 billion.1.34 billion and 1 billion RMB was committed to develop the Aktogay mine for copper cathode production. The first copper cathode production from oxide ore occurred in December 2015 and is expected to produce 100,000 tons of copper concentrate annually (project #41941 and #39557).

title: China provides $10m USD Supplier's Credit for Digital Telephone Exchange
description: In June 2004 China agreed to provide10m USD in Supplier Credit to Bangladesh for the establishment of the Chittagong Hill Tracts Digital Radio Link and Telephone Exchange. A joint communique by the Chinese and Bangladesh governments in 2005 suggests that China had agreed to provide concessional loan for the project by 2005. According to a report from the Economic Relations Division of the Bangladeshi Government, 0.372 million of the pledged amount has been dispersed as of 2017.

implementing_agencies: B-R Powergen, State-owned Company; China National Electric Import & Export Corporation, State-owned Company; Fujian Electric Power Engineering Company (FEPEC), State-owned Company; Jiangsu Construction Engineering Group Co., Ltd.,
title: Chinese EXIM Bank and ICBC provide 129,264,152.64 worth of export credits for construction of 150 MW Kodda Power Plant
description: In 2013, China EXIM Bank and Industrial and Commercial Bank of China agreed to provide 129,264,152.64 USD worth of export credits to BR Powergen to build the Kodda 150MW power plant in the Gazipur District of Dhaka. The China National Electric Import & Export Corporation, Jiangsu Construction Engineering Company, and Fujian Electric Power Engineering Company formed a syndicate to construct the power plant. BR Powergen signed their engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) contract with the aforementioned companies on January 3, 2013. BR Powergen signed the loan agreement for the export credits on July 2, 2013. BR Powergen signed their Power Purchase Agreement with the Bangladesh Power Development Board (BPDB) on November 3, 2013. BR Powergen signed their fuel supply agreement on December 5, 2013. Construction on the Kodda Power Plant on January 28 2014 and finished on August 15, 2015. The plant runs on two fuel sources: heavy fuel oil and gas. According to B-R Powergen's 2017-2018 Annual Report, the EPC contract with the construction syndicate is worth 155,842,358.61 USD. The project had an additional cost of 8,224,274.00 USD for insurance, which BR Powergen paid to the Ministry of Finance of Bangladesh. BR Powergen and the Ministry of Finance signed their agreement on October 23, 2013. This project has a debt:equity ratio of 85:15. The debt has a two year grace period, a 12 year maturity, with an interest rate set at the 6-month LIBOR rate + 3.19%, leading to an interest rate of 3.593% at the time of signing. Payments are sent every 6 months, with the first payment made in July 2016. At the start of 2017, BR Powergen still owed 9,988,130,809 BDT. During 2017, they paid 1,024,418,309 BDT, but the outstanding debt increased by 76,589,003 BDT to adjust for foreign exchange risk. During 2018, BR Powergen paid 1,066,105,994 BDT to reduce their outstanding debt to 7,974,195,509 BDT. MAN Diesel & Turbo SE, Germany manufactured the plant's engine. STAFF_NOTE: The LIBOR rate was not identified in any of the attached reports, so this project uses the average 6 Month LIBOR rate from July 2013 (when the financing agreement was signed) of 0.403% for the interest rate calculation. The total interest rate is 0.403% + 3.19% = 3.593%

implementing_agencies: China Petroleum Pipeline Bureau,
title: China EXIM Bank $467.8 million in preferential buyer's credits funds construction of Oil Tanker Mooring Platform and 220km pipeline system (Linked to project #38349)
description: In 2017, China EXIM Bank agreed to provide preferential buyers' credit USD 467.8 million for the construction of an oil tanker mooring platform and a 200km of underwater and onshore pipeline in Chittagong, Bangladesh. The project is to build a ship-to-shore crude oil pipeline. China Petroleum Pipeline Bureau, which is a subsidiary of China National Petroleum Corporation, will be in charge of constructing the oil tanker mooring platform as well as establishing the 146 km of pipeline under the Bay of Bengal to the coast. An additional 74km onshore pipeline will also connect to new storage tanks and Bangladesh's only oil refinery in Chittagong. The repayment terms of the preferential buyer's credit are unclear. In January 2015, CPPB, a subsidiary of the state-owned China National Petroleum Corporation, and the Energy Division under the Ministry of Power, Energy and Mineral Resources signed an agreement to build a single point mooring system (SPM) in the Bay of Bengal to carry petroleum from vessels at the outer anchorage to depots onshore. Upon completion of the project, fuel unloading time will be shortened from the original 11 days to two and a half. This project will reduce lower fuel costs and the risk of oil spills. As of March 2015, state-run Eastern Refinery Ltd (ERL) had received the technical offer from the CPPB to build the SPM. Before submitting the technical offer, a team of the CPPB visited the project location near Moheshkhali island in the Bay of Bengal and found the site suitable. The ERL, along with an international consultant, would review the 'lone' technical offer before submitting its evaluation report to the Energy and Mineral Resources Division (EMRD) under the ministry of power, energy and mineral resources (MPEMR). The Chinese firm would submit financial offer on completion of the review. The project was expected to take 36 months, but 19 months into the project (October 2018), the China Petroleum Pipeline Bureau had only completed initial surveying and some designing. This project is linked to the 82.56 million USD concessional loan from the Chinese EXIM bank in 2017 to finance this same project (project #38349). STAFF_NOTE: The loan terms are assumed to be concessional due to the fact that they are preferential buyer's credits.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/lwto3uv514o4hpr/IJGlobal%20-%20Bay%20of%20Bengal%20Pipeline%20%28220KM%29%20%26%20Single%20Point%20Mooring%20%28SPM%29%20-%20Bangladesh.pdf?dl=0, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://www.dropbox.com/s/1qqsuu3xdaor87q/Double%20Pipeline%20Project.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://energybangla.com/550-4m-single-point-mooring-project-hits-snag/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://newsbase.com/topstories/cpp-wins-bangladesh-pipeline-contract, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs; http://www.bu.edu/cgef/#/2017/Country/Malaysia, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation)

title: Alternative North-South Road Project Section Aral-Kazarman, Preferential Buyer Credit Loan (Linked to Project ID #40491, #46350)
description: On June 15 2015, the Kyrgyz government signed an agreement with China on the allocation of a Preferential Buyers Credit loan for the Alternative North-South Road Project Section Aral-Kazarman. The Ministry of Transport and Communications of the Kyrgyz Republic and China Road and Bridge Corporation entered into a Commercial Contract on May 4 2014 for the purpose of implementing the project. The aim of this international transport corridor North-South is to provide cooperation of the North European countries and Russia with the countries of the Persian Gulf, the Indian Ocean and South-East Asia through Iran. The international transport corridor North-South, which is an alternative to the sea route through the Suez Canal, primarily deals with container cargo traffic. The loan details for this project are as follow: 20 Year Maturity, 11 Year Grace Period, 2% Interest Rate Kyrgyzstan's 'North-South' highway will have a total length of 433 km and require850 million in capital. The project is being implemented in three parts: Phase I (2014): Alternative North-South Road Project Section Kazarman-Jalal Abad (km291-km433) and Section Balykchy-Aral (km183+500-195+486); US399,989,041 Preferential Buyers Credits financed by the Export-Import Bank of China [Project 40491] Phase II (2015): Alternative North-South Road Project Section Aral-Kazarman (KM 195-KM 291); US185,254,119 export buyer's credit from EXIM Bank [Project 53585] & RMB 697,562,608 concessional loan from EXIM Bank [Project 46350] Phase III (planned): 'Balekchi-Kezeldez' (0-183km) [Total: 183km] STAFF_NOTE: Since this project is an export credit and has concessional terms, it was coded as mixed intent.
sources: http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/dl/gbdqzn/upload/jierjisi.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/1q67pueoowul7vp/2015%20China%20Eximbank%20Export%20Credit%20for%20ALTERNATIVE%20NORTH-SOUTH%20ROAD%20PROJECT%2C%20SECTION%20ARAL-KAZARMAN%20%28KM195-KM291%29%20in%20Kyrgyz%20Republic.pdf?dl=0 , Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://kg.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201505/20150500979348.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://uc40ecda589681de6d814fb4ef62.previews.dropboxusercontent.com/nativeprint?file=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dropbox.com%2Fsh%2Fcsm96s09710qee6%2FAAACGhIk-jgmQTb2u5MBx5Sda%2F2015%2520China%2520Eximbank%2520Export%2520Credit%2520for%2520ALTERNATIVE%2520NORTH-SOUTH%2520ROAD%2520PROJECT%252C%2520SECTION%2520ARAL-KAZARMAN%2520(KM195-KM291)%2520in%2520Kyrgyz%2520Republic.pdf%3Fdisable_range%3D1%26from_native_print%3D1%26preview%3D1, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://uc0ec6f1e906aba9316ff3b6eb35.previews.dropboxusercontent.com/nativeprint?file=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dropbox.com%2Fs%2Fyppxwt8jkgjf4bm%2FChina%25E2%2580%2599s%2520Silk%2520Road%2520Economic%2520Belt%2520Initiative-%2520Network%2520and%2520Influence%2520Formation%2520in%2520Central%2520Asia%2520.pdf%3Fdisable_range%3D1%26from_native_print%3D1%26, Academic Journal Article; https://www.dropbox.com/s/zrj0yfnwejus6nv/JICA%20Presenta, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.azernews.az/region/83790.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
title: China Friendship Foundation for Peace and Development (CFFPD) provides $300,000 USD for technical support for Tajikistan National University
description: On January 14, 2016, Ambassador Yue Bin of Tajikistan attended the handover ceremony of the multimedia audio-visual project of Tajikistan National University, which was built by the China Peace Development Foundation (PDP). At the ceremony, the China Friendship Foundation for Peace and Development (CFFPD) provided US$300,000 worth of technical assistance to Tajik National University. The modern audio-visual facilities established have created a good learning environment for Tajik students.
sources: https://www.asiaplus.tj/en/news/tajikistan/society/20170310/237470, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://tj.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1331809.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Usmon Soleh, Head, PDP Public Relations Department; Yue Bin, Ambassador (China)

title: China builds the Women's Sewing Training Production Center in Dushanbe, Tajikistan
description: On January 8, 2016, Yue Bin, Ambassador of Tajikistan, attended the inauguration ceremony of the Women's Sewing Training Production Center in Dushanbe, sponsored by the Embassy. It is believed that the establishment of the training production center will definitely play a positive role in further promoting local women's employment and improving their living standards, and at the same time writing a new chapter for the friendship between the people of Tazhong.
sources: https://www.mfa.gov.cn/chn//pds/gjhdq/gj/yz/1206_29/1206x2/t1330436.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://tj.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1330435.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Yue Bin, Ambassador (China)

implementing_agencies: China Jing'an Import & Export Corporation, State-owned Company
title: China-funded Takuriabu Anti-drug Branch office building
description: On March 18, 2016, Yue Bin, the ambassador to Tajikistan, attended the completion handover ceremony of the office building of the China-funded Takuriabu Anti-drug Branch office building. The project was funded by Ministry of Public Security of China and implemented by China Jing'an Import & Export Corporation. The office building aided by the Chinese side is a three-story brick-concrete structure with a construction area of ​​more than 1,000 square meters, including offices, equipment rooms, interrogation rooms, lounges.
sources: http://tj.chineseembassy.org/chn/sbgx/t1348927.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com/world/2016-03/19/c_128814017.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Yue Bin, Ambassador (China)

title: Chinese embassy built Women's Sewing Training Production Center in Wahsh District, Tajikistan
description: On September 14, 2016, Yue Bin, Ambassador of Tajikistan, attended the inauguration ceremony of the Women's Sewing Training Production Center in Wahsh District, Tahaltun, sponsored by the Chinese Embassy.
sources: http://tj.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1397560.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Yue Bin, Ambassador (China)

title: China sponsored an electronic classroom of the Tajik State Institute of Languages
description: On September 24, 2016, Yue Bin, Ambassador of Tajikistan, attended the opening ceremony of the electric classroom of theTajik State Institute of Languages sponsored by the Chinese Embassy in Beijing. The president of the National Language University of Raja Buzoda, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Ministry of Tajikistan, and representatives of the Ministry of Education and more than 300 students and teachers attended the event.
sources: http://tj.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1400272.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Yue Bin, Ambassador (China)

title: Chinese embassy built women sewing training and production center in Danghara, Tajikistan
description: On January 11, 2016, Ambassador Yue Bin went to Tajikistan President Rakhmon's hometown Danjiala to attend the opening ceremony of China-sponsored Danjiala women sewing training and production center.
sources: http://tj.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1429681.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Yue Bin, Ambassador (China)

implementing_agencies: China Meteorological Administration, Government Agency
title: China and Tajikistan complete joint investigation on climate change
description: In September 2015, the Tajikistan academy of sciences invited researchers from the Institute of Urumqi Desert Meteorology of the China Meteorological Administration. The groups carried out an 8-day scientific investigation of climate change and water resources. The investigation is expected to bolster regional cooperation among countries in Asia and act as a foundation for future research of climate change in Central Asia countries.
sources: http://www.cma.gov.cn/en2014/news/News/201509/t20150923_293669.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates broadcasting equipment to Tajikistan
description: In 2008, the Chinese government donated broadcasting equipment worth684,931 to Tajikistan, as reported in the May 2018 Flat Export from Tajikistan AIMS. The project ID is TJK/082179.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/rl546mymjz3f15f/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20from%20Tajikistan%20AIMS%20China%20Specific%20Projects.xlsx?dl=0, Other

title: China donates furniture to Tajikistan
description: In 2008, the Chinese government donated furniture worth410,960 to Tajikistan, as reported in the May 2018 Flat Export from Tajikistan AIMS. The project ID is TJK/082180. STAFF_NOTE: No additional information about this project could be found.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/rl546mymjz3f15f/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20from%20Tajikistan%20AIMS%20China%20Specific%20Projects.xlsx?dl=0 , Other

title: China grants 60m yuan for school feasibility study in Dangara
description:
In 2009, the Chinese Government and the Government of Tajikistan signed a technical economic agreement for China to provide grant aid of RMB 60 million to conduct a feasibility study on the construction of a school in Dangara District, Khatlon Province (see pg.79 of 'Development Partner Profiles 2014').

STAFF_NOTE: The agreement for this grant is called 'Technical Economic Agreement' by the Government of Tajikistan's AIMS system, project ID TJK/102179. It seems like that the agreement was an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), but that is merely an educated guess. Additionally, the RMB 60 million was used instead of $8,788,633 USD because Chinese Government grants tend to be denominated in RMB.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/rl546mymjz3f15f/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20from%20Tajikistan%20AIMS%20China%20Specific%20Projects.xlsx?dl=0 , Other; https://uceec09b265043133ca8d4b53bdb.previews.dropboxusercontent.com/nativeprint?file=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dropbox.com%2Fs%2Fj174ru3dvw3sl4k%2F2016%2520Development%2520Partners%2520Profiles%2520From%2520State%2520Committee%2520on%2520Investments%2520and%2520State%2520Property%2520Management.pdf%3Fdisable_range%3D1%26from_native_print%3D1%26preview%3D1, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://untj.org/dcc/files/2014-2015/Strategic-Framework/dpp_2014_en.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

implementing_agencies: Ministry of Public Security in China, Government Agency
title: China provides grant assistance to Tajik officers for drug trafficking seminars
description: In 2011, the Chinese Government provided grant assistance worth305,810 USD to Tajikistan for seminars, as reported by the May 2018 Flat Export from Tajikistan AIMS. The project ID is TJK/112259. This was likely referencing the training courses and seminars provided in 2011 to 15 Tajik drug control officers entitled "Fight against Illicit Drug Trafficking" provided by the Ministry of Public Security of China and the XUAR Department for Public Security. The training took place in China’s Xinjiang-Uyghur Autonomous Region (XUAR).
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/rl546mymjz3f15f/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20from%20Tajikistan%20AIMS%20China%20Specific%20Projects.xlsx?dl=0 , Other; https://www.asiaplus.tj/en/news/tajikistan/20111101/15-tajik-drug-control-officers-take-training-course-china, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China grants $500,000 USD to Tajikistan for the Ninth Meeting of the Heads of Governments of member states of SCO
description: The May 2018 Flat Export from Tajikistan AIMS reports that the Chinese government provided500,000 in grant assistance to Tajikistan for the Ninth Meeting of the Heads of Governments of member states of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO). The AIMS project ID is TJK/112261. The ninth meeting of the heads of government of SCO was held in Russia in 2009, so it seems likely that this Tajikistan AIMS project may instead mean the eighth meeting of the heads of government of SCO, which was held in Tajikistan in 2008. The commitment year has therefore been coded as 2008 and flagged as year uncertain.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/rl546mymjz3f15f/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20from%20Tajikistan%20AIMS%20China%20Specific%20Projects.xlsx?dl=0 , Other; https://idsa.in/strategiccomments/The9thShanghaiCooperationOrganisationSummit_MSRoy_240609, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); https://www.asiaplus.tj/en/news/tajikistan/politics/20181012/president-of-tajikistan-meets-with-sco-heads-of-government, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China grants 1,223,241 USD for repair of Shar-Shar (Liberty) tunnel access road (linked to #40406)
description: In 2013, the Chinese Government granted 1,223,241 USD for the repair of the access road to the Shar Shar (now Ozodi or Liberty/Freedom) Tunnel. The May 2018 Flat Export from Tajikistan AIMS reports the grant assistance as1,223,241 and recorded the project ID as TJK/112262. The project was implemented from 2013-2014. This is linked to project ID #40406, a Chinese loan for the construction of the tunnel in 2006. STAFF_NOTE: ADB reports Chinese funding for this project as 2.2 million USD, but the transaction amount has been coded based on the information provided by the Tajikistan AIMS.
sources: https://wikileaks.org/plusd/cables/09DUSHANBE954_a.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dropbox.com/s/rl546mymjz3f15f/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20from%20Tajikistan%20AIMS%20China%20Specific%20Projects.xlsx?dl=0 , Other; https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/linked-documents/49042-005-dc.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: Supreme Court Complex Repair and Refurbishment
description:
On April 7, 2016, the Chinese Government and the Government of Sri Lanka signed an RMB 500 million grant agreement for the Comprehensive Refurbishment of Superior Courts Complex Project. 

Yanjian Group subsequently submitted an unsolicited proposal to the Government of Sri Lanka implement this project. However, when the Government of Sri Lanka asked it to implement the project on a “build and lease” basis, Yanjian Group declined. Therefore, the Government of Sri Lanka decided to look for another suitable contractor.  

Staff Note: This project is also known as the “House of Justice” Project. Sri Lanka’s Superior Courts Complex was originally constructed in 1989 with aid from the Chinese Government
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/Publications/ERDReport2017/ERDReport2017-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://bizenglish.adaderana.lk/sri-lankas-supreme-court-refurbishment-completed-says-chinese-embassy/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://cabinetoffice.gov.lk/cab/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=16&Itemid=49&lang=en&dID=5329, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/pdf/performance_report_2016_english_version.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates to two elementary school reconstruction in Paghman, Kabul, Afghanistan
description:
In 2016, the Embassy of China in Afghanistan provided a grant for the reconstruction of Miba elementary school (米巴小学) and Tahgwa elementary school (塔格瓦小学) in Paghman District and Kabul Province. The amount of the grant is unknown. The reconstruction handover ceremony was held on September 17, 2016. 

There are nearly 4,000 students in a school in Tahgwa, including 1,800 girls. Due to the poor state of school buildings, the limited number of classrooms can only accommodate students in batches. After the completion of the school reconstruction project, the classroom windows of the two schools were equipped with glass; the roof was reinforced and made rainproof; private toilets were installed. and the new school building greatly improved the enthusiasm of local residents to send their children to school. 

STAFF_NOTE: These two schools are also known as the China-Afghanistan Friendship School in Paghman District. The spelling of these elementary schools cannot be found, so we simply provide pinyin translations.
sources: https://www.mfa.gov.cn/chn//pds/wjdt/zwbd/t1398181.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1398180.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates office equipment to Afghan government
description: On November 14, 2016, the handover ceremony of office equipment granted by Chinese government to the Afghan government was held by Afghan Chief Executive Office. Afghan Chief Executive Abdullah Abdullah and Chinese Ambassador Yao Jing attended the ceremony.
sources: http://finance.sina.com.cn/roll/2016-11-15/doc-ifxxsmuu5669788.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1415384.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 50 million yuan of tent, blanket and medical equipment to Afghanistan
description: On December 2016, China donated 50 million yuan of humanitarian aids to Afghanistan. The aid includes blankets, tents, and medical equipment that will be delivered to 34 provinces in Afghanistan. It will help to settle down refugees and provide support for families affected by wars or natural disasters. The handover ceremony was held on December 21, 2016. The 'natural disaster' refers to the snow disaster that hit Afghanistan in the same year. This project is linked to project #53630 that provided cash aid to the snow disaster. It is also linked to #53631 that also provided humanitarian aid at a different delivery time.
sources: http://world.huanqiu.com/hot/2016-12/9847883.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.cctv.com/2016/12/22/ARTIBdLErvSRkuZewvdpcrrT161222.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1426058.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.mfa.gov.cn/chn//pds/wjdt/zwbd/t1437807.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Afghanistan National Disaster Management Authority, Government Agency
title: China provides Afghanistan 1 million Yuan grants for snow disaster in Badakhshan Province (linked to #53629 and #53630)
description: On December 27, 2016, China grants Afghanistan 1 million Chinese Yuan (approxi. 145,000 USD) as humanitarian aid in response to snow disaster hit Badakhshan Province. The grant was delivered immediately on cash. In response to the snow disaster in Afghanistan, the Chinese side also handed over 50 million yuan of humanitarian materials to the Afghan side, which is reported in project #53629. A second grant of humanitarian aid was given by China in February 2017, reported in #53631.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1427118.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.mfa.gov.cn/chn//pds/wjdt/zwbd/t1437807.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan National Disaster Management Authority, Government Agency

implementing_agencies: Afghanistan National Disaster Management Authority, Government Agency
title: China provides humanitarian aid to Afghanistan for blizzard (linked to #53629 and #53630)
description: On February 2017, China provides humanitarian aid to Afghanistan government in response to blizzard. The aid includes tents, comforter, and down jackets. The first plane containing aids arrived in Afghanistan on February 19, and the second one arrived on February 25. One news reports puts the total worth of all materials at 137.1 million afghanis dollars. This project is linked to another grant of humanitarian aid of 50 million yuan for the snow disaster, #53629, and a grant of 1 million yuan as aid for the snow, #53630. STAFF_NOTE: this project is not a duplicate of #53629 since the delivery times are different.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1439707.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FbxDQtTIjlh_eZGSNAZDN6HP3vECv3iy/view?usp=sharing, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//world/2017-02/20/c_129485362.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.mfa.gov.cn/chn//pds/gjhdq/gj/yz/1206/1206x2/t1439708.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan National Disaster Management Authority, Government Agency

title: China donates equipment to Kabul University
description: On February 22, 2016, the Chinese government donated teaching equipment to Kabul University. Chinese Ambassador Yao Jing and Afghanistan Minister of High Education and President of Kabul University attended the ceremony. Among the equipment were laptop and desktop computers, microscopes, UPS (uninterruptible power supply) machines, projectors, printers and stationery. This project should not be confused with the construction of a building and auditorium at Kabul University, #53635.
sources: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1p-ekq7FbmbQnsw_TvDLEF8uW-WLRcFl1/view?usp=sharing, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://spainembassy.fmprc.gov.cn/web/zwbd_673032/gzhd_673042/t1440781.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1440780.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Multilateral
title: China donated 1 million USD humanitarian aid for Afghan Refugees
description: On March 9, 2017, China donated 1 million USD humanitarian aid to Afghanistan through Office of the UN High Commissioner for Refugees. According to the contract, UNHCR will be responsible for using that 1 million USD to purchase, transport and deliver humanitarian aids. Materials including double side blanket and gas tank were delivered. Starting from 2016 winter, the extreme weather has caused 239 casualties, 214 injured and over 520 houses destroyed. STAFF_NOTE: This project is not a duplicate of #53644 since the delivery times are different. In addition, #53644 is through the World Food Programme and #53633 is through UNHCR.
sources: http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/dl/gbdqzn/upload/afuhan.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1444679.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://drive.google.com/file/d/1esEhhoUmoNWpLQlnq2A8up3Dg6tOhe85/view?usp=sharing, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://fec.mofcom.gov.cn/article/gbdqzn/upload/afuhan.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com/world/2017-03/10/c_1120603698.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/155131?destination=donors/2976/flows/2017%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522704%253ABANGLADESH%2520-%2520Rohingya%2520Refugee%2520Crisis%2520%2528from%25202017%2529%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

implementing_agencies: China Railway 14th .Construction Bureau Co., Ltd (China Railway Shisiju Group Corporation), State-owned Company; Chinese Embassy, Government Agency; SIPPR Engineering Group Co., Ltd, State-owned Company
title: China supports Afghanistan to build Vocational and Technical Institute in Kabul National Vocational Institute
description:
In 2017, the Chinese Government and the Government of Afghanistan signed an MOU related to the National Vocational and Technical College Project. The MoU was signed by the Afghan Education Minister and the Economic Attaché for the Embassy of China in Kabul. The Bureau for International Economic Cooperation within China’s Ministry of Commerce committed RMB 180 million of grant funding for this project. 

The project involved the construction a new general building, the construction of an academic building with 65 classrooms, a dormitory, and a gymnasium; and the upgrading of an existing automobile repair laboratory. It has reportedly provided employment to 300 local residents. Upon completion, it was designed to serve up to 1,720 students. The National Vocational and Technical College was designed by SIPPR Engineering Group Co., Ltd (中国机械工业第六设计研究院有限公司) and constructed by China Railway 14th Construction Bureau Co Ltd. (中铁十四局). Construction began on April 12, 2017, and the project was completed in January 11, 2019. It successfully passed completion acceptance on March 10, 2019. 

STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese project title is 阿富汗职业技术学院项目.
sources: http://www.xinhuanet.com/world/2017-04/13/c_1120798859.htm, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1453204.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/dl/gbdqzn/upload/afuhan.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.weibo.com/ttarticle/p/show?id=2309351000444146854110604452&infeed=1, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs; http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2017-10/10/c_136670303.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.pajhwok.com/en/2015/11/30/china-pledges-58m-aid-afghan-education-sector, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://drive.google.com/file/d/160mqM3xSICKlZF518q3PQeFD_BMfLIXh/view?usp=sharing, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.crcc.cn/art/2017/7/19/art_551_119727.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2017-08/22/c_136545614.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: Kabul University, Academic, Training and Research
title: China Builds Integrated Teaching Complex and Auditorium in Kabul University, Afghanistan (Linked to #54009, #53640, and #53999)
description: On May 16th, 2016, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang and Afghan Chief Executive Officer Abdullah Abdullah signed six bilateral cooperation documents, including an exchange note on the construction grant of two buildings at Kabul University. On October 10, 2017, China began construction on the Integrated Teaching Complex and and an auditorium for Kabul University, Afghanistan. The construction project includes an academic lecture hall with 40 classrooms and an auditorium with a capacity of 500 people. The project is estimated to cost 60 million USD and is being granted by China. The construction project is expected to be finished within 27 months. Other documents signed on May 16th, 2016 include: an agreement to grant 500 million yuan (#54009), a trade agreement for saffron, a Memorandum of Understanding on the nature of the One Belt One Road Initiative, an exchange note on a grant of 50 million yuan for non-emergency humanitarian aid (#53640), and an exchange note on China creating a survey for the construction of affordable housing for civil service employees in Kabul (#53999). For another project Chinese government provide for Kabul University, see #53632 for details. As of 2018 the project is still in implementation phase.

title: China donates desks and chairs to China-Afghan Friendship School
description:
On April 15, China Embassy in Afghanistan donated desks and chairs to China-Afghan Friendship School in Paghman District, Kabul, Afghanistan. The school is renamed as 'China-Afghan Friendship School' （中阿友谊学校). This project is completed. 

In March 2018, China donated textbooks to China-Afghan Friendship School, which is recorded in project #54110.
sources: https://www.mfa.gov.cn/chn//pds/gjhdq/gj/yz/1206/1206x2/t1454015.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1454014.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government Agency
title: China donates Video Conference Systems to Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs
description: On May 10, 2017, Chinese Embassy in Afghanistan donated a Video Conference System to Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affair. The original source does not indicate the cost of the system.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1460490.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government Agency

implementing_agencies: World Food Program (WFP), Multilateral
title: China donates 4242 tons of rice to Afghanistan
description: In 2017, China donated 4242 tons of rice to Afghanistan worths 50 million Chinese Yuan as a part of the emergency food aid. The first part of rice, total 502 ton, has arrived at Kabul on October 26, 2017. The rest of rice is supposed to arrive by March 2018. The final handover ceremony is held on June 3, 2018. This project is part of the emergency food aid project provided by the Chinese government to the Asian and African countries through the World Food Program in early September. The emergency food aid to Afghanistan will directly benefit a total of about 38,000 Afghan returning refugees and displaced people who have been displaced by the war in the south-central region of the country. The funding agency is unknown.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1505626.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201806/20180602751928.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com//2017-10/17/c_1121814890.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CWnLj2FkBhzxnWJyq17HSRiqb6U48CYZ/view?usp=sharing, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ThE_5PuM4WyT6m81B91shbjWcnnMlXw_/view?usp=sharing, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China Grants 50 million Yuan for Non-Emergency Humanitarian Aid to Afghanistan (Linked to #54009, #53635, and #53999)
description: On May 16th, 2016, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang and Afghan Chief Executive Officer Abdullah Abdullah signed six bilateral cooperation documents, including an exchange note granting 50 million yuan of non-emergency humanitarian aid to Afghanistan. The assistance included food and non-food items such as tents and blankets that are intended for Afghan refugees, war displaced families, and people affected by natural disasters. It was delivered in December of 2016. Other documents signed on this date include: an agreement to grant 500 million yuan (#54009), a trade agreement for saffron, a Memorandum of Understanding on the nature of the One Belt One Road Initiative, an exchange note on the construction of the auditorium at Kabul university (#53635), and an exchange note on China creating a survey for the construction of affordable housing for civil service employees in Kabul (#53999).

title: China agreed to provide additional annual 50 national scholarships to Afghanistan
description: During Afghanistan Chief Executive Abdullah Abdullah's visit in China between May 15-18, 2016, China agrees to provide an additional 50 national scholarships to Afghanistan annually for 5 years. The scholarships are for Afghan students to study in China. In 2014, China agreed on providing 500 national scholarships to Afghanistan (See project #37861 for details).
sources: http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2014-10/31/content_18835431.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/wxzl/t1392473.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.mfa.gov.cn/chn//pds/wjdt/zwbd/t1437807.htm , Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: World Food Program (WFP), Multilateral
title: China donated 1 million USD of food aid to Afghanistan through World Food Programme
description: On October 16, 2018, China donated 1 million USD for emergency food assistance to Afghanistan. The project cooperates with the United Nations World Food Program. China plans to provide food aid through WFP to refugees, homeless and natural disasters victims in Pakistan, Syria, Iran, Ethiopia, Zimbabwe, Cameroun, Afghanistan and Niger. The US$1 million contribution will be used to purchase fortified wheat flour, sunflower oil enriched with vitamins, lentils, rice and sugar for food distributions among Afghan and Iraqi refugees in Iran. The commodities will be locally purchased to ensure speedy delivery and conformity with Iranian standards. This project is not a duplicate of #53633 since the delivery times are different. In addition, #53644 is through the World Food Program and #53633 is through UNHCR.

implementing_agencies: Hydrochina Corporation, State-owned Company
title: ICBC finances Hydro China Dawood Power Ltd 49.5 MW Wind Farm Project in Gharo, Pakistan (CPEC, IPP)
description: The Hydro-China Dawood Wind Power Project is a 49.5 MW project located at Bhanbore, Gharo, Sind. It was put into commercial use on 5th April, 2017 and is currently operational. According to the 2016 Government of Pakistan Bond Prospectus, the project has an estimated cost of 125 million USD. The project was constructed by HydroChina International Engineering Co., Ltd, a subsidiary of the Power Construction Corporation of China. The project was also designated as a priority infrastructure project for the Belt and Road Initiative. The State-Owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission of the State Council (SASAC) announced on March 11 2015 that a project loan agreement was signed, with ICBC providing a loan of 78.82 million USD. On April 20, 2015, ICBC Chairman Jiang Jianqing signed the Dawood Power Project financing agreement, which stated that ICBC will provide financing support for the design, equipment purchase and site construction. The signing was witnessed by Chinese President Xi Jinping and Pakistani Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif. On January 4 2016, ICBC announced that it recently disbursed the first loan of 25 Million USD to the Dawood project. On April 20, 2018, Hong Kong Trade Development Council reported that the project was backed by a78.8 million USD credit line from ICBC, affirming the amount announced by SASAC. The turbines used by the project were from Guangdong's China Ming Yang Wind Power Group in association with Aerodyn Energiesysteme, a German wind-power specialist. According to the IMF, the debt-equity ratio of the project is 80:20, though no up-to-date information could be found regarding the equity portion of the project. The IMF puts the interest rate of the loan at 8.4%, with a repayment period of 10 years and grace period of 1 year.

implementing_agencies: China Railway 25th Bureau Group Co.,Ltd., State-owned Company
title: Construction of Out Patient Department (OPD) of National Hospital (NHSL)
description: On 16 September 2014, the Government of China signed a 138 million USD grant agreement with Sri Lanka for the construction of a new Outpatient Department (OPD) of the National Hospital (NHSL) (see 'Resource Mobilization' from Sri Lanka Department of External Resources). The project work began in 2017, and as of May 2019 is ongoing. The building will be nine stories, and will contain an emergency department, an outpatient center, clinics (ex: Obstetrics, Gynecology and Paediatrics), medical and technology rooms, and administrative offices. It is expected to be 49,150 square meters. The project is being undertaken as an attempt to make up for the lack of repairs to the current outpatient center, which sees 5000 patients each day. The construction will be completed by 2020. According to a press release by the Chinese Agency for International Economic Cooperation on Apr 19, 2017, the chairman of CPPCC (Chinese People's Political Consultative conference), Yu Zhengsheng attended the foundation laying ceremony in Sri Lanka on April 6. The project is undertaken by the China Railway 25th Bureau Group Co., Ltd., with a construction period of 39 months.

implementing_agencies: China National Aero-Technology (CATIC), State-owned Company
title: HSBC contributes US$44.1 million for runway overlay & associated works at Bandaranaike International Airport in Sri Lanka
description: In a 2017 Performance Report by Sri Lanka's Department of External Resources, it was reported that the Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation (HSBC China) was contributing US$44.1 million to Sri Lanka's runway overlay & associated works at Bandaranaike International Airport Katunayake. Observation for work to be done was completed from 6th January 2017 to 5th April 2017 with 8 hours of runway closure.China National Aero Technology International Engineering Corporation (CATIC) was the Design and Build Contractor for Runway Overlay Project. Work commenced in Sept. 2016 and total contract period was 12 months. The scope of work for the 30-year-old runway overlay project included the delivery and commissioning of the complete light-emitting diode (LED) airfield ground lighting (AGL), signs, an airfield lighting control and monitoring system (ALCMS), and power management solutions. The project also included the construction of an additional apron area to increase the number of parking bays, including 45 for mixed aircraft configurations. STAFF_NOTE: Original source is unclear whether this is a loan or grant.
sources: http://www.airport.lk/aasl/developments/Developments_of_Runway_Overlay.php, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/Publications/ERDReport2017/ERDReport2017-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2017-04/06/c_136187821.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.airport-technology.com/uncategorised/newscolombos-bandaranaike-airport-to-build-new-terminal-and-modernise-old-runway-5791666/, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: China National Aero-Technology (CATIC), State-owned Company

title: HSBC provides US$79.8 million for diesel units for Sri Lanka railways project
description: In a 2017 Performance Report by Sri Lanka's Department of External Resources, it was reported that HSBC was providing US$79.8 million for the procurement, purchase and delivery of 9 diesel units for upcountry line operations in Sri Lanka Railways Project. The total cost of this project is US$93.9 million; the remaining US$14.1 million will be provided by HNB, which appears to be a Sri Lankan Bank. STAFF_NOTE: Flow type unknown.
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=166:two-loan-facilities-for-road-and-railway-sector-development-of-the-country&catid=28:news-events&Itemid=101&lang=ta, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/Publications/ERDReport2017/ERDReport2017-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China grants 1.2B Rs. for construction of National Nephrology Special Hospital in Sri Lanka
description: Based on a 2017 Report by Sri Lanka's Department of Project Management and Monitoring Ministry of Development Assignments, China and Sri Lanka are funding the construction of a new laboratory and hospital for kidney disease called the National Nephrology Special Hospital. China will provide a 1.2 billion Rs. grant. The project will be located in Polonnaruwa. This is the result of a MOU signed in 2015, in which it was established that further cooperation in the health sector, including the the CKD hospital, would be worked on. The bidding for building design plan was completed in December, 2016. The design was finalized in 2017. The foundation-laying ceremony was held on Dec 6, 2017. The project will cost a total of US$100 million. The proposed building will have a 500 bed hospital with 150 dialysis machines, 8 operating theaters, 2 ICUs each with 20 beds, a High Dependency Unit with 20 beds, a fully-fledged laboratory and various other facilities. The 25,517-square-meter hospital will include 200 inpatient beds and 100 hemodialysis beds. There will also be a 200-seat auditorium with a car park which can accommodate 300 vehicles. The hospital is supposed to be completed in 2020.

title: CDB loans 252 million to UEP 100 MW Jhimpir wind project (CPEC, IPP)
description: The UEP wind farm is located at Jhimpir, District Thatta in Sindh province of Pakistan, and has a generating capacity of 100MW. Pakistan's Alternative Energy Development Board (AEDB) had earlier in November 2011 issued a Letter of Intent to UEP Wind Power to develop the wind power project. UEP Wind Power Pvt. Ltd (UEP Wind) is a joint venture of Orient Group Investment Holdings Co. Ltd (99% ownership) and United Energy Group (1% ownership). The project achieved financial closure in March 2015, and achieved commercial operation on 15th June, 2017. UEP estimated the total cost of the project to be approximately 260 Million USD. China Gezhouba Group Company Limited was the Engineering, Procurement, Construction (EPC) Contractor for the project. Xinjiang Goldwind Science & Technology Co., Ltd, the largest manufacturer of wind turbines in China, supplied 66 Wind Turbine Generators of 1.5 MW each to the project. On April 20 2015, Hu Huaibang, President of China Development Bank and UEP President Tariq signed a loan agreement for the power project. The signing was witnessed by Chinese President Xi Jinping and Pakistani Prime Minister Sharif. According to a special report on CPEC projects from the Chinese embassy, the debt-equity ratio of the project was 75:25, with China Development Bank providing a loan of 252 USD Million. The special report also stated that the project hired 850 local Pakistani staff and employed a primarily local labor force. It also reported that the contractor paid RS. 152,598,971.00 tax to Pakistan government, as well as undertook a series of CSR projects in the community, including constructing a well for the local village as well as donating books to local schools. According to the IMF, the interest rate of the loan is 5.45%, with a repayment period of 10 years and a grace period of 2 years.

title: China grants 1,950 million Rs. for Sri Lankan Research Center for Water Research
description:
On February 16, 2016, the Chinese Government and the Government of Sri Lanka signed a $105 million grant agreement for the China-Sri Lanka Joint Research and Demonstration Centre for Water Technology Project. This project involves the construction of a scientific research complex, a water quality analysis platform, a pilot study center, expert accommodations, and supporting facilities. 

The purpose of the project, which is taking place in Kandy (Sri Lanka’s second largest city) is to find a scientific solution to end chronic kidney disease of unknown origin (CKD). Chronic kidney disease (CKD) has spread over 11 districts in Sri Lanka mainly due to the changes in various human activities and environmental factors. Over the past 30 years, it has become a major health issue. This disease is particularly acute among the farmers’ 40-60 age groups. Most researchers believe that the cause of CKD is drinking contaminated water. China Tiesiju Civil Engineering Group Co., Ltd. (CTCE) — a subsidiary of China Railway Group Ltd. — is the contractor responsible for project implementation. Construction began on September 28, 2018. Then, on July 17, 2009, the project successfully passed mid-term acceptance with the funder of the project (the Chinese Government’s Ministry of Commerce). The originally anticipated project completion date was May 2020. 

STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese project title is 斯里兰卡水技术研究与示范联合中心项目. This project involves the construction of a state-of-the-art water testing laboratory in Kandy, Sri Lanka’s second largest city. More detailed locational information can be found at https://www.google.com/maps/place/China+Srilanka+Research+Grant+Project+office/@7.317239,80.6194001,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x3ae36947a382bb4d:0xaac1f9800d1f5474!8m2!3d7.317239!4d80.6215888 and http://www.cslrgp.com/form-of-cooperation-of-the-project/.

title: China grants US$1.5 million for emergency relief following landslide in Sri Lanka
description: Following a landslide in May 2016 in Sri Lanka, the Government of the People's Republic of China (through its embassy in Sri Lanka) donated US$1.5 million to provide for emergency assistance.
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/Publications/ERDReport2017/ERDReport2017-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Hunan Constructing Engineering Group Corporation,
title: China grants 22.5 billion Rs. to construct friendship village in Sri Lanka after landslide
description:
Following a 2016 Sri Lankan landslide which destroyed a village in Aranayaka, the Chinese Government committed to provide a grant worth 22.5 billion Rs. (1.5 million USD) for the Aranayake China-Sri Lanka Friendship Village Project. This project involved the construction of 60 two-story houses for those living in the Aranayake village who were displaced by the disaster. 

The total cost of the project was $1.95 million. Construction of the village was completed, and the houses were turned over to their new owners.  Hunan Construction Engineering Group Sri Lanka Branch was the contractor responsible for the Aranayaka China-Sri Lanka Friendship Village Project.
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/Publications/ERDReport2017/ERDReport2017-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.dailymirror.lk/expose/article/Aranayaka-Victims-Left-in-the-Lurch-146854.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ft.lk/news/china-assists-construction-of-china-sri-lanka-friendship-village-for-landslide-victims/56-592703, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/china-sri-lanka-build-friendship-village-for-landslide-victims-117011801365_1.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=DAFTSL0020160603ec6300008&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Hunan Constructing Engineering Group Corporation,

implementing_agencies: Hunan Constructing Engineering Group Corporation,
title: Hunan Branch of EXIM Bank of China will fund USD $67M construction of Kattankudy Waste Water Disposal Project
