description: In a 2017 Performance Report by the Sri Lankan Department of External Resources, it was reported that the Hunan Branch of the Export-Import Bank of China will provide a US$67 million loan for the construction of Kattankudy Waste Water Disposal Project (determined to be also known as Kattankudy Division Sewerage Disposal Project), which will be implemented in 2018. The project will provide sewerage connections for Baticolao municipal council area and Kattankudy DS division area will be covered. A 50km collection network and 10,500m3/day wastewater treatment plant will be constructed. The total project cost will be92.8 million.
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/files/Parliament%20Question%20-%20Export%20Credit.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.mnpea.gov.lk/web/images/PIP_English/EnglishPIP-229-243.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://slidex.tips/download/public-investment-supported-by-export-credit, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/Publications/ERDReport2017/ERDReport2017-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/files/Parliament%20Question%20-%20Export%20Credit%2022.052014.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China EXIM Bank Provides Loan of US$33 million for 500 kV overhead line “TSS Syrdarya – TSS Novo Angren" in Uzbekistan
description:
The Export-Import Bank of China provided a loan of USD$33.02 million for the 500 kV overhead line (OHL) "TSS Syrdarya – TSS Novo Angren" in Uzbekistan; the project is expected to run from 2014-2016. The length of the line will be approximately 130km. The total cost is the project is estimated at USD$93 million; funds not provided by the EXIM Bank of China will be provided by Uzbekenergo. 

Syrdarya may also be spelled "Sirdaryo" or "Sirdarya." The project was also referred to as "Syrdarya TPS – Novo-Angren TPS."
sources: https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/linked-documents/41340-015-dc.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.unece.org/fileadmin/DAM/project-monitoring/5-sustainable-energy/E234/2014_NationalStudies/UZ/UZ_Report.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TRENDE0020150116eb1g001jn&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://documents.worldbank.org/curated/en/810761468318884305/pdf/ACS41460WP0Box0Issues0Note00PUBLIC0.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/project-document/73436/46007-002-uzb-iee.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China donates sea ambulance to Maldives
description:
In 2014, during Xi Jinping's state visit to the Maldives, he pledged that the Chinese Government would donate a sea ambulance to Maldives, according to the Edition. Then, in 2015, during the visit of President of Maldives Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom to China, the Maldives and China formally agreed to gift a sea ambulance to the Maldives, according to PSM News. The sea ambulance was handed over to the Maldives National Defence Force (MNDF) on July 12, 2018, according to the Chinese Embassy and the Maldives Independent. Additionally, according to the Edition, Chinese Ambassador to Maldives Zhang Lizhong pledged that China would provide the required technical assistance for the boat. 

According to the Edition, the donated sea ambulance was larger and featured more medical facilities than the existing 25 Maldivian sea ambulances. According to the Maldives Independent, the 26-meter-long vessel was equipped with a “mini-medical theater,” including facilities for scans, electrocardiography tests, intravenous therapy, and oxygen delivery. The Chinese Embassy reported in July 2018 that the ambulance would improve the health and well-being of the Maldivian people. Many Maldivians live on remote islands and have poor medical conditions, so the ambulance would greatly improve the ability to transport and treat them. According to the Edition, medics had encountered drawbacks while transferring emergency patients from the atolls to Malé because of the length of travel, and the donation of the fully-equipped sea ambulance would help alleviate this problem. According to Sun Online, the Coast Guard was to manage to the new vessel.

A Chinese expert team trained the Maldivians in ambulance driving and use of the medical equipment. Training was completed by October 30, 2018, according an article in the Chinese Embassy in November 2018. 

STAFF_NOTE: The value of the donated sea ambulance is unknown.
sources: https://en.sun.mv/49491, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://mv.china-embassy.org/chn/zmgx/t1577461.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://edition.mv/news/6505, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://maldivesindependent.com/society/china-donates-sea-ambulance-139357, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://psmnews.mv/en/36421, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: Harbin Electric International Co., Ltd., State-owned Company; Uzpromstoybank, Government Agency
title: Export Import Bank of China Loans US $165.6 million for Angren Thermal Plant Project in Uzbekistan
description: On September 9, 2011, the EXIM Bank of China and the Industrial and Construction Bank of Uzbekistam (Uzpromstroybank) signed an agreement for a 165.6 million USD loan to modernize the Angren thermal power plant in the Tashkent region. The funds are to be repaid over 20 years with a 5 year grace period and the project will have a capacity of 130-150 MW. The total cost of the project is 242.6 million USD, with Uzbekenergo funding the final 75.1 million USD. It is unclear which organization eventually cofinanced the project because it seems that Uzbekistan also requested funding from ADB in 2014. In 2017, the information from the Harbin Electric website indicated that the project is in progress. STAFF_NOTE: An original official source indicated funding was estimated at US$150 million, but later official sources indicate the funding was US$166 million or US$165.6 million. Defaulted to the source that stated US$165.6 million, as it states the funding organization was specifically the EXIM bank, while other sources stated government of China. Since interest rate could not be found, Flow class was coded Vague Official Finance.
sources: http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/dl/gbdqzn/upload/wuzibieke.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.uzdaily.com/articles-id-23620.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/ztdy/201401/20140100469344.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=BBCCA00020130621e96l000m9&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.odi.org/sites/odi.org.uk/files/odi-assets/publications-opinion-files/9987.xlsx, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.china-hei.com/en.php/News/news_1_view/id/2166, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.carecprogram.org/uploads/CAREC_TA8727_CountryReport_Uzbekistan.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.sourcewatch.org/index.php/Angren_power_station, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=TRENDE0020130910e99a001bc&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/project-document/74195/43549-012-reg-annexes4-5.2.2-1.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/vults7c3kv89j45/BU_PITCH_ENGLISH_2018.xlsx?dl=0, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://silkroadnews.org/en/news/the-chinese-company-will-upgrade-angren-tpp-in-uzbekistan-for-243-million, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Uzpromstoybank, Government Agency

title: China Eximbank provides $113.8 million loan for Conversion of Units 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 of Novo‐Angren Thermal Power Plant Project.
description: Between 2010 and 2012, Uzbekistan secured financing of US$273 million from the Export-Import Bank of China to fund the conversion of Units 1, 2, 3, 4, & 5 of Novo-Angren Thermal Power Plants to the all year coal firing (phase 1). The Thermal Power Plant is located in Dzhuma Angren. The capacity of the project was reported to be 7 bln kWh p.a. by the World Bank Report, and is expected to shift to burning coal by 2013. The other two units of the plant are expected to be converted by 2016. STAFF_NOTE: this project was amended October 30th, 2018 to spell out TPP as Thermal Power Plants
sources: http://documents.worldbank.org/curated/en/810761468318884305/pdf/ACS41460WP0Box0Issues0Note00PUBLIC0.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://documents.worldbank.org/curated/en/810761468318884305/pdf/ACS41460WP0Box0Issues0Note00PUBLIC0.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.kcl.ac.uk/sspp/departments/warstudies/research/groups/eucers/pubs/strategy-paper-11.pdf, Academic Journal Article

title: China supports construction of Chukurbulak mudflow check dam on the Khorgos River
description: In June 2017, China and Kazakhstan signed an agreement on the construction of the Chukurbulak dam on the Khorgos River worth 11.7 billion tenge (34.4M USD) during the official visit of Chinese President Xi Jinping to Kazakhstan and was ratified by the Kazakh Senate on June 8 2018. The project is being co-financed by both parties. 3.8 billion tenge of the 2018-2020 Kazakh national budget is allocated for 2018. The construction of the dam includes a central reinforced concrete part (including the necessary metal structures), the ground part of the dam, the control and measuring system, the temporary bridge and drainage channel for passing water during the construction period, as well as the shore protection structures (dams) under the dam. The dam will halt approximately 10 million cubic meters of mudflow and will also protect people in the lower basin of the river. The dam will be built five kilometers upstream from the Dostyk Kazakh-Chinese hydraulic power system. Experts from both countries designed and estimated the cost of the project and a Kazakh-China committee will be established to manage the construction process. The operation and management will be determined by another agreement. The project began construction in April 2019 and is to be completed in 2021. STAFF_NOTE: No transaction amount recorded as financing allocation is unclear.
sources: http://lenta.inform.kz/en/kazakh-chinese-dam-to-protect-icbc-khorgos_a3035179, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://astanatimes.com/2018/07/kazakhstan-china-to-construct-dam-on-khorgos-river/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://kz2.mofcom.gov.cn/article/chinanews/201805/20180502750223.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://en.trend.az/business/economy/2919711.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.akorda.kz/en/events/akorda_news/meetings_and_receptions/negotiations-with-xi-jinping-chairman-of-the-peoples-republic-of-china-in-expanded-format, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://bnews.kz/en/news/kazakhstan_and_china_to_construct_dam_on_khorgos_river, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: China Three Gorges Corporation (CTG), State-owned Company
title: China Development Bank loans 84.1 Million USD to Three Gorges Second Wind Farm (Linked to Project #54317, #54012, #37233) (CPEC, IPP)
description: The Karot Three Gorges Second Phase Wind Power Project (49.5MW) is located in Jhimpir, Thatta District, Sindh Province, Pakistan, which is 90 km west of Karachi city and 80 km north of the coast of Arabian Sea. Financial closure was achieved March 17 2017, and the Commercial Operation Date was June 20 2018. The project was developed on a Build-Own-Operate basis. Three Gorges Second Wind Farm Pakistan (Pvt.) Limited reported to National Electric Power Regulatory Authority (NEPRA) that it entered into a financing agreement on December 28, 2016 with China Development Bank for a 84.1 Million USD loan, with a 3 Months LIBOR rate of 0.2706% + 450 bps. Grace period is assumed to be the same as construction period, which is 18 months. The repayment period is inferred from the Debt Servicing Schedule on a 2019 tariff adjustments decision document from NEPRA. Project is part of the2 billion Karot power projects, focusing on hydro and wind power, under the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor reported to be completed by 2018. The total project cost and financing breakdown is not known.
sources: https://nepra.org.pk/Tariff/IPPs/000%20IPPs%20Wind/Three%20Gorges%202nd%20Wind%20Farm/2019/TRF-348%20TGSWFPL%20Adjustment%20COD%2008-01-2019%20201-203.PDF, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://dukespace.lib.duke.edu/dspace/bitstream/handle/10161/16605/MP%20CR%20TS%20XW.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/8csdpteq2a5b3lj/2016%20Government%20of%20Pakistan%20Bond%20Prospectus.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://ctgsail.com/bussiness/99-MW-THREE-GORGES-2ND-AND-3RD-WIND-FARM, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://cpec.gov.pk/project-details/24, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BUSFINC020170311ed3b000b5&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China funds 2.194B rupee China Sri Lanka Research Grant Project
description: In a report published by Sri Lanka's Department of Project Management Monitoring Ministry of Development Assignments, it was stated that in 2016, China and the government of Sri Lanka began funding the China Sri Lanka Research Grant Project (CSLGRP) for 2,194 Rs.mn. It was unclear how much of this funding was provided by China versus the government of Sri Lanka. Therefore the transaction amount was not recorded. The general objectives of this project are to identify the possible causing factors to the occurrence and distribution of the Chronic Kidney Disease (CKDu) of unknown etiology in Sri Lanka, to develop groundwater treatment methods and technologies in CKDu affected regions in Sri Lanka, to develop rain water collection and use methods and technologies in dry areas of Sri Lanka, and to help the government of Sri Lanka make integrated water supply and sanitation infrastructure development plan, integrated water resource management plan, and land use plan. From March 12 to 20, 2016, a 42-member Chinese delegation from several Chinese institutes and enterprises visited Sri Lanka. The delegation visited the Ministry of City Planning and Water Supply (MCPWS), the inviting party of Sri Lanka, and National Science Foundation of Sri Lanka (NSF). From March 16 onwards, three research teams were organized and sent to conduct field investigations on CKDu Cause Study, Water Treatment Tech and Jaffna Water Resource management. The project will consist in part of the establishment of a monitoring laboratory and the installation of a groundwater treatment pilot project & rainwater harvesting project. Construction design is in progress, and the groundwater pilot project & rain water harvesting project were installed. The project was expected to be completed by the end of 2019, but was behind schedule on December 31, 2017, with only 10% physical progress completed due to the lack of adequate project staff allocation. STAFF_NOTE: The identifying report was unclear how much of this funding would be provided by each government. A report titled 'Progress of development projects and programs being implemented in 2017 (As at 30th September 2017)' lists the total cost as 1900RnMn, this was not coded as it is not as recent as the other official reports. CRS sector coded as multisector due to the health and environmental aspects of the project.
sources: http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Third_quarter_2017-new.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.cslrgp.com/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.castwas-cewe.org/Article/detail/fid/30/id/41.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Progress%20of%20Mega%20Projects.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/ENGLISH_FULL_2017.12.31.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China and Sri Lanka fund 300 RsMn MRI scanner for Colombo North Teaching Hospital
description: Based on a 2017 Report by Sri Lanka's Department of Project Management and Monitoring Ministry of Development Assignments, China and Sri Lanka are funding the provision of one MRI Scanner for Colombo North Teaching Hospital. The expected cost of this project is 300,000,000 RsMn. It is unclear how much of this total cost if being covered by each of the governments. The physical progress of this project was at 20% as of December 31st, 2017, which was behind schedule due to delays in signing agreements. The project is expected to be completed in 2019. STAFF_NOTE: since China's contribution to this project is unknown, the transaction amount was left blank.
sources: http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/ENGLISH_FULL_2017.12.31.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Third_quarter_2017-new.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: China National Electric Equipment Corporation, State-owned Company
title: China Exim Bank Provides $10 million loan for Andijan Hydropower Plant in Uzbekistan (linked to #53684)
description: In 2007, the Export-Import Bank of China provided a10 million loan to the government of Uzbekistan for the construction and equipping of the Andijan Hydropower Plant in Andijan. The loan had a government guarantee. The hydropower plant has a capacity of 50MW and was opened in 2010 (the designed capacity is 171.1 million kilowatts-hours of electricity). The total cost of the project was28.5 million USD; it is unclear where the remaining funding was sourced from. The plant was a joint venture between the Uzbek Agriculture and Water Management Ministry and the China National Electric Equipment Corp (CNEEC), which signed an agreement in 2007 to build one hydropower station each in Andijan and Akhangaran (project ID #53684). Based on the agreement, the Chinese company would provide equipment and execute the assembly of the plants. STAFF_NOTE: Commitment year unclear. Conflicting sources regarding the wattage of the station (original source stated 17MW), defaulted to most frequently listed wattage.
sources: https://news.tj/en/news/chinese-eximbank-finances-hydroelectric-station-construction-uzbekistan, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.unece.org/fileadmin/DAM/project-monitoring/5-sustainable-energy/E234/2014_NationalStudies/UZ/UZ_Report.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/CR/Issues/2016/12/31/Republic-of-Uzbekistan-Poverty-Reduction-Strategy-Paper-21636, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://tajikwater.net/docs/100908_CANewsWire.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.internationalrivers.org/sites/default/files/attached-files/new_great_walls_report.pdf, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://www.carecprogram.org/uploads/Diagnostic-Study-CAREC-Energy-Strategy-Pillar1-Full-Report.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://en.trend.az/business/energy/1744589.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: China National Electric Equipment Corporation (CNEEC), State-owned Company
title: China Eximbank loans $5.93 million to equip Akangaran Hydropower Plant in Uzbekistan (linked to #53683)
description: In 2009, China Eximbank provided a5.93 million loan for equipment delivery to a small hydroelectric power plant (HPP) at the Akhangaran water reservoir (capacity 50 MW). The total cost of the project was US$70,000,000. The Ahangaran Hydropower Plant was started as a joint venture between China National Electric Equipment Corp (CNEEC) and the Uzbek Agriculture and Water Management Ministry in 2007. Based on this agreement, the Chinese company would provide equipment and assemble the plant. Under this same agreement, the Andijian Hydropower station was also initiated (Project ID#53683). STAFF_NOTE: Exact commitment year is uncertain. May also be known as Akhangaran hydropower plant - a source listing it with this name stated that the plant had 21MW. Defaulted to official source wattage.
sources: http://tajikwater.net/docs/100908_CANewsWire.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.unece.org/fileadmin/DAM/project-monitoring/5-sustainable-energy/E234/2014_NationalStudies/UZ/UZ_Report.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/CR/Issues/2016/12/31/Republic-of-Uzbekistan-Poverty-Reduction-Strategy-Paper-21636, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://open_jicareport.jica.go.jp/pdf/246217.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.carecprogram.org/uploads/Diagnostic-Study-CAREC-Energy-Strategy-Pillar1-Full-Report.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.carecprogram.org/uploads/Diagnostic-Study-CAREC-Energy-Strategy-Pillar1-Full-Report.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://news.tj/en/news/chinese-eximbank-finances-hydroelectric-station-construction-uzbekistan, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China Funds Tupolong Hydropower Plant in Uzbekistan
description: The Chinese government assisted the government of Uzbekistan with the construction of the Tupolong Hydropower Plant with a capacity of 90MW (the first unit had 30MW). The total cost of the project was115,00,000 USD, but it is unclear how much of the funds China provided. STAFF_NOTE: Had not been completed as of 2009 report, but indicated it had been started. No current status could be found
sources: https://www.carecprogram.org/uploads/Diagnostic-Study-CAREC-Energy-Strategy-Pillar1-Full-Report.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://open_jicareport.jica.go.jp/pdf/246217.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China Development Bank loans US$1.2 billion to Uzbekneftegaz for synthetic liquid fuel production plant
description: In 2017, China Development Bank (CBD) provided a loan of US$1.2 billion to Uzbekneftegaz for the the production of synthetic liquid fuels based on purified methane from Shurtan Gas Chemical Complex. A gas to liquid processing plant will be constructed at the Shurtan petrochemical complex in Guzar district, Qashgadaryo Region of Uzbekistan.The total cost of the plant is US$3.7 billion. The remaining financing will be obtained from Uzbekneftegaz and international financing institutions; the consortium includes Export-Import Bank of Korea, Korea Trade Insurance Corporation K-SURE, Gazprombank, Russian export credit agency EXIAR, Credit Suisse, and Japanese banks MUFG, SMBC and Mizuho. Uzbekistan GTL LLC, a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Uzbekneftegaz, is the operator of the project, while a South Korean consortium led by Hyundai Engineering & Construction company is the general contractor. The project began construction in January of 2017, and is expected to have a capacity capacity of 743,500 tons of diesel fuel, 311,000 tons of aviation kerosene, 431,100 tons of naphtha and 20,900 tons of liquefied gas per year. Shurtan Gas Chemical Complex will supply the plant with 3.6 billion cubic meters of methane per year. The plant is scheduled to begin service in 2020. STAFF_NOTE: Region also spelled as Kashkadarya Region. Year marked uncertain because implementation dates are 2015-2020, but CDB loan appears to have been provided in 2017.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/vults7c3kv89j45/BU_PITCH_ENGLISH_2018.xlsx?dl=0, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TREOGE0020170531ed5v0001t&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.azernews.az/region/142796.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.constructionboxscore.com/project-news/uzbekistan-raises-$23-billion-to-build-gtl-plant.aspx, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://energy.economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/oil-and-gas/uzbekistan-borrows-2-3-billion-for-gas-to-liquids-plant-project/67111971, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://invest.gov.uz/en/invest-projects-taxonomy/realizuemye-investitsionnye-proekty/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://invest.gov.uz/en/invest-projects-taxonomy/realizuemye-investitsionnye-proekty/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.gtai.de/GTAI/Navigation/DE/Trade/Maerkte/suche,t=usbekistan-errichtet-neue-petrochemie-und-gaskomplexe,did=1842842.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.ogj.com/articles/2017/06/uzbekistan-lets-contract-for-ethylene-expansion.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://as.ucpress.edu/content/ucpas/58/4/747.full.pdf, Academic Journal Article

title: China Central South University and Nepal sign MoU on medical education
description: In June 2017, China and Nepal signed a Memorandum of Understanding concerning education in Beijing. Ministry of Health and Population of Nepal and Central South University (CSU), Changsha, Hunan, Ambassador of Nepal to China Mr. Leela Mani Paudyal signed the document. According to the MoU, Central South University will begin the 'Developing Country Advanced Care and Medical Master Scholar' program and provide 25 scholarships per year Master's Level Program in Advanced Nursing Practice & Medical Technology upon recommendation of Ministry of Health of Nepal for the next five years. Both agencies will apply 'Silk Road' Clinical Medicine Scholar to trains Nepal professional on bachelors, masters, and doctors. staff_note pg 24
sources: https://mofa.gov.np/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/MOFA-Bulletin-Vol-2-Issue-1-Final.pdf, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://iecd.csu.edu.cn/info/1016/3802.htm, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://mofa.gov.np/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Annual-Report-12-Oct-final.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://mofa.gov.np/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Annual-Report-12-Oct-final.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides Afghanistan 50 Government Scholarships annually(Linked to #37861 and #53641)
description: Starting in 2011, China agrees to provide Afghanistan 50 government scholarships each year to allow Afghans to study in China. The number of scholarships increased to 500 in 4 years in 2014 (See project #37861) and additional 50 annually in 2016 (#53641).
sources: https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206/1206x1/t356107.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/ztgk/t1097559.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China trains 400 Nepali in human resource development
description: In March 2016, China announced it would provide the opportunity for 400 Nepali to be trained in human resource development, as well as offer more government scholarships to Nepalese as part of an effort to enhance contact between their peoples. The agreement was made during an official visit of the Prime Minister of Nepal to China from March 20 to 27, 2016. staff_note: on pg 121
sources: https://mofa.gov.np/joint-press-statement/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://mofa.gov.np/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/MOFA_REPORT_Nepal-Foreign-Affairs_2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.gov.cn/xinwen/2016-03/23/content_5056979.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 20 million yuan of supplies to Sri Lanka
description: In 2014, after the flood, China donated supplies that worth 20 million yuan to Sri Lanka. STAFF_NOTE: Official sources indicate that this project is separate from #33387.
sources: https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides supplies worth 15 million yuan to Sri Lanka
description: In 2017, the Chinese embassy provided humanitarian supplies worth 15 million yuan to Sri Lanka after the flood and landslide. The supplies include 600 tents, 20 thousand blankets, 5000 sheets, 20,000 life jackets, and 1,000 pairs of rain boots.
sources: http://chinaplus.cri.cn/news/china/9/20170529/5429.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.lankabusinessonline.com/indian-ships-arrive-in-sri-lanka-with-flood-relief-china-pledges-usd2-2mn/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lk.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201706/20170602586961.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2017-06/01/c_136330994.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: KyrgyzTelecom, Private Sector
title: China Development Bank provides $60m USD loan for fiber-optic laying
description: In 2008, China Development Bank gave a commercial loan of60 million to KyrgyzTelecom to lay fiber-optic cables and expand networks and digital broadcasting in the Batken region of Kyrgyzstan. The details of the commercial loan are currently unknown. According to a Freedom House Report, KT finished laying the fiber-optic cables in 2010. STAFF_NOTE: Unsure if loan occurred in 2008, but project was finished by 2010.
sources: https://freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-net/2017/kyrgyzstan, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://www.imf.org/external/np/pp/eng/2010/072110.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
recipient_agencies: KyrgyzTelecom, Private Sector

title: China reconstructs Basantapur Tower in Kathmandu Durbar Square, Nepal (Linked to project #43970)
description: In 2017, the Chinese Government agreed to provide an RMB 90 million grant for reconstruction of Basantapur Tower(九层神庙) in Kathmandu Durbar Square (加德满都杜巴广场), Nepal. The nine-storeyed Basantapur Tower in Durbar Square, Kathmandu, was built in the 18th century during Shah Dynasty. The tower was damaged by the 2015 earthquake. Reconstruction efforts began on August 15, 2017 and they were expected to finish within 5 years. China Cultural Heritage Research Institute is responsible for project implementation. This is one of the 25 projects pledged by China as assistance for earthquake reconstruction. For the umbrella project, see Project #43970. Staff Note: This project is also known as the Nautale Durbar Renovation Project.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=CHNDHK0020170504ed550001a&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.hubpd.com/c/2017-10-30/624184.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.bjnews.com.cn/world/2017/08/15/454370.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1558687.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: China Energy Engineering Group Northwest Power Construction Engineering Co., Ltd., State-owned Company; China Gezhouba Group Co. Ltd., State-owned Company; China International Water and Electrical Corporation, State-owned Company; Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA), Government Agency
title: China provides USD129.25 million loan for Upper Trishuli 3A Hydroelectric Project in Nepal (linked to #34389)
description:
On February 28, 2011, the Government of Nepal and China Eximbank signed a government concessional loan (GCL) worth RMB 640 million (equivalent to approximately $90 million) for the 60 MW Upper Trishuli 3A Hydroelectric Power Plant Construction Project (or 上崔树里3A水电站项目 or 上崔树理3A水电站的建设). The terms of the loan were as follows: 1.75% interest rate, 25-year maturity, and a 5 year grace period. The Government of Nepal used the proceeds of the loan to develop an on-lending arrangement (through a “Subsidiary Loan Agreement”) with Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA) on April 15, 2011. These loan agreements went into effect on June 1, 2011. However, in 2013, the scope of the project was expanded and the face value of these loan agreements were increased to $114.7 million. The Upper Trishuli 3A hydroelectric power plant project involved the construction a 60 MW run-of-river (ROR) plant with annual energy generation of 460 GWh. The plant is located near Simle village within Kispang Rural Municipality on the borders of the Rasuwa and Nuwakot districts. On May 31, 2010, China Gezhouba Group Co. Ltd. (CGGC) signed a commercial (EPC) contract with NEA to implement all civil, electro-mechanical, and hydro-mechanical works, including gradation of the 11.5 km long access road, construction of a steel bridge over Trishuli River, construction of temporary camp at headworks, and excavation of Adit no. 1 and head pond excavation. Northwest Engineering Corporation Limited (previously known as Northwest HydroConsulting Engineers) was selected as the contractor responsible for construction supervision. CGGC received a “Commencement of Work Order” on June 1, 2011. The project was initiated on November 23, 2011 and it encountered various delays due to disputes over whether to build powerhouse underground or overground, disputes about whether to increase the capacity of the project, damages to the access roads leading to the project site (resulting from landslides that were triggered by an April 2015 earthquake), and a blockade imposed by India. On May 26, 2019, the first unit of the plant was successfully connected to the grid.  The second unit was successfully connected to the grid later in 2019. The hydroelectric power plant was officially completed and inaugurated on November 18, 2019. The electricity that is now generated by the plant mainly serves people in Kathmandu and it reportedly fulfills seven percent of the country’s total electricity demand. STAFF_NOTE: The Government of Nepal’s Aid Information Management System (AMIS) records the face value of the China Eximbank loan as $129,241,702. However, the AMIS project record seems to combine the China Eximbank loan for the 60 MW Upper Trishuli 3A Hydroelectric Power Plant Construction Project (this record) and the Upper Trishuli 3A-Kathmandu 220kV Transmission Line and 132kV Line Bay Extension Works Project (Project ID#38705). Therefore, we record the face value of the loan for the 60 MW Upper Trishuli 3A Hydroelectric Power Plant Construction Project as $114.7 million for the time being.

The 60 MW Upper Trishuli 3A Hydroelectric Power Plant is located near Simle village within Kispang Rural Municipality on the borders of the Rasuwa and Nuwakot districts. The exact coordinates of the power plant can be found at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Upper+Trishuli+3A+Powerhouse/@28.117778,84.6364041,10z/data=!4m8!1m2!2m1!1sUpper+Trishuli+3A!3m4!1s0x39eadbf2740c67c7:0x15a04724da9278bd!8m2!3d28.0255896!4d85.1860467.
sources: http://np.china-embassy.org/eng/EmbassyInfo/asaa/t961506.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.nea.org.np/admin/assets/uploads/supportive_docs/87757284.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.chinca.org/CICA/info/19052013553411, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.internationalrivers.org/resources/upper-trishuli-3a-and-3b-3589, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ceec.net.cn/art/2019/6/6/art_11019_1909576.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=KATMPO0020100917e69g0005x&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2017-09-24/chinese-bank-renews-loan-grace-period.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://gb.oversea.cnki.net/KCMS/detail/detail.aspx?filename=N2016060076000325&dbcode=CYFD&dbname=CYFD, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://www.china5e.com/news/news-103637-1.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1560599.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA), Government Agency

implementing_agencies: China New Era International Engineering Corporation, State-owned Company
title: China reconstructs Sindhupalchok hospital in Nepal (Linked to project #43970)
description:
In 2017, the Chinese Government agreed to provide a grant to the Government of Nepal reconstruct the Sindhupalchok (Chinese sources refer to this as Sindu Balkok) District Hospital ( 杜巴尔乔克县医院) in Sindhupalchok (सिन्धुपाल्चोक जिल्ला), which was damaged from the 2015 earthquake. The objective of the project was to construct a medium-sized hospital with 39 beds in Sindupalchok. Construction will take place on a 3790 square meter lot. On May 30, 2018, China’s Ministry of Commerce — through its Agency for International Economic Cooperation (AIECO) — issued an award to China Qiyuan Engineering Corporation (also known as China New Era International Engineering Corporation) (abbreviated as CQEC or 中国新时代国际工程公司) for the implementation of this project. The Chinese project title is 尼泊尔辛杜巴尔乔克县医院恢复和改造项目. 

STAFF_NOTE: reports by Chinese embassy suggest this is one project under the general framework of earthquake rehabilitation efforts made by China. Project linked to ID# 43970.

The Sindhupalchok District Hospital is located in Chautara in Sindhupalchok District. Its exact locational coordinates are available at https://www.google.com/maps/place/District+Hospital+Sindhupalchok/@27.7805239,85.711024,15z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x0:0x1cc89490ddc1829d?sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjE3f6Un4bpAhVRYDUKHWQCD1QQ_BIwFHoECA8QCA and https://www.google.com/maps/place/District+Hospital+Sindhupalchok/@27.9200731,85.4840047,10z/data=!4m8!1m2!2m1!1sDistrict+Hospital+Sindhupalchok!3m4!1s0x39ebac3b919b85c9:0x1cc89490ddc1829d!8m2!3d27.7805239!4d85.711024.
sources: https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%BE%9B%E6%9D%9C%E5%B8%95%E5%B0%94%E4%B9%94%E5%85%8B%E5%8E%BF, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1542839.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.cecep.cn/gjgc/g10971/s20734/t62585.aspx, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2018-03/15/c_137041527.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: United Nations Development Programme (UNDP),
title: China grants $4 million in aid for flood damages to Nepal (linked to project #54190)
description: In November 2017, China agreed to donate4 million to UNDP for aid to the victims of heavy rainstorms in Nepal. The aid includes blankets, cooking utensils, mosquito nets, water filters and hygiene kits, which will benefit 31,800 affected families in 7 provinces. The implementation of programs start on January 11, 2018, and all delivery completed on March 26, 2018. This project is linked to the August 20171 million given by China to Nepal in response to flooding (see project #54190).
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=SCMCOM0020170816ed8g0005x&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=HNTM000020170816ed8g004v5&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2018-02/04/c_136948779.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinanews.com/gn/2018/03-26/8476344.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.livemint.com/Politics/3I7pQdjUSs3B7GUVyIvFHO/Nepal-floods-China-announces-1-million-assistance.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1525344.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: United Nations Development Programme (UNDP),

implementing_agencies: Shanghai Construction Group General Co., State-owned Company
title: China grants Rs 90.1 million for reconstruction of Durbar High School in Nepal (Linked to project#43970)
description: In 2017, China agreed to reconstruct Durbar High School (also known as Bhanu Secondary School) in Kathmandu, Nepal. The school, founded on 1853, was previously damaged by the 2015 earthquake. The school will be reconstructed with funding of Rs 90.1 million from the Chinese government, with Shanghai Construction Engineering Group Co., Ltd. as the contracting company. The construction project officially starts on August 3, 2018 and is expected to last 20 months. The project is part of post-earthquake 25 China-aided recovery projects. For the umbrella project, see project #43970.
sources: http://news.cri.cn/20180803/7aa16025-471b-db4f-78bf-861a203c773d.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/dl/gbdqzn/upload/niboer.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://thehimalayantimes.com/kathmandu/reconstruction-of-durbar-high-school-begins-with-chinese-govts-assistance/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201809/20180902786798.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China agrees to train 200 professionals for Afghanistan (Linked to #54075, #54076)
description: In 2006, China agreed to help Afghanistan train 200 professionals in different fields to support 'national construction' between 2007 and 2008. The agreement was signed when Afghanistan President Hamid Karzai visited China between June 18 to June 21, 2006. According to Afghanistan DAD platform, the training will take 2,080,000 USD. It is unclear where the training will take place, but it is intended to support construction in Afghanistan.
sources: http://news.sina.com.cn/w/2006-06-21/01269256450s.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://dadafghanistan.gov.af/de/frame.jsp?src=/de/deView.faces?sessionid=154258875818446093&MasterID=12&SubModuleID=1&Hierarchy=A12_E_Projects&UserID=13&iLanguageID=1&jsf_sequence=1&projectid=2436&beansKey=154258875818446093_1542593490059, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.gov.cn:8080/zwjw/2006-06/20/content_315771.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/wxzl/t852277.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China agrees to provide 30 annual national scholarships to Afghans (Linked to #37861, #53703, #53641)
description: In 2006, China stated in the Joint Statement with Afghanistan that it will provide 30 annual scholarships for year-long training in China to Afghans. The details of the implementation of the scholarships are unclear. In 2014, China agreed on providing 500 national scholarships to Afghanistan (See project #37861 for details), an additional 50 annually in 2011 (#53703) and an additional 50 in 2016 (#53641).
sources: http://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2006/content_352476.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/wxzl/t852277.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Pakistan Railways, State-owned Company
title: China provides technical and financial support for US$65m Havelian Dry Port (Linked to Project #52429)
description: In November 2016, a request was made for Chinese funding for the65 million Havelian Dry Dock Port. The request came as the result of a joint feasibility study of the Main Line 1 ML1 and this project in August 2014 during the third Joint Cooperation Council (JCC) in Beijing. To meet the demand of containerized future freight traffic in connection with Pak-China Economic Corridor, the dry port will be established at Havelian by utilizing the railway land, railhead facilities, high speed / capacity stock, and potential of well established off-dock terminal for handling bonded import / export containers. The project will be funded through a Chinese Government Concessional Loan (GCL). The construction contract will be awarded through open bidding. The project is listed on CPEC website, which also suggests that the project framework agreement was signed in May 2017 (along with the reconstruction of railway ML-1 project), and that the project is to be put on fast track. Project framework agreement was signed June 2017, allowing project construction to start. According to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance, the project's groundbreaking is planned for 2018. In January 2017, the Pakistani government's Railway Division contributed 28 million Pakistani rupees for a comprehensive feasibility study for upgrading Main Line 1. According to the 2016 Government of Pakistan Bond Prospectus, project cost is65 million. Expected completion is in 2018. STAFF_NOTE: Since no project update is found after 2017 when the governments signed the framework agreement and port design work started, coder assumed that as of June 2019, the implementation has not started yet. Project is coded as commitment for now. Chinese financing is also unclear. STAFF_NOTE: the railway utilized in conjunction with this port is also a Chinese-assisted CPEC project. Linked to Project #52429.
sources: http://www.finance.gov.pk/survey/chapters_18/13-Transport_and_Communications.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/8csdpteq2a5b3lj/2016%20Government%20of%20Pakistan%20Bond%20Prospectus.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.beltroad-initiative.com/bri-factsheet-series-havelian-dry-port/, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAKOFN0020170614ed6c0000d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NINTPK0020170118ed1i00035&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://cpec.gov.pk/project-details/31, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.cpecinfo.com/cpec-news-detail?id=NTEzNw==, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
recipient_agencies: Pakistan Railways, State-owned Company

implementing_agencies: Gwadar Port Authority, State-owned Company
title: China provides US$32 million concessional loan for construction of Gwadar Port Free Zone and Export Processing Zone
description: This project involves infrastructure construction around the Gwadar Port and will aim at creating backup port industry for Gwadar Port. The focus of this zone is to restore water and power supply, machinery, and warehouse and supervision systems, as well as a functioning air facility. As of Nov 2018, following areas have been allocated as free zone and export processing zones in the industrial locations of Gwadar through either government earmark or acquisition: Gwadar port free zone: 2,280 acres GIEDA industrial zone: 3,000 acres EPZA export processing zone: 1,000 acres Within the Free Zone will be 100% private investment and the Zone is to be operated by COPHCL (China Overseas Port Holding Company). CPEC puts the estimated cost at US$32 million and indicates that there is a Chinese Government Concessional Loan provided. However, it remains unclear what portion of the cost is provided by China. The 2016 Government of Pakistan Bond Prospectus confirms the project cost and the start date. Tax exemptions for port and Free Zone were first notified in a finance bill in 2016. The 1st phase was completed and inaugurated in January 2018.
sources: http://pk.chineseembassy.org/chn/zbgx/t1530349.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASPKOB0020170427ed4r0001c&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dropbox.com/s/8csdpteq2a5b3lj/2016%20Government%20of%20Pakistan%20Bond%20Prospectus.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.cpecinfo.com/gwadar-port-city, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://cpec.gov.pk/project-details/36, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/Estimates_of_Foreign_Assistance_2018_19.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Gwadar Port Authority, State-owned Company

implementing_agencies: China Communications Construction Co., Ltd. (CCCC), State-owned Company
title: China grants Rs 425m for Gwadar Smart Port City Master Plan
description: Talking to a Pakistani news agency, Pakistani officials in Gwadar indicated that the 'master plan' would transform the existing city into a modern port of international standards and a smart, sustainable city that can drive local, national and regional growth in the coming decades. They said the development of Gwadar is a strategic priority for the Government of Pakistan. CPEC originally estimated cost at US$4 million.The project MoU was signed in Nov 2015. Chinese Fourth Harbour Design Institute has been nominated for Gwadar Smart City Plan. The project contract was signed in May 2017 alongside the Gwadar Eastbay Expressway project. As of 2019, the companies reportedly estimated a total cost of Rs 521 million. This includes a Chinese grant of Rs 425m, and an additional Rs91m provided by the government of Pakistan. According to a Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2016/17, LOE was signed on 09-09-2016. Implementation Minutes and Contract Agreement has been signed. (15th May 2017). The contract amount is 28.6 million CNY, which is roughly the equivalent of the total project cost Rs521m. The company began working on the project plan in 2017, and it was sent to the federal government for approval after completion in December 2018. In January 2019, a media source reported Chinese companies were frustrated over delays in the final approval of the plan by Pakistan's government, warning that costs due to these delays would be the responsibility of the government. A different CPEC website puts the project status as still undergoing contract negotiations. It is possible that this website is outdated. STAFF_NOTE: For now, coded recorded the project as commitment. The project status can be modified if update is found in the future. As the date of grant agreement signing could not be found, the project commitment date is coded as the signing date of the implementation contract in 2017.
sources: https://pakobserver.net/master-plan-gwadar-smart-port-city-finalized-soon/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://tribune.com.pk/story/1892965/1-gwadar-master-plan-delay-upsets-chinese/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/pakistan/chinese-companies-warn-pakistan-against-delay-in-cpec-project/articleshow/67627895.cms, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://monitoring.bbc.co.uk/sample-search?searchText=Pakistan,%20China%20ink%20pacts%20to%20make%20Gwadar%20modern%20port%20city&minScore=0&sort=publication_time&sortDirection=DESC, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/dl/gbdqzn/upload/bajisitan.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ccccltd.cn/news/jcxw/jx/201705/t20170517_88667.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://cpec.gov.pk/project-details/63, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.cpecinfo.com/gwadar-port-city, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Final%20PCP%20Year%20Book%202016-17%20.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Pakistan Broadcasting Corporation, State-owned Company; ZTE (Zhongxing Telecommunication Equipment), State-owned Company
title: China provides grant for Pilot Project Of Digital Terrestrial Multimedia Broadcast (DTMB)
description: According to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance, China and Pakistan signed a memorandum of understanding to expand the Digital Terrestrial Multimedia Broadcast (DTMB). As of 2018, the first phase of the project, a pilot DTMB installed at Remote Backup Service (RBS) in Murree by Chinese ZTE Corporation for demonstration of the Pakistan Television Corporation (PTV) terrestrial network, is completed. The project is financed through a Chinese government grant, but it is unclear how much. The feasibility project had a reported cost of 0.70 million RMB and is completed, according to the Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book for 2015/2016. According to the CPEC website, as of 2018 the total cost of the pilot project was2 million, and the demonstration project is with funding from the Chinese side. PC-1 of the Demonstration project approved by CDWP on 2nd May 2018.
sources: http://www.finance.gov.pk/survey/chapters_18/13-Transport_and_Communications.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://cpec.gov.pk/others, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Final%20PCP%20Year%20Book%202016-17%20.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/8csdpteq2a5b3lj/2016%20Government%20of%20Pakistan%20Bond%20Prospectus.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://cpec.gov.pk/project-details/41, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pakistaneconomist.com/2018/07/09/pakistan-moving-towards-digital-future-under-cpec-plan/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.finance.gov.pk/survey/chapters_17/13-Transport_and_Communications.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Pakistan Broadcasting Corporation, State-owned Company

title: CPEC project - Karachi Circular Railway
description: The 6th Joint Coordination Committee (JCC) agreed in principal for inclusion of Mass Transit System as part of CPEC component. Transport Working Group has been asked to work on the projects based further studies and consultation. Feasibility of Karachi Circular Railways completed in May 2017. Groundbreaking is expected in 2018. As of April 2019, no update on this project has been found. Earlier, the project was to be financed by Japanese development agency, JICA, and was scheduled to be completed in 10 years but under the special directives of former prime minister Nawaz Sharif, it was decided the project would be included in CPEC and would be completed within a period of three years. The total cost of the project is estimated at Rs 270.547 billion. But contribution from the Chinese side is unclear. The project would be undertaken by government of Sindh and China, while ministry of planning would oversee the matter. The 43.2 kilometer standard gauge double railway track (14.94 km at surface and 28.18 km elevated) would be constructed with allied structures on the existing land reserved for KCR. The corridor will have total 24 stations with an average station spacing of 1.8 km.
sources: https://www.samaa.tv/economy/2017/08/karachi-circular-railway-to-be-completed-by-sept-2020/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.finance.gov.pk/survey/chapters_18/13-Transport_and_Communications.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/dl/gbdqzn/upload/bajisitan.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://cpec.gov.pk/project-details/43, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karachi_Circular_Railway, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government Agency
title: China provides Afghanistan Official Equipment
description:
On October 8, 2012, the signing ceremony of Chinese office equipment donation to Afghanistan was held in Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The value or the detailed content of the grant is not specified.  According to Mahmud, the third Chief Secretary for Politics of Afghans Ministry of Foreign Affairs (外交部第三政治司司长马赫穆德), this grant will significantly improve Afghans government working conditions and improve efficiency. 

This project is not the duplicate of #53740, as the items handed over are landscaping supplies, not office supplies, or #37898, as the signing dates are different.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t977239.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government Agency

title: China provides Afghanistan President Landscaping Equipments
description: On October 1, 2012, the handover ceremony of China grant to Afghanistan was held in Afghanistan President's Office. The value of the grant is not indicated in the original source. The grant includes snow shovel machines, street cleaners, and lawn mowers. That equipment will help the cleaning and beautification of the area surrounding Afghans President Office and capital city, as well as improve the environment. As the equipment handed over is intended for landscaping, not office supplies, this is not a duplicate of #53739.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t976192.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: China Railway 14th .Construction Bureau Co., Ltd (China Railway Shisiju Group Corporation), State-owned Company
title: China support construction of Afghanistan Science and Education Center
description:
In 2011, the Chinese Government agreed to support the National Center for Science and Technology Education Project in Afghanistan. China’s Ministry of Commerce reportedly committed RMB 78.1 million of grant funding for this project. With a total construction area of 7,891 square meters, the project involved the construction of laboratories, conference rooms, lecture halls, libraries and other facilities. The National Center for Science and Technology Education also reportedly doubles as a venue for cultural exchanges. 

China Railway Shisiju Group Corporation, which is also known as China Railway 14th Bureau Group Co., Ltd., was the contractor responsible for project implementation. Construction began on August 18, 2012, and ended on December 22, 2013, three months before the planned completion date. A project handover ceremony was then held on April 15, 2014. 

STAFF_NOTE: This project is also known as the Science and Education Center Complex Project. The Chinese project title is 国家科学教育中心 or 国家科教中心. This project captured the funding agreement for the construction of National Center for Science and Technology Education in Afghanistan. The project is linked to Project ID# 69620, which captured the technical cooperation between China and Afghanistan.
sources: http://yws.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zt_obor/subjecte/201508/20150801089766.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/eng/zagx/introduction/t1088794.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1147384.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201501/20150100879514.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.crssg.com/art/2016/10/21/art_1855_514977.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.sasac.gov.cn/n103/n86114/n326638/c855899/content.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of the Interior, Government Agency
title: China donates 6 million Yuan police equipments to Afghanistan
description: On November 8, 2014, China delivered police equipment worths 6 million Chinese Yuan to Afghanistan. The equipment was handed to Minister of Interior. The materials handed over by the Chinese side include communication equipment, forensic cameras, police helmets and shields, and rapid detection equipment for drugs (drugs). The Chinese side also provided assistance to the Afghan in equipment operation training. In addition to these, there are some computer equipment, which is Lenovo's E49 model. The network shows that the price of such computers does not exceed RMB 4,000. There is no offensive weapon in this batch of public police materials, indicating that China has taken into consideration its stance and position when choosing assistance, and avoided transmitting information that is deeply involved in the armed conflict in Afghanistan.
sources: http://hlj.ifeng.com/china/detail_2014_11/10/3128967_0.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1209609.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2014-11-09/234731118901.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of the Interior, Government Agency

implementing_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of the Interior, Government Agency
title: China provides $1.4 million in material aid to Afghans Ministry of Interior
description: In July 2003, China and Afghanistan's Interim government signed an agreement with China. China will provide the Afghanistan Ministry of Interior with communication equipment and vehicles. It's worth 1.4 million US dollar in total, includes 22 Cherokee vehicles. The equipment and vehicles were handed over on June 30, 2004. The communication equipment came from Shandong Weifang Huaguang Communication Co., Ltd. The 22 vehicles came from Beijing Jeep Automobile Co., Ltd.
sources: http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200407/20040700243063.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of the Interior, Government Agency

title: China Exim bank loans 143.9m USD for Dushanbe-Dangara road reconstruction [Phase 2] (linked to #40063, #40440)
description: In 2009, the Export-Import Bank of China loaned Tajikistan143,925,000 for Phase II of the rehabilitation of the Dushanbe-Kulma highway, Dushanbe-Dangara section. The grace period is from 5 to 7 years. The remaining amount of the151.5 million project was provided by the Tajik government. This section of the road is 50.5 km and includes the construction of the Chormagzak tunnel. The project was implemented between 2009 and 2013. This project is linked to project ID #40063 (49 million loan for Phase I), and project ID #40440 (loan for the Chormagzak tunnel).
sources: http://documents.worldbank.org/curated/en/877071468303575509/pdf/891840NWP0P14700TJK0NOTE60final0web.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://open_jicareport.jica.go.jp/pdf/12246633.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.carecprogram.org/uploads/TAJrev_EN.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.asiaplus.tj/en/news/tajikistan/20090213/tajikistan-negotiates-financing-tunnel-construction-china-s-bank, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/dl/gbdqzn/upload/tajikesitan.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://president.tj/en/node/957, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/15efu2nx5saapnr/List%20of%20Chinese%20Government-Financed%20Projects%20in%20Tajikistan%20from%20the%20Ministry%20of%20Finance%20via%20the%20IMF%20May%202018.xlsx?dl=0, Other; http://minfin.tj/downloads/files/MTEFfinalTajikenglish.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: China National Heavy Machinery Co., State-owned Company
title: EXIM Bank provides $88.5m USD loan for three industrial TALCO aluminum plants
description: In July 2016, the Tajik Aluminum Company (TALCO) was expected to put three industrial plants into operation in the Yovon district. One plant will produce 18,000 tons of aluminum fluoride annually, another will produce 12,000 tons of cryolite, and another will produce 130,000 tons of sulfuric acid. The plants are part of a five-year plan to shift Tajikistan's aluminum smelters to domestic raw materials. Construction originally began in 2008, and the total cost was126 million USD. This includes the88.5 million soft loan provided by China Exim Bank, and37 million invested by TALCO. News report from Asia Plus in July 2016 says that in June 2014, TALCO reportedly signed a contract with China National Heavy Machinery Corporation on completion of work on introducing these plants into operation, and that the three plants were expected to be introduced into operation in Yovon July of that year. A press statement from the Chinese embassy indicates that the project had been finished by as late as October, 2016.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/15efu2nx5saapnr/List%20of%20Chinese%20Government-Financed%20Projects%20in%20Tajikistan%20from%20the%20Ministry%20of%20Finance%20via%20the%20IMF%20May%202018.xlsx?dl=0 , Other; https://www.thefreelibrary.com/China+to+provide+%2488-mln+loan+to+build+three+plants+in+Tajikistan.-a0397408318, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://tj.chineseembassy.org/chn/dszl/dshd/t1406431.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.asiaplus.tj/en/news/three-plants-talco-expected-be-introduced-operation-yovon-next-month, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.thefreelibrary.com/China+to+start+implementation+of+%241.5+billion+worth+projects+in...-a0389850567, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.president.tj/en/node/12934, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://news.tj/en/news/tajikistan/economic/20160725/three-plants-talco-expected-be-introduced-operation-yovon-next-month, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: CPEC project - Zhob Quetta (N-50)
description:
China-Pakistan Transport Joint Working group agreed to include upgrades of a section of the Zhob (兹霍布) Quetta (奎塔) (N-50) Highway as a short term project. The section is 331 km. Hiring of Consultancy for feasibility and design initiated. As of 2019 April, land acquisition along existing road is under progess.

STAFF_NOTE: Project was deactivated because there is no evidence of Chinese official financing.
sources: http://cpec.gov.pk/project-details/86, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.finance.gov.pk/survey/chapters_18/13-Transport_and_Communications.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://kknews.cc/zh-my/news/zgnglbl.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: SinoHydro, State-owned Company
title: China Exim Bank loans 147.9M USD for Talpitigala Reservoir project in Sri Lanka
description: As of December 30th, 2016, Sri Lanka had completed a feasibility study for the Talpitigala Reservoir Project, and an EPC contract agreement was signed with Sinohydro Corporation Ltd of China to commence work on the project. According to Sri Lanka's Department of External Resources, the EXIM Bank of China will provide a loan of USD 147,900,000 under a Preferential Buyer Credit (PBC) facility. The project is expected to be completed in 2018. According to the Ministry of Irrigation and Water Resources Management, the budget per year for this project was -2012: 1.460 million Rs [actual] -2013: 387 million Rs. [estimate] -2014: 1.2 billion Rs. [estimate] The Thalpitigala Reservoir is located about 3 km upstream of the existing Bathmedilla anicut at a location near the village Hunuketiya (Dematapelessa) which will lead to enhanced regulation and management of Uma Oya basin. The project will include the construction of a 46 m high, 15.83 MCM capacity reservoir across Uma Oya at Thalpitigala, which will release 20 MCM water to Bathmedilla Scheme to improve irrigation facilities to 668 ha of paddy lands. In addition to that it is expected to generate 51.3 GWh of electrical energy. It is also proposed to provide safe drinking water facilities to Wasanagama, Madulla, Thetilla and Beramada villages in the Kandaketiya Divisional Secretary's Division.
sources: http://www.treasury.gov.lk/documents/10181/39476/152.pdf/0b7cfe61-03b1-4ae7-b979-c9980b2f6ab8?version=1.0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Progress%20of%20the%20Projects%20Implemented%20through%20the%20Capital%20Budget%20in%20the%20year%202016_EN%20full.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=114:news&catid=29&Itemid=226&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://irrigationmin.gov.lk/thalpitigala-reservoir-project/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Lanco Infratech Ltd., Private Sector
title: CDB gives $200 million USD buyers credit to India for Lanco Amarkantak Thermal Power Units 3&4
description: In 2010, China Development Bank and Lanco Infratech Limited — one of the India’s largest integrated infrastructure developers — signed a200 million buyer’s credit agreement to the support the construction of Units 3 & 4 (1320 MW) of Lanco Amarkantak Thermal Power Plant, the 1320 MW Babandh Power Station, and the 1320 MW Vidarbha Power Station. The terms and conditions of this buyer’s credit are unknown. Units 3 & 4 (1320 MW) of Lanco Amarkantak Thermal Power Plant are located in in Pathadi village and Korba district. The 1320 MW Babandh Power Station is located in the village of Kharagprasad within Dhenkanal district. The 1320 MW Vidarbha Power Station is located 2 km east of the village of Mandva (or Mandwa) and 6 km northwest of Wardha. These projects are in various stages of implementation, and all have encountered major delays.
sources: https://www.moneycontrol.com/news/business/companies/-1647381.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/companies/lanco-infratech-to-supply-300-mw-power-to-mp/article23095140.ece, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.pp.u-tokyo.ac.jp/research/dp/documents/GraSPP-DP-E-14-003.pdf, Academic Journal Article; https://www.sourcewatch.org/index.php/Lanco_Amarkantak_Thermal_Power_Project, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/vults7c3kv89j45/BU_PITCH_ENGLISH_2018.xlsx?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.lancogroup.com/pdf/Lanco_Word/Lanco_World_Final.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.telegraphindia.com/business/lanco-gets-2bn-chinese-loan/cid/360782, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Lanco Infratech Ltd., Private Sector

title: China donates 100,000 yuan to Sri Lanka for second year of Chinese Ambassador Scholarship
description: In 2017, the Chinese Ambassador in Sri Lanka donated 100 thousand yuan to the Sri Lanka Ministry of Education for a 'Chinese Ambassador Scholarship'. 18 Sri Lankan students were awarded the full Chinese government scholarship this year, although 55 total students benefited. The awards ceremony was held at the Chinese Embassy on 2 August with the attendance of Ambassador Yi Xianliang, Mr. Madhawa Dewasurendra, Additional Secretary of Ministry of Higher Education and Highways and family members of the winners. This is the second year of this annual scholarship. Linked to projects #53789 (2016) and #54019 (2018). Staff Note: intent is coded as mixed because it is both development and representation.
sources: http://www.ft.lk/news/22-Sri-Lankan-students-awarded-Chinese-Government-Full-Scholarship/56-661710, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ft.lk/hr/18-sri-lankan-students-awarded-chinese-government-scholarship/47-634572, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://lk.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1483303.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2017-08/02/c_136494319.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.china.org.cn/world/Off_the_Wire/2017-08/02/content_41335950.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://dailynews.lk/2017/08/03/local/124088/%E2%80%98chinese-help-signifies-long-standing-friendship-lanka%E2%80%99?page=3, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: China CAMC Engineering Co., Ltd., State-owned Company
title: China Exim Bank loans Sri Lanka 13B Rs. for Lower Mulwathu Oya reservoir project
description:
In 2016, Exim Bank of China agreed to provide a 13 billion Rs. loan for the Lower Mulwathu Oya Multi Sector Development Project in the Anuradhapura and Vavuniya Districts. 13,215 ha of lands will be irrigated benefiting 10,000 farm families. 

This project envisages construction of 209 MCM capacity reservoir, 3,590 m long earth dam, Radial Gated Spillway, Left Bank, Right Bank and River Sluices, canal systems to new settlement area, and a power house. Stored water at proposed reservoir is released through the river sluice to the Malwathu Oya and picked up at Tekkam Anicut (24 Km d/s from Proposed Malwathu Oya Reservoir). From Tekkam Anicut 500 Cusec and 250 Cusec capacity right bank and left bank canals respectively convey water to irrigate 24,450 acres and 6,230 acres under existing Giant’s tank and Akitamuruppu tank respectively. 2,000 acres of new irrigable lands just downstream of the Reservoir is proposed for introducing commercial farming and 675 acres of lands have been identified for paddy cultivation. Other expected benefits are the provision of 2.0 MCM of domestic water annually for the new settlers, generation of 4.28 GWH Hydro power energy annually and the improvement of agricultural activities, livestock development, and other infrastructure development.

As of 2016, EIA had already been completed and cabinet approval had been obtained for implementation with CAMCE - China. Technical and financial proposals have been called from CAMC Company LTD for an EPC contract. MSD approval has been obtained for initial project carder. According to 'Progress of development projects and programmes being implemented in 2017,' only 15% of land surveying has been completed and financial progress is very low. The construction of the Malwathu Oya reservoir is expected to commence in the first quarter of 2018.

STAFF_NOTE: The concessionality of this loan is unknown, so flow class was coded as Vague (Official Finance).
sources: http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Development_Performance_2014_End.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Progress%20of%20the%20Projects%20Implemented%20through%20the%20Capital%20Budget%20in%20the%20year%202016_EN%20full.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ft.lk/columns/Lower-Malwathu-Oya-project-%E2%80%93-A-series-of-misconception-errors/4-639380, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/mid%20year-2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Final%20Document-%20English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.parliament.lk/uploads/documents/paperspresented/performance-report-ministry-of-irrigation-water-resources-management-2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.dailynews.lk/2018/09/17/local/162770/malwathu-oya-reservoir-work-delayed, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: China CAMC Engineering Co., Ltd., State-owned Company

implementing_agencies: Adani Power, Private Sector
title: China Development Bank Loans $166.67 million USD for the Tiroda Thermal Power Project in India (Linked to #54345)
description: On April 22nd, 2013, the China Development Bank loaned166,670,000 USD for the construction of the 3300 MW Tiroda Thermal Power Project of 5x660 MW units. The Tiroda Thermal Power is also called the Gondia Coal-Fired Project. The loan has a maturity of ten years. The project was constructed by the Adani Power Maharashtra Ltd (APML). The first unit of the plant was commissioned on 28th August 2012 and subsequently, other units were commissioned. The project was commissioned on October 11th, 2014. The Tiroda Thermal Power Project was also funded by a166.67 million USD loan by the ICBC (project #54345) and a166.66 million USD loan by the Standard Chartered Bank, both under the same loan conditions.
sources: http://www.pp.u-tokyo.ac.jp/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/GraSPP-DP-E-14-003-SOM.pdf, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); https://www.dropbox.com/s/vults7c3kv89j45/BU_PITCH_ENGLISH_2018.xlsx?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/vipk6unz6vz2z49/IJGlobal%20-%20Gondia%20Coal-Fired%20Project%20Additional%20Facility%20%283300MW%29%20-%20India.pdf?dl=0, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://www.business-standard.com/article/companies/adani-power-commissions-third-unit-of-660-mw-at-tiroda-113062000369_1.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.bv.com/Projects/Adani-Power-Maharashtra-Limited, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/energy/power/adani-power-set-to-commission-third-unit-in-tiroda-this-month/articleshow/19397774.cms, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.hindustantimes.com/india/three-units-of-adani-power-plant-in-maharashtra-operational/story-K2mSQn9VFB4xHva0Ma47tI.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.adanipower.com/businesses/operational-power-plants/tiroda, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
recipient_agencies: Adani Power, Private Sector

implementing_agencies: China Communications Construction Co., Ltd. (CCCC), State-owned Company
title: China-Pakistan Faqeer Primary School Project
description: On August 26 2016, Faqeer primary school opened up to 121 students. On September 1 2016, Nawaz Sharif, Prime Minister of Pakistan visited Gwadar for the school's inauguration, along with Chinese Ambassador Sun Weidong. On September 13 2016, Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan Sun Weidong visited the school. The Chinese Overseas Port HOlding Company (COPHC) donated books to help set up the school's library along with 380 school uniforms. The project is listed on CPEC website under the Gwadar project tab. The Chinese embassy website introduction to CPEC projects suggests that the project has a 0.399 million USD cost, covered by a Chinese government grant. The construction started in November 2015 and completed in September 2016. However, the exact commitment date is unclear.
sources: https://pk.chineseembassy.org/eng/zbgx/t1627110.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.cpecinfo.com/gwadar-port-city, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.dropbox.com/s/k2fbw5jdczjtj5g/Introduction%20to%20CPEC%20Project%20on%20Chinese%20Embassy%20Website%20in%20Pakistan%20September%202018.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China loans US$230m for new government buildings
description: According to the 2017 Bond Prospectus published by the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan, in August 2017 China agreed to loan Tajikistan 1.5 billion yuan (approx. US$230 million) to finance the building of a new parliament and government complex. On October 13 2018, Tajik President Emomali Rahmon and Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China Li Keqiang participated in the ground breaking ceremony. The main building of the parliamentary complex will be 49.7 meters high with a total area of 42,874 square meters. The governmental complex will be on fifteen story building and two thirteen story buildings with a total area of 10.27 hectares. STAFF_NOTE: loan details could not be found.

title: China EXIMbank loans $79m for the construction of 500 kV power transmission line
description: In September 2017, the government of Tajikistan signed an agreement with China's Exim bank for a79 million loan on preferential terms for the reconstruction of 500 kilowatt (KW) power transmission line. STAFF_NOTE: Another agreement reached at this time was a US$230 million loan to finance the building of a new parliament building, which is reported in project #53786.
