title: China offers scholarships to 15 students in Sri Lanka
description: In 2016, China offered scholarships to 15 Sri Lanka students to study in China. STAFF_NOTE: This project does not appear to be a duplicate of #53789.
sources: http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2016-07/28/c_135546544.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lk.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1385688.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 2 million rupees to Sri Lanka for establishment of Chinese Ambassador Scholarship (Linked to projects #53779 and #54019)
description:
In 2016, during the scholarship ceremony, Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka donated 2 million rupees to the Sri Lanka Ministry of Education for the establishment of the “Chinese Ambassador Scholarship” to fund 54 outstanding undergraduates in Sri Lankan universities this year.

Linked to projects #53779 (2017 scholarship) and #54019 (2018 scholarship).
sources: http://lk.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1385688.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lk.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1385688.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ft.lk/youthcareershigher-education/china-awards-15-scholarships-for-sri-lankan-students/30-557952, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://colombogazette.com/2016/07/28/china-grants-scholarships-to-15-sri-lankan-students/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ft.lk/news/22-Sri-Lankan-students-awarded-Chinese-Government-Full-Scholarship/56-661710, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates 500,000 rupees to Sri Lankan Svillaga Blind Children's Home
description: In March 2016, the Chinese Embassy donated 500,000 Sri Lankan rupees to the Svillaga Blind Children's Home near Colombo. It also donated some life and study necessities. The money will be used to improve the drainage system. The drainage system removes the breeding ground for mosquitoes and greatly reduces the risk of dengue fever in children.
sources: http://lk.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1347911.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates water quality testing equipment to Sri Lanka
description: In October 2015, the Chinese Academy of Sciences donated water quality analysis instruments worth Rs 22 million to Sri Lanka for the study of unexplained chronic kidney disease affecting the nation's farming population. The equipment was donated during a meeting of the Chinese delegation with the Sri Lankan officials in Colombo.
sources: http://english.cas.cn/newsroom/news/201511/t20151102_155015.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lk.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1308597.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China granted 80 refrigerated car to Turkmenistan
description: In February 2017, the 80 refrigerated cars were given to Turkmenistan by Xi Jinpin, the Chairman of PRC, as a gift. The refrigerated cars were ordered by Ministry of Commerce of PRC, produced by Yutong Heavy Industries, and shipped by General Logistics Company.
sources: http://tm.chineseembassy.org/chn/zgtx/t1426284.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://hbclgq.com/indu-news/60.html, Other; http://www.gentrans.com.cn/news/content.asp?id=1487, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

title: China donates school supplies to Kazakhstan
description: In May 2017, China donated school supplies to the Hadong people in Kazakhstan. Ambassador Zhang Hanhui met with Anhusai, President of the Association of East Asian People in Kazakhstan in Astana. Through the association, China donated money and 500 sets of textbooks including 2,500 teaching books and 500 reading pens to the Hadong people. The books are meant to teach Chinese to schoolchildren.
sources: http://kz.china-embassy.org/chn/sgxx/sgdt/t1459151.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Harbin Electric International Co., Ltd., State-owned Company
title: China Eximbank loans 558.73 Million USD to 1223 MW Balloki RLNG Project [non-CPEC; IPP]
description: National Power Parks Management Company Limited and Harbin Electric International Company Limited completed the construction of a Regasified Liquefied Natural Gas Power Project (RLNG) on July 30, 2018. The project is located in Balloki, District Kasur in the Province of Punjab, Pakistan, with an installed capacity of 1223.106MW. National Power Parks Management Company (Private) Limited is a private limited company, wholly owned by Government of Pakistan and incorporated under the Companies Ordinance 1984 on 2nd March 2015 with an objective to set up two RLNG based power projects on fast track basis at Balloki, Kasur and at Haveli Bahadur Shah, Jhang in the Province of Punjab. Harbin Electric International Company Limited is the Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) contractor for the project. According to a Generation Tariff Determination document issued by Pakistan's National Electric Power Regulatory Authority (NEPRA) on August 9 2016, the total project cost is 798.183 million USD. The same document reported that funds have been provided under Cash Development Loan (CDL) In accordance with the approvals of Cabinet Committee on Energy (CCoE) and Executive Committee of National Economic Council (ECNEC), but a decision has been taken to finance the cost of the Project on a debt to equity ratio of 70:30 with loan provided at 3-month KIBOR plus 3% floating mark-up rate. The financing arrangement is reportedly in line with the government's objective to sell down the project to the private sector, which requires the Project to be commercially attractive and financially viable. There is a minimum equity requirement of 20%. According to NEPRA, the EPC contractor of this project is a Joint Venture of Harbin Electric International and Habib Rafiq (Pvt.) Ltd, selected after an International Competitive Bidding process. It also indicates that Sinosure provides insurance for the project. The 70% debt component amounts to 558.73 million USD. According to the IMF, this will be funded by China EximBank, with a loan of interest rate 9.35%, repayment period of 10 years and grace period of 30 months. The 30% equity component will be provided for by the Federal Government. For the purpose of this project record, only the 70% debt component value has been recorded.
sources: http://www.nepra.org.pk/Tariff/IPPs/NPPMCL%20-%20Balloki/TRF-359%20NPPMCL%20Determination%2009-08-2016%2010954-10956.PDF, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.genewsroom.com/press-releases/nppmcl-hei-ge-announce-completion-balloki-power-plant-284451, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.pips.gov.pk/sites/default/files/PIPS%20Parliamentary%20Research%20Digest%20November%202017.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/bd1mi9adzm3o4e3/Pakistan_IMF_Project_List_December_2017.xlsx?dl=0, Academic Journal Article

implementing_agencies: China Harbour Engineering Co., Ltd., State-owned Company
title: China grants 62.24M yuan to Sri Lanka for extending fishery harbors
description: In 2010, China Harbour Engineering began work on the extension of fishery harbour projects in Sri Lanka at a cost of 62.24 million yuan. In 2011, the construction was finished. This project is an extension from a series of Chinese aid to Sri Lanka in response to the 2007 Sri Lanka floods.
sources: http://lk.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201106/20110607593427.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides aid for two middle schools damaged by earthquake in Nepal
description:
In May 2017, the Chinese Government announced it would provide grant funding for the reconstruction of two middle schools  that were damaged during the 2015 earthquake in Nepal: Bhairav Secondary School in Rainas Municipality, Lamjung district, Province 4 and the Shree Ratna Rajya Secondary School in Bramhachi VDC-9 within Sindhupalchok District.  TIbet Jinlong Construction Engineering Co. LTD. served as the general contractor for the project. China Tibet International Economic Service Center served as the project management agency. Guangzhou Wanan Construction Supervision Co.. LTD. served as the project supervision company. Architectual Reconnaissance and Design Institute of Tibet served as the project design company.  Construction began on May 22, 2017 and ended on December 10, 2019. These two schools can accommodate 1,046 full-time students and 130 faculty members. Shree Ratna Rajya Secondary School alone can accommodate 630 students. Bhairav Secondary School consists of a four-storey building with 68 rooms including classrooms, science and computer labs, library, art and music rooms, canteen and hostels for students and teachers. It can accommodate 416 students. Solar lights have been installed at different parts of the school area while a basketball court and parking area have also been constructed. The Chinese Government provided a grant worth approximately 810 million Nepali rupees for the reconstruction of the Shree Ratna Rajya Secondary School and a grant worth approximately 830 million Nepali rupees for the reconstruction of the Bhairav Secondary School. Therefore, we have set grant commitment estimate to 1.64 billion Nepali rupees. Staff Note: Bhairav Secondary School is sometimes referred to as Bhairab Secondary School. For a third Chinese Government grant-financed school reconstruction project, see Project ID #53719.

The Bhairab Secondary School is located in a village in Rainas Municipality, Lamjung district, Province 4. Shree Ratna Rajya Secondary School is located in Bramhachi VDC-9 within Sindhupalchok District.
sources: http://www.chinanews.com/gj/2017/05-22/8230854.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201705/20170502582409.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides 1 million USD material aid to Afghanistan
description: On October 5, 2004, China granted official equipment and sports supplies to Afghanistan. The grant worths 1 million US dollar. It includes 400 personal computers, 300 printers, 70 copiers, television, bicycles, soccers, basketballs, sports outfits. The delivery ceremony is held in Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs. This project should not be confused with i #34514, as the delivery date and content is different.

description: In April 2005, during the Afghan Vice President visit to China, China agreed to provide an assortment of items to Afghanistan's legislature. The aid was worth1 million. It includes a CCTV system, 24 cameras, 20 jeeps, 20 pickup trucks, and kitchen utensils. It is not known if a specific Chinese organization or agency was responsible for procuring and giving the donation. The handover ceremony was held on November 9

implementing_agencies: World Food Program (WFP), Multilateral
title: China grans $1m USD to WFP to assist FATA (linked to #54372)
description: In November 2017, the 'China South-South Cooperation Assistance Fund' provided1 million USD to the World Food Program in order to support humanitarian initiatives in Pakistan's Federally Administered Tribal Area (FATA). This donation will enable food and nutrition assistance to an estimated 158,000 vulnerable and displaced people. This is the first project supported by the fund. The second is a4m USD initiative to provide housing and commodity assistance, as well as help with the rebuilding of schools in the region.

title: China provides 10 million yuan in material aid to Afghanistan earthquake relief
description: In October 2015 in response to an earthquake, China provided 10 million Chinese yuan in emergency material aid to Afghanistan and announced that Vice Chairman Li Yuanchao would provide an additional 1 million USD in cash assistance. The material aid was delivered to Afghanistan in November 3, 2015. The earthquake relief materials include 300 tents, 20,000 blankets and 60 generators. STAFF_NOTE: This project records just the 10 million RMB.

title: China commits a buyer's credit of USD 203.25 million to Pakistan for Lahore Orange Line Metro Train project (Linked to project #37280 and #54420)
description:
The Government Pakistan first announced its interest in pursuing a project to develop a city-wide train system in the eastern city of Lahore on April 27, 2011. Lahore, the capital of Punjab province, is Pakistan’s most populous and prosperous province. It is home to more than 5 million people. Pakistani officials expected the new transport system, the first of its kind in the country, to substantially decrease road traffic. Then, on April 20, 2015, a commercial contract for the Lahore Orange Line Metro Train Project: was signed between Punjab Mass Transit Authority (PMA) and CR-NORINCO [a joint venture of China State Railway Group Co. Ltd. (CR) and China North Industries Corporation (NORINCO)]. 

Shortly thereafter, on December 21, 2015, the China Eximbank and the Government of Pakistan signed three separate loan agreements for the Lahore Orange Line Metro Train Project: a $203.25 million buyer’s credit loan (BCL) agreement, a $1,235,480,000 preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) agreement, and an RMB 1,200,000,000 government concessional loan (GCL) loan agreement. The BCL (Project ID#53820 and loan ID#BC-OLL-2015) has a 5.2% interest rate and a 20 year maturity. The PBC (Project ID#37280 and loan ID#PBC-OLL15-34377) has a 20 year maturity and an unknown interest rate. The GCL (Project ID#54420 and loan ID#GCL-OLL15-20559) has a 2% interest rate and a 20 year maturity. According to the Government of Pakistan’s Economic Affairs Division, $672.7 million of this “mixed credit” from China Eximbank had been disbursed as of June 30, 2017.  

The Lahore Orange Line Metro Train Project involved the construction of a 27km two-lane metro bus corridor runs through the heart of Lahore along Multan Road, McLeod Road, and GT Road. Upon completion, the Orange Metro Line was expected to have capacity for 30,000 passenger per hour and  serve 250,000 passengers per day. CR-NORINCO — a joint venture of China State Railway Group Co. Ltd. (CR) and China North Industries Corporation (NORINCO) — was the entity responsible for project implementation. The project was initially expected to begin by the end of 2014, last for 27 months, and conclude in 2018. However, it encountered various delays.   

The Lahore Development Authority began marking sites for demolition in August 2015, including government buildings, royal tombs, mosques, schools, and residences. Civil works were then initiated by CN-NORINCO on October 25, 2015.  Popular protests  prompted the Lahore high court to suspend work surrounding heritage sites in January 2016 while the court deliberated the issue. Then, in August 2016, the Lahore high court ruled that the government could not evict people or harm the heritage sites. The Punjab provincial government challenged the ruling, and in April 2017, the Supreme Court reversed its decision, allowing construction to continue under 31 conditions to limit the disruption and damage of the project.  This project was ultimately completed on December 10, 2019. 

Staff Note: The Chinese project title is 巴基斯坦拉合尔轨道交通“橙线”项目.

implementing_agencies: Pakistan National Highway Authority, Government Agency
title: CPEC Project Wangu Hills - Khuzdar (M-8) Construction
description: According to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance, in 2013 the Pakistan NHA and CPEC began a project to build on the Ratodero - Gwadar Motorway (M-8) section at Wangu Hills, Khuzdar to improve East-West connectivity. The section is 113 km and is part of the Eastern alignment. A source about CPEC route details found in March of 2019 during Stage 2 research lists this section as complete.
sources: https://sites.google.com/site/pakinfodata/cpec/cpecroute, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.finance.gov.pk/survey/chapters_18/13-Transport_and_Communications.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: China State Construction Engineering Corporation (CSCEC), State-owned Company; Housing Development Corporation Ltd. (HDC), State-owned Company
title: HDC Hulhumale Development Phase II - 7000 housing units
description: On August 14th, 2017, the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) loaned 368.9 million USD (5,681,060,000 MVR) to the Housing Development Corporation (HDC) for the construction of 7,000 apartments in Hulhumale, which falls under the Maldives Housing Development Corporation's plan to build 15,000 housing units in Hulhumale (Hulhumale Development Phase II). The total project cost for the 7,000 housing unit development is 434 million USD, and Credit Suisse will provide the remaining 65.1 million USD. ICBC granted the loan to be paid within 15 years, with an interest less than four percent. At the end of September 2018, the disbursed outstanding debt was 209,076,877 USD. The project is being implemented by Maldives' state owned HDC and state owned China State Construction Engineering Corp. The total construction area is 451,900 square meters and the project includes 16 high-rise (25 story) buildings. The 7,000 social housing flats will measure 550 square feet each, featuring two bedrooms and two bathrooms. All construction materials such as steel and cement will be transported from China. As of November 20, 2017, the contractor had started the construction. The project is slated to be completed in 2019. The main difference between this project and another 2500 unit housing project in Hulhumale Phase II (see project ID #54276) is that the proposed buildings for the 2500 housing unit project are all 15-17 stories high, while this 7000 housing unit project includes buildings of 25 stories high (see p. 4 of EIA document).

title: China provides 37 million PKR for Establishment of Geodetic Datum of Pakistan
description: A Pakistani government project status report in May 2017-18 records the project. China provides financing of 34.374 million PKR for the project 'Establishment of Geodetic Datum of Pakistan.' The executing agency is noted as Defense. Commitment year and project status are both uncertain. According to a Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2016/17, Letter of Exchange signed on 13th May, 2017. Implementation agreement yet to be signed. The committed amount is CNY99.9 million. This is much larger than the 34 million rupees amount mentioned above. According to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates of Foreign Assistance for 2017-2018, the revised budget predicted 0 funds for that year, indicating that likely no funds were disbursed in 2016-2017 for the project. Pakistan estimates Chinese loan to the project to be 34.374 million Pakistani rupees in 2017-2018. According to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates of Foreign Assistance for 2017-2018, the revised budget estimate for 2018/9 is 18.197 million Pakistani Rupees, meaning that the project had not started construction as of 2017. No further information has been found. The sources above all document the project amount and specify the funding type as loan, but no other source could confirm this; for now, flow type is coded as vague. STAFF_NOTE: as the purpose of the project is military, for now crs sector is coded as unallocated and intent as representational.
sources: http://www.ead.gov.pk/frmDetails.aspx, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/Estimates_of_Foreign_Assistance_2018_19.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/Estimates_of_Foreign_Assistant_2017_18.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Final%20PCP%20Year%20Book%202016-17%20.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China Commits to Give Uniforms worth US$150,000 to Uzbekistan's Police
description: In February 2015, the Ministry of Public Security of China signed an agreement to provide uniforms (summer and winter clothing) to Uzbekistan's Ministry of Internal Affairs' policemen for a total amount of USD$150,000.
sources: http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201502/20150200888013.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC), State-owned Company
title: CDB provides $85 million loan for Mubarek Gas Chemical Complex Project
description: China Development Bank loaned85 million USD for the construction of a propanebutane mixing unit at the Mubarek Gas Processing Plant. In September 2014, it was reported that China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC) participated in the construction of Mubarek Natural Gas Processing Plant, a gas chemical complex created in the Kashkadarya (also spelled as Qashqadaryo) region of Uzbekistan. The project has a total cost of about2.5 billion. The plant is expected to produce 492,000 tons of polyethylene, 66,000 tons of condensate gas and tonnes of pyrolized petroleum a year. In May 2012, Uzbekneftegaz and Indorama Group (Singapore) established a joint venture based on the Mubarek Natural Gas Processing Plant (UzIndoramaGasChemical). CNPC signed a MOU with this joint venture in September of 2013 in order to participate in the gas chemical project, but their involvement became official in 2014. It is expected that each of the three involved companies will own 33.3% of the shares, although funding may also be secured from a loan from the Fund for Reconstruction and Development of Uzbekistan. The project was expected to begin construction in 2015, and will last 3 years.
sources: https://mfa.uz/en/press/news/2015/09/5230/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201407/20140700651148.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201309/20130900320535.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com/world/2014-09/11/c_126972947_2.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.uzbekembassy.org/userfiles/files/files/Fund%20of%20Reconstruction%20and%20Develpment.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.uzdaily.com/articles-id-24758.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.aucconline.com/news.php?news_id=512, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.afghannewsagency.com/en/News/163126/1392-6-26/2013-52-17/CNPC-to-join-joint-venture-on-gas-complex-construction-in-Uzbekistan-worth-$25-billion, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.uzdaily.com/articles-id-28260.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: China National Logging Corporation (CNLC), State-owned Company; China National Oil and Gas Exploration and Development Corporation (CNODC), State-owned Company; China Petroleum Engineering & Construction Corporation (CPECC), State-owned Company; New Silk Road Oil and Gas Company Ltd, Private Sector; Uzbekneftegaz, State-owned Company; XIBU Drilling Engineering Company Ltd., State-owned Company
title: China Finances Development of Three Gas-Condensate Fields in Uzbekistan for 377.5 million USD (Linked to #54069, #39659, and #39658)
description: In 2017, the Chinese National Petroleum Company (CNPC) and Uzbekneftegaz began developing three gas condensate fields in the Bukhara-Khiva region of Uzbekistan (Dengizkul, Kojadavlat, and Sharky Alat) for 377.5 million USD. The project is funded by a loan agreement with the Bank of China, under the guarantee of the CNPC. When the three fields are developed, they will produce 869.6 million cubic meters of natural gas for exportation and 6,400 tons of gas condensate for domestic markets annually. The project was scheduled to begin in 2014, but construction began on May 30th, 2017. The project will be implemented by three CNPC subsidiary companies: China Petroleum Engineering & Construction Corporation (CPECC) will develop the fields, designs, logistics, construction, and commissioning of facilities for the project; XIBU Drilling Engineering Company Ltd. will drill 10 production wells; and China National Logging Corporation will repair 6 wells and test production wells. In December 2017, the New Silk Road Oil and Gas Company Ltd (NSROG) founded as a joint venture by the CNPC and Uzbekneftegaz to oversee the project, started gas production in the Dengizkul field after the drilling of 2 new wells and repairing of 3 wells. NSROG announced that the Kojadavlat and Sharky Alat, specifically the 8 new wells and 3 damaged wells within these fields, were still under construction. A projected end date for the project has not been announced; however, construction was still occurring in September 2018. Leading up to the 2017 development of these fields, the China National Oil and Gas Exploration and Development (CNODC), a subsidiary of CNPC, conducted a 5 year geologic oil survey for 359 million USD in 2006 (#54069), drilled 13 exploratory wells worth 260.2 million USD in 2011 (#39659), and 14.9 million USD for further oil exploration in 2012 (#39658). STAFF_NOTE: Spelling was a little different in each source for site names, specifically Sharky Alat vs. Sharqiy Alat and Dengizkul vs. Khojasayat (the name of the overall region). Role of the JV unclear as Chinese companies both funded and implemented the project. Terms of the loan are unclear.

title: China provides two Urban Infrastructure Development Packages worth of USD300 million to AJK region in Pakistan
description: According to a Pakistan Finance Ministry Monthly Disbursement report from Aug 2016, China provided two Urban Infrastructure Development Packages to the AJK region in Pakistan, respectively worth of USD143.90 million and 156.20 million, in the form of Public Buyer's Credit. Only an extremely small proportion of these amounts were actually disbursed that month. The source also records the start date as 18.06.2009 and the end date 31.12.2016. Project should have been completed but no relevant information is found in stage 1. STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to a Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2016/17, the project is listed in the category of completed projects with a transaction amount of USD300 million. Changed the project status to completion. STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape The Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16 records the project with a combined committed amount of USD300 million and a fulfilled part of 206.5 million. STAFF_NOTE: NOV 27 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape The Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimate of Foreign Assistance for 2015-2016 states the revised budget estimate halfway through the fiscal year for the project in 2014-2015 is 3,566.450 million Pakistani rupees in addition to 3,859.500 million Pakistani rupees for the same project. The Estimate for 2016-2017 predicts the revised budget estimate for Chinese loans to the project to be 3,048.850 million Pakistani rupees for 2015-2016. The Estimates of Foreign Assistance for 2017-2018 records the revised budget estimate for the two packages in FY 2016/17 to be 6,394.08 rupees, or 90.22 million USD, approximately the remainder of the funds. The budget estimate for FY 17/18 is 0.

description: The Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates of Foreign Assistance for 2017-2018 suggests that despite earlier promises, the funding had not been disbursed by the Chinese side as of the end of 2017, and that no funding is planned for the year 2017-18.

implementing_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Public Health, Government Agency
title: China provides aids to Afghanistan Ministry of Health for H1N1
description: From September 23, 2010, to December 20, 2017, China provided 1,327,333 USD to Afghanistan to support fighting against the H1N1 virus. The fund was distributed to Afghanistan Ministry of Public Health. It is used to provide good and services, as well as the acquisition of assets. The yearly contribution is shown below: March, 22, 2013: 704,713 USD October 13, 2014: 295,287 USD October 8, 2015: 295,287 USD September 24, 2016: 32,046 USD DAD platform referral code: AFG/370623; Old referral code: AFG/0011504 STAFF_NOTE: No other details regarding the use of these aids could be found during stage 2. Project 34583 could possibly be a part of this project. However the 1 million aid in project 34583 was pledged in 2010 and the earliest distribution of this project was on 2013. Project 34581 could also have intersections with this project since the agreement reported in 34581 was made on 2010 and mentioned aids in health and medical sectors.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/ttwe1lxhfyzo0c2/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20of%20Afghanistan%20DAD%20China%20Project%20Data.xlsx?dl=0, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/cu75mmi3ek8d6sc/Flat%20Export%20of%20Geocoded%20Afghanistan%20DAD%20from%202014.xlsx?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://dadafghanistan.gov.af/de/frame.jsp?src=/de/deView.faces?sessionid=154258875818446093&MasterID=1&SubModuleID=1&Hierarchy=A1_RT_OP_PROJECT&UserID=13&iLanguageID=1&jsf_sequence=1&projectid=11504&beansKey=154258875818446093_1542590291717, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/qycggbgg4kj6shl/Afghanistan%20DAD%20Project%20370623.pdf?dl=0, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government Agency; Afghanistan Ministry of the Interior, Government Agency
title: China provides Afghanistan 13 million Yuan for emergency assistance and uniforms
description: In 2002, China provides 13 million Chinese Yuan (equivalent to 4 million USD) to Afghanistan for emergency assistance as well as other aids. The fund was delivered in March 2002. The fund was used deliver medical supplies, stationary (80,000 pieces) and uniforms for the army (50,000 pieces) and police (20,000 pieces), 30 computers to Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Part of the medicine was utilized in the north during the crises of Nahreen Earthquake. The fund is fully disbursed and used by 2006. DAD platform referral code: DAD/000357. STAFF_NOTE: This Project is not affiliated to #34498 because the transaction amounts and currency are separate.

title: China provides a USD 15 million loan for Procurement of Machinary for rehabilitation of Irrigation Infrastructure in Sindh Pakistan
description: The Executive Committee of National Economic Council (ECNEC) of Pakistan approved the project on 16-08-2012 and Commercial Contract has been signed by Government of Sindh with Chinese Company. The documents have been sent to Exim Bank, China for further action. According to the Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16, on a request of Government of Sindh, EAD forwarded loan application for Preferential Buyers Credit to finance the project to Exim Bank China. According to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates of Foreign Assistance for 2015-2016, and of 2016-2017, no disbursement had been made by the end of 2017.

implementing_agencies: Harbin Electric International Co., Ltd., State-owned Company
title: EXIM Bank provides USD 464 million loan for the 747 MW Guddu Combined Cycle Project
description: On September 20, 2009, Pakistan Electric Power Company (PEPCO) and Harbin Power Engineering (HPE) sighed a contract for a 747 MW Combined Cycle Project at Guddu Power Company. The project is expected to have a net efficiency of 54.5 percent. HPE has been involved in other power projects in Pakistan, and will be using size 9-FA gas turbines from General Electric USA. In June 2012, Harbin reportedly completed 50 percent of the project, but top management voiced concerns over employee's safety after fighting between tribal groups. The officials at Pakistan's Ministry of Water and Power wanted the project to be completed in June 2013. China Exim Bank is providing a credit of464 million backed by Chinese insurance company Sinosure. The government of Pakistan already provided40 million USD to Sinosure. The total cost of the 747 Guddu project stands at550 million. A Pakistani ministry of finance government project status report - disbursement report in April from 2015-2016 records the project as a loan of a committed amount of 464.08 million USD. The project has a start date of 23.12.2011 and an end date of 23.12.2015. The report suggests that 71.25 million of the total loan was fulfilled. STAFF_NOTE: Monthly Disbursement Report states executing agency as Wapda Power. Listed under 'fin' tab of source.
sources: http://forum.pakistanidefence.com/index.php?showtopic=68105&page=6, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ead.gov.pk/ead/userfiles1/file/EAD/Publication/Monthly%20report_xls%20July-%20June%202013-14.xls, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://pk2.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/chinanews/200909/20090906530825.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/frmDetails.aspx, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Huawei Company, Private Sector
title: China Development Bank gives a loan to Uzbekistan to purchase Huawei's equipments
description: In 2007, 'Aloqabank' or 'Aloqa' bank used a loan from the China Development Bank to purchase communication equipment from Huawei, an independent Chinese telecommunications company. The total contract value was US$21.28 million, and includes 70 mobile phone base stations installed in 9 regions with a total capacity of 40,000 gates; 36 data transmission systems with a total capacity of 100,000 ports; and 124,000 NGN network devices and 5.56 million ports of C&C08 type digital communication station equipment. Aloqabank is an Uzbek banking and financial services company. The purchased equipment was loaned to the Uzbek Telecom Company with principal interest. STAFF_NOTE: transaction amount was not coded since it is unclear how much of the contract value will be covered by the loan from CDB.
sources: http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/200702/20070204410859.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Chinese project forms relief fund For Sri Lankan flood and landslide victims
description: The China-funded Colombo Port City Project distributed relief items to thousands of people affected by floods through a relief campaign, 'Port City Sahana,' in 2016. The types of items donated were not listed.

implementing_agencies: Anhui Construction Engineering Group, Private Sector
title: China provides additional facilities to a School and Hospital in Baffa, Pakistan (Linked to project #55836)
description: In 2006, China agreed to build for Pakistan a Baffa Tehsil Headquarters Hospital (THQ Baffa) and Government Higher Secondary School Baffa (GHSS Baffa), in District Baffa, Mansehra, and started construction in 2012. In 2015, the Chinese government will provide Rs 94 million additional funds to Earthquake Reconstruction, Rehabilitation Authority to upgrade the buildings with additional facilities and equipment. The MoU was signed on 21-11-2014. The up-gradations include a Waste Water Treatment Unit, Medical Waste Burning Facility (Hospital), Drainage for the hospital, Provision for Voltage Stabiliser in hospital and provision for Voltage Stabiliser in school. The construction contract was signed on 2015-12-18. Construction began in 2015. The implementing agency is Anhui Construction Engineering Group, a Chinese company. The project has finished and the handover ceremony was held on 2017-11-02. According to a Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2016/17, the project cost is 5.8 million RMB, which is roughly the equivalent of the Rs94 million mentioned above. STAFF_NOTE: For details of the construction of the original buildings, see project #55836.
sources: http://pk.mofcom.gov.cn/article/todayheader/201711/20171102664540.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://fp.brecorder.com/2015/12/201512221257985/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Final%20PCP%20Year%20Book%202016-17%20.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Website%20Year%20Book%202015-2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/ead/userfiles1/file/Trainings/Website%20Year%20Book%202014--15.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ztb365.cn/xm/info-27610.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://pk.mofcom.gov.cn/article/todayheader/201512/20151201216312.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides a CNY95 million Grant of Police Pickups, Ambulances for Hospitals and Office Equipment to Pakistan
description: STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to the Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16, China fulfilled a grant worth of 95 million Chinese Yuan for Police Pickups, Ambulances for Hospitals and Office Equipment for Capacity Building of EAD. The Hand-over certificate was signed on 09-06-2016 in Islamabad. The Letter of Exchange for this project was signed on 20-04-2015. There are two similar projects created but the commitment years were significantly earlier (Refer to 53524 and 38777).

description: In 2016, it was reported that China and Sri Lanka had developed a Marine and Coastal Zone Joint Research Center.

title: China agrees to feasibility study for Municipal Solid Waste Treatment and Recycling in Maldives
description: On December 8, 2017, the Government of Maldives and the Government of China engaged in a signing ceremony at the Great Hall of People in Beijing, witnessed by President Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom and President Xi Jinping. They exchanged a Letter of Feasibility Study on the China-Aid Municipal Solid Waste Treatment and Recycling Project. STAFF_NOTE: The extent to which China will support this joint project is unclear. As of March 2019, it is difficult to find additional information beyond the Maldives Ministry of Foreign Affairs article, as well as a Twitter post from the MFA.
sources: https://foreign.gov.mv/index.php/en/mediacentre/news/4289-key-agreements-signed-between-the-maldives-and-china, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://twitter.com/MDVForeign/status/938787246399832064, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs

title: China pledges to build a joint ocean observation station
description: On December 8, 2017, China and Maldives signed an agreement to establish a Joint Ocean Observation Station between the State Oceanic Administration of China and the Ministry of Environment and Energy of Maldives. The agreement was signed by the Minister of Foreign Affairs, H.E. Dr Mohamed Asim and Administrator of State Oceanic Administration, Wang Hong. The station will be built at Makunudhoo Island in the Maldives and is purely for ocean observation and not a military application or submarine base as previously reported and believed.
sources: https://foreign.gov.mv/index.php/en/mediacentre/news/4289-key-agreements-signed-between-the-maldives-and-china, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/defence/chinas-ocean-observation-station-at-maldives-not-a-submarine-base-chinese-media/articleshow/63114532.cms, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: Ministry of Economy of Uzbekistan, Government Agency; Xinjiang Silu Changlong Investment Co., Ltd, Private Sector
title: China's Exim Bank Loans to Create Food Transport Center in Bukhara (Linked to #54125)
description: In 2016, China's Xinjiang Silu Changlong Investment Co., Ltd committed to implementing, with the Ministry of Economy of Uzbekistan, a food transport center in Bukhara, Uzbekistan for the production, processing, and exportation of agricultural products. Total foreign financing will be28.7 million; news sources report that this consists of investment by Xinjiang Silu Changlong Investment Co., Ltd. (project #54125) and a loan from the Eximbank of China, captured in this project. The breakdown of this financing is unclear. For the purpose of this project,28.7 million has been coded as the transaction amount for the linked project, so as not to be double counted. The project will include a modern logistics center; 2 plants for processing of fruits, vegetables, meat and dairy products; a factory for the production of cardboard and plastic boxes; 4 refrigerators; energy efficient green houses; plant orchards using intensive technologies; and 20 refrigerated MAN trucks. The initial capacity of the project will be 10,000 products annually, and all fruits & vegetables will be exported.
sources: https://www.producereport.com/article/uzbekistan-china-broaden-cooperation-agriculture, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.uzbekistanitalia.org/home/fiera-internazionale-dell-ortofrutta/uzbekistanhasshowcasedsunnyfruitsandvegetablestotheworld, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.lex.uz/docs/3835897, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=UZBDAY0020160718ec7i00031&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TCASIA0020160722ec7m00002&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TRENDE0020160719ec7j000jj&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

contacts: Tian Nan Jean, President (Xinjiang Silu Changlong Investment Co., Ltd)

implementing_agencies: China National Corporation for Technical Import and Export, State-owned Company
title: China Exim Bank agrees to finance Masalsky Mining and Processing Plant construction project
description: In May 2017, during Nazarbayev's visit to China, Massalsky Mining and Processing Plant LLP and China National Technical Import and Export Corporation ('CNTIC') signed two agreements for the construction of a mining and metallurgical complex at the Massalskoe titanium magnetite deposit in the Akmola region. It is planned that the complex will cover the entire value chain, from ore extraction to the production of high-quality steel grades. C1 and C2 reserves at the Massalskoe deposit amount to 729 million tonnes. In addition, Massalsky Mining and Processing Plant LLP and Exim Bank of China signed a framework agreement to finance the project, which cost 1.3 billion USD. In 2017, a feasibility study was performed on the construction site and was approved by Tau-Ken Samruk analysts. As of 2018, the funds from the Chinese EXIM bank are yet to be sent, and Tau-Ken Samruk describes the site as under design development, with an estimated completion year of 2025. Mazhit Turmagambetov, CEO of Tau-Ken Samruk JSC, commented during the signing ceremony: 'We want to produce our own high-quality steel, as currently Kazakhstan only imports the metal, bringing in around 1.5 million tonnes of steel annually. Our plant is not large by international standards, with an annual capacity of 940,000 tonnes. This is a new industry trend, because enterprises increasingly need to be flexible. They have to be ready to adapt at any moment and produce what is required by industry customers at any given time.' It is unclear whether China Exim Bank will finance the entire project cost, although Germany Trade & Invest reported that Exim Bank will finance 1,190 million USD in export credit, while Tau-Ken Samruk will finance 210 million USD. No other sources were found to substantiate this. STAFF_NOTE: This project is linked to ID #53932
sources: http://www.tks.kz/storage/07/07892d6afe6c1c0b744aeaab996cff5b.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.sasac.gov.cn/n2588025/n2588124/c4444351/content.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lenta.inform.kz/en/masalsky-iron-ore-field-plant-to-employ-7-000-people_a3026473, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.exim.gov/sites/default/files/reports/competitiveness_reports/2017/China%20Database%202017.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.minexforum.com/en/chinese-cntic-to-invest-to-massalsky-mining-and-processing-plant/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.tks.kz/storage/7d/7daf4e19a0230a48db7b0076035be418.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=DANWS00020150831eb8v001gw&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TASS000020150831eb8v000jt&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.sk.kz/press-centre/media/18006/?lang=en, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TASS000020150831eb8v000jt&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TRTRAN0020150915eb9f0000b&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: China Railway Group Ltd., State-owned Company
implementing_agencies: Astana LRT LLP, State-owned Company
title: China Development Bank finances construction of Astana Light Rail
description: On May 7 2015, China Railway Group Limited signed a EPC agreement with Astana LRT to construct the Astana Light Metro. Later in August 2015, the China Development Bank Chairman Hu Huaibang signed a financing agreement for not more than 1.6 billion USD loan to the transportation project. The funds borrowed were taken for 20 years at 2.5 % per anum. In May 2017 MOFCOM announced that construction of the Astana Light Rail Transportation system will begin that month, and the project is estimated to cost1.8 billion, with a final value varying on the construction process. Chinese contractors will be leading construction. The light rail system is expected to be completed within 2 years. The light rail system will have 18 stations, with a length of 22.4 km. It is unclear where the 0.2 billion increase in project cost was also covered by the CDB. STAFF_NOTE: This project is linked to ID #53932
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TASS000020150831eb8v000jt&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TASS000020150831eb8v000jt&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2015-09/01/content_21766084.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://astanatimes.com/2017/05/astana-to-begin-light-rail-system-construction-in-may/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://reconnectingasia.csis.org/database/projects/astana-light-rail/6be78a84-a65b-42e2-8a13-a3325cfe84fa/, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://unohrlls.org/custom-content/uploads/2018/10/LLDCs_Report_18_digital_Final.pdf, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.crecgi.com/?newshow/tp/222/id/165.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/article/i/jyjl/e/201705/20170502572935.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.gtai.de/GTAI/Navigation/DE/Trade/Maerkte/suche,t=china-weitet-engagement-in-kasachstan-aus,did=1806084.html, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

funding_agencies: China Export-Import Bank, State-owned Company
implementing_agencies: China National Machinery and Equipment Import & Export Corporation, State-owned Company
title: China's Exim Bank loans $17.3 million USD to Uzbekistan to supply housing stock with cold and hot water meters
description:
On April 30, 2007, China Eximbank and Ipoteka Bank signed a $17,293,502.35 preferential buyer's credit (PBC) loan agreement for the procurement of Chinese-produced residential hot and cold water meters. The loan carried an interest rate of 2%, a 5 year grace period, a 20 year maturity, a 0.3% commitment fee, and a 0.3% management fee. It is to be repaid semi-annually.  

A consortium consisting of China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation and II YAN is the contractor responsible for project implementation. The consortiium was contracted to provide more than 1 million hot and cold water meters to Uzbek public utilities and state local governments, and will be responsible for the installation of water meters. These water meters were to be installed in bungalows and buildings in Tashkent and other states. 

Staff Note: The Russian name of the project is «Оснащение жилищного фонда Республики Узбекистан приборами учета холодной и горячей воды».
sources: http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/200705/20070504634630.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/project-document/64787/42489-uzb-rrp.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.ipotekabank.uz/upload/Ipoteka_bank_2017%20Report%20and%20Opinion_ENG%20with%20sign.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.unece.org/fileadmin/DAM/hlm/documents/Publications/CP_Uzbekistan_withCorr.EN.pdf, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy

funding_agencies: China Ministry of Finance, Government Agency
title: China grants RMB 10 million emergency humanitarian relief to Tajikistan
description: On July 23, 2015, Chinese Foreign Minister of China Wang Yi pledged to provide emergency humanitarian relief to Tajikistan during the meeting with his Tajik counterpart Sirojiddin Aslov. Constant high temperature since July caused glaciers to melt, leading to severe landslides in Tajikistan and causing serious casualties. On August 5, the Department of Foreign Assistance of MOFCOM delivered Tajikistan RMB10 million relief.
sources: http://sydney.chineseconsulate.org/chn//zgxw/t1283525.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://english.mofcom.gov.cn/article/newsrelease/significantnews/201508/20150801075452.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=CEASEN0020150724eb7o000jk&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency
title: Ustyurt Natural Gas and Petrochemicals Complex at Surgil Gas Field
description: In May 2012, a consortium of banks including the China Development Bank signed a2.54 billion finance deal with Uzbekneftegaz for the Ustiurt gas-chemical complex (Ustyurt gas-chemical complex), which was completed in September of 2015 (ahead of schedule). The project will have a total value of4 billion and the mega-project will be based in the Surgil Gas field. The complex will consist of a gas separation plant, units producing 400,000 tonnes per year of high-density polyethylene, 100,000 tonnes of polypropylene, and 110,000 tonnes of pryolised gasoline beginning in 2016. Uz-Kor Gas, the project SPV, is a joint venture between Uzbekneftegaz and Kor-Uz, a consortium of Korean firms. Based on information from IJGlobal Project Finance & Infrastructure Journal, the project's debt-equity ratio is about 65:35, with the debt portion amounting to USD 2.539 billion. China Development Bank is providing about 10% of the debt portion at a value of USD 250 million with a maturity of 16 years. For the purpose of this project, only the USD 250 million loan from CDB has been recorded. The breakdown of the remaining 90% of the debt portion is as follows: 1. USD 700 million (28%) from Export-Import Bank of Korea 2. USD 125 million (5%) from Asian Development Bank 3. USD 800 million (31%) from a KSure covered tranche loan. Under this tranche loan, USD 500 million came from Korea Finance Corporation, USD 225 million from Korea Development Bank, USD 25 million from ING Group, and USD 50 million from Credit Suisse. 4. USD 100 million (4%) from National Bank of Uzbekistan 5. USD 300 million (12%) from a Kexim covered tranche loan. Under this tranche loan, USD 75 million came from Korea Development Bank, USD 75 million from ING Group, USD 25 million from Credit Suisse, USD 75 million from Siemens Financial Services, USD 10 million from BayernLB, and USD 40 million from SEK. 6. USD 140 million (6%) from an EKN covered tranche loan. Under this tranche loan, USD 60 million came from Nordea, USD 60 million from ING Group, and USD 20 million from SEK. 7. USD 124 million (5%) from a Hermes covered tranche loan. Under this tranche loan, USD 64 million came from KfW and USD 60 million from BayernLB. The equity portion of this project's financing amounts to USD 1.4 billion, and the investors are as follows: Uzbekneftegaz (50%), Lotte Chemical Corporation (17.5%), Korea Gas Corporation (17.5%), SK Group (5%), STX (5%) and LG Corporation (5%).
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/hospffehxhlnbr4/AACqO6vuNw0ylFmRHN675S_6a?dl=0&preview=IJGlobal+-+Surgil+Petrochemical+and+Natural+Gas+Complex+financing+-+Uzbekistan.pdf, Academic Journal Article; https://www.reuters.com/article/gas-uzbekistan-loan/uzbekistan-gets-2-54-bln-in-loans-for-gas-project-idUSL5E8GL2JQ20120521, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://af.reuters.com/article/commoditiesNews/idAFL4N11M27W20150916, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://parliamentrk.gov.uz/ru/news/234/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://ijglobal.com/Articles/77873, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); https://www.oxfordenergy.org/wpcms/wp-content/uploads/2012/12/NG_69.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.aucconline.com/news.php?news_id=567, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.uz-kor.com/index.php/en/about, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China Grants 8100 USD to Maldives Autism Association (linked to #52447)
description: In August 2016, the Chinese embassy in Maldives granted 8,100 USD (MVR 124,902) to a school run by the Maldives Autism Association. The money will be used to fund therapy, make fee settlements for children who are unable to pay, and give teachers their salary. In October 2016, the Chinese embassy donated 19 computers to the Autism Association (#52447).
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=MIADMD0020160823ec8n00002&cat=a&ep=ASE , Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://en.sun.mv/39248, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://mv.chineseembassy.org/eng/sgsd/t1391249.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Ifhaam Hussain, Managing Director, Autism Association

implementing_agencies: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency; Nepal Ministry of Culture, Tourism, and Civil Aviation, Government Agency
title: China Provides Language Training to Nepalese Tourism Professionals (linked #53705)
description: On March 23, 2016, China agreed to provide Chinese language training for 200 Nepalese tourism professionals within 5 years. The project aimed at boosting Nepal's tourism industry because based on data in 2017, China was the largest tourism source market for Nepal. The Chinese Language Training Course for Nepali Tourism Professionals was organized by the Chinese Embassy and Ministry of Culture, Tourism and Civil Aviation of Nepal. The project started in July, 2017, and as of November, 2018, the third course had been held. The project is in progress. STAFF_NOTE: This project is linked to a human resources training agreement (#53705) signed at the same time.
sources: http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2018-11/27/c_137635349_2.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020160323ec3n007kf&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://travelnewsnepal.com/10836/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2018-11/27/c_137635349.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Nepal Ministry of Culture, Tourism, and Civil Aviation, Government Agency

implementing_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Agriculture, Government Agency
title: China Grants 8.5 million USD of Agricultural Equipment to Afghanistan's Ministry of Agriculture
description: On August 25th, 2015, Chinese Ambassador Deng Xijun granted 300 tractors and agricultural equipment worth 8.5 million USD to Assadullah Zamir, Minister of Agriculture, Irrigation, and Livestock, in a handover ceremony. China additionally sent 10 experts to teach Afghani how to use the machinery with the goal of improving productivity, through the mechanization of agriculture, to reach self-sufficiency. On November 8th, 2016, Afghanistan's High Economic Council decided to distribute the machinery to private seed companies, agricultural cooperatives, and mechanized agricultural stations. Distribution depends on each company's debt status and accordance to legislative standards. As of Jan 4th, 2018, all machinery has been handed over to Afghanistan as of August 2015, but it is unclear whether the machinery has been distributed internally within Afghanistan. STAFF_NOTE: Initial article indicated that these tractors may be related to International NGO ChinaAid, but further research suggested that the agricultural equipment originated from the Chinese government.
sources: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WOTMkyOapLI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201501/20150100879514.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.afghanistantimes.af/china-donates-300-tractors-to-mail/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.bakhtarnews.com.af/eng/politics/item/25894-hec-holds-session.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://bakhtarnews.com.af/eng/business/item/18763-china-donates-300-tractors-to-afghanistan.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sjofHAPB22I, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PARALL0020150902eb91000ha&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Agriculture, Government Agency
contacts: Assadullah Zamir, Minister (Afghanistan Ministry of Agriculture); Deng Xijun, Ambassador (China)

funding_agencies: Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS),
implementing_agencies: Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Tajikistan, Government Agency; Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS),
title: Chinese Academy of Sciences opens a joint ecology and environment research center in Tajikistan
description:
On September 13, 2014, Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS) signed an agreement on scientific cooperation with Academy of Sciences of Tajikistan on the construction of Tajik branch of the Dushanbe Research Center for Ecology and Environment of Central Asia  according to Asia-Plus. The center was jointly built by CAS and the Tajik Academy of Sciences, and dealt with the ecological environment, geology, and physics (see '驻塔吉克斯坦大使岳斌参观中亚生态与环境杜尚别研究中心'). The opening ceremony of the center was held on August 29, 2016, according to Asia-Plus. The main objective of the center is to 'conduct fundamental and applied research in the field of natural Sciences' (see '中科院中亚中心：古丝路遇上中国科技'). This center was the first joint scientific institution between Tajikistan and China, according to Asia-Plus.

STAFF_NOTE: The project is known in Chinese as '中国科学院中亚生态与环境研究中心塔吉克斯坦分中心'. According to the Research Center for Ecology and Environment of Central Asia, CAS provided $2 million dollars in research equipment to joint laboratories in Central Asia, including a joint laboratory for geology and mineralogy in Tajikistan, which is probably this. However, if it's not clear if each lab received $2 million dollars in equipment, or if the combined value of equipment spread across the three labs was $2 million, so the coder did not code a transaction amount.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASIPLU0020160831ec8v00008&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.sciencenet.cn/htmlnews/2016/8/354766.shtm, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
recipient_agencies: Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Tajikistan, Government Agency

funding_agencies: China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency; Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: China EXIM Bank and CDB RMB denominated loan to Appolo Solar Development Pakistan Limited 100 MW solar power project (Linked to Project #50939 and #54287) (CPEC, IPP)
description: Appolo Solar Development Pakistan Limited (ASDPL) is a 100 MW Solar PV power plant located at Quaid-e-Azam Solar Park at Lal Sohanra in Cholistan, District Bahawalpur in the Province of Punjab. On June 27 2015 ASDPL signed Engineering, Procurement, Construction contracts with China First Metallurgical Group Co. Ltd and with MCC Ruba International Construction Company (Pvt) Ltd to build, own and operate a 100 MW AC Solar powered electric generation facility to be located at Bahawalpur, Punjab. On October 16, 2015 the company signed a Term Facility Agreement (TFA) with the Export-Import bank of China ('EXIM bank') and China Development Bank. The Company achieved Financial Closing on November 6, 2015. The Commercial Operation Date of the project was May 31, 2016. Total project cost is 149.154 USD Million, with a Debt-Equity ratio 79:21. China Development Bank and the Export Import Bank of China provided 2 syndicated loans, one worth 400 Million RMB which is equivalent to 62.93 USD Million (interest rate 2.65%), and a loan denominated in USD which amounts to 62.6 USD Million (interest rate 4.96%). These loans make up the 79% debt component. This project records the RMB denominated loan. It is unclear how the equity component was financed.
sources: http://www.eximbank.gov.cn/aboutExim/annals/2015/201807/P020180712414684910260.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://nepra.org.pk/Tariff/IPPs/002%20Solar%20IPPs/Appolo%20Solar%20Development%20Pakistan%20Limited/TRF-316%20ASDPL%20COD%2018869-71%2016-11-2017.PDF, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: China Exim Bank USD Denominated loan to 100 MW Crest Energy Pakistan Limited Solar Power Plant at Quaid-e Azam Solar Park (Linked to Project #50939, #54283 and #54282) (CPEC, IPP)
description: Crest Energy Pakistan Limited (CEPL) is a 100 MW Solar PV power plant located at Quaid-e-Azam Solar Park at Lal Sohanra in Cholistan, District Bahawalpur in the Province of Punjab. CEPL signed Engineering, Procurement, Construction contracts with China First Metallurgical Group Co. Ltd. and MCC Ruba International Construction Company Pvt. Ltd. on June 27 2015 to build, own, and operate a 100 MW AC Solar powered electric generation facility in the Solar Park. The cumulative EPC contract value is 984 Million RMB. On December 21 2015 CEPL signed a Term Facility Agreement with China EXIM Bank and China Bohai Co Limited. Financial closure was reached on December 28 2015. The Commercial Operations Date for this CEPL Solar Power plant was July 31 2016. The total project cost is 149.457 USD Million, with a Debt-Equity ratio of 75:25. China EXIM Bank made 2 loans to CEPL - one denominated in RMB worth 100 Million (equivalent to 15.196 million USD) and another one denominated in USD, worth 40.810 Million USD. China Bohai Bank made 1 loan to CEPL, denominated in USD and worth 56.190 million USD. These two loans make up the 75% debt component of the overall project. The interest rate for Exim Bank's RMB denominated loan is 2.65%. The Interest rate for Exim Bank's USD denominated loan is 5.6916%, and the interest rate for China Bohai Bank's loan is 5.0958%. This projects records the USD denominated loan from China EXIM bank. It is unclear how the equity component was financed.
sources: http://nepra.org.pk/Tariff/IPPs/002%20Solar%20IPPs/Crest%20Energy%20Pakistan%20Limited/2017/TRF-318%20CEPL%20COD%2018875-77%2016-11-2017.PDF, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.nepra.org.pk/Licences/Generation/RE-2006/Crest%20Energy%20Solar/LAG-294%20CREST%20ENERGY%20PL%20GENERATION%20LIC%2030-06-2015%209851-57.PDF , Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: China EXIM Bank USD loan to Best Green Energy Pakistan Limited 100 MW solar power project (Linked to Project #50939, #54285 and #54286) (CPEC, IPP)
description: Best Green Energy Pakistan Limited (BGEPL) is a 100 MW Solar PV power plant located at Quaid-e-Azam Solar Park at Lal Sohanra in Cholistan, District Bahawalpur in the Province of Punjab. BGEPL later signed Engineering, Procurement, Construction contracts with China First Metallurgical Group Co. Ltd and with MCC Ruba International Construction Company (Pvt) Ltd to build, own and operate a 100 MW AC Solar powered electric generation facility to be located at Bahawalpur, Punjab. On December 21, 2015 the company signed a Term Facility Agreement (TFA) with the Export-Import bank of China ('EXIM bank') and Bank of Jiangsu Co Limited. The Company achieved Financial Closing on Dec 28, 2015. The Commercial Operation Date of the project was July 31, 2016. Total project cost is 150.269 USD Million, with a debt-equity ratio of 81:19, China Eximbank gave 2 loans, one denominated in RMB worth 100 Million which amounts to 15.4 million USD (2.65% interest rate), and another denominated in USD worth 49.060 million USD (5.0058% interest rate). The Bank of Jiangsu gave 1 loan, denominated in USD which amounts to 64.440 (5.0958% interest rate). This projects records the USD denominated loan from China EXIM bank. It is unclear how the equity component was financed.
sources: https://nepra.org.pk/Tariff/IPPs/002%20Solar%20IPPs/Best%20Green%20Energy%20Pakistan%20Limited/2017/TRF-317%20BGEPL%20COD%2018683-65%2016-11-2017.PDF, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: China Railway First Survey and Design Institute Group Co., Ltd., State-owned Company; China Road and Bridge Corporation, State-owned Company
title: China Road and Bridge Corporation grants for reconstruction and repair of road between Kurgan-Tyube and Kulob
description: On December 27, 2017, China Road and Bridge Corporation finished the Phase II of Kurgan-Tyube and Kulob reconstruction and repair project in Tajikistan. The first phase of the project was already finished by 2016, which included 12 kilometers of roads in Kurgan-Tyube and Kulob and two automobile bridges in Kulob. The second phase included 22 kilometers on 15 streets and four bridges in Kurgan-Tyube and Kulob, and on December 19, the lauching ceremony of the Phase II took place. Construction started on December 28, and finished on December 15, 2017. The government of China granted 58.4 million Yuan and 59.6 million Yuan for the first and second phase of the project respectively, totaled 118 million Yuan. The project is supervised and managed by China Railway First Survey and Design Institute Group Co.,Ltd., and implemented by China Road and Bridge Corporation. STAFF_NOTE: The start and end date of construction in this project apply to Phase II. However, the transaction amount is the sum of both phases.
sources: http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/article/shangwubangzhu/201801/20180102701988.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TCASIA0020161220ecck00004&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://jjhzj.mofcom.gov.cn/article/y/201612/20161202319556.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.crbc.com:8426/site/crbc/274/info/2018/46881874.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

implementing_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Finance, Government Agency; Afghanistan Ministry of Urban Development and Housing, Government Agency
title: China grants 500 million yuan to Afghanistan for 10000 residential apartments in Kabul (Linked to Project #54451)
description: On November 3, 2015, Chinese Vice President Li Yuanchao and Afghan President Ashraf Ghani met and signed economic and technical cooperation agreements for China to grant the Afghan government 500 million yuan to build 10,000 residential apartments in Kabul. The affordable housing is for civil servants, specifically the families of deceased Afghan National Army, Afghan National Police, and National Security Forces personnel. This disbursement may be part of the agreement signed in 2014, which stated that China will provide Afghanistan 500 Million RMB of grant assistance every year from 2014-2017 (#54451). On May 16th, 2016, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang and Afghan Chief Executive Officer Abdullah Abdullah signed six bilateral cooperation documents, including an exchange note for a feasibility study on the construction of affordable home for government employees in Kabul. In March 2017, officials announced that the first phase of construction would include 1400 units the Old Darulaman Palace in Kabul. The Afghan Minister of Finance and the Chinese Ambassador signed an agreement to start the project in 2017. The next two phases are dependent on the success of the first. The project will be overseen by Afghanistan's Ministry of Urban Development and Housing. It is not known which Chinese contractor has been selected to implement the project, but the news articles did suggest that Afghan subcontractors will be used. This project is linked to two other technical agreements that were also signed on November 3, 2015: a grant of 1500 scholarships for Afghan students (#54038) and aid to help Afghanistan with Taliban peace talks (#54039).
