implementing_agencies: China Railway No.5 Engineering Group, State-owned Company
title: China Aided Kyrgyz Republic for a New Hospital Building
description:
In 2007, the Chinese Government provided a grant to the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic for the Bishkek Hospital Building Construction Project. This project involved the construction of a six-story urology and ophthalmology center — including an outpatient ward and an operating room — at the Republican Hospital in Bishkek. The total construction area was 5661.6 square meters and it added 150 beds to the existing capacity of the hospital. China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation and China Railway No. 5 Engineering Group Co., Ltd. were the contractors responsible for project implementation. A groundbreaking ceremony took place on June 9, 2011. Then, on July 2, 2013, a project completion ceremony took place. The hospital put to use on June 29, 2014. The new urology and ophthalmology  center was opened for use on June 29, 2014. 

Staff Note: The Chinese project title is 新建泌尿科医疗楼项目 or 立医院新建泌尿科医疗楼项目 or 吉尔吉斯斯坦项目国立医院新建医疗楼正 or 尔吉斯斯坦国立医院医疗楼项目. The Kyrgyz project title is Урология борборунун. The Russian project title is строительству нового здания лечебного корпуса Нацгоспиталя КР, or Научный центр урологии на базе Национального госпиталя Кыргызстана.
sources: http://www.ztwj.cn/ArtcleDetail.aspx?ID=236&cid=34, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://kg.china-embassy.org/chn/dssghd/t1055517.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

funding_agencies: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
title: Chinese Donation to Deaf-Mutism School
description: On November 19th 2014, the Ambassador of Kyrgyzstan, Qi Dayu, led the diplomat of the embassy to the Bishkek Deaf School to sympathize with the teachers and students of the school, and presented the children with computers, projectors, daily necessities, and books on Chinese history and culture.
sources: http://old.kabar.kg/eng/society/full/11484, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://kg.china-embassy.org/chn/dssghd/t1213131.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Power Construction Corporation of China Ltd,
title: China Aided Agriculture Irrigation Project
description: On September 11 2015, Qi Dayu, the ambassador to Kyrgyzstan, attended the signing ceremony for the exchange of documents of the Chinese government aided Kyrgyz agricultural irrigation project, and signed an exchange of letters with the Minister of Agriculture of the Ministry of Agriculture, Aidalyliev, on behalf of the two governments.The Chinese government will provide free aid for the construction and improvement of the nationwide irrigation facilities in Kyrgyzstan. The two sides exchanged views on deepening agricultural cooperation between the two countries. On May 2018, the construction for this project begins. The project is expected to bring benefits to more than 50 thousand people. Power Construction Corporation of China is responsible for the project.
sources: https://wenhui.whb.cn/zhuzhan/huanqiu/20180505/197057.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/web/gjhdq_676201/gj_676203/yz_676205/1206_676548/1206x2_676568/t1296126.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.powerchina.cn/art/2018/5/4/art_19_281328.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

title: China Grants 500 million yuan to Afghanistan for construction of Afghanistan International Exhibition Center in Kabul (linked to #54451)
description: Chief Executive of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan Abdullah Abdullah paid an official visit to China from 15-18 May 2016. In a joint statement released during the visit, it was stated that in 2016, the Chinese Government will provide RMB500 million of grants to the Afghan Government for the mutually agreed project of Afghanistan International Exhibition Center in Kabul. On the same day, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang and Afghan Chief Executive Officer Abdullah Abdullah signed six bilateral cooperation documents. Documents signed on this date include: a trade agreement for saffron, a Memorandum of Understanding on the nature of the One Belt One Road Initiative, an exchange note on the construction of the auditorium at Kabul university (#53635), an exchange note on a grant of 50 million yuan for non-emergency humanitarian aid (#53640), and an exchange note on China creating a survey for the construction of affordable housing for civil service employees in Kabul (#53999). This disbursement may be part of the agreement signed in 2014, which stated that China will provide Afghanistan 500 Million RMB of grant assistance every year from 2014-2017.
sources: http://fec.mofcom.gov.cn/article/gbdqzn/upload/afuhan.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=HNASNI0020160517ec5h000ry&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://prod.tolonews.com/afghanistan/afghanistan-china-sign-six-cooperation-agreements, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://ceo.gov.af/en/news/joint-statement-between-the-peoples-republic-of-china-and-the-islamic-republic-of-afghanistan, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020160518ec5i00899&cat=a&ep=ASE , Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/wxzl/t1392473.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=HNASNI0020160517ec5h000ry&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=RVESEN0020160517ec5h00clg&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency
title: HVDC project from Matiari To Lahore in Pakistan Debt component (Linked to project #53695) [CPEC]
description:
In 2018, China Development Bank provided a $1.326 billion loan to Pak Matiari-Lahore Transmission Company (Private) Limited — a special purpose vehicle — to build an 878 km power transmission line from Matiari, Sindh (South of Pakistan) to Nankana Sahib, Lahore (N Punjab). Pak Matiari-Lahore Transmission Company (Private) Limited will build a 660 kV, High Voltage Direct Current Line (HVDC) that transmits 4,000 MW of electricity from newly constructed Port Qasim, Hub, and Thar Coal power projects to the northern parts of Pakistan. The project will be built on Build, Own, Operate and Transfer (“BOOT”) basis based on an Independent Power Plant (“IPP”) structure. Once completed, this transmission line will become the backbone of Pakistan’s transmission network. 

China Electric Power Equipment and Technology (CET) is the project sponsor, which is a subsidiary of State Grid Corporation. The total cost of the project is around $1.66 billion and it is being financed with 80% debt and 20% equity. CDB is providing $1.326 billion of debt with insurance coverage from Sinosure. It is reportedly providing this debt on the following terms: 13 year maturity, 3 year grace period, an an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus a 4.5% margin. The overseas investment company of State Grid of China — State Grid International Engineering Limited — will provide approximately $332 million as the equity through 2 special purpose vehicles (SPVs). The project is guaranteed a 17% Internal Rate of Return (IRR) under a CPEC Cooperation agreement.  The commencement ceremony for this project took place on December 1, 2018.  The expected commercial operation date is March 01, 2021. 

STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese project title is  巴基斯坦默蒂亚里—拉合尔±660千伏直流输电工程
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/8csdpteq2a5b3lj/2016%20Government%20of%20Pakistan%20Bond%20Prospectus.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=IARPAK0020160604ec5v00001&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwiEz5jTuJzhAhWJON8KHQBpCqAQFjAAegQIBBAB&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dawn.com%2Fnews%2F1331080&usg=AOvVaw07ZWM0AdBbn6He9-Fcj8Aa, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.nepra.org.pk/Tariff/Transmission/TRF-351%20Determination%20Matiari%20%20%2018-08-2016%2011318-11321.PDF, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.nepra.org.pk/Licences/Licence%20Application/2017/6%20applications/Special%20Purpose%20Transmission%20License%20Application%20of%20Pak%20Matiari-Lahore.PDF, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.icap.org.pk/cpecconference/pdf/SalmanAminCPECNEPRA.pdf , Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.cpecinfo.com/energy-generation, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://cpec.gov.pk/project-details/17, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

title: [PD] China and India Initiates Annual Sino-India Think Tank Conference
description:
May 2015, China and India agree to start annual Sino-India Think Tank Conference. It will be held in each country in turn. The conference is established to enhance communication and increase mutual understanding. The India-China Think Tank Forum was established by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Xi Jinping during the Indian Prime Minister’s visit to China. The goal of this conference is to foster closer dialogue and mutual understanding between the two countries and to deliberate on contemporary issues of regional and international significance. The 2015 conference had two roundtable discussions: one on Indo-Chinese cooperation on global economic governance and another on how India and China could steer global financial markets. 

The Chinese delegation was led by Prof. Wang Weiguang, President of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences (CASS).  It is the first and the most comprehensive academic research organization in China for study in the fields of philosophy and social sciences and is central to policy-making in China. The transaction amount is unknown. 

Other project captures at the same source include institutionalizing Sino-India Media Summit (Code: 54021) and establishing Mahatma Gandhi (圣雄甘地) India Research Center in Fudan University.

STAFF_NOTE: The flow class and flow type were marked as vague because it is unclear if China will provide any financial flow to India.  The Chinese Academy of Social Sciences is affiliated with the State Council of China, so this project is listed as official finance.
sources: http://in.china-embassy.org/chn/zygx/zywx/t1264214.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.gatewayhouse.in/india-china-bilateral/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Wang Weiguang, CASS President

title: [PD] China and India establish Sino-India Communication Fund
description:
In 2006, China and India agree to start Sino-India Communication Funds (中印交流基金). The fund is established to enhance academic communication between both countries. The details of the fund will be decided in later communication.  It is unclear how China is funding this project and what financial value they have contributed.  It is unclear which organizations from China or India are involved in this project.

Quotes: 30、为进一步促进中印学术交流，双方同意推动建立 “中印交流基金”。基金的具体模式将通过双方磋商制定。
sources: http://in.china-embassy.org/chn/zygx/zywx/t738015.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Nalanda University, Academic, Training and Research
title: China Donates 1 Million USD to India for the Construction of Nalanda University
description: In 2010, Chinese Ambassador to India, Zhang Yan, announced that China will donate 1 million USD to Nalanda University (Nalanda Mahavihara) in Rajgir, India. Yan made the announcement after meeting Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. The donation aims to enhance cultural relations with India. In 2010, the Indian Parliament passed an act to establish the new Nalanda University in the image of the Nalanda University of ancient India. The funds will be used to build a Chinese-type library at the university. The project has been completed. It is unclear what branch of the Chinese government provided funding. The project is part of Sino-India culture communication initiative. As a part of the same cultural communication initiative, the government of India provided 4 million USD worth of technical, financial, and other support to build an Indian-style Buddhist Temple in Luoyang, Henan Province, China. The new temple sits adjacent to the 1st century White Horse Temple (Baima Si).

title: China Development Provides US$10 million for Uzbek Universities to join E-Education Network
description: In 2012, China Development Bank provided US$10 million to assist Uzbekistan's schools in joining the 'E-eduction network.' The funding was part of an overall loan of US$37.2 million for ICT projects in Uzbekistan (captured in project #53952).

implementing_agencies: Uztelecom JSC, Government Agency
title: China Development Bank loan to develop CDMA-450 mobile network, and implement FTTx fiber technology (linked to #53952)
description: In 2012, China Development Bank agreed to loan Uzbekistan's Uzbek Telecom (Uzbektelecom)107.6 million for the purpose of network expansion, developing the CDMA-450 mobile network, and implementation of FTTx fiber technology. The funds were sent in the second quarter of 2013, with which Uzbektelecom was expected to purchase implementation technology. These funds were also earmarked for overall network expansion and infrastructure improvements This project is linked to #53952. Only the confirmed costs for developing the CDMA-450 mobile network - US$18.19 million and implementing FTTx fiber technology US$9.01 million is recorded for this project. The project is also mentioned in China EXIM Bank annual report for 2016 (see attached exim source p.52); it is unclear how or whether China EXIM is financially involved.

title: China Grants 1500 Scholarships for Afghan Students (Linked to projects #53999 and #54039)
description: On November 3, 2015, China pledged to grant 1500 scholarships to Afghan students in 2016. Chinese Vice President Li Yuanchao signed the education cooperation agreement with Afghan President Ashraf Ghani during his visit in Afghanistan. According to Li, the scholarships will provide Afghan students with training in health service and education in China, and will facilitate the 'people to people exchange' between the two countries. Amount of the scholarships and status of this project remain unclear. This project is linked to two other technical agreements that were also signed on November 3, 2015: a 500 million Yuan grant for the construction of 10,000 apartments for civil servants in Kabul (#53999) and aid to help Afghanistan with Taliban peace talks (#54039). In Oct 1, 2016, it was reported that 150 scholarships had been granted. As of Feb 21, 2019, the completion status is unclear.

implementing_agencies: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
title: Chinese Embassy Supports Guldasta Sewing Center in Varzob District
description: On December 10, 2014 the Chinese embassy in Tajikistan assisted in the opening of the 'Guldasta' sewing center in teh Varzob District, located 25 km north of Tajikistan's capital. Zhao Syanzhun, wife of the Chinese Ambassador participated in the opening ceremony along with the chairman of the Varzob district and a representative from the People's Democratic Party. The embassy donated 20 sewing machines, scissors sets, irons, and other necessary equipment. STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese embassy press release specified that this is the second sewing training center donated to Tajikistan. The project needs to be distinguished from the first center that was transferred in June 2014 (project 54043).
sources: http://www.avesta.tj/eng/4732-chinese-embassy-supports-to-open-sewing-center-in-varzob-district.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://tj.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1218176.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Chinese Embassy Establishes Gulafshon Sewing Training Center
description:
In June 2014, the Chinese Embassy of Tajikistan helped to establish a sewing training center 'Gulafshon' in Dushanbe and employs 60 women.

On June 4, Zhao Xiangrong, the Chinese Ambassador to Tajikistan, attended the inauguration ceremony of the “Gulafushang” Women's Sewing Training Production Center. Others attending included Mr. Ratibov, Vice Chairman of the People’s Democratic Party of the People’s Republic of China, Kurbova, Vice Mayor of Dushanbe, Mrs. Sun Wei, the wife of the Political Counselor of the Embassy, and more than 100 representatives from the relevant departments of the tower and local women and children.

STAFF_NOTE: Transaction amount was not found. Coder decided that this is most likely a grant.
sources: http://www.avesta.tj/eng/4732-chinese-embassy-supports-to-open-sewing-center-in-varzob-district.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinanews.com/gn/2014/07-16/6391048.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://tj.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1162244.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

funding_agencies: China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Kazakhstan Development Bank, Government Agency
title: China Exim bank loans $884 million to Kazakhstan Development Bank for reconstruction of Atyrau Refinery under restricted portion of master loan facility (linked to project #54797)
description: In August 2009, China Export-Import Bank permitted the DBK to draw up to5 billion from a master facility agreement. This included an unrestricted1.5 billion loan to Kazakhstan Development Bank and a restricted3.5 billion. The agreement is for a period of up to 15 years. The agreement prohibits the DBK from incurring indebtedness exceeding 25% of its assets or disposing of over 25% of its assets. The restricted portion of the China Ex-im Bank Facility is aimed at the development of energy, transport and communication infrastructure and the funding of strategic projects in metallurgy, chemical and oil industries. The funds of this credit facility will be used for investment projects of Kazakhstan companies, including the exporting of industrial output, services and equipment to China. The facility's expansion was expected to be completed in 2015. Under the restricted portion of the China Ex-im Bank Facility, on 12 December 2009, DBK entered into an individual credit agreement with the Export-Import Bank of China for the amount of U.S.$884 million of which U.S.$874 million had been drawn as at 30 June 2017. This loan was granted for the purpose of providing financing for the reconstruction of the Atyrau Refinery and was amended on 19 December 2013, 8 May 2014 and 30 October 2014. This individual credit agreement matures on 21 July 2023. Principal and interest under this individual credit agreement is paid semi-annually. As at 30 June 2017, the principal amount outstanding under the restricted portion of the China Ex-im Bank Facility was U.S.$602 million. It is highly likely that this project was funded through the 3 billion USD restricted portion of a China Eximbank Master Loan Facility to the Development Bank of Kazakhstan, captured in #54797.
sources: http://kase.kz/files/emitters/BRKZ/brkzf4e6_2010_e.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.ogj.com/articles/2014/05/kazakhstan-lets-contract-for-atyrau-refinery.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://uc27e23b1ce40f2a8cf81e4d98b5.previews.dropboxusercontent.com/nativeprint?file=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dropbox.com%2Fs%2Fp22jt2pz5fawj2x%2FKazakhstan%25202012%2520Bond%2520Prospectus.pdf%3Fdisable_range%3D1%26from_native_print%3D1%26preview%3D1, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.reuters.com/article/oil-kazakhstan-china-idUSL5E8H667N20120606, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Kazakhstan Development Bank, Government Agency

title: China to train 200 Afghan professionals
description: In 2006, China announced to support Afghanistan's national reconstruction. The Chinese side will train 200 Afghan professionals in 2007 and 2008. A press release from a Chinese embassy in 2008 reported that China will continue to train Afghanistan professionals in various fields, but it is likely that China fulfilled its pledge to train 200 professionals. STAFF_NOTE: Unsure if a government agency was involved with providing training. Removed the scholarship section of this project because it would've been a duplicate of #53721.
sources: http://www.gov.cn/misc/2006-06/20/content_315724.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.chinaconsulatesf.org/eng/xw/t447642.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides natural disaster relief to Afghanistan
description: On March 9th, 2017, the Chinese government provided1 million in cash assistance to the UNHCR. The UNHCR also distributed winter supplies such as double-sided blankets and gas tanks to more than 330 refugee families. According to the relevant agreement, the UNHCR will carry out specific work on material procurement, transportation and distribution on behalf of the Chinese government, and follow-up aid materials will be distributed to the refugees. According to local media reports, since the winter of 2016, extreme weather has caused at least 239 people in the country to be killed, 214 people were injured, and more than 520 houses were destroyed. STAFF_NOTE: Can't verify the1 million cash assistance grant to the UNHCR, but can verify the aid items distributed by the UNHCR. Articles are unclear how the1 million grant was used, or if it was an evaluation of the aid donated to the UNHCR.
sources: http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-03/10/c_136118622.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//world/2017-03/10/c_1120603698.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: China Gezhouba Group Co. Ltd., State-owned Company; China National Machinery and Equipment Import & Export Corporation, State-owned Company
title: China Exim Bank second loan to 969 MW Neelum-Jhelum Hydroelectric Project (Linked to project #35266) (non-CPEC, IPP)
description: The Neelum-Jhelum Hydropower Project is a 969 MW run-of-the-river project in the State of Azad Jammu and Kashmir. The Water and Power Development Authority (WAPDA) claims that it is the largest hydropower project undertaken by WAPDA since the completion of Mangla, Tarbela and Ghazi Barotha Hydropower Projects. The Project is designed to divert the water from river Neelum through a tunnel. The tunnel intake is at Nauseri 41 Km North East of Muzaffarabad and the underground powerhouse is being constructed at Chatter Kalas, 22 Km South of Muzaffarabad. The diverted water will produce electric power by passing through the turbines and thereafter this water will be released back into the River Jhelum, about 4 Km South of ChatterKalas.The Project will produce 5.15 Billion units of electricity annually. Neelum Jhelum Hydropower Company Limited was created to design, construct, own, operate and maintain the Neelum Jhelum Hydropower Project. On 7 July 2007, the Chinese consortium CGGC-CMEC (Gezhouba Group and China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation) were awarded the contract to construct the dam and power station. The construction contract was settled at a cost of PKR 90.90 billion by the end of the year and in January 2008, the letter of commencement was issued. According to WAPDA, as of March 2018, 90%of the construction works have already been completed. According to a March 2018 Tariff Petition document issued by Neelum Jhelum Hydropower Company Limited to Pakistan National Electric Power Regulatory Authority (NEPRA), the total project cost of PKR 506,579 million is estimated to be funded based on a debt-equity-grant ratio of 79:9:11. The total debt component amounts to PKR 401,416 million, which is around 3823 USD million. According to the document, the debt portion consists of Foreign Relent Loans from GoP, cash development loans and local commercial financing. Foreign Relent Loans are raised by the Government of Pakistan and relent to NJHPC at a fixed rate set by Economic Affairs Division of Pakistan. Foreign Relent Loans received by NJHPC consist of Islamic Development Bank Loans IDB Istisna I &II of US$ 358 Million, China Exim Bank Loan I and II of US$ 1024 Million, Kuwait Fund for Arabic Economic Development KFD loan I and II of US$ 74 Million, Saudi Fund for Development SFD Loan I and II of US$ 181 Million and OPEC Fund for International Development OFID Loan I and II of US$ 81 Million. The equity will be injected by Water & Power Development Authority, who is the sole sponsor of Neelum Jhelum Hydropower Company Limited. The China Eximbank Loans are broken up into China Eximbank Loan 1 of 448 USD million and China Eximbank Loan 2 of 576 USD million. Both have a repayment period of 20 years and a grace period of 8 years, with an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR + 280 bps. As the relevant LIBOR interest rate was not explicitly identified in the document, the LIBOR rate at the time the project agreement was finalized or published would be used. As such, the 6 month LIBOR rate in March 2018 (2.32%) was used for the purpose of this project record. A interest rate of 5.12% is thus recorded. According to the Economic Affairs Division, as of 30th June 2017, the 448 USD million loan has been fully disbursed in the form of Preferential Buyer Credit, and 191.067 million USD of the 576 million USD loan has also been disbursed in the form of Preferential Buyer Credit. The same division also states that the 448 million USD loan was signed on 22 May 2013, and the 576 million USD loan was signed on 29 September 2016.

funding_agencies: China Export-Import Bank, State-owned Company
implementing_agencies: Tebian Electric Apparatus, Private Sector
title: Dushanbe CHP-2 (Phase I) (linked to project #46211)
description:
Dushanbe 2 is a combined heat and power plant (CHP) — also known as the Dushanbe-2 Thermal Power Plant (TPS-2) — that provides heat and electricity for the residents of Dushanbe. It only operates in the winter. The 400MW Dushanbe CHP-2 Construction Project required two phases. Phase 1 (mainly constructed between 2012-2014) installed a capacity of 100 MW, while Phase 2 (constructed between 2014-2016) installed an additional capacity of 300 MW. TBEA was the contractor responsible for implementation of both phases, according to the Diplomat. CHP-2 was to be fueled by coal, with the potential to switch to gas (see 'KEEPING WARM: Urban Heating Options in Tajikistan Summary Report'). According to State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission of the State Council, Inner Mongolia Electric Power Survey and Design Institute Co., Ltd. was the project designer for Phase 2. According to PowerChina, Hydro Electric Power System Engineering Company was also involved in the undertaking of Phase 2 of the project.

According to President of Tajikistan Emomali Rahmon as relayed by TBEA, the plant generates 9.6 million kWh power per day and 235 trillion Kcal heat, and provided nearly 700 stable jobs to Tajiks. 150 Tajikistan technicians went to China for training, and about 100 Tajikistan operators mastered professional know-how under the guidance of Chinese experts. According to Xinhua, the completed station met 60 percent of the power demand and enabled the restart of central heating for more than 700,000 Dushanbe residents after 15 years of suspension. The completion of the Dushanbe-2 thermal power station was also declared to be the solution to Tajikistan's long-existing issue of power shortages in winter.
 
On July 4, 2009, the Export-Import Bank of China and China Development Bank (CDB) provided a $30 million USD loan for Phase 1 of the 400MW Dushanbe CHP-2 Construction Project (see pg. 30 of 'Проект «Повышение синергетического эффекта национальных программ стран-членов СНГ по ЭЭ и энергосбережению для повышения их энергетической безопасности» Страновое иследование (Таджикистан)'). According to Trend News Agency, the project's financing was on a 50-50 basis by the two banks. For purposes of recording, this project only captures the $15 million USD from China Eximbank. For the China Development Bank contribution, please see linked project ID#71101. Other terms of this loan are unknown.

Then, in 2014, the Export-Import Bank of China provided two loans — an RMB 929,977,078 government concessional loan (GCL) (captured in project ID#46211) and a $178,969,220 USD preferential buyer’s credit loan (PBC) (captured in project ID#71137) for Phase 2 of the 400MW Dushanbe CHP-2 Construction Project (for the GCL loan amount, see pg. 87 of 'Program Appraisal Document on a Proposed Grant...'; for the PBC loan amount, see 'Information on existing state investment projects'). Both of these loans were ratified by the Tajik Parliament on January 14, 2015, according to a 1/14/2015 Sputnik article. 

The RMB loan was contracted with the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan and it carried the following terms: 25 year maturity, 11 year grace period, and 1.5% interest rate (see 'РАМОЧНОЕ СОГЛАШЕНИЕ между Правительством Китайской Народной Республики и Правительством Республики Таджикистан о предоставлении Китайской Народной Республикой Республике Таджикистан льготного кредита'). The PBC loan has a 20 year maturity, 9 year grace period, and 2% interest rate (see 'List of Chinese Government-Financed Projects in Tajikistan from the Ministry of Finance via the IMF May 2018'). The Government of Tajikistan contributed $17,443,400 USD (see 'Information on existing state investment projects'). In total, the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan contracted $331,058,220 USD of China Eximbank debt for Phase 2 of the 400MW Dushanbe CHP-2 Construction Project (see 'The May 2018 Flat Export from Tajikistan AIMS').

The Government of Tajikistan used the proceeds from the GCL and the PBC loan to on-lend to Open Joint Stock Holding Company (OHSHC) “Barqi Tojik” (see pg. 39 of 'Consolidated financial statements...(. OHSHC “Barqi Tojik” was a state-owned enterprise in Tajikistan responsible for the generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity and thermal energy (pg. 15 of 'Consolidated financial statements...').

The subsidiary GCL loan agreement (#TАJ 2014-028-2) was signed between Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan and OHSHC “Barqi Tojik” on December 18, 2014. It carried an interest rate of 5% and a maturity of 25 years. Its final maturity date was set to August 21, 2039. The subsidiary PBC loan agreement (#TАJ 2014-028-1) was also signed between Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan and OHSHC “Barqi Tojik” on December 18, 2014 and it carried an interest rate of 5% and a maturity of 20 years. Its final maturity date was set to June 21, 2034 (pg. 39 of 'Consolidated financial statements...').

According to the Economic and Commercial Counselor Office in Tajikistan, the first phase was scheduled to be completed and put into production before the celebration of the 20th anniversary of Tajik independence in 2011 (September 9th), and the second phase was scheduled to be completed in 2013. Phase 1 of the project began on September 8, 2009. According to the 11/11/2015 Sputnik article, Phase 1 was put into operation on November 10, 2014. Phase 2 of the project began on May 14, 2015, according to the 05/14/2015 Sputnik article. Phase 2 was completed on December 8, 2016, according to TBEA.

This power plant is located in Dushanbe. Its exact locational coordinates are available at http://globalenergyobservatory.org/geoid/41775.

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian project title is Душанбинская ТЭЦ-2. The $30 million loan from China Eximbank and China Development Bank may not have covered the full cost of Phase 1 of the project. In the Government of Tajikistan’s Aid Information Management System (AIMS), the project is referred to as 'Project of construction of second in succession construction of 'TPS-2' in Dushanbe.' Some sources suggest that major delays took place after Tajikistan contracted this loan on July 4, 2009. The ceremony for the beginning of the project was clearly on September 8, 2009, but it seems project construction did not begin in earnest until 2012, when TBEA agreed to “front” $178 million for the construction of Phase 1 by borrowing directly from China Eximbank, and, in turn, the Tajik government agreed to grant TBEA exclusive rights to explore and develop gold deposits at the Eastern Duoba mine and the Upper Kumarg mine (until TBEA could recoup its investment). The Tajik government also reportedly agreed to give TBEA the rights to further mining deposits (at an unidentified location) if the profit made from the gold deposits did not cover the cost of building the power plant. It is also important to note that the Economic and Commercial Office of the Chinese Embassy reported in 2009 that TBEA was to receive mining rights in return for the project, before this exchange took place. Please see the 'The Full Story Behind China's Gold Mine-Power Plant Swap in Tajikistan' article from the Diplomat for more information on this 'resource-for-infrastructure' deal.

description: In 2011, China's EXIM Bank continued to implement a loan of 200 million yuan to Turkmengaz. The commitment year of this loan is unclear. Turkmengaz will use the funds to purchase oil, gas, and pipeline equipment for their operations. implementing_agencies: United Nations Development Programme (UNDP),
title: China provides $4 million for Nepal Livelihood Recovery for Peace
description: On November 17, 2017, China provided Nepal with a cash donation of4 million to support Livelihood Recovery for Peace (LRP) project, which originally started in 2009. However, only3,810,139 has been disbursed so far. The project constructs peace buildings at the community level and brings marked improvements in the livelihoods of vulnerable, excluded, and economically deprived households and communities. According to its descriptions, it provides support to women empowerment and allows most deprived individuals to have more assets. This project has multiple donors, but here only China is recorded. This is also a part of earthquake assistance initiative. An undated article published by the UNDP has reported that the LRP project has made an impact in the affected communities.

title: China Development Bank Loans $30 million USD to Uzbekistan's Ipoteka Bank
description: On July 26th, 2017, China Development Bank loaned30 million USD to Uzbekistan's Ipoteka Bank over the period of 8 years. Loan payments are made semi-annually at an interest rate of 6M Libor+4% per annum. As of December 31st, 2017, the outstanding balance of the loan is UZS 52,106,489 thousand. Chairman of the board of Ipoteka bank said the loan resources will be directed to developing small businesses and private entrepreneurship in Uzbekistan, and to purchase modern equipment and tools. STAFF_NOTE: FEB 11 2019 The international 6M Libor rate in July 2017, 1.475%, was used to calculate interest rate.

implementing_agencies: Uzbekhydroenergo JSC, Government Agency
title: China's Exim Bank loans $240 million USD to Uzbekhydroenergo for Hydropower Plant plant on Pskem River
description: In November 2017, it was reported that China's Export-Import Bank would loan240 million to Uzbekhydroenergo for a hydropower plant on the Pskem River in the Bostanlyk district of the Tashkent region, Uzbekistan. The plant will cost a total of800 million USD, with remaining other funding coming from Uzbekistan. Design and survey works for the project began in mid-2017. The projected capacity of the plant will be 400 MW with an average annual output of 900 million kWh. Loan details are unknown.
sources: https://eurasianet.org/uzbekistan-plans-its-own-hydropower-plant, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.energycentral.com/news/new-largest-hpp-appear-uzbekistan-0, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: China Poly Group Corporation, State-owned Company
title: Tire Plant in 'Angren' Special Economic Zone
description: In August 2014, China Poly Group signed a contract with Uzbekistan National Chemical Company to oversee the engineering, procurement and construction of a USD 213.9 million tire plant in Special Economic Zone 'Angren', which would be partially funded by a USD 156.37 million loan from the Export-Import Bank of China. Construction began on August 28th, 2014 and was expected to last 34 months. The first tire was produced on trial on September 1st, 2017, and production gradually increased during the end of 2017. The project was officially completed on 25 July 2018. The plant's initial production capacity is 3 million car tires, 200,000 agricultural tires and 100,000 linear meters of conveyor belts for cleaning equipment per year. All production equipment and processes were sourced from China. Based on information provided from various sources including Tire Industry Research and Asaka Bank, the project's debt-equity ratio is about 70:30, with China Exim Bank funding the debt portion amounting to USD 156.37 million. The Fund for Reconstruction and Development of Uzbekistan, O'zimyosanoat, O'zavtosanoat, the Navoi Mining and Smelting Plant, and Almalyk Mining and Smelting Plant are funding the equity portion, although the breakdown of the USD 57.53 million equity portion is unclear. For the purpose of this project, only the USD 156.37 million loan from China Exim Bank has been recorded.

funding_agencies: China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency
title: China Development Bank signs $300 million Facility Agreement with Pakistan (Linked to project #50486, #54159)
description: According to a Monthly Disbursement Report from the Economic Affairs Division, on May 15 2017, China Development Bank signed an agreement for a project titled 'US1 Billion Term Facility' . However, only 300 million USD was eventually committed. The agreement was intended for Pakistan to continue to improve its foreign reserves holdings and other banking and macroeconomic conditions. According to the IMF, the loan has an interest rate of LIBOR rate (6 months) plus 3.02%, no grace period and a 3-year maturity period. Two other facility agreements have been signed by Chinese banks to help Pakistan with its balance of payments. Linked to project #50486, #54159.

description: On May 24 2017, Bank of China signed a facility agreement of 300 million USD with Pakistan in order for Pakistan to continue to improve its foreign reserves holdings and other banking and macroeconomic conditions. The loan has an interest rate of LIBOR 3 Months + 2.93%, no grace period and a 3-year maturity period. Two other loans have been made by Chinese banks as facility agreement to help Pakistan balance its payment account. Linked to project #50486, #54158.

implementing_agencies: Shanghai Construction Group General Co., State-owned Company
title: Maldives Ministry of Foreign Affairs 2005 building renovation (Linked to #54157)
description: In 2005, China committed a grant of 25.4 million MVR to Maldives' Ministry of Foreign Affairs for building renovation, according to the Maldives' 2007 and 2008 Government Budget reports. 24.7 million MVR was disbursed in 2005, and 0.7 million MVR was disbursed in 2006. Shanghai Construction Group was contracted for this project. This is linked to a 2018 Chinese financed renovation of the Maldives' Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Project #54157).
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/15hzodv2yvzgrs3/Maldives%20Budget%20in%20Statistics%202008.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjb_663304/zzjg_663340/yzs_663350/gjlb_663354/2737_663478/2739_663482/t190336.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/z9wz821gh8ab4rp/Maldvies%20Budget%20in%20Statistics%202007.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides 30m yuan worth of supplies for earthquake relief (linked to #53542)
description: Sep 25, 2013, the Chinese government decided to provide emergency relief assistance to the Pakistani government for earthquake aftermath. The assistance includes1.5 million USD (captured in project 53542) and supplies worth 30 million yuan. On September 29, the first batch of materials arrived in Pakistan. A 7.7 magnitude earthquake hit Pakistan's southwest province, leaving at least 348 people dead.
sources: http://www.gov.cn/gzdt/2013-09/26/content_2495661.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://fts.unocha.org/flows/108988?destination=donors/2976/flows/2013%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://news.ifeng.com/mil/2/detail_2013_09/29/29981257_0.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://reliefweb.int/report/pakistan/china-offers-earthquake-assistance-pakistan, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/article/ae/ai/201309/20130900328301.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides USD1.6 million grant for CPEC Emergency Medical Center in Gwadar, Pakistan [BRI]
description: The Chinese Embassy website's introduction to CPEC projects records that China provided a 1.6 million USD government grant for the construction of an emergency medical center in Gwadar district, Balochistan. On May 7, 2017, the construction completed and the emergency medical center started operation. This project is reported by the Chinese Red Cross Foundation as part of the Belt and Road Initiative and co-building the China-Pakistan Life Rescue Corridor, which is financed by the Belt & Road Fraternity Fund. This project is the first China-Pakistan Life Rescue Corridor project. infrastructure, equipment, and personnel of the China-Pakistan Fraternity Emergency Care Centre After completion of construction, Chinese Red Cross Foundation sent the first medical team of 12 people, including medical experts from Huashan Hospital of Fudan University and Beijing Red Cross 999 Emergency Rescue Centre as well as RCSC project personnel. This medical team will take a half-year rotation, and the second medical team will go to Pakistan for rotation at the end of April 2018. The second medical team consists of nine people, including medical experts from Huashan Hospital of Fudan University, Obstetrics and Gynaecology Hospital of Fudan University, and the Beijing Red Cross Emergency Rescue Centre as well as CRCF coordinators.
sources: https://www.dawn.com/news/1331742, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.crcf.org.cn/sys/html/lm_13/2018-01-11/104208.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/k2fbw5jdczjtj5g/Introduction%20to%20CPEC%20Project%20on%20Chinese%20Embassy%20Website%20in%20Pakistan%20September%202018.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://tribune.com.pk/story/1692588/1-gwadar-chinese-red-cross-set-emergency-care-unit-quetta/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Chinese Government, Government Agency
title: China grants $1 Million Aid to Nepal for Flood Response (linked to #53718)
description: On August 15, 2017, Chinese Vice-Premier Wang Yang agreed to provide1 million humanitarian assistance aid to help repair regions affected by landslides and floods in Nepal. The agreement was signed during Wang's visit in Nepal, but it is unclear which branch of the Chinese government will provide the funding. More than 110 people were killed by landslides and flooding in Nepal. This project is now complete. In November 2017, China provided an additional grant of4 million, described in project #53718
sources: https://www.livemint.com/Politics/3I7pQdjUSs3B7GUVyIvFHO/Nepal-floods-China-announces-1-million-assistance.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2018-02/04/c_136948779.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=SCMCOM0020170816ed8g0005x&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=HNTM000020170816ed8g004v5&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinanews.com/gn/2018/03-26/8476344.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1525344.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Sichuan Provincal Government, Government Agency
title: China's 20-person Medical Team Provides Free Medical Service in Nepal (linked to #38574)
description: On December 10, 2017, a 20-member medical team from Sichuan Province of China launched a week-long health camp in Dhulikhel of Nepal. The team claimed to be providing free medical services on orthopedics, diabetes, hypertension and respiratory diseases for the local people of Nepal. The team, led by the Deputy Inspector of Sichuan provincial foreign affairs office had 17 doctors. The team also served in the humanitarian assistance project in 2015 following an earthquake in Nepal #38574.
sources: https://health.economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/industry/hyderabad-womens-group-pitches-for-ban-on-unsafe-abortions/68407990, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=XNHA000020171211edcb000ul&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: Chinese Navy, Government Agency
title: Chinese Navy donates supplies to Sri Lanka for relief assistance after floods and landslides
description: On May 31, 2017, the Chinese Navy provided relief assistance and supplies to Sri Lanka after floods and landslides caused by Tropical Cyclone Mora. Three Chinese Navy ships, Changchun, Jingzhou, and Chaohu arrived in the Port of Colombo, bringing 1 metric ton of rice, 1 ton of flour, 10 inflatable rubber boats, 300 boxes of bottled water, instant noodles as well as various medical equipment and supplies. On June 1, the fleet dispatched a 16-member medical team to provide services in 2 allocations sites. The team treated 508 local people affected by the disaster. According to Shen Hao, the fleet commander, the fleet was originally on a 4-day visit to Sri Lanka. They changed the plan and did the best to gather supplies immediately after being informed of the floods.
sources: https://www.chinadailyhk.com/articles/10/106/248/1496393463204.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://eng.mod.gov.cn/services/2017-06/05/content_4782108.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/1049533.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-06/01/c_136331636.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Chinese Government,
implementing_agencies: Maldives Ministry of Youth and Sports, Government Agency
title: China Donated USD 22,700 to Youth and Sports Ministry of Maldives
description: On September 19, 2017, China donated USD 22,700 to the Youth and Sports Ministry of Maldives for the development of the Maldivian sports industry. The funds will be used to procure equipment for sports associations across the Maldives islands. The Chinese ambassador to the Maldives and the Maldivian Sports Minister attended the ceremony in Male, Maldives.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=MIADMD0020170920ed9j00005&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://edition.mv/sports/4238, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Maldives Ministry of Youth and Sports, Government Agency

title: China donates 2,752 tons of rice to Sri Lanka for drought relief
description: In 2017, China agreed to donate 2,752 tons of rice to Sri Lanka drought victims. In November of 2017, the first 1000 tons of this rice were delivered. The second 1,000 tons was delivered in December 2017. The remaining 752 tons reached Colombo in late December. It was received by the Disaster Management Ministry in Colombo. The drought is considered the worst in 40 years due to delay of monsoonal rains and has affected over 1 million people in 11 districts.
sources: https://gain.fas.usda.gov/Recent%20GAIN%20Publications/Grain%20and%20Feed%20Update_Beijing_China%20-%20Peoples%20Republic%20of_2-1-2018.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-12/11/c_136817807.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-12/11/c_136817807.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

implementing_agencies: Kyrgyz Ministry of Health, Government Agency
title: China Finances Telecommunication Installation at 15 Medical Facilities in Kyrgyzstan
description: In July 2017, the Chinese government granted computers for the installation of a video telecommunications network for 15 medical facilities in Kyrgyzstan. To implement this project, the Chinese government provided computers and network equipment to the Kyrgyz medical facilities. The Urumqi government of the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region agreed to the installation in accordance with the Cross-Border Remote Medical Services on the Silk Road Platform.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNHA000020170717ed7h000b5&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.silkroad.news.cn/2017/0720/41380.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://kabar.kg/eng/news/china-equips-with-video-communication-equipment-15-medical-institutions-in-kyrgyzstan/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201806/10/WS5b1c84cba31001b82571f1fc.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Kyrgyz Ministry of Health, Government Agency

implementing_agencies: China Railway No. 5 Engineering Group Co. Ltd, ; Kyrgyzstan Ministry of Transport and Roads, Government Agency
title: Bank of China offers bank guarantee for the Bishek-Kara-Balta road in Kyrgyzstan
description: In 2017, the Hunan Branch of the Bank of China agreed to give a bank guarantee to renovate the section of road between Bishkek-Kara-Balta, however details of this arrangement are unclear. The Kyrgyz Ministry of Transport and Roads offered70,239,899 to China Railway No. 5 Engineering Group Co. for three years to implement. The project was funded by the Asia Development Bank as part of a larger sum for the implementation of this road of100 million ($65 million in loans and35 million granted). As of March 8, 2019, the project was delayed but being implemented.
sources: http://kabar.kg/eng/news/bishkek-kara-balta-road-will-be-rehabilitated-by-china-railway/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=CEASEN0020170331ed3v0008e&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/project-document/177568/45169-001-iee-05.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/linked-documents/45169-001-ieeab.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://akipress.com/news:617081/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Dongfang Electric, State-owned Company; State Electric Company Ltd. (STELCO), Government Agency
title: 5th Power Development Project
description: On December 27th, 2016, China's Export-Import Bank loaned75,395,226 USD to the Maldives' State Electric Company (STELCO) for the 5th Power Development Project. As of the end of September 2018, the disbursed Outstanding Debt was55,860,790 USD. The project includes the installation of six 8.9 MW diesel generators, and the plant will eventually have the capacity to generate 50 MW of power to Male', Mulule' and Hulhumale' via the Sina-Male' Bridge (the China Maldives Friendship Bridge). This will be the largest power project in Maldives, funded by a loan from EXIM Bank to STELCO and contracted to Dongfang Electric International Corporation. The project commenced implementation in February 2017. According to Dongfang's website, the first unit of the Fifth Power Development Project was successfully synchronized on January 18th, 2019, and according to STELCO the Fifth Power Project would begin functioning in April 2019. As of June 2019, it is unclear whether or not the project has been completed. The loan details are not specified in available resources.
sources: https://maldivestimes.com/the-practical-works-of-stelcos-5th-power-development-project-commences/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.finance.gov.mv/public/attachments/bKVqiwaAFFIKAdPnendZWq8Gvuqo42NcaIFUk0eV.xlsx, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.stelco.com.mv/archives/5882, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.dongfang.com.cn/index.php?s=/Home/Article/detail/id/1173.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://psmnews.mv/en/20955, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/dl/gbdqzn/upload/maerdaifu.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: State Electric Company Ltd. (STELCO), Government Agency

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: China Communications Construction Co., Ltd. (CCCC), State-owned Company
title: Irufen Island Resort Project
description: On 14 December 2017, China's Export-Import Bank signed a 127.5 million USD loan agreement with Ahmed Siyam Holdings Pvt Ltd for the Irufen Island Resort Project. China Communications Construction Company was contracted in late January 2016 to implement the project. The resort will be the biggest in the Maldives with 509 rooms. At the end of September 2018, the disbursed outstanding debt was 42,061,601 USD. The project appears to be in implementation because the Maldives Ministry of Finance reported disbursement of a portion of the loan funds, but the current status of the project is unclear. The loan details are not specified in available documents.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/cy74ftfszlxbq7y/FT%20February%202019%20The%20Maldives%20counts%20the%20cost%20of%20its%20debts%20to%20China%20%7C%20Financial%20Times.pdf?dl=0, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.ccccltd.cn/investorrelations/announcement/201601/P020160127488263466574.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://mv.chineseembassy.org/eng/sgsd/t1337332.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjb_663304/zwjg_665342/zwbd_665378/t1337333.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.mv/public/attachments/bKVqiwaAFFIKAdPnendZWq8Gvuqo42NcaIFUk0eV.xlsx, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

funding_agencies: China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Housing Development Corporation Ltd. (HDC), State-owned Company
title: CDB provides $159 million USD loan for Housing Development Project Phase III - Development of 1530 Housing Units in Hulhumalé
description:
On November 21, 2017, China Development Bank provided a $159,000,000 USD loan to the Housing Development Corporation (HDC) (a state-owned enterprise in the Maldives) for Housing Development Project Phase III - Development of 1530 Housing Units in Hulhumalé. The Government of Maldives provided a sovereign guarantee for this loan. As of the end of September 2018, $42 million USD had been disbursed (see 'Government Guaranteed Debt').

On November 9, 2015, China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC) and the Maldivian Ministry of Housing and Infrastructure signed an EPC contract for the project, according to a 2015 CMEC web article. According to a November 9, 2015 press release, CMEC, as the general contractor, was to design, procure, and construct the project on a turnkey basis. The value of the contract amounted to approximately $187.5 million USD, and the construction period was expected to last for approximately 24 months upon the commencement of the construction. On July 14, 2017, CDB and HDC signed the loan contract on the project, witnessed by CMEC, according to a 2017 CMEC web article.

According to Yicai Global, CMEC began work on the project on November 18, 2017, after a groundbreaking ceremony attended by Maldives President Abdulla Yameen. The construction was ongoing as of early March 2019, according to CMEC's website.

According to Yicai Global, this project, in conjunction with an ICBC-funded project (see Project ID#53832), sought to increase public housing by 8,500 units on Hulhumalé, the second largest island of the Maldives, and improve the crowded living conditions in the country.

STAFF_NOTE: The project was also financed by a $14,250,000 million loan from Seylan Bank Plc, which also has a sovereign guarantee from the Government of Maldives (see 'Government of Maldives Active Sovereign Guaranteed Debt as at end June 2019').

Additionally, there is some conflict with the sources - most say 1500, but the 'Government Guaranteed Debt' which says 1530. Because of its credibility and relative recentness, the coder has chosen this.
sources: http://statisticsmaldives.gov.mv/yearbook/2016/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2016/04/13.9.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/cy74ftfszlxbq7y/FT%20February%202019%20The%20Maldives%20counts%20the%20cost%20of%20its%20debts%20to%20China%20%7C%20Financial%20Times.pdf?dl=0, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.finance.gov.mv/public/attachments/WULvHAKHkEWDBtC4AMXMxR3CYpqacsdWxIIHZBip.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.mv/public/attachments/bKVqiwaAFFIKAdPnendZWq8Gvuqo42NcaIFUk0eV.xlsx, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Housing Development Corporation Ltd. (HDC), State-owned Company

funding_agencies: China Export-Import Bank, State-owned Company
title: China Exim Bank RMB Denominated loan to 100 MW Crest Energy Pakistan Limited Solar Power Plant at Quaid-e Azam Solar Park (Linked to Project #50939, #53988 and #54284) (CPEC, IPP)
description: Crest Energy Pakistan Limited (CEPL) is a 100 MW Solar PV power plant located at Quaid-e-Azam Solar Park at Lal Sohanra in Cholistan, District Bahawalpur in the Province of Punjab. CEPL signed Engineering, Procurement, Construction contracts with China First Metallurgical Group Co. Ltd. and MCC Ruba International Construction Company Pvt. Ltd. on June 27 2015 to build, own, and operate a 100 MW AC Solar powered electric generation facility in the Solar Park. The cumulative EPC contract value is 984 Million RMB. On December 21 2015 CEPL signed a Term Facility Agreement with China EXIM Bank and China Bohai Co Limited. Financial closure was reached on December 28 2015. The Commercial Operations Date for this CEPL Solar Power plant was July 31 2016. The total project cost is 149.457 USD Million, with a Debt-Equity ratio of 75:25. China EXIM Bank made 2 loans to CEPL - one denominated in RMB worth 100 Million (equivalent to 15.196 million USD) and another one denominated in USD, worth 40.810 Million USD. China Bohai Bank made 1 loan to CEPL, denominated in USD and worth 56.190 million USD. These two loans make up the 75% debt component of the overall project. The interest rate for Exim Bank's RMB denominated loan is 2.65%. The Interest rate for Exim Bank's USD denominated loan is 5.6916%, and the interest rate for China Bohai Bank's loan is 5.0958%. This projects records the RMB denominated loan from China EXIM bank. It is unclear how the equity component was financed.
sources: http://www.eximbank.gov.cn/aboutExim/annals/2015/201807/P020180712414684910260.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.nepra.org.pk/Licences/Generation/RE-2006/Crest%20Energy%20Solar/LAG-294%20CREST%20ENERGY%20PL%20GENERATION%20LIC%2030-06-2015%209851-57.PDF , Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://nepra.org.pk/Tariff/IPPs/002%20Solar%20IPPs/Crest%20Energy%20Pakistan%20Limited/2017/TRF-318%20CEPL%20COD%2018875-77%2016-11-2017.PDF, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: China EXIM Bank RMB denominated loan to Best Green Energy Pakistan Limited 100 MW solar power project (Linked to Project #50939, #53989 and #54286) (CPEC, IPP)
description: Best Green Energy Pakistan Limited (BGEPL) is a 100 MW Solar PV power plant located at Quaid-e-Azam Solar Park at Lal Sohanra in Cholistan, District Bahawalpur in the Province of Punjab. BGEPL later signed Engineering, Procurement, Construction contracts with China First Metallurgical Group Co. Ltd and with MCC Ruba International Construction Company (Pvt) Ltd to build, own and operate a 100 MW AC Solar powered electric generation facility to be located at Bahawalpur, Punjab. On December 21, 2015 the company signed a Term Facility Agreement (TFA) with the Export-Import bank of China ('EXIM bank') and Bank of Jiangsu Co Limited. The Company achieved Financial Closing on Dec 28, 2015. The Commercial Operation Date of the project was July 31, 2016. Total project cost is 150.269 USD Million, with a debt-equity ratio of 81:19, China Eximbank gave 2 loans, one denominated in RMB worth 100 Million which amounts to 15.4 million USD (2.65% interest rate), and another denominated in USD worth 49.060 million USD (5.0058% interest rate). The Bank of Jiangsu gave 1 loan, denominated in USD which amounts to 64.440 (5.0958% interest rate). This projects records the RMB denominated loan from China EXIM bank. It is unclear how the equity component was financed.

funding_agencies: China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency; Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: China EXIM Bank and CDB USD denominated loan to Appolo Solar Development Pakistan Limited 100 MW solar power project (Linked to Project #50939, #53985) (CPEC, IPP)
description: Appolo Solar Development Pakistan Limited (ASDPL) is a 100 MW Solar PV power plant located at Quaid-e-Azam Solar Park at Lal Sohanra in Cholistan, District Bahawalpur in the Province of Punjab. On June 27 2015 ASDPL signed Engineering, Procurement, Construction contracts with China First Metallurgical Group Co. Ltd and with MCC Ruba International Construction Company (Pvt) Ltd to build, own and operate a 100 MW AC Solar powered electric generation facility to be located at Bahawalpur, Punjab. On October 16, 2015 the company signed a Term Facility Agreement (TFA) with the Export-Import bank of China ('EXIM bank') and China Development Bank. The Company achieved Financial Closing on November 6, 2015. The Commercial Operation Date of the project was May 31, 2016. Total project cost is 149.154 USD Million, with a Debt-Equity ratio 79:21. China Development Bank and the Export Import Bank of China provided 2 syndicated loans, one worth 400 Million RMB which is equivalent to 62.93 USD Million (interest rate 2.65%), and a loan denominated in USD which amounts to 62.6 USD Million (interest rate 4.96%). These loans make up the 79% debt component. This project records the USD denominated loan. It is unclear how the equity component was financed.
sources: https://nepra.org.pk/Tariff/IPPs/002%20Solar%20IPPs/Appolo%20Solar%20Development%20Pakistan%20Limited/TRF-316%20ASDPL%20COD%2018869-71%2016-11-2017.PDF, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

funding_agencies: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Bangladesh Ministry of Disaster Management and Relief, Government Agency
title: China provides disaster rescue equipment to Bangladesh
description: In October 2017, the Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh handed over rescue operation equipment to the Secretary of Disaster Management and Relief of Bangladesh in Dhaka. The equipment comes at the Bangladeshi government's request and included a hydraulic wheel excavator, forklift, air compressor, generator set, and a cutting machine. It is not known from where the Chinese government procured the equipment. STAFF_NOTE: This project is coded as emergency response as a part of CRS code 74010 (Disaster prevention and preparedness), but the donation of the equipment was not prompted by a natural disaster at the time.
sources: http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-10/29/c_136713408.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://borneobulletin.com.bn/china-hands-over-high-tech-equipment-for-rescue-and-relief-operations-to-bangladesh/, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Bangladesh Ministry of Disaster Management and Relief, Government Agency

funding_agencies: China Construction Bank Corporation (CCB), State-owned Company; China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency; Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC), State-owned Company
title: Chinese bank syndicate loaned 200 million USD to Thar Coal Block II Mine (linked to #35127, #53968)
description:
Sindh Engro Coal Mining Company Limited (SECMC) is a joint venture — between Government of Sindh (54.7%), Engro Powergen Limited (EPL) (11.9%) and its Affiliate Engro Powergen Thar Limited (EPTL) (11.9%), Habib Bank Limited (9.5%), Hub Power Company Ltd (8%), China Machinery Engineering Corporation (4%) —  that is responsible for developing a coal mine of 3.8 million tonnes per annum capacity which will supply coal to a 2 X 330 (660MW) mine mouth circulating fluidized bed technology coal-based power plant, which is located at Thar Block II, 25 kilometer from the city of Islamkot, near the village of Singharo-Bitra Tharparkar District and Sindh Province. The coal will initially be supplied to Engro Powergen Thar (Private) Limited (EPTL), per a Coal Supply Agreement dated June 7, 2015. However, SECMC plans to expand its mining capacity to 7.6 metric tons per annum to cater for the two additional 330MW power plants run by Thar Energy Limited and ThalNova Power Thar (Pvt.) Limited. Thar Block II is a 95.5 square kilometer (km2) area of the Thar coalfield, which has total lignite reserves of 175 billion tons which can be utilized to produce 100,000 Megawatt (MW) for over 200 years. The project will cost $911m million and it is being financed with 75% debt and 25% equity. 

On December 21, 2015, Sindh Engro Coal Mining Company (SECMC) signed three loan facility agreements: a syndicated loan facility agreement with 8 commercial banks (Habib Bank Limited, United Bank Limited, Bank Alfalah Limited, Askari Bank Limited, Sindh Bank Limited, Bank of Punjab, NIB Bank Limited, and Habib Metropolitan Bank) worth 40 million Pakistani rupees with a 14 year maturity, 4 year grace period, and interest rate of 6-month KIBOR plus a 1.75% margin; an Islamic syndicated finance agreement with three banks (Meezan Bank Limited, Faysal Bank Limited, and Habib Bank Limited) worth 12 million Pakistani rupees with a 14 year maturity, 4 year grace period, and interest rate of 6-month KIBOR plus a 1.75% margin; and a $200 million (USD-denominated) syndicated loan facility with ICBC, China Construction Bank and China Development Bank that has a 14 year maturity, 4 year grace period, and an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus a 3.3% margin.  

This project records the debt financing component. The equity financing component can be found in Project #53968. China Machinery Engineering Corporation and China-East Resources Import & Export Company are the EPC contractors responsible for project implementation. Project implementation began on April 13, 2016. In September 2017, it was reported project was in the process of dewatering three of the aquifers in the mine, with all challenges being addressed in a timely manner. The water drained from the three aquifers would recycled later for the operational work of the Thar Coal Block-II power projects. In December 2017, it was reported that half of the work on That Coal Block-II was completed and that the project was to be completed and functioning by August 2019 and have a capacity of 1.32 gigawatts but divided into four mine-mouth power plants and mining 7.6 million tonnes of coal per year. The project ultimately reached its commercial operation date (COD) on July 10, 2019
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASMESG0020170911ed990000h&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dropbox.com/s/q5lthzouc1lftfi/IJGlobal%20-%20Thar%20Coal%20Block%20II%20Mine%20-%20Pakistan.pdf?dl=0, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

funding_agencies: China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency
title: China Development Bank loans 84.4 Million USD to Three Gorges Third Wind Farm (Linked to Project #53675, #37233, #54012) (CPEC, IPP)
description: The Karot Three Gorges Second Phase Wind Power Project (49.5MW) is located in Jhimpir, Thatta District, Sindh Province, Pakistan. Financial closure was achieved March 17 2017, and the Commercial Operation Date was June 9 2018. The project was developed on a Build-Own-Operate basis. Three Gorges Third Wind Farm Pakistan (Pvt.) Limited reported to National Electric Power Regulatory Authority (NEPRA) that it entered into a financing agreement on December 28, 2016 with China Development Bank for a 84.4 Million USD loan, with a 3 Months LIBOR rate of 0.2706% + 450 bps. Grace period is assumed to be the same as construction period, which is 18 months. The repayment period is inferred from the Debt Servicing Schedule on a 2019 tariff adjustments decision document from NEPRA. Project is part of the2 billion Karot power projects, focusing on hydro and wind power, under the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor reported to be completed by 2018. The total project cost and financing breakdown is not known.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BUSFINC020170311ed3b000b5&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://nepra.org.pk/Tariff/IPPs/000%20IPPs%20Wind/Three%20Gorges%20third%20wind%20farm/TRF-349%20TGTWFPL%20UPFRONT%20TARIFF%2001-04-2016%204197-99.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://nepra.org.pk/Tariff/IPPs/000%20IPPs%20Wind/Three%20Gorges%20third%20wind%20farm/2019/TRF-349%20TGTWFPL%20Adjustment%20COD%2008-01-2019%20207-209.PDF, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

implementing_agencies: Bangladesh Ministry of Agriculture, Government Agency
title: China provides 6,004 pieces of agricultural equipment to Bangladesh
description: On April 2017, Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh Ma Mingqiang handed over 6,004 pieces of farming equipment to the Bangladesh government. The equipment was selected with Bangladesh's tiny size in mind. The grant of equipment was said to be part of a movement to modernize Bangladesh's agricultural sector. STAFF_NOTE: No information about the commitment date could be found.

funding_agencies: China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency
title: CDB Loans $462 million USD to finance the capital expenditures of the 2G, 3G and BWA services of Aircel and its three subsidiaries in India
description: On March 19th, 2015, China Development Bank loaned462 million USD to finance the capital expenditures of the 2G, 3G and BWA services of Aircel and its three subsidiaries in India. The loan has a duration of 10 years and is a part of a651 million USD syndicated loan from SEK and the Nordic Investment Bank. STAFF_NOTE: Couldn't find additional sources that specifically cited the CDB loan of462 million. In 2018, Aircel went bankrupt. Multiple creditors are bringing Aircel to court in order to recover funds, including the CDB.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/uajahndy0dxumb3/IJGlobal%20-%20Aircel%202G%2C%203G%20and%20BWA%20Telecom%20Additional%20Financing%20-%20India.pdf?dl=0, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

funding_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
title: China's Exim Bank Loans $88 million USD for coal-based power plant at Jhajjar, Haryana (Linked to #54344)
description: On November 17th, 2010, China's Export Import Bank loaned88 million USD for the debt financing of the coal-based power plant at Jhajjar, Haryana. The coal-based power project was developed by CLP India Private Limited, a subsidiary of CLP Group. Construction began in January 2009. Stage one involved installing 660 MW capacity and that was commissioned March 2012. Stage two involved installing 660 MW capacity and was commissioned July, 2012. The loan has a duration of 13 years and 6 months, making the maturity date May 17th, 2024. The loan is described as a Sinosure-covered tranche. The loan is replacing a part of the Rs39 billion of the 15 year debt from a 2009 loan by IDBI. This project is co-financed by an100 million USD by China Development Bank with the same terms (project #54344). This loan agreement is part of a larger syndicated loan for288 million. The 5 institutions involved in the loan are the China Development Bank, the China Ex-Im Bank, The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation, The Standard Chartered Bank, and Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ.
sources: https://www.clpindia.in/media/CLP%20Jhajjar%20Financing%20India%20press%20release.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://asian-power.com/regulation/news/clp-india-completes-228m-refinancing-jhajjar-plant, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.pp.u-tokyo.ac.jp/research/dp/documents/GraSPP-DP-E-14-003.pdf, Academic Journal Article; http://www.pp.u-tokyo.ac.jp/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/GraSPP-DP-E-14-003-SOM.pdf, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/project-document/67374/42933-ind-seia.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/vults7c3kv89j45/BU_PITCH_ENGLISH_2018.xlsx?dl=0, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/qdih5dk09kqe8mc/IJGlobal%20-%20CLP%20Jhajjar%20Power%20Refinancing-%20India.pdf?dl=0, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy

funding_agencies: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC), State-owned Company
implementing_agencies: Adani Power, Private Sector
title: ICBC Loans $166.67 million USD for the Tiroda Thermal Power Project in India (Linked to #53783)
description: On April 22nd, 2013, the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) loaned166,670,000 USD for the construction of the 3300 MW Tiroda Thermal Power Project, which comprises 5x660 MW units. The Tiroda Thermal Power is also called the Gondia Coal-Fired Project. The loan has a maturity of ten years. The project was constructed by the Adani Power Maharashtra Ltd (APML). The first unit of the plant was commissioned on 28th August 2012 and subsequently, other units were commissioned. The project was commissioned on October 11th, 2014. The Tiroda Thermal Power Project was also funded by a166.67 million USD loan by the CDB (project #53783) and a166.66 million USD loan by the Standard Chartered Bank, both under the same loan conditions.

title: China's Exim Bank Loans 2477.24 million rupees for the Raj Westpower Power Plant
description: On April 1st, 2009, China's Export-Import Bank loaned 2477.24 million rupees for the Raj Westpower (also known as the Barmer Plant) Power Plant, a 1080 MW lignite based pitehead power plant. This project was also funded by a 2477.24 million rupees loan by the ICICI Bank.

funding_agencies: China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Reliance Communications Ltd., Private Sector
title: CDB Loans $300 million USD to Reliance Communications (Facility II) (Linked to #42654, #54349, #54350)
description: On March 9th, 2011, China Development Bank loaned300 million USD to Reliance Communications to help modernize their equipment and payoff maturing loans.. The interest rate of the loan is 2.408%. As of December 31st, 2014,29 million USD of the loan was outstanding. This project is linked to three other CDB loans to Reliance:750 million USD in 2008 (Facility I) (#42654),1.33 billion in in 2011 (Facility III) (#54349), and300 million USD in 2011 (Facility IV) (#54350). STAFF_NOTE: The listed interest rate was aggregate of the applicable LIBOR + 2.2% per annum. LIBOR rate was calculated off of the March 2011 average for USD, 0.208%. The four facilities/loans were all probably withdrawn to help primarily stave off bankruptcy, which Reliance Communications ended up filing for in 2018. Many creditors, including the CDB, are suing the RCom for their funds back. Media reports suggest that Facility 2 and 4, amounting to 600 million USD was used to import telecomm equipment from Huawei and ZTE.

The interest rate of the loan is 3.458%. As of December 31st, 2014,1.237 billion USD of the loan was outstanding. This project is linked to three other CDB loans to Reliance:750 million USD in 2008 (Facility I) (#42654),300 million USD in 2011 (Facility II) (#54348), and300 million USD in 2011 (Facility IV) (#54350). description: On March 9th, 2011, China Development Bank loaned300 million USD to Reliance Telecom Ltd through a facilities agreement. Reliance Communications guaranteed the loan. title: ICBC Facility II to Reliance Communications (linked to #56456)
description: On July 21st, 2014, the Industrial & Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) loaned 1.2 billion Indian rupees in a working capital loan to Reliance Tech Services Limited for debt relief. Most of the funds will be used to repay Reliance's short term loans. Reliance Communications guaranteed the loan. The interest rate of the loan is calculated by adding the 6 Month LIBOR rate on the date of agreement 0.328% to the margin of 1.25%. The loan will be paid back over 10 years. This project is linked to ICBC and Exim's 2012925.2 million USD loan for the construction of ICBC Facility I (#56456).

funding_agencies: Bank of China (BOC), State-owned Company; China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency
implementing_agencies: Reliance Power Ltd., Private Sector
title: CDB, BOC, and China Exim Bank Loan $1.1 billion USD for Reliance Power's 3,960MW coal-fired Sasan Ultra Mega Power Project (UMPP) (sub project of #43106)
description: On December 15th, 2010, the China Development Bank, Bank of China, China ExIm Bank, and the Standard Chartered Bank loaned1.1 billion USD for the debt refinancing of Reliance Power's 3,960MW coal-fired Sasan Ultra Mega Power Project (UMPP). The loan is insured by SinoSure and has a maturity of 13 years. The loan will primarily be used to purchase power equipment from Shanghai Electric (#43107). The equipment would be delivered to Krishnapatnam ultra mega power project, Chitrangi power project and Tilaiya ultra mega power project, as well as the Rosa, Butibori and Sasan plants. The equipment will provide 30K MW of coal-based power capacity, and includes 42 power generators of 660MW power. The Sasan UMPP has 6 power towers of 660MW each and is a 'super-critical technology based pit-head coal-fired power generating plant.' In addition, four other loans with different terms contributed to the debt refinancing of Sasan UMPP for an overall total2.181 billion USD in loans. In an International commercial bank insured loan the DBS Bank, Mizuho Financial Group, and Standard Chartered Bank each loaned50 million USD; with a 13 year maturity and interest rates of Libor +375bp to April 2015 Libor +400bp to April 2019 Libor +415bp afterwards. This is a sub-project of the 12B dollar export credit-based MoU signed in October of 2010 (#43106). The unaccounted for funds have been coded in the original umbrella project.
